664582682.name: Memorable Beach
664582682.author: a TripAdvisor user
664582682.reviewBody: Playa el Palmar is a wonderful and picturesque beach, located adjacent to hotel row and in walking distance of the town of Ixtapa. Beach area is clean and expansive, offering ample space for diverse activities, such as beach sports, sun bathing, running, walking and recreational things-to-do like parasailing. The waves are spectacular though ominous for the causal swimmer. If you pause long enough to examine the waves you can see sting rays skimming the crest and quickly disappearing into the trough. The sun rises are beautiful, and the sun sets are stunning with its kaleidoscope of red and orange colors. It reminds us of the sun sets above Santorini Island in Greece, which are often described as the \u201cmost romantic sunsets\u201d in the world. The beach also offers one-hour massages at a fraction of cost of a hotel massage. We were skeptical at first, but as we walked the beach, we met numerous vacationers on their way to get a massage. For some it was a daily ritual. Based on the recommendations, we tried it, and we\u2019re glad we did. For us, this massage is the best ever for the money, and all the while the only ambient sound heard is the crashing of the waves onto the shore. It left us feeling great and became a daily ritual for us as well. There are two massage locations on the beach. One is on east end of the beach, which we were told cost more, and the other is on the west end, which we used. We thoroughly enjoyed every minute of our time on the beach.

658694298.name: Palmer Beach
658694298.author: a TripAdvisor user
658694298.reviewBody: Love this beach! Second visit and would come back again. Like it because it\'s more laid back then others I\'ve been to.

657187203.name: One of my favorite beaches
657187203.author: a TripAdvisor user
657187203.reviewBody: Great beach. Very nice to walk along. Amazing sunsets. The water can be rough, but you can swim with caution. You can view whales from shore and watch manta rays jump and play in the surf. \n\nHonestly, next to the beaches of Cuba, this is my favorite beach. Spectacular.

655914679.name: Big wave
655914679.author: a TripAdvisor user
655914679.reviewBody: Big wave, you don\'t see the bottom of the ocean, lots of rays.\nNo the best beach out here.\nVery windy but the sunset was extremely nice, restaurant on the beach are great.

655432281.name: Great for morning or evening beach walking
655432281.author: a TripAdvisor user
655432281.reviewBody: Great walking beach, but busy.  Not for swimming - try Playa Madera in Zihuatanejo instead.  Nice hotel pools and beach chairs.

652973276.name: The resort area\'s main beach is fantastic!
652973276.author: a TripAdvisor user
652973276.reviewBody: We stayed at the Pacifica resort at the east end of the beach. Our family members made a walk along the beach a regular start to the day. The sand is soft and comfortable, we went barefoot without worry. The surf can be quite something - there were a number of areas cordoned off by resorts along the beach, moreso along the east end of the beach. Always busy with people walking from sunrise to past sunset. Amazing views of the Pacific!

651830663.name: Beautiful beach for walking.
651830663.author: a TripAdvisor user
651830663.reviewBody: The water can be too rough for swimming, but it is perfect if you enjoy a long beach walk. Walk right to the end at the marina. There is a small path to the public access for the marina.

649329651.name: very nice view with the islands in the middle of bay
649329651.author: a TripAdvisor user
649329651.reviewBody: i ran up and down the beach.  the left side of the bay has very small waves, the center of the bay has big waves that are very rough.\n\ni like the sand, and the water was clean.

640907579.name: Beautiful beach lined with resorts.
640907579.author: a TripAdvisor user
640907579.reviewBody: Fantastic early morning walks and beautiful sunsets. Beach does get very busy during the day with resort guests  and public access visitors.

633439199.name: Excellente.
633439199.author: a TripAdvisor user
633439199.reviewBody: One of the Best beaches in the world.Long walking beach from the cliffs at one end to the rock jetty at the other end.Hotels and restaurants on the beach.big crowds during Easter and Christmas Holidays.It was a bit cloudy yesterday and we were the only couple in front of Barcelo Hotel.The surf was large.I got several great rides with my Hobi Mach 7 boogey board. I also did some body surfing. The waves ,los olas,can be fun but also can be dangerous.Fron big barrel rolling surf to tall thinner waves to smaller waves.Many wave varieties depending on local winds and wheather .Love this beach.Reminds me of home which is Misquamicut RI USA.No rip tides this month November 2018.Free public beach which has 3 public entrances.Our condo is about a 15 minute walk.

619759212.name: Nice Walking Beach
619759212.author: a TripAdvisor user
619759212.reviewBody: This beach is in the hotel zone in Ixtapa. It is very clean and a good place to relax. Not many vendors on the beach, which makes it more relaxing.  This is not a swimming or snorkeling beach. Only black and red flags were out during our stay.  The beach is great for taking walks.  Good for when you have to work off the food you ate at the buffet. You may even see a baby turtle making a run for the ocean.  There are opportunities for parasailing and jet skiing here. There are huts near the Park Royal if you\u2019re needing a massage. It\u2019s 200 pesos for an hour or about $10 USD.

598707887.name: Waves are too strong
598707887.author: a TripAdvisor user
598707887.reviewBody: This is a very busy beach... lots of beach activities.  The waves are too dangerous to stay in the water.  We tried to swim pass the water break but that did not work.  Must be careful! Nice for walking.

582765315.name: decent beach with parasailing
582765315.author: a TripAdvisor user
582765315.reviewBody: It\'s easy to access this public beach. It\'s pretty long, so you can find a spot to settle down in a lively zone or a quiet zone.  here\'s restaurants and hotels along the edge, but I\'m not sure which ones are private or public.\n\n There are quite a few parasailing operators on the beach for 400 pesos per person, per trip, which is one way down the beach and back.

575297128.name: Beautiful Beach
575297128.author: a TripAdvisor user
575297128.reviewBody: walked a lot on this beach with lovely hotels and condos. The beach is very wide. Lots of parasailing on this beach.

570834024.name: The beach is great!
570834024.author: a TripAdvisor user
570834024.reviewBody: Spend the whole day here and the SunSet was just beautiful! The main entrance to it is next to the Barcelo Hotel where you will be great by an inspector to make sure you dont take any glass to the beach. If you dont take your umbrella you can rent the set for $150 pesos, of course, you will have to look around to fit your budget (It does not include meal like it does in Playa La Madera where you can get the table for free as long as each adult spends $100 pesos each on food or drinks) The waves are a bit rough but its great! lots and lots to walk to the other side where you can catch a ride to Isla Ixtapa. Enjoy!

567027546.name: Best Beach Ever
567027546.author: a TripAdvisor user
567027546.reviewBody: We have been to a few beaches and this is by far one of the best ever. Interesting walk from one end to the next.

566451836.name: Beautiful Beach
566451836.author: a TripAdvisor user
566451836.reviewBody: Playa Palmar is a beautiful beach and well taken care of. No glass, styrofoam or pets allowed on the beach to help keep it clean. This year there\'s more calmer days than crazy waves which is great as you can go in but you still need to be cautious. The waves and current can be dangerous so always take note of the flag, black means pretty much ankle deep only! Most of the rest of the time it\'s a red flag, in all my years here I have never seen yellow or green! The beach is great for walking, it\'s over 2 kilometres end to end. Keep an eye out in the bay for possible whale sightings, this year was very frequent through January to early March! For those of us who are not at one of the hotels or condos on the beach you can rent a table and chairs just to the south of the Barcelo, very reasonable too. In the middle of the beach, by the Dolphinarium are a couple of bar/restaurants. The old Rock and Arena is under renovation but open for great drinks made by Bartolo and Rafael and Daniel the owner plays guitar many days, a great place to hang out and watch the sunsets.

566388602.name: Amara Condo on Playa el Palmar
566388602.author: a TripAdvisor user
566388602.reviewBody: We rented a condo at Amara on Playa el Palmar and couldn\'t be happier! The beach is long and very walkable. The sand is hard packed which makes it easy to walk, jog or run. There is lots to do on the beach. My teens have joined several beach volleyball games. The waves are awesome for body surfing and Boogie boarding! There are jet ski rentals, parasailing, massage huts, and lots of people watching!

565130101.name: Clean, safe, sandy beach \u2013 waves too rough for swimming
565130101.author: a TripAdvisor user
565130101.reviewBody: Great beach for walking day or night! Very safe. Lots of activities to enjoy including parasailing, banana boat rides, baby turtle releases, and massage huts. Our hotel faced this beach. The waves are too rough for swimming with a dangerous undertow, and many hotels will put out flags which indicate the really dangerous days (black flag). We stood in the beginning of the surf and got wet up to our thighs and it wasn\'t too bad. Saw some people doing turtle releases. It was fun to watch the para-sailing and banana boat riders. There is the usual amount of vendors harassing you about their services, but it\'s not super annoying. There are many birds to watch; the grackles will steal your food if you\'re not watching. You can see Brown Pelicans, Brown and Blue-Footed Boobys, Magnificent Frigate-birds, Royal Terns, and Turkey Vultures. One morning we watched a mother and calf Humpback Whale splash around in the bay! You will see beautiful sunsets from this beach.

561366494.name: Beautiful Beach!
561366494.author: a TripAdvisor user
561366494.reviewBody: This is the main beach in Ixtapa.  It is a great beach for a walk!  The waves are very rough.  You should use caution when going into the water.  We saw a life guard pull someone from the water one afternoon.  He did not survive.  We spotted several whales and dolphins in the water from our condo.  Unfortunately, there are no longer many restaurants to visit on the beach as most of the hotels have gone all inclusive.  It is really a shame!

561314317.name: Best beach on Pacific Ocean Mexico
561314317.author: a TripAdvisor user
561314317.reviewBody: Great walking beach on Pacific side of Mexico \n\nEven better is Ixtapa island and Zihuatanejo bays beaches.

560918531.name: Long Walks on the Beach...Beware the Waves!
560918531.author: a TripAdvisor user
560918531.reviewBody: Our hotel was located on this beach, it is sandy, long and is a great place to watch the parasailers and jet skiers.  My sons spent lots of time in the water, the waves were always a bit tempestuous which you do need to be aware of.  Don\'t turn your back, always know when they\'re coming.  My son lost a pair of sunglasses and goggles within the week we were there.  The flags were at red or black the whole week, that didn\'t\' stop them from having fun in the waves.

560156873.name: Strong waves, long sandy beach
560156873.author: a TripAdvisor user
560156873.reviewBody: The waves were amazing to watch and listen to, however, the undertow was dangerous. We swam a bit but really just enjoyed our daily walks on this lovely and clean beach. There are a lot of hotels along the length of it and many locals selling their goods. You can also get a massage on the beach and buy food and drinks. The views are spectacular when the sun is setting over the water!

557370266.name: Nice sandy beach
557370266.author: a TripAdvisor user
557370266.reviewBody: Nice sandy 2.5km beach but beware of the waves.They can be fun to body surf but don\'t turn your back they can be big. Seen whales 4 of the seven days on this beach. Very few vendors.

554516134.name: Nice beach for a resort
554516134.author: a TripAdvisor user
554516134.reviewBody: We took a local bus from Zihua to Ixtapa to see the Zihua\u2019s \u201csister\u201d city.  Realistically, there is nothing related about these two places other than they are proximal and share the same ocean.  Ixtapa is a Fontura resort location planned and facilities by the Mexican government.  It is a well manicured resort with all the imagination and style one would expect from a cookie cutter resort area.  Nevertheless, it fits an important niche and there were no shortage of visitors enjoying the all-inclusive resorts and clean-raked beaches.  Playa el Palmar is a nice beach but the waves were quite large when we visited, so we retreated back to Playa la Ropa for the remainder of our trip. Though I find the respite from the random piles of trash dotting Zihua refreshing, this is not my personal style of vacation.

553653274.name: Great Beach
553653274.author: a TripAdvisor user
553653274.reviewBody: Nice place whit a lot of restaurants and very cheap if we return as always the warmth of the people of Mexico like no other and more of this place Ixtapa

553040167.name: One of the best places we\u2019ve been in the south!
553040167.author: a TripAdvisor user
553040167.reviewBody:
As Canadians, in the winter, we look to the south for a hot, sunny and a beautiful beach spot.  Ixtapa and El Palmar beach is IT!!!  It’s so calm.  The weather is perfection.  The ocean is a bit rough at times but otherwise very warm.  The sunsets???  I’m telling you the best pictures for your Instagram account!  Lol!  

We can’t wait to go back.  We we’re there for New Year’s and it did not dissapoint anyone with us, from our teenagers to our parents!

Highly recommend!

551881650.name: nnice quieter beach and GREAT massages
551881650.author: a TripAdvisor user
551881650.reviewBody: We loved walking this beach in the mornings as it was quieter, without all of the parasailing, and people. I do SO recommend the massage huts, and number 7 is by far the BEST. only $10 USD for an hour.

551312533.name: Natural Beauty!!!
551312533.author: a TripAdvisor user
551312533.reviewBody: This sheltered bay beach attracts both locals & tourists. It is  interesting & diverse. At the end, there are some beautiful condominiums to ogle at. There are a few informal restaurants, & 6 massage huts. Most hotels have activities on the beach.CLEAN!!!! No garbage, rocks, bugs, or anything of the like, to deter from your enjoyment. And....if you want to buy a souvenir on the beach, you are hard pressed to find the usual hustlers. Ixtapa-Zihuantenejo is certified as a "Culture of Peace" community in partnership with the U.N. They are designated as a "BLUE FLAG" area, with a serious commitment to people and the environment. One MAJOR perk....we watched 100\'s of 12 hour old hatched turtles crawling the sand and finding their way in to the ocean. The equivalent of a "U.S. Park Ranger" taught all the onlookers what was going on & why.

547064415.name: WE walked this beach every day
547064415.author: a TripAdvisor user
547064415.reviewBody: This is a wide beach with good sized waves it is one op my favorite beaches in the world we stayed at the Emporio ocean front room love falling asleep to the sound of the waves

546249545.name: Sewer still coming into the ocean from Pacifica Resort
546249545.author: a TripAdvisor user
546249545.reviewBody: This is a beautiful beach. Very clean until you get down near the Pacifica Resort. If you are in the  ocean when the estuary starts to drain please get out!   There appears to be sewer that has been dumped into the estuary by SOMEONE ( no one seems to know who) everyone blames someone else. But this is very dangerous to swimmers who happen to be in the ocean when the draining starts. This beach has been designated a "CLEAN BEACH" by The Blue Flag Global environmental organization. I am not sure how this beach can keep its "clean" designation when this happens on an almost daily basis, sewer dumping into the ocean.    This same problem was happening in 2016 but it had been cleaned up until about 1 week ago. it has now started again. BEWARE !!!

541019997.name: Impressively clean
541019997.author: a TripAdvisor user
541019997.reviewBody:
Ran this beach for the past 3 days and found only one plastic cup along the way .2+miles each way....no Trash..there has been a big push over the past few years to clean up this beach and it has worked. 

No dogs are allowed so no brown bombs and people seem to be making special efforts to avoid littering.

 Some of the resorts do not even allow straws to be used on the beach to avoid the littering problem

Kudos to the powers that be and the resorts along this great beach for cleaning up!!!!

539843173.name: El palmar beach Ixtapa
539843173.author: a TripAdvisor user
539843173.reviewBody: El palmar beach,one of the Best beaches in Ixtapa... Along the palmar beach you can enjoy,a morning walk during the morning, watch the surfers, at the end of palmar beach... Contact Filiberto for a morning walk, Will inform you about the development of Ixtapa, how was build, how the goverment took from locals land to make the ixtapa tourist proyect back in the 60\'s...

535877870.name: Great Beach
535877870.author: a TripAdvisor user
535877870.reviewBody: The nice thing about the El Palmar Playa is it\'s 2 miles long. The negative is that it isn\'t the white sugar sand you get on the Caribbean side similar to Cancun or Play Del Carmen, but it is a light brown sand. There are very few rocks any where so walking in the shallow water is very nice. The waves on the Pacific side are sometimes quite large so you need to be careful where you are standing in the water so as not to get caught beneath the wave when it\'s crashing down. This is a great beach for walking and the views are wonderful. El Palmar Beach is located in Ixtapa but Ixtapa and Zihua have mountains surrounding each city so the views are great ocean side or inland. Ixtapa and Zihuatanejo are drastically different cities so it\'s like your on 2 different vacations in 1 trip. Both cities are 4 miles apart and Zihua offers 4 separate beaches in the bay area. Principle Beach, Madera Beach, La Ropa Beach and Las Gatas Beach. My favorites are La Ropa and Las Gatas Beach. Anyways El Palmar Beach is the longest stretch of beach but all are fun to visit.

533155793.name: Great place to swim and sunbathe
533155793.author: a TripAdvisor user
533155793.reviewBody: The beach is great place to swim and sunbath. The water was not rough.  It was a 15 - 20 walk from my hotel.

529281265.name: Great beach with bus service and public access
529281265.author: a TripAdvisor user
529281265.reviewBody:
Yes, you can enjoy this beach even if you are not staying at one of the all-inclusive hotels that seem to have it monopolized.  There are 2 public access points where anybody can easily walk on a paved driveway right up to the sand and surf.

The first cut-through is right next to the Barcelo resort, near the south end of the beach.  To get to the Barcelo you can take ANY bus that says Ixtapa on the windshield from the central area of Zihuatanejo.  Busses that say Ixtapa or Ixtapa Marina or Ixtapa Playa Linda will ALL go right past the Barcelo resort.  The fare is 12 pesos as of October 2017.

Additionally, there is an Oxxo convenient store across the street from the Barcelo - perfect to pick up some cold beers/drinks/snacks for the beach.  When you do get to the beach next to Barcelo, there are some tables, chairs & umbrellas that can be rented too... but be advised, they are pretty beat up and the beach right there is certainly not the nicest area.  There are also a couple food carts selling tacos & other local favorites at the beach entrance.

The other public cut-through to Playa Palmar is about a mile further to the north - next to the Park Royal hotel tower and the "Dolphinity" exhibit.  Once again, there is a handy Oxxo store directly across the street from the short roadway that goes to the beach.  But to get to this spot by bus you must take the Ixtapa MARINA bus.  The other busses that say Ixtapa do not go as far down this stretch of the coastal/hotel road - toward the Ixtapa Marina.  The fare is still 12 pesos - and you could walk from where the Ixtapa and Playa Linda busses turn off - but it's hot & unnecessary.  Take the Marina bus.

Lastly, at this more northern entrance to the beach there are 2 restaurants with tables and umbrellas on the beach that do serve food and drink to anybody with cash money.  There are also a few palm trees that might provide some shade.  The rest of this gorgeous beach is all taken up by all-inclusive resorts -- so there is nowhere else the public can purchase food or drink or even sit in chairs or shade.

Finally, be warned, the waves and undertow can be dangerous all along Playa Palmar.  There are some lifeguards but most people seem content to go only about waist deep.  The beach itself is probably the nicest stretch of sand in the Ixtapa/Zihuatenejo area; flat, fluffy, golden, clean, no rocks. Really nice!  It goes another half-mile or so further north too, ending at the Marina... then of course, about a mile to the south past the Barcelo resort.  We spent a couple lovely afternoons picnicking in the middle of Palmar - but again, no shade.  Still, if you are in Zihua - don't miss this beach!

509292770.name: Playa palmar
509292770.author: a TripAdvisor user
509292770.reviewBody: Beautiful views!!! Big waves. Lots of cabanas on beach. Vendors for activities out daily. Coconuts are yummy!

486491205.name: Magnificent flat beach
486491205.author: a TripAdvisor user
486491205.reviewBody: If you like to run barefoot..you can not do any better...2.5 miles of flat clean, beach with minimal shells and rocks, one of the gr3eat beaches in the world to run

482192250.name: Best walking beach by far
482192250.author: a TripAdvisor user
482192250.reviewBody: Absolutely Loved Walking this Beach ! Every Morning we took a long walk and went for a Message way down at the one end for 200 pesos. Never too full Sand got a bit Hot but run down to the shore and its perfect. We took in a lot of Sunsets on this Beautiful beach. Not one rock Excellent !!!

471991572.name: perfect beach for walking, playing and sunsets
471991572.author: a TripAdvisor user
471991572.reviewBody: The perfect beach to walk on (once you get past the hot dry sand). The water is good to play in the waves and you must get a massage(hut #6 Teresa was the best 200 pesos for an hour!).  A new sunset everyday to watch.

467666715.name: beautiful beach
467666715.author: a TripAdvisor user
467666715.reviewBody: Playa el Palmer is lovely for early morning or sunset strolls, approx 2.5 kms of beautiful soft sand, which heats up drastically throughout the day, in the afternoon wear your flipflops! My sister and I bought silver brcelets from a vendor, so beautiful and reasonable, we wish we had bought a few more. The massage lasies are so worth the 200 pesos, go every day if you can.

464764410.name: Awesome sunsets
464764410.author: a TripAdvisor user
464764410.reviewBody: We stayed at a condo on this beach. Not many places open to the public, but the beach is nice for walking. Some vendors but not too many. Great sunsets. Parasailing $20 US and jet skiing $30. One vendor sells fresh oysters around 4pm each day.

463364649.name: Unfriendly Experience
463364649.author: a TripAdvisor user
463364649.reviewBody: Of all the beaches in the Barra to Playa Linda corridor, this is the most disappointing. Hard to access with all the high rise AIs lining the waterfront. Pretty much zero on the scale of \'does this place have a soul\'. And without a wrist band, you really stick out.

463274780.name: Great walking beach
463274780.author: a TripAdvisor user
463274780.reviewBody: Beautiful beach for walks and watching the sunset. The waves are pretty rough, so I wouldn\'t brave the water if you\'re not a strong swimmer. There are reasonably priced activities like parasailing, jet skiing and banana boats available.

461498126.name: Sexy Sand and Sunsets
461498126.author: a TripAdvisor user
461498126.reviewBody: Love this clean beach. So many activites to entertain while you are exploring this Hotel Zone. No vendors to distract you from enjoying Ixtapa at it\'s finest.

456756943.name: AMAZINGLY clean
456756943.author: a TripAdvisor user
456756943.reviewBody: Entire beach is verrrrry clean. Excellent soft sand. I believe it\'s about 10,000 steps from end to end. Is that about 5 miles? \nThe water is \'soft\' the waves at end of January were quite gentle. The water was a beautiful color.  I enjoyed the water every day. Unlike our experience in Los Cabos even at the \'safest\' swimming beach where the current there was still way too strong.

451902280.name: Pretty much what we expected.
451902280.author: a TripAdvisor user
451902280.reviewBody: This area was pretty much what we expected: a lovely beach, yes, but red flags up and we did see either a few cautious swimmers or a couple of people gasping as they fled the surf!\nHuge, towering all inclusives dot the beach and there is really one or two public places to eat.  Otherwise you need to be staying at one of the towers to get in to a beachside restaurant.  \nNot our style of Mexican holiday; prefer the small villages on the quieter beaches.

450531246.name: Fresh shucked oysters
450531246.author: a TripAdvisor user
450531246.reviewBody: I walked to this beach which ends in a rocky outpost, from my hotel\'s beachside. There\'s a local man that sells fresh shucked oysters for 100 pesos a plate, by the rocks. I tried it and didn\'t have any problems, even though he didn\'t have a cooler or any ice.\n

449243903.name: Nice Beach
449243903.author: a TripAdvisor user
449243903.reviewBody: Nice beach and place to get away form the other white people. this is were real Mexican go to play and enjoy the beach. A few small road side places to get a cold beer or something. Oh I\'m a white guy.

444112811.name: Access to hotels and restaurants.
444112811.author: a TripAdvisor user
444112811.reviewBody: Most of the hotels, even the all- inclusives, have day rates that you can pay and go in and enjoy the bars and restaurants for a certain time period each day. A few of the beach hotels are not totally all-inclusive and you can go in and pay per drink and meal, etc. You just have to inquire as you are walking by .

386185279.name: Beautiful. Worth the visit
386185279.author: a TripAdvisor user
386185279.reviewBody: Very nice beach and one of the few open sea beaches where you can swim( at the southern end, near Dorado Pacifico)with relative safety. Need to be very careful though due to riptides and sudden 6 foot waves.

384147402.name: Beautiful Beach!
384147402.author: a TripAdvisor user
384147402.reviewBody: This is a beautiful beach indeed, like one would expect to find at any world-class sun-worhipper-visitor destination. This is a good thing!

383214636.name: My favorite  beach in Ixtapa
383214636.author: a TripAdvisor user
383214636.reviewBody: Even if the waves are a little rough I really enjoy swimming and going for long walks in this beach. It\'s always clean and safe.

378963901.name: The beach is long, maybe 1.5 miles.  It\'s great for walking, running, parasailing, massages,swimming at the south end.
378963901.author: a TripAdvisor user
378963901.reviewBody: On the beach you can sit under a palapa for hours with the afternoon breeze, temperatures in the high 80\'s.  Fishing is available.  You can buy silver jewelry, dresses, magazines, wood carvings, tamales, coconut, temporary tatoos, hats,  and other items from the vendors on the beach.  An hour massage is only $20.

354652895.name: Ocean fun!
354652895.author: a TripAdvisor user
354652895.reviewBody: Beautiful sandy beach, no rocks, big waves, clear to the bottom.  Lots to do here right off the beach; body surfing, boogie boarding, sea-dooing, parasailing. All week long was sunny and hot (at least 30\' celcius).  I want to go BACK!

351685848.name: Ixtapa beach used to be great, but now? No - not safe to swim.
351685848.author: a TripAdvisor user
351685848.reviewBody: I have visited often and used to swim at Playa El Palmar, near Pacifica resort and Hotel Barcel\u00f3.  But in the past year, the lagoon has gotten more and more contaminated and SMELLY! The lagoon water empties into the ocean. I don\'t think the water is clean anymore and want to warn people about this.

351453445.name: Beach is a 10!!\'
351453445.author: a TripAdvisor user
351453445.reviewBody: This beach is great to walk, three miles round trip. Also wonderful to just lounge. The vendors are not a bother when you say, no gracias. One of my favorite beaches! The sunsets are unbelievable!

351367774.name: Wide beach
351367774.author: a TripAdvisor user
351367774.reviewBody: Typical of most west coast Mexican beaches. Nice public access. Took a short walk down beach and unable to find any beach bars or restaurants not attached to hotel.

350532154.name: Nice beach for walking.
350532154.author: a TripAdvisor user
350532154.reviewBody: I have stayed many times in Zihuatanejo but never in Ixtapa until my last trip. I really enjoyed my daily walks on Play el Palmar I only wish it had some small beach bars and restaurants for breaks as it is much longer than the beaches in Z.

349172114.name: Theater of La Playa
349172114.author: a TripAdvisor user
349172114.reviewBody: Playa Palmar is Ixtapa\u2019s public beach.  Maybe three miles, it\u2019s a bowl shaped bay of sandy shores from the rocky breakwater at the marina to the rocky cliffs of the seaside hills that dive into the coastline that separates Ixtapa from Zihuatanejo.  The beach is graced by half a dozen or so hotels and several condos that face the blue pacific, and the horizon is endless except a series of rocky dome islands that define the sightline boundaries of the bay.  The surf roars.  Everywhere you look on the beach there\u2019s a lot going on.  People run the compact sand near the edge of the tides before daybreak, madrugada over the Sierra Madres.  The walkers walk along the ocean\u2019s edge.  The day begins and life on the beach erupts like spontaneous chemistry.  People play with balls and nets.  Kids play with sand pails.  They roll and tumble in the waves.  Along the sea walls of the hotels and condos the chairs beneath the palapas fill.  From my vantage shaded by a palm thatched palapa at a hotel situated just about center to the bay, there is animated opportunities for people watching as everybody plays at the beach.  Playa Palmar is Ixtapa\u2019s grand promenade.  The parachutes take off and land with riders pulled airborn ten stories by speedboats that moor just beyond the breakers \u2013 what a view.  There\u2019s volleyball, and soccer, people tossing Frisbees, aerobies and american footballs, flying kites and slinging bolos.  And walking, up and down the beach, kicking the walls at each end, observing the activities, the other walkers.  Vendors selling beachwear, eyewear, crafts, jewelry, news mags, mariscos, henna tattoos, excursions and fishing all walk by in the sand, never hassling anybody, being friendly as they pass through, here and there a showing and a sale.  The latest thing are three man bands dressed as cowboys who will sing and play a medley of mexican tunes for an agreed price.  Along this beach you walk an international crossroads.  Everybody wears a suit \u2013 bathing suits.  It\u2019s intergenerational.  The sky is blue with dapple clouds \u2013 wear sunscreen, hats and shades by all means \u2013 and the ocean breeze caresses you as the sea embraces your ankles and your soles and toes paw the spongy sand.  You can observe the people at the swimming pools and patios of the other condos and hotels.  Public access from the town is viable from several places.  A ceremony takes place releasing baby turtles into the sea.  They\u2019re setting up for a beachfront wedding.  You see dopplegangers of people you think you know among the crowds.  Somebody\u2019s speaking quebecois french.  Guys who rent out jet skis name their watercraft Lama and Pirata.  The parachutes advertise ice cream and beer.  The hotel hospitality is the finest on the planet.  People you get to know however briefly are cheerful and simpatico, and conditions can favor making friends.  Please, kids, don\u2019t throw sand.  You can read beach novels and write in your spiral notebook under the palapa, and just think, contemplating the roaring surf.  There\u2019s the Girl from Ipanema!  And again.  Music from the pool stereo drifts with a latino pulse.  Salvavidas the lifeguard patrols with his red floatie buoy.  Camera phones everywhere.  Masaje?  Another walk.  By sunset even the runners pause for el sol to descend reverently into the sea.  Kids pick up their toys.  One last lime daquiri.  We proclaim another great day and think about dinner.  The surf roars on as the sky turns purple and pink.\n\nMKD

345474252.name: A great beach destination
345474252.author: a TripAdvisor user
345474252.reviewBody: Located in a beautiful bay, Playa El palmar is a picture perfect beach with palm trees, white sand and clean dark turquoise water. If you love medium to big waves, this is the place to be. If you like walking on a beach this is the place to be too since it\'s a 3 km stretch of sand. At night you will be amazed by fabulous sunsets. During the day, lots of activities such as parasailing, surfing, bodyboarding etc...Most of Ixtapa\'s hotels are located along this beach.

344600436.name: Beautiful Bay
344600436.author: a TripAdvisor user
344600436.reviewBody: The bay is really beautiful with all the resorts and hotel around it. What is great about Mexico is a hotel can not block off part of the beach. The beach is for everyone, sometimes you will see fishermen throwing their nets out hoping to catch something. There are no public life guards and the undertow can really be bad some times. This is one of the most beautiful beaches in the area.

344538309.name: Beautiful
344538309.author: a TripAdvisor user
344538309.reviewBody: Several miles of beach to walk barefoot. Numerous activities on the beach and a glorious view of the ocean.

344011219.name: Nice Long Beach
344011219.author: a TripAdvisor user
344011219.reviewBody: Husband and I stayed at a private condo (Monarca Ixtapa) North (or maybe it was South I really don\'t know) of the Hotel Zone which was marked as Playa el Palmar II beach and it was the quiet end so it was away from all the All Inclusive and many resorts and people.  We walked many times from our condo location to the Pacifica Resort which was at the one end of the beach and back.  Beautiful beach for long walks and lovely sunsets.   Since the hotels line the beach, it didn\'t seem to have any open restaurants but we were not looking for them either.   Waves are strong (seemed to always be a red flag) so swimming wasn\'t really possible but fun to play in the waves, just stay close to shore and be smart.   Open air message booths on the beach, unfortunately never got a chance to go but were highly recommended by many.  Enjoyed many days on the beach.  Cant wait to go back

343204218.name: Nice Walking Beach with Beautiful Sunsets!
343204218.author: a TripAdvisor user
343204218.reviewBody: This is a great beach for walking and the sunsets are beautiful.  There are not all that many public restaurants on this beach as most all of the hotels and their restaurants have gone all inclusive.  The waves are rough on this beach but there are people who swim here anyway.  This year we saw lots of people riding the waves with paddle boards.  You can often see dolphins and sometimes you can spot a whale or two.

337109289.name: Sandy beach, crashing waves
337109289.author: a TripAdvisor user
337109289.reviewBody: While we very much liked the water temp., the waves are not very good for body surfing. They break high and near shore most of the time.  But my 12 year old grandson (who is not all that fond of big waves) had a great time diving through them and occasionally catching the secondary waves for a short ride.   The sand can get pretty hot mid-day, so have booties, flip-flops, tough feet or be fast across to the wet sand.  We spent many hours wading, diving, treading and generally enjoying this beach, but in a perfect world the break would be better for riding.

336778047.name: Most beautiful beach in Mexico!
336778047.author: a TripAdvisor user
336778047.reviewBody: This sandy golden beach stretches on and on. Take a walk and enjoy the view and waves of the surf. The water is a wonderful temperature for swimming, body surfing or just wading. Fantastico!

335847114.name: Excellent beach to play in the water or relax, get there early
335847114.author: a TripAdvisor user
335847114.reviewBody: We only had a few hours before check -out so we walked to this beach with two towels in hand and thoroughly  enjoyed our time . The waves can get very high so keep an eye out for kids which in the water.

335538409.name: beautiful
335538409.author: a TripAdvisor user
335538409.reviewBody: Very nice sand, nice waves, water clear and clean and warm. plenty of chairs and cabanas for shade. parachute rides available, as well as seado rentals. not many beach vendors bothering you. very good overall.

324298000.name: One of the most senic beaches in the area with all everything you need.
324298000.author: a TripAdvisor user
324298000.reviewBody: This beach always has great activities, great people watching and plenty to do. It is the main beach in Ixtapa.  There are several condos and hotels along the beach, the end near the marina has a surf spot as the waves are a little larger there.  The water is generally clear, and the sand is very soft.  It is not a good idea to swim here unless you are a decent swimmer, since large waves can come in with minimal notice.  Favorite beach around for bodysurfing, swimming, and relaxing!

299426774.name: My favorite beach on earth. Period.
299426774.author: a TripAdvisor user
299426774.reviewBody: My wife and I have been walking the great beaches of the Caribbean, Hawaii, North & Central America for 40 years of marriage. This is always #1. Boogy boarding there almost cost me my life 20 years ago, but, incredibly I was saved by one of Lifeguards there on a jet ski rescue. The place is safe [if you are careful and watch out for the crashing waves]. The sand beach is not lilly white, kind of off-white, but long, wide and beautiful. Just say "no gracias" to the salesmen trying to sell something to feed their families. Buy a beach chair downtown with umbrella. When you leave, give it away to one of the kids who can rent it out thereafter. Be kin, re-wind.

297233260.name: Love this beach!
297233260.author: a TripAdvisor user
297233260.reviewBody: Very beautiful beach.  Large waves all day long.  Clean.  Get a massage on the beach; more than one massage tent to choose from.  Be sure to walk in the morning on the beach to marvel at the size of the waves.

289229023.name: A must in Ixtapa
289229023.author: a TripAdvisor user
289229023.reviewBody: All of Ixtapa\'s beaches are clean, turquoise colored, with warm water and with great golden soft sand. Palmar is not the exception. I love the massage cabins that offer great services at a fraction of hotel prices. No vendors around, just be careful of waves or rip currents always ask about the state of the ocean to avoid troubles. Great for long walks and beautiful sunsets!

288009736.name: Wonderful beach to play on and relax at
288009736.author: a TripAdvisor user
288009736.reviewBody: With the constant low rolling surf it is easy to relax and be lulled into a nice nap at any one of the seaside palapas provided by the area resort hotels. Not exactly a great swimming beach but, it is fun to play in up to waist level. The area lifeguards will blow their whistle to alert you if they feel you are getting too far out (usually just before the break zone is okay). If you\'re in Ixtapa, you\'ll go to the beach.

286832405.name: Gorgeous warm water
286832405.author: a TripAdvisor user
286832405.reviewBody: Being from Oregon, we don\'t get to play in the warm Pacific waters that often. The surf comes with quite a kick here, mind the flags and the lifeguards! Well worth it, we had so much fun when the surf was down in the water and lounging when it was feisty. The beach was well maintained (most trash picked up), plenty of shady spots to be found and needed! The lifeguard at Tesoro was even able to help us relocate ocean stolen sunglasses we\'d written off. Great beach, use your smarts about safety as the waves can be something to wrangle but definitely doable.

269986167.name: Nice beach
269986167.author: a TripAdvisor user
269986167.reviewBody: Big waves, with major undertow. be aware. However there are lifeguards who do their job well. the vendors leave you alone for the most part.

264091306.name: a nice bay with quality sand
264091306.author: a TripAdvisor user
264091306.reviewBody: Big waves! clean beach with thick grainy golden sand, a nice walk from side to side...a bit of an under tow for swimmers to watch for.

262425883.name: Playa el Palmar, Morning smoke from the Ixtapa dump fire
262425883.author: a TripAdvisor user
262425883.reviewBody: Playa el Palmar is beach is one of our favorite beaches in Mexico, especially for taking very walks. However for the last few weeks the smoke from the dump fire in Ixtapa has degraded the air quality especially the south end but it also spreads to much of the area, depending the wind direction. I have included an early morning photo from our condo showing a portion of the smoke plume at the south end of the beach. It seems to be getting better but I really don\'t know how long last.

262128372.name: Walking
262128372.author: a TripAdvisor user
262128372.reviewBody: You can walk for a long time on this beach,it is very clean,no vendors to hound you,except  for the massage girls

261865406.name: Save the Playa
261865406.author: a TripAdvisor user
261865406.reviewBody: This is a beautiful walking beach. Thousands of Turtles lay their eggs here and the qualified Hotels have egg pens to hatch the eggs and release them when born at sunset so the birds do not get them. This is beach is threatened by the cleaning of the Marina on the North side, with huge bore pipes that spew the sludge into the oceanfront, and the affluents that are released from the South side from the lagoon at Pacifica usually on Mondays. People this year had ear, and throat infections a few times. If this keeps up even though the authorities have been advised it will become a ghost beach in the future.

261753315.name: Gorgeous Beach!
261753315.author: a TripAdvisor user
261753315.reviewBody: The beach is beautiful for a nice long walk and it\'s very clean.  The beach has been given "Blue Flag" status which means they\'ve implemented environmental standards to keep the beach pristine.  It was great to see garbage cans and recycling bins at either end of the beach and at several of the resort entrances to the beach.  This was not there 3 years ago when I was there last and I definitely noticed a huge difference in the cleanliness of the beach.  Great to see!

261085787.name: So beautiful but with dangerous waves
261085787.author: a TripAdvisor user
261085787.reviewBody: My favorite part of our 2 weeks in Ixtapa was my morning walk along Playa el Palmar.  Each morning, before the sun came over the mountain, I walked barefoot along this clean beautiful beach, watching the pelicans diving for their breakfast.  The only problem is that the wave action is too dangerous for swimming.  I swan only once and was tossed around so much that I didn\'t go back in.  We saw several people with bad injuries caused by being caught in the huge waves.

259298656.name: Awesome
259298656.author: a TripAdvisor user
259298656.reviewBody: This beach is fabulous- lots of beach, easy to walk along the shore,  and a nice long walk.  The beach is very clean with nothing really washing up on the shore.

259156498.name: Enjoyable walks
259156498.author: a TripAdvisor user
259156498.reviewBody: I recently returned from staying at Barcelo.  Since I am not one to lay in the sun for hours, I so enjoyed the long, daily walks on both sides of the Barcelo, at the water\'s edge of a clean, lovely beach.  Swimming took the form of a few dips beyond the breaker points. I was extremely fortunate to be there during the week when John built many sand sculptures, photos attached.

259148204.name: Perfect-with a big flaw!
259148204.author: a TripAdvisor user
259148204.reviewBody: The cleanest beach in all of Mexico (per the Mexican gov\'t ratings & other top travel companies reviewers). Too bad it was ruined by turning all of the hotels into all inclusives. The Dorado Pacifico used the be the best & most fun, but it turned all inclusive & ruined it. There is no place to stay that is not all inclusive. Fonatur needs to add some non all inclusive options bc its killing Ixtapas tourism. There are people who like to venture out & go out to dinner & bars & not be stuck at their hotel. Its quite sad bc Ixtapa was the best place to go. Lots of us have started going elsewhere.

258587427.name: Wonderful Beach
258587427.author: a TripAdvisor user
258587427.reviewBody: We stayed at the Barcelo and the beach here is fantastic.  Smooth sand for walking no rocks etc. Not great for swimming and we had a couple black flag days but for a quick dip to cool off and to relax and take a leisurely stroll this was good.

257349948.name: This is the main beach in Ixtapa most of the resorts are here
257349948.author: a TripAdvisor user
257349948.reviewBody: This beach is one of my favorites large surf, clean sand and lots of people. Want a massage  20 pesos  I am told # 12 has the best  it is 1 3/4 mile one way

255802810.name: Smell at Real De Palmas
255802810.author: a TripAdvisor user
255802810.reviewBody: The terrible smell emanating from the canal running through the grounds of Real De Palmas is so disgusting that on some days we are unable to sit by the pool and have to close our bedroom windows at night. You can actually see raw sewage floating down and once or twice a week, it empties into the ocean by Pacifica Resort. This situation is a health hazard. No one seems to be able or capable of rectifying the problem, we have notified the authorities and they say they will come and see it for themselves but no one ever shows up.

255581488.name: horrible smell in front of the Pacifica Resort
255581488.author: a TripAdvisor user
255581488.reviewBody: I am not sure what is going on, but there is a sewer smell /look coming from the Pacifica Resort flowing into the ocean at Playa el Palmar. I am told this is a "Clean Beach " so not sure how it can have this title if the beach has sewer from the Pacifia going into the water.

255169767.name: Wonderful Walking Beach
255169767.author: a TripAdvisor user
255169767.reviewBody: Since the beach is wide and firm, it is a great beach to take a walk and enjoy the beauty of the ocean. Plus you can try parasailing, surfing, sailing, or just swim in the ocean. It is one of our favorite beaches in Mexico.

253234819.name: White Sand Beach
253234819.author: a TripAdvisor user
253234819.reviewBody: Beautiful & great to walk day or night!  Lots of parasailing opportunities & these guys are experts-a very safe & adventuous activity.

251967878.name: Excellent Beach for Walking
251967878.author: a TripAdvisor user
251967878.reviewBody: We stay at a condo right next to the Krystal and the Dorado Hotels in Ixtapa.  Playa el Palmar is a great beach.  If we walked to the left in the morning toward Zihua, it was a mile and a half walk to and from our condo.  If we waled to the right toward the marina, the walk was 2.09 miles.  The beach is very clean and there are few rocks so you are able to walk without shoes.  The waves are strong but many people swim here nonetheless.  This year we saw whales almost every day and on our last day, a whale put on quite a show.  There are vendors that walk the beach selling, jewelry, clothing items, pottery and just about anything else you can think of including tamales, nuts and other food items.  There used to be a great deal of restaurants and bars that you could visit on this beach, but now most, but not all, of the resorts are all inclusive and you cannot visit.

251111218.name: Nice Beach for a Sunset Walk
251111218.author: a TripAdvisor user
251111218.reviewBody: I like fresh water swimming to ocean swimming so I did not spend much time in the water. Playa el Palmar was good for beach walking and watching the jet skiers and hang gliders. The beach vendors were a bit annoying but you will have that at most any Mexican beach.

249908192.name: Love the Beach, Love the Ocean, Love the Whales
249908192.author: a TripAdvisor user
249908192.reviewBody: For the past three years we have stayed at the Bay View Grand Marina (BVGM), for six weeks. We start each morning with a walk pretty well to the end of the beach and back. This is a lovely wide beach and perfect for walking. I love swimming in the ocean, but swimming here is not for the faint of heart. Each day is different, where the surf can be high or low. I noticed a pattern over the past few years where the surf gets smaller as you move from the beginning of January to later in the month. I had a fantastic swim this afternoon. Low surf and the water was warm and crystal clear. BONUS-we have seen so many whales in front of our place as well as dolphins almost everyday. Doesn\'t get any better than that.

249373739.name: Not a swimming beach
249373739.author: a TripAdvisor user
249373739.reviewBody: Too rough to swim. Jelly fish and boats were swimmers are. I did not really see any good swimming beaches in Ixtapa.

248292334.name: Nice long strech of beach
248292334.author: a TripAdvisor user
248292334.reviewBody: While there aren\'t as many places to grab a chair, drinks, and food as other beaches offer in the area, this is still a great stretch of beach. Beautiful to walk along, and just a short walk back into Ixtapa for food & drinks.

247690520.name: Relaxing beach
247690520.author: a TripAdvisor user
247690520.reviewBody: Loved the warm water and gentle waves if this beach!  It was fun to buy jewellery from Hector on the beach!

245336309.name: Air, Water and Land show
245336309.author: a TripAdvisor user
245336309.reviewBody: If you happen to be in town, it\'s a must see.It was on  the weekend of 12/20 .Jet ski tricks, motorcycle stunts, hang gliders and a really good concert.I was probably one of the few Americans there, but felt right at home.Also there was a  craft show in the parking lot.All very laid back.

241710361.name: Big hotels only
241710361.author: a TripAdvisor user
241710361.reviewBody: Nice beach with medium sized surf, but seems to be only large hotels wall to wall, so not that great for a visit if not staying at one of them.

241192560.name: Paradise
241192560.author: a TripAdvisor user
241192560.reviewBody: Stayed on the beach (again), Few vendors, not pushy. Nice 6.6km "round trip" walk. Mild undertow, firm wide sandy beach. From crocodillos at 1 end to surfers at the other!

240620446.name: Large Gorgeous Beach
240620446.author: a TripAdvisor user
240620446.reviewBody: Something for everyone. Beach walkers, runners, boogie boarders, jet skiing, parasailing. If you want to snorkel or collect shells go in at Pacifica hotel side. Everyone plays (including kids)in the water all along the beach. We\'ve been here for 16 days. There was a crowd at the all inclusives for 1 weekend during this time. Otherwise, a minimal amount of people. Loving it! Turtles, turtles,turtles. Releasing all month. Learned so much from the Eco members and condo employees. The water is so clear you can see the Rays in the waves. We even saw Dolphins.

230548252.name: really clean beach... not good to swim...
230548252.author: a TripAdvisor user
230548252.reviewBody: the larger beach in Ixtapa... it is clean but not an easy beach to swim. There are a lot of cross currents.

200416355.name: Massive beach
200416355.author: a TripAdvisor user
200416355.reviewBody: Terrific, long sandy beach for early morning walks!\nOften quite wavy, and difficult to swim. Beautiful sunsets.

198081114.name: Big waves for boogie boarding or body surfing
198081114.author: a TripAdvisor user
198081114.reviewBody: This beach is perfect for playing in the waves.  Uncrowded, no rocks or sharp things to step on, great for beach walking.  When the lifeguards put out black flags, though, be careful as the undertow and riptides can be strong and unpredictable.

197961048.name: beautiful  - but
197961048.author: a TripAdvisor user
197961048.reviewBody: Beautiful beach. Limited access if you are not staying at one of the resorts. No cafes etc line the beach - the resorts from the beach and you have to  be staying there or buy a day pass to use their facilities.  Not a swimming beach. red flag up lots of the time bc of waves and rip tides. No shade on the beach unless you have your own parasol or are at one of the resort properties.

196761992.name: Playa el Palmar
196761992.author: a TripAdvisor user
196761992.reviewBody: This was a welcome respite as our beach was not swimmable our entire vacation. (we were staying close to Playa Linda)\nBeautiful clean wide beach. Chairs available to rent on the public portion. We were there on a fairly calm day and didn\'t find the waves to be a problem. \nIf we come back to Ixtapa, we will take a hotel along this beach.

195818809.name: Blue Flag beach
195818809.author: a TripAdvisor user
195818809.reviewBody: Playa el Palmar is one of the best beaches in the world.  That is why it has the blue flag designation.  It is free of trash, two miles long and the son shines all winter. Don\'t go swimming the surf is dangerous. The walk is the best

195144304.name: Busy busy beach
195144304.author: a TripAdvisor user
195144304.reviewBody: This is a busy beach, with all the activities you want. Lots of parasailing, good for people watching and long for walking. The surf can really pound sometimes, so not the best place to try and go swimming.

194775855.name: Beautiful
194775855.author: a TripAdvisor user
194775855.reviewBody: Long, flat, safe...easy to walk and quite beautiful. Lots to see but hard to get to unless you are staying in one of the resorts or condos.

192163511.name: Beautiful Beach - No Seashells :(
192163511.author: a TripAdvisor user
192163511.reviewBody:
This beach is the main beach for all the Ixtapa resorts/condos. You can walk one end to the other easily.

There can be strong waves - so it's not a calm type of beach rather waves are constant every day. I would advise being a strong swimmer if you decide to venture into the ocean. Beach shoes are not necessary as the sand is so soft, BUT the sand does get HOT in the afternoon so you will need shoes for that :) 

Water sports are abundant. Vendors come around, but not barraged by them. I bought a few nice silver jewelry pieces while sunning on the beach! 

Parasailing is offered all along the beach - ocean breezes are perfect for it!! 

I've included some photos for your viewing and I know you will enjoy it, unless you are seashell hunting.....the shells are super tiny and mainly fragments of shells - not whole ones.

189754816.name: Great little beach on the Mexican Pacific
189754816.author: a TripAdvisor user
189754816.reviewBody: A well hidden secret on the Mexican Pac\u00edfic coast perfect for a family vacation, a honeymoon or an exciting surfing expedition on the northern coast. Safe with an ethnic al spirit, that will remember you Maui at better prices.

187395142.name: It offers a lot..
187395142.author: a TripAdvisor user
187395142.reviewBody: The beach is long but the sand is hot if you go out late. On the north end of the beach are a lot of massage huts that offer great value compared to the resorts but this area is not recommended for swimming (undertow). There is a lot of competition so prices start at 150 pesos and you have to experience it to know who is best. You can rent jet skis, go para-sailing or banana boating along the beach. The surf can be big at times, a lady we met broke her ankle when a wave caught her by surprise.. When the red flag is up, be cautious. There is a crocodile show at 3 PM at the Pacifico Resort on the south end but beware of the time share people offering a free ride on the cable ride to their restaurant. Seems like it\'s always an anniversary special or something to get you into that restaurant. The beach vendors are not at all pushy, they understand the words "no thanks".

173233032.name: Beautiful
173233032.author: a TripAdvisor user
173233032.reviewBody: Very Clean! The service was good, the waiter always come around to see if we needed refills. The ocean was beautiful. The acitivties on the beach were very good.

156559534.name: very pretty beach
156559534.author: a TripAdvisor user
156559534.reviewBody: long crescent, nice sand.  A good beach to walk, nice and flat with plenty to look at along the way.  There seems to be a lot of opportunity for para sailing, looks like fun!

153336942.name: long beach, great walks
153336942.author: a TripAdvisor user
153336942.reviewBody: Great location, but very hot sand. wide beach, great for walking, nice breeze, unlike a lot of other beaches we have been to.

151102339.name: Beautiful
151102339.author: a TripAdvisor user
151102339.reviewBody: The beach is a long cresent with beautifully maintained sand and few vendors so I found it tranquil and lovely.  The surf at the south end of the beach is just right for those of us that don\'t like big waves and the surf at the north end is big enough for some surfboarding.  All in all, a perfect beach.

150292036.name: Very nice beach
150292036.author: a TripAdvisor user
150292036.reviewBody: This beach has excellent waves to play in, not to rough, but just enough to make it fun.  Water is warm, plenty of beach room.

149887426.name: Miles of great beach!
149887426.author: a TripAdvisor user
149887426.reviewBody: Fun waves, warm water, some undertow and rip tides so care is needed. Best parasailing in Mexico!  We loved it.

143134178.name: Great beach to watch the sunset.
143134178.author: a TripAdvisor user
143134178.reviewBody:
Been going to Ixtapa for 19 years now - every evening we've sat and watched the sunset on this beach.
Just the right length for walking end to end. Vendors are respectful and mostly the same from year to year - walking the beach every day to sell jewelery, scarves, pottery, fishing trips - almost everything. There are jet ski, banana boat, and parasail folks to rent from.  There are some beach volleyball opportunities, typically at the end of the day.
The sand is very nice. The surf can be dangerous often it seems - watch for red/black flags being flown at the hotels. There is some surfing on the far North end. Occasionally jellyfish will show up on the beach, making sandels wise.
The best part, since the beach faces west, are the sunsets though.

141180463.name: Beautiful clean beach
141180463.author: a TripAdvisor user
141180463.reviewBody: This beach is a great walk in the mornings before it gets too hot.  It\'s a 3.5 mile trip, rock to rock to rock (from one end of the beach to the other end and back).  There a few vendors every day but not too many and they are polite and not overbearing.  Parasailing, wave runners and other water activities including fishing are available.  We spend 4 weeks there every January and the weather is between 30 and 32 C (86 to 90 F) every day.  And no rain.

136437312.name: Gorgeous beach
136437312.author: a TripAdvisor user
136437312.reviewBody: We love it. It is absolutely beautiful. Last visit was the calmest I have seen the waves and it was easier to swim. The waves can be a little tricky if you do not know how to maneuver them. The sand is wonderful and sometimes shelling is really good. Not a lucrative shelling beach. There is a lot of activity available on the beach such as Parasailing, banana boat rafting, beach volleyball and vendors selling jewelry, scarves and wood carvings.

132135248.name: Beautiful beach
132135248.author: a TripAdvisor user
132135248.reviewBody: Beautiful beach to walk, but it can be tough to swim if the waves are big

131674444.name: Very clean beach
131674444.author: a TripAdvisor user
131674444.reviewBody: Beach was very clean and excellent to walk.  Water is too rough for children or poor swimmers.  Might have strong under tow.

131304322.name: Beautiful Soft Sand Beach!
131304322.author: a TripAdvisor user
131304322.reviewBody: This beach is large and beautiful.  The sand is soft and clean and the water is so warm.  Make sure to take an early morning or evening stroll, we loved it!

129894235.name: nice sand, good to swim
129894235.author: a TripAdvisor user
129894235.reviewBody: good beach, many hotels. watersport available also rental of chairs and umbrellas.

128170875.name: Cleanest beach ever!
128170875.author: a TripAdvisor user
128170875.reviewBody: Great beach. Be a bit careful with the ocean though :)

125670242.name: Great beach
125670242.author: a TripAdvisor user
125670242.reviewBody: Beautiful with lots of walking area? Watch the fishermen early morning and the pelicans diving all day.

124447901.name: lovely beach
124447901.author: a TripAdvisor user
124447901.reviewBody: Loved walking on the beach every morning and it wasn\'t very crowded!

124419467.name: Clean, Rough
124419467.author: a TripAdvisor user
124419467.reviewBody: Super Clean Beach, Ocean is usally extremly rough and not advisable to swim, you will get knocked and twisted around by a huge wave, guaranteed. Not for kids.

122944477.name: Hotel Row in Ixtapa Mexico
122944477.author: a TripAdvisor user
122944477.reviewBody: This beach is beautiful, clean and filled with people.  There are waverunners to rent; banana boat rides; and parasailing.  Volleyball is played on the beach as a few vendors try to sell their souvenir items.  What I liked about this beach is viewing the restaurants and pools in back of each hotel, which are so close they could kiss each other.  Too often we only see the front of hotels as we taxi by.  However, the most amazing site is watching the sunset from this location as it sinks into the ocean.

122387279.name: Nice pacific beach
122387279.author: a TripAdvisor user
122387279.reviewBody: The beach was clean along most of the length (southeast end had some debris.  Surf was moderate most days, although a little rough for small children.  Surf towards northwest was too rough for most swimmers (4-6 foot breakers).\n\nEven though all the hotels were full, the beach didn\'t seem overly crowded.

2789723.name: One of the better beaches
2789723.author: a TripAdvisor user
2789723.reviewBody: This beach fronts the major hotels on the strip in Ixtapa. It features clean, clear and warm water! The wave action is non-stop. I marked the beach down from excellent because it is a beach where you don\'t want to leave young children unattended - the waves can get pretty rough. For experienced, safe swimmers, it is wonderful! Boogie boards rent for about $5 US per hour - it\'s a lot of excitement! There are other activities, parasailing, "banana" rides, jet-ski rentals, etc. Be careful and use good judgement - OSHA doesn\'t operate in Mexico and some parasailing operations are not as safe as others. There are hotels all along the beach, many will let you use their facilities if you get permission and buy your snacks, beverages, etc. from them. Ask first.\n

669706548.name: Well maintained cycle path
669706548.author: a TripAdvisor user
669706548.reviewBody: Ixtapa\'s cyclopista is a dedicated red-asphalt that runs from the marina to the Grand Azul (strictly I think it\'s called the Hotel Azul Ixtapa Grand Suites) for Playa Linda with a side loop through an eco-park.  It\'s also possible to take a short cut from the start at the marina over a rather rough cobbled private road to get back to the main road (and cyclopista) at the end of a quite sharp hill.  Most of the way is on a smooth red surface (shades of Milton Keynes redways!) but at one point on a paralleling service road.  There were a few unguarded holes at the far end, but overall it is an excellent path.  At the summit, there\u2019s a good view across a small bay.  The overall distance is about 7km each way.\n\nThere are a small number of bike hire shops in the village.  Although they post their prices outside, be prepared to negotiate, especially if you want to use a bike for several days.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

668188184.name: Great well maintained bike path through an eco park
668188184.author: a TripAdvisor user
668188184.reviewBody: We biked 9 km each direction on this extremely well maintained bike path. Great way to see local flora and fauna. Loads of iguanas and crocodiles and migrating seabirds and there nests at the end. Not too hard of a ride but still a nice workout.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

667893208.name: Bike ride, kayak, snorkel and lunch
667893208.author: a TripAdvisor user
667893208.reviewBody: Javier is the best.  Second time we\'ve done this and its awesome. What a great experience.   I highly recommend.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

664845066.name: Must Do!
664845066.author: a TripAdvisor user
664845066.reviewBody: We went on the tour provided by our hotel, but apparently you can also rent bikes just across the street from the hotel zone as well.  This was a great activity and our whole group really enjoyed it.  The tour takes about 2 hours but there\'s some sightseeing time in there, it\'s not all peddling!  The trail is fairly flat and was an easy enough ride for our middle-aged semi-active group. Go before the heat of the day and bring water!

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

664013539.name: A nice paved trail for cycling.
664013539.author: a TripAdvisor user
664013539.reviewBody: We rented bikes in Ixtapa for this outing and it was an easy 9.5km ride (one way) from the marina in Ixtapa to past Playa Linda. It\'s mostly in the sun but also some shady spots. Playa Linda is a very popular beach with locals on the weekends - there were so many tour buses lined up dropping people off!. It was so colourful and so many places to eat!! The path ends up by the ecological preserve at the beach where you\'ll see all sorts of crocodiles, iguanas, amazing birds and other wild life. We went again a few days later and another couple who were also cycling told us they saw a crocodile on the bike path. Yikes!! All we saw on the bike path was a coati (so cute!!). There is also a dirt trail that intersects the paved trail at about the 4km mark. We decided to give that a go and unless you are a experienced mountain cyclist, you will find this to be a very steep hill. We biked up about 10% of the hill then had to walk up. We did not get to the top as we were on a tight time schedule but I\'m sure there is a fabulous lookout up there. It was hot and dusty and difficult to walk our bike down (again, too steep for me to ride!) Sure was a good workout though! In my opinion, this is a lovely ride, with a great destination and then at the end back in Ixtapa, there are plenty of bars and restaurants to enjoy a big, cold margarita, or cerveza. Well worth doing if you like to bike.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

655027205.name: Fun enjoyable journey!
655027205.author: a TripAdvisor user
655027205.reviewBody:
We rented the bikes for 280 mxd (20$ cdn) for three hours. Plenty of time as we wondered and explored extra areas. 

Initially we found it difficult to find the bike path but once we were on it it was fine. It splits off in a few spots depending where you want to go. 

We went through the ecological habitat and saw a few neat critters; namely crocodile and a possum like creature. After you exit there is an oxxo for ice cream and snacks before continuing to the end or returning. 

Overall not terribly difficult. Playa linda may be worth a stop for the views but I was warned of the restaurants for uncleanliness.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

651792945.name: Great bike trail, about 11-12 mile round trip Ixtapa-Playa Linda
651792945.author: a TripAdvisor user
651792945.reviewBody: Great bike trail, about 11-12 mile round trip Ixtapa-Playa Linda. Riding through forest, smooth with a few moderate climbs.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

648175624.name: Beautiful!
648175624.author: a TripAdvisor user
648175624.reviewBody: They did an amazing job on these paths, they are beautiful and you can bike on them or walk through them.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

646456231.name: Nice, safe bike trail
646456231.author: a TripAdvisor user
646456231.reviewBody: Great way to walk or bike away from traffic and go to Playa Linda. Cycle path is well-maintained and easy to follow. Felt safe for daytime exploration. Can imagine that this is a good way to see birds and other wildlife during morning and early evening hours, but can be busy with humans during the daytime.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

646419437.name: One of the best ways to see Ixtapa
646419437.author: a TripAdvisor user
646419437.reviewBody: Newly completed path down the middle of the blvd. Connects both paths north and south. Smooth and safe.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

646217918.name: Top notch
646217918.author: a TripAdvisor user
646217918.reviewBody: The ciclopista is 9.8 kilometers each way. It\'s a great bicycle ride and wonderful way to enjoy a couple of hours in Ixtapa. We rode the  well maintained trail that runs through an ecological reserve twice during our stay in Ixtapa and rented perfectly adequate bicycles from 2 places: one opposite the Park Royal Hotel and the other in Ixtapa\'s "shopping centre".  The trail is fairly flat though there are a couple of hills that even a  non-regular rider and older person like me was able to manage.  Given the 30 degree Celsius temperature, we rode from Ixtapa to the  lovely Playa Linda in the morning. Much of the trail is in the shade however we recommend riders-or walkers- bring water with them. Before reaching the end of trail there is a small commercial zone with restaurants etc and the opportunity to see crocodiles, iguanas, turtles and myriad other wildlife that make the reserve their home.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

646056902.name: Nice bike trail from Playa Linda to Zihautanejo
646056902.author: a TripAdvisor user
646056902.reviewBody: Concrete trail for over 22 kilometers with some hills but not too difficult.  It also goes through an ecological park.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

643830723.name: Quiet and well kept
643830723.author: a TripAdvisor user
643830723.reviewBody: The course that we took of 8 km was well kept, with easy curves and only minor ups and downs in the terrain. It is used mostly by runners, cyclists and only a few skaters. Throughout the way trees provide plenty of shadows and if you are lucky you\u2019ll spot a few animals, mostly birds and the crocodile reservoir at the end next to Playa Linda.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

641067147.name: Relaxing, Well-Planned
641067147.author: a TripAdvisor user
641067147.reviewBody: If you get a chance while visiting Ixtapa, definitely rent a bike whether for a short ride or an all-day outing. The trail is paved and well-marked and except for a few ups and downs, it\'s a moderate and easy ride past lovely scenery.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

633789935.name: Great, safe bike trail
633789935.author: a TripAdvisor user
633789935.reviewBody: very well maintained and fun.  We stayed at Cala de mar and the loop back to the hotel took about an hour at a leisurely pace.  I would be wary about cycling into ixtapa from the hotel as it\'s all downhill ... coming back would be a real challenge!

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

599687962.name: amazing place to run in Ixtapa!
599687962.author: a TripAdvisor user
599687962.reviewBody: The cycle path is all shaded, very cleanand safe.  I went for runs every morning and saw butterflies in every run, what a beautiful place, we loved it!

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

598207630.name: Best bike ride in the world.
598207630.author: a TripAdvisor user
598207630.reviewBody: This place is great. Serene and exoctic . Beautiful place to connect with nature. run, walk or rent a bike and go. You can do a few kilometers or the whole 10. Take water and sunscreen.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

588641789.name: A fun bike ride through the jungle
588641789.author: a TripAdvisor user
588641789.reviewBody: Well maintained trail through the jungle. Moderately easy with small hills. Suitable for those who can cycle a few kilometers. Go early in the morning to enjoy moderate temperatures and shade.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

578838804.name: Ciclopista
578838804.author: a TripAdvisor user
578838804.reviewBody: We saw turtles, crocodiles, rosette spoonbill birds, etc. We checked out bikes from Barcelo and rode on the trail. It had a varied terrain - hilly and flat. Quite easy.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

574067242.name: A 3 Hour Tour
574067242.author: a TripAdvisor user
574067242.reviewBody:
No rough weather here. This activity should meet the approval of most people. If you don’t ride a bike, you could walk all, or part of this path and not be disappointed. 
 
 We rented 2 bikes from Bici-Rent in Ixtapa, by Ruebens Hamburgers, in the courtyard behind Dominos Pizza. 2 bikes for 3 hours = $240 Pesos. From there, head out, cross the road and keep right. The people at Bici-Rent will point you in the right direction. A fairly leisurely ride from there. Undulating hills along the way, with the steepest at the start, and finish if you plan a return trip, which I’m sure most will. 
 
 If you geocache, check your favourite app, and allow for time if you’re a cache-oholic. There seems to be one every 200 meters or so. If you plan to look, rent a bike for longer so you’re not pressed for time. We rented for 3 hours, found 4 and still had a bit of time to look around at Playa Linda. 

 We rode at midday which was quite warm. The breeze when riding kept us cooler, but I would recommend starting earlier than 11:30. If needed, you can pick up more “fluids” (hey, it’s Mexico right?) at the OXXO right by the path in Playa Linda.
 
 All in all, an enjoyable repeatable excursion.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

570286253.name: Excelllente 15 km bike path
570286253.author: a TripAdvisor user
570286253.reviewBody: Love this bike path. If you like biking you will like this very moderate path, easy to go a short distance or more.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

569705505.name: Very nice trail
569705505.author: a TripAdvisor user
569705505.reviewBody: We left with our hotel guide from the Barcelo at 9am on our way to Playa Linda. The path was a wide paved path through the trees and is mostly flat. It took us about 1 hour to get there. We stopped to look at the birds and crocodile, then went into the very busy market just in time to watch the pole flying show (or whatever you call it).

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

567028645.name: Bike Ride
567028645.author: a TripAdvisor user
567028645.reviewBody: Rode bike from Pacifica to Playa Linda on the very excellent bike trail. Got to Playa Linda just as the pole climbing was commencing. Very good show to celebrate the new day.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

566388308.name: Great Bike Ride
566388308.author: a TripAdvisor user
566388308.reviewBody: We rented bikes and biked the path from our condo to Playa Linda and back. We rented the bikes for three hours and that was perfect. It gave us enough time to stop along the way and enjoy the crocs and bird sanctuaries. Once we arrived at Playa Linda we looked around the shops, dipped in the water and relaxed for a bit before the return bike ride home. Our teenagers enjoyed the ride too! Get an early start because it gets hot on the ride back! We rented our bikes next to Ruben\'s Hamburgers. This bike shop was the cheapest!

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

565127073.name: Beautiful bike path between Ixtapa and Playa Linda
565127073.author: a TripAdvisor user
565127073.reviewBody: This 20-km or so of paved bike path winds its way from Ixtapa to Playa Linda. We started in Ixtapa, renting bikes from Bici-Rent (about $40 for 2 bikes for a whole day). The path winds a bit before entering into the Ecological nature preserve. We saw tons of wildlife! We did not go with a group, so we were able to stop whenever we wanted to. Guided groups we saw seemed to always be rushing through. We saw wood storks, roseate spoonbills, crocodiles, iguanas, tejones, and herons we saw. The path is mostly flat, but there are some hills, which are a challenge in the heat! When you leave the nature preserve, you are right in Playa Linda, which has a beautiful beach and small village. We rode to the end of the Ciclopista and turned around, but if you keep going on the dirt path, you can get closer to the Crocodile Reserve. On the way back to Ixtapa, we rode the entire length of the Ciclopista and stopped at Fisher\'s Bar for a cervesa (SO refreshing!). We are very glad we did this, it was very cool!

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

563055505.name: Beautiful path thru the jungle
563055505.author: a TripAdvisor user
563055505.reviewBody: We have gone on this bike ride each year we have travelled to Ixtapa. So a total of five times. We look forward to it. We have seen a few wild animals and of course the crocodiles that are near Playa Linda. We stay at the Holiday Inn and they provide bikes and a guide. There are two trips daily and each takes about two hours. Take a bottle of water, wear tennis shoes and take a few pesos for the bathroom at the market in Playa Linda.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

562390398.name: great bike trail.. did a ride with hotel activity person
562390398.author: a TripAdvisor user
562390398.reviewBody: It was a great bike trail, highly used on the day that we were on it. we went to playa linda and saw all of the crocodiles in their natural state, seperated from us by a fence.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

561312506.name: Nice Paved Trail
561312506.author: a TripAdvisor user
561312506.reviewBody: Unexpectedly nice flat trail from Ixtapa to Playa Linda.  I hope they build more in the area!  Crocodile viewing area at the end of the trail in Playa Linda with Roseate Spoonbills and Iguanas.  A small grocery store and Mexican market also.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

560922794.name: Biking Through the Ecological Reserve
560922794.author: a TripAdvisor user
560922794.reviewBody: This was a highlight of our trip to Ixtapa, as a family of four we didn\'t want to spend all of our days at the pool/beach.
