We did a bike tour through our hotel which was about 18kms and took us along the Blvd. to the Aztlan Ecological Reserve and wound its way out to Playa Linda.  We then stopped to see the crocodiles, watch an ancient Mayan traditional dance and a special treat on the way back was a Red Knee Tarantula crossing the pathway.  \n\nAll in all, about 2hrs in the morning, loved it!  Would have done it every day if we hadn\'t had other things planned.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

559932102.name: Great pathway system!
559932102.author: a TripAdvisor user
559932102.reviewBody:
Just follow the reddish paved pathway to bike, run, walk and explore the area around Ixtapa, down to the marina or out to Playa Linda. 

If going to Playa Linda it's about 9km one way so plan in advance, leave earlier because it was very hot even when were coming back at 10:30am! It took us about an hour and a half with some stops to bike there and back from Playa Linda. There are a couple of small 'hills' but the rest is flat. It goes through a nature conservation area where if lucky you might see a crocodile crossing the pathway, or some other wildlife along the way. We only saw and heard a lot of different birds. 

In the other direction to the marina it's about 4km. There are a couple of bike rental shops that open around 8am with reasonable rates. We were using the complimentary bikes through our hotel. Make sure to take water because it's needed in that heat! The pathway is very clean and well maintained. Motorists were very respectful and stopped to let us cross the road to stay on the ciclopista.

It seems that most hotel bike tour groups are on this pathway daily between 9am and 11am so if you are on your own, you'll be in good company because there are a lot of cyclists on it at this time. If you want to avoid this busy time either go earlier or later. There were also quite a few runners in the morning.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

558320840.name: Fantastic bike and walking path!
558320840.author: a TripAdvisor user
558320840.reviewBody: If you like to do things and not just sit on a holiday this is for you.  9.7 km of bike/walking trail through nature where you can see birds and animals. Great morning activity before the heat of the day.  No public washrooms along the path so make sure you go before you leave the resort or be prepared to find a bush to go in.  Plenty of bird life early in the day.  Shade for part of the trail if you go a bit later but warm so bring water with you.  Easy as it is flat and not hilly so is also wheelchair friendly for those who can not walk or bike.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

558090158.name: NIce for a walk or a bike
558090158.author: a TripAdvisor user
558090158.reviewBody: Did the morning walk from Club Med and also booked the bike excursion.   The main part of the path is through a forest away from the main road, and pleasantly shaded for much of the way.  Possibility of seeing wildlife and lots of vegetation variety.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

555007649.name: wnat a lovely ride
555007649.author: a TripAdvisor user
555007649.reviewBody: No traffic or pollution on this bike only lane!  Plan your cycling early morning or late afternoon!  You will melt midday in January! The path is shaded in some parts.  We walked it, did not cycle.  The abundance of flora and fauna was exceptional!  If you\'re a bird lover, you\'ll love it!

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

554854236.name: Must do bike tour
554854236.author: a TripAdvisor user
554854236.reviewBody: This is a fabulous 10km off road paved bike path. Most ixtapa  resorts offer free morning bike tours on this trail. No cars so very safe. A few rolling hills through the canopy covered trail with lots of birds in certain sections.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

551313960.name: Hot and Fun Family Bike Ride
551313960.author: a TripAdvisor user
551313960.reviewBody: Excellent well maintained bike path and a great way to spend an early morning.  Bike rentals are very reasonable and the roundtrip bike ride takes between 1 to 1 & 1/2 hours for a family to complete - longer if you spend time exploring the market stalls at Playa Linda. There is a XO market when you get to the end of the main path in Playa Linda - so a perfect place to get out of the heat and have a cold drink - as none of us were smart enough to bring water on the ride!

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

548631098.name: Must do!
548631098.author: a TripAdvisor user
548631098.reviewBody: We had a great time - so glad we made the trip from Zihua!  We rented bikes from Xplora (across the street from Park Royal). Bikes were pretty good. Trail is easy - just a couple small hills. Take your time & watch for animals along the way - we saw a deer, coatimundi & even a croc along the side of the path as we got closer to Playa Linda. The croc pit was so cool & the iguana were very entertaining to watch. Highly recommend!

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

509369686.name: Must do when visiting Zihua!
509369686.author: a TripAdvisor user
509369686.reviewBody: My family and I rented bikes and began our ride on the path which is well marked so don\'t worry about getting lost.  What an awesome ride!!  You ride through butterflies and under lush green forest trees.. You\'ll see different creatures on the sides....can\'t remember the names of the animals but yep they are right there!  it\'s just beautiful and peaceful!!!! do it!!!!!

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

501708142.name: Revamped Bike Path
501708142.author: a TripAdvisor user
501708142.reviewBody: Try the bike route through Ixtapa and around the marina. The path is very wide and has recently been improved.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

494690788.name: Wonderful for runs and bike rides
494690788.author: a TripAdvisor user
494690788.reviewBody: The beautiful, perfectly maintained bike track is practical to run or bike to / from some of the hotels to the nature reserve just in front of Playa Linda. It makes a full circuit to the marina in Ixtapa and passes in front of most hotels. I used it both to bike and to run, and it was safe and very enjoyable.\nThe bit within the nature reserve is shaded enough to allow for exercise even in a sunny day.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

493577999.name: Nice for trekking and biking!
493577999.author: a TripAdvisor user
493577999.reviewBody: I loved this road where you can also go for a run. It has some ups and downs so your training will be very complete. You\u00b4ll be biking or running surrounded by trees which makes your workout more pleasant.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

493104511.name: Surprisingly entertaining bike ride!
493104511.author: a TripAdvisor user
493104511.reviewBody: Got my heart-rate going pretty well, but wasn\'t too terribly difficult! Rented bikes from local store for pretty cheap... asked our resort concierge for the best deal. Saw some interesting wildlife in the nature area - beautiful birds and even crocodiles!

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

489246039.name: Better than expected. Ok for medium length rides.
489246039.author: a TripAdvisor user
489246039.reviewBody: I was surprised how long it was. However a bit too curvy for real workouts. For running it\'s great, just watch out for the bikes.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

483518098.name: Great bike path!
483518098.author: a TripAdvisor user
483518098.reviewBody: We did a short bike tour on the Ciclopista, it was really fun.  It\'s in excellent condition and goes through a lovely natural area with many birds, crocodiles and plants.  Very fun, I\'d do it again.  It\'s a pretty non-strenuous bike ride, also suitable for running.  I wouldn\'t do it alone, just to be safe.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

481293640.name: Amazing bike trail!!
481293640.author: a TripAdvisor user
481293640.reviewBody: We love this trail and biked it often.  It\'s a must in my books.  It\'s well maintained and well used.  There are tours available through the bike rental shop if you don\'t want to venture out on your own.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

481082390.name: Great Place to see some nature
481082390.author: a TripAdvisor user
481082390.reviewBody: Great place to ride a bike ride. Lots of nature to see but watch out for the crocks.  The path gets busy at all times of the day.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

477796697.name: Great Ride or Walk
477796697.author: a TripAdvisor user
477796697.reviewBody: We walked from the Azul Grand Resort into Ixtapa along the Ciclopista (7.5 kms approx.). There were great lookout points along the way. The bike path is well maintained and smooth; good for all levels of riders. If you are staying in the area I highly recommend renting or borrowing a bike to check it out. Make sure you bring plenty of water because it was hot!

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

474108534.name: Fun bike ride!
474108534.author: a TripAdvisor user
474108534.reviewBody: Rented bikes downtown and rode out to Playa Linda and back. Easy ride with few hills and all on a bike path. Fun way to burn off the margarita calories. Cool birds, crocodiles and iguanas along the way.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

471977980.name: Walked 5km of the Trail
471977980.author: a TripAdvisor user
471977980.reviewBody:
I walked 5km of the trail on my own to watch the wildlife and birds.  

I saw: Squirrel Cockoo, Boat-billed flycatcher, a Tanager (Summer or Flame Coloured), Black crowned Night Heron, Yellow Crowned night heron, Cattle Egret, Roseate Spoonbill, Wood Stork,  A humming bird (could not identify), a couple of finches (could not identify),  Black Vulture, Plain Chachalaca, White-throated magpie-jay and Citreoline trogon.

At the lagoon lookout there were about a dozen tiny baby crocs.  Also saw a couple of skink lizards.  

In all a pretty good 2 hour wildlife walk.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

471820248.name: Energize yourself with bike excursion!
471820248.author: a TripAdvisor user
471820248.reviewBody: Went across the street and rented a couple of bicycles and rode this magnificent and beautiful bike path from the hotel to Playa Linda...breathtaking lush green scenery through dense foliage...just do it!

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

470299557.name: Perfect path for power walks
470299557.author: a TripAdvisor user
470299557.reviewBody: I love morning power walks and this path was excellent for cyclists and walkers alike.  It is a lovely winding path that runs through the ecological reserve and is well-shaded.  I wish I had had a bike to go on long rides on this path...next time I\'ll find a place to rent a bike.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

469967978.name: Great Path!
469967978.author: a TripAdvisor user
469967978.reviewBody: We enjoyed the various birds along the way and spent some time on the viewing platform in the Preserve area watching nature.  Safe path to walk, cycle, jog or roller blade on.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

468182388.name: 8 kms to Playa Linda .... and 8 kms back
468182388.author: a TripAdvisor user
468182388.reviewBody: We enjoyed our bike ride from Ixtapa even though it was very hot!  Take water!!!  Reasonably flat and easy with some fairly challenging hills - definitely worth it.  At Playa Linda lots to enjoy - the beach, the stalls, the pole spinners, the crocodiles, the iguanas and the spoonbills.  Great exercise!

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

466709456.name: Fantastic
466709456.author: a TripAdvisor user
466709456.reviewBody:
Hired some great bikes from Bici-Rent for $12 each for 3 hours and then set off for Playa Linda.

Excellent off road cycle path which is in very good condition.  Mostly through shady tropical rain forest with lots of opportunity to encounter a wide variety of wildlife at close quarters.

Playa Linda was a bit of a disappointment, but this didn’t detract from a wonderful excursion.

Would thoroughly recommend a visit for some gentle exercise in great surroundings if visiting Ixtapa.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

460710387.name: Nice 2-3 hour bike ride into the forest
460710387.author: a TripAdvisor user
460710387.reviewBody: My wife and I rented bikes and started our ciclopista bike ride around 8:30 in the morning. The weather was around 79 degrees, perfect for bike riding. You start on the red colored trail in the city and then you end up going thru forest and finally to the Playa Linda area. Along the way you might see animals and there is a viewing spot towards the end where you can see some large crocodiles in the creek. 3 hours is plenty to do a leisurely bike ride, and have time to check out the Playa Linda area at the end of the trail. \nThere are several bike rental shops around the area and best to check prices and bike conditions. Before you get started recommend you check the tire pressures and see if all the gears are working, as there are a couple of hill areas where you will need lower gears to ride.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

460676120.name: Great path
460676120.author: a TripAdvisor user
460676120.reviewBody: This is a first I have seen in Mexico.  Nice and shaded in a lot of areas.  Path is 9.7km and we used it about 3 or 4 times to get out to Playa Linda, much flatter than taking the road.  Nice to have that, wish we had something similar close to home.  Saw coatis the last day we were on it.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

457478817.name: Wonderful bike path
457478817.author: a TripAdvisor user
457478817.reviewBody: I think this is the only Mexican resort town that has a dedicated bike (non-motorized) path that takes you from the marina, through a nature preserve, and eventually to Playa Linda. It\'s about 6 miles each way. This path was one of the reasons my wife and I decided to buy a condo here. We both love to bike and this is a lovely ride. Many people run or walk this path as well.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

456879298.name: Walk, run, or bike
456879298.author: a TripAdvisor user
456879298.reviewBody: I love this paved trail and use it every day.  It\'s great for a morning run or ride a bike to the other end and walk along a long stretch of undeveloped beeach.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

454249873.name: We love it
454249873.author: a TripAdvisor user
454249873.reviewBody: The ciclopista is probably the best attraction in Ixtapa for all the family, you meet from very serious runners and cyclist to all the family on it, you can have a guide who will take you around explaining the flora and fauna on the way.\nAt the end of the ciclopista you find a \'Cocodrilario\' (crocodile area) sometimes there is a \'Cocodrilo charmer\' near the beach \'Playa Linda" where you can have a well deserved fresh coconut and watch at the same time the "Papanteco\'s flyers" and carry on.\nThe ciclopista get\'s used for the \'31st Dec New Run\' for all ages which its really good fun, as well as for the triathlon events.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

453488297.name: Very useful
453488297.author: a TripAdvisor user
453488297.reviewBody: The paved cycle path helps you get around Ixtapa without competing with cabs for road space. The path will get you to Playa Linda or into Zihuatanejo. It is used by pedestrians as well so caution is advised but really handy if you have access to a bike during your stay.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

453065483.name: Need to do (need to, need to)
453065483.author: a TripAdvisor user
453065483.reviewBody: This is the best (and inexpensive) activity in Ixtapa.\nyou just find a bike shop, rent bikes and find the easily marked bike bath. Then you ride through the jungle along nature preserves for about 6 miles and end up at playa Linda (if you like). The path is well maintained and there is plenty of shade. So much fun a for a low impact workout

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

452137489.name: Wonderful bicycle/walking route...
452137489.author: a TripAdvisor user
452137489.reviewBody: If you want to do something relaxing and interesting, then I recommend this. I\'ve rented bicycles near the hotel zone and ridden the five mile trip from Ixtapa Playa Palmar north to Play Linda along the clean, smooth path. Ride fast for exercise or slow for nature watching....I did both!

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

451969924.name: Excellent bike path....a real highlight
451969924.author: a TripAdvisor user
451969924.reviewBody: We recently returned from ixtapa and based on the reviews rented some bikes and headed to the path.  It is 9.7 kms. each way and so beautiful and peaceful. Very good, well taken care of path with enough other bikers to be very safe.  Half of the path is through a nature reserve which ends up ar Playa Linda and the crocodile pond.  \n\nNow for the "buyers beware".....we rented our bikes from the shop across from the Park Royal.  Their bikes out front to rent are junk.  Ask to see the ones at the back....they are new and a treat to use.  They advertise 60 pesos an hour but make sure you write down the time you leave on a piece of paper and leave it with the front desk.....or she will try to cheat you.  She tried to up charge us 100 pesos....thinking we wouldn\'t do the math and it left a bad taste.  We are there to enjoy your beautiful city and environment and to support both....not be cheated.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

447740016.name: Bike Path
447740016.author: a TripAdvisor user
447740016.reviewBody: Rented bikes and use the path. Crowded with pedestrians, specially in the Ixtapa town portion. Thins out towards the crocodile reserve. Fun experience with kids and adults alike

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

446968982.name: Beautiful Paths
446968982.author: a TripAdvisor user
446968982.reviewBody: Great bike paths to go on.  No worries about traffic, as it is all dedicated to bikes. Great scenery, stopped and looked at the crocodiles in the wild!

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

444752979.name: Walk or bike through this forested trail
444752979.author: a TripAdvisor user
444752979.reviewBody: This paved pathway starts at the Marina in Ixtapa, and goes all the way to Playa Linda.  There are a few small hills to go up, but the ride takes you through a protected natural area with lots of trees, birds, marsh, turtles, and other wonders.  It is a nice ride on the bike mostly in the shade, or you can walk along the path if you want to watch for more birds, and animals.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

440779162.name: Tandem
440779162.author: a TripAdvisor user
440779162.reviewBody: OK so really the bikes were old and in need of maintenance but the 12 miles was a blast and do take extra water, not as easy to find along the way as you would think. We bought some at Playa Linda finally. Very cheap to rent but ask for a patch kit to take with you as you wont find any help where your going to be riding and it would be a long push back.Beautiful ride in the jungle on a well paved trail.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

436309377.name: Very nice and easy to follow
436309377.author: a TripAdvisor user
436309377.reviewBody: Nice to have a dedicated cycle path, as cycling is not that common here, so the car drivers re not used to cyclists. It may need some maintenance in the near future

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

381893396.name: Very Nice ride
381893396.author: a TripAdvisor user
381893396.reviewBody: Rented bikes by Rueben\'s for 90 min and took the path. Great ride. Not tough except that we started in the peak of the heat. Saw iguana, birds, cool trees. If you run out of water, there\'s an OXXO at the 8.5k marker. Also, you can hit the beach and cool off near the end of the trail.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

363741393.name: Nice safe ride over the hill
363741393.author: a TripAdvisor user
363741393.reviewBody: THis is a great bike path trip, stretching from downtown Ixtapa over the hill to Playa Linda, about 7 k one way. Nice change of altitude and you get to see big crocodiles at the 1/2 way point before heading back. Very safe separated bikeway and repaved last year.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

360602968.name: Fantastic
360602968.author: a TripAdvisor user
360602968.reviewBody: While staying at the Grand Azul we signed up for the morning bike tour and were very pleasantly surprised by this lovely path we then travelled on. We did an 8 km ride and ended with a stop at the crocodile area. Lovely path and very well maintained. We would definitely use this again. Kudos to Ixtapa tourism for having this facility.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

358907237.name: Great cycling path
358907237.author: a TripAdvisor user
358907237.reviewBody: Wow, what a lovely surprise! The path is very high quality and I felt very safe. All I would suggest is a few more pullout areas for cyclists to take a break or admire the scenery without worrying about damaging the fauna. Wonderful trip! I am not an athlete by any means but felt completely at ease.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

355597775.name: One of the reasons we love Ixtapa!
355597775.author: a TripAdvisor user
355597775.reviewBody: We spend 3 weeks in Ixtapa & rent bikes to ride on this bike path! It runs 10K each way out to Ixtapa Island.  The path is more beautiful every year!  It is 10\' wide well marked & very safe! We are also runners & the path is great for that also! This year they were adding some new landscaping in areas but it is already great!

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Playa Linda

671995353.name: Great shopping and ocean access
671995353.author: a TripAdvisor user
671995353.reviewBody: We rented a table & chairs from one of the restaurants for $100 pesos. We spent time soaking up the sun, and playing in the surf. The Mercado shopping was pretty typical, but prices were great. You can bring your own snacks & drinks and also purchase from the restaurant. Our restaurant didn\u2019t have running water or soap for the restroom and the bathroom was not clean. The public restroom is a better option for 25pesos.

670188300.name: Great little market
670188300.author: a TripAdvisor user
670188300.reviewBody: We walked there from Club Med Ixtapa to visit the market and the Crocodile reserve.  From there, you can also take a water taxi to Ixtapa Island.

667953889.name: What a great eco park
667953889.author: a TripAdvisor user
667953889.reviewBody: We bike through the whole park to the beach. Great accessibility to see the crocodiles, iguanas and various large birds, like spoonbills and egrets building their nests. Unfortunately some locals do not understand the consequences of throwing their trash inside the preserve. That was disappointing. But the experience was great. We skipped the local marketplace.

660023632.name: Pleasant time!
660023632.author: a TripAdvisor user
660023632.reviewBody: Loved the animal- bird sanctuary! Enjoyable walk on beach and pleasant visit with restaurant owner!\nEnjoyable drive, safe driver!

656793993.name: Playa Linda is an excellent beach which features calmer waters than some other Ixtapa beaches.
656793993.author: a TripAdvisor user
656793993.reviewBody: Playa Linda is an excellent beach which features calmer water than other beaches in Ixtapa. There is plenty of excellent beach food. You are also near the habitat of some very large crocodiles

655004513.name: Nice long beach
655004513.author: a TripAdvisor user
655004513.reviewBody: This is a beautiful beach that allows you to walk for quite some time before hitting the rocky area leading to the RV/Camping park. There are a few restaurants on the beach that have chairs and sunshades set up. All of them want you to come and drink their cervesas and eat their food. Definitely worth checking out, Better to do so during the week though as it gets a lot busier there on the weekend when the locals come out for family days on the beach.

653778700.name: Fun
653778700.author: a TripAdvisor user
653778700.reviewBody: We took the Playa lynda bus 18 pesos and the water taxi over for 50 pesos was a great day. good food snorkeling, a few beers over all a wonderful day... for 68 pesos

652144903.name: Calm waters..but crowded
652144903.author: a TripAdvisor user
652144903.reviewBody: It was nice to swim in calm waters , there are a lot of families and children and floaties!!  Friendly people at the restaurants, and cold beer!\nIt was a nice day overall.

650788262.name: Great place to spend the day!
650788262.author: a TripAdvisor user
650788262.reviewBody: Playa Linda has always been one of our favourite beaches in this area. We can walk there but there are lots of buses and cabs that you could catch. The biggest percentage of the time the water is fairly calm and good for swimming. There are quite a few beach bars to chose from. We usually pick a spot that isn\u2019t too busy not that we have ever seen any of them very busy except on weekends. You can usually hang out at a spot all day if you buy a couple drinks or order food. We always enjoy ourselves here

649407501.name: A little bit of Heaven
649407501.author: a TripAdvisor user
649407501.reviewBody: I highly recommend taking a bike ride over to playa Linda.Approx 45 min ride. Bike rental is near by.Very different feel than Ixtapa strip. Smaller location & quaint in my view. Noticed in the distance, a row of resorts. Calm & more relaxed feel than Ixtapa strip.Check it out

649362333.name: Nice beach
649362333.author: a TripAdvisor user
649362333.reviewBody: There is a nice beach at Playa Linda as well as a cute little market that sells everything you want to bring back with you.  Massage on the beach reasonable and good.

649322301.name: Popular Beach with Locals
649322301.author: a TripAdvisor user
649322301.reviewBody: Playa Linda is a busy location during the day with homespun markets and restaurants - nothing fancy.  The public markets are crowded with lots of touristy items though you can find some bargains if you have the patience to negotiate.  The big draw are the large alligators and turtles who live close to the bridge over a small stream they are larger and better fed than many in the Southern US.  Good for a few hours visit.

647473823.name: Bike ride to playa Linda from Ixtapa hotel zone.
647473823.author: a TripAdvisor user
647473823.reviewBody: We rent bikes from downtown Ixtapa hotel zone. They have well-built bike path all the way to the Playa Linda. It is a long beach good for swimming. Also, there is an area fenced around with lots of crocodiles and turtles inside. Lots of exotic birds on the trees. Around the beach, there are lots of vendors selling drinks and snakes. The bike trail is shaded by trees that made is very pleasant to ride. It took about 40minutes each way very easy. Bike rental is about 60 peso an hour with helmet direction included.

641231802.name: lot\'s of shops
641231802.author: a TripAdvisor user
641231802.reviewBody: There were many little kiosks at Playa Linda - souvenirs galore.  You can buy just about anything there.  It was interesting and the beach was nice as well.

641220748.name: Crocodiles and turtles, bus stop
641220748.author: a TripAdvisor user
641220748.reviewBody: we didn\'t stay at the beach, just took a boat to get to Ixtapa island. Convinient, 50 pesos boat both ways per person. On the way to boat you can see turtles, crocodiles, iguanas.

640908258.name: Beautiful beach with numerous restaurants.
640908258.author: a TripAdvisor user
640908258.reviewBody: This excellent beach is great for swimming and walking. Beautiful sunrise and sunsets. This beach is a short bus or taxi ride from the main part of Ixtapa and a little longer from Zihuatanejo.

639266271.name: The People\'s Beach
639266271.author: a TripAdvisor user
639266271.reviewBody: This is where most of the residents of the Ixtapa/Zihuantanejo region go the beach, as access to Playa Palmar is limited by the Ixtapa resorts that dominate the shore. The sand is darker and coarser than the fine white sand in Ixtapa but that doesn\'t stop people from having fun there. We went on a Sunday when the families were out in force. Many beachfront restaurants/clubs offering food, drink and beach chairs. Many souvenir shacks and street food vendors. There\'s a pier from which you can take a water taxi to Isla Ixtapa and a small wildlife preserve, teeming with crocodiles, turtles and birds. A 12 peso one way bus ride from Ixtapa. Worth the trip.

614728620.name: Bike riding trip from Sunscape Dorado
614728620.author: a TripAdvisor user
614728620.reviewBody: Love be local feel of Playa Linda! It was a lovely bike ride (thanks Alejandro!) We got to see sleeping crocodiles too!

607063448.name: local cuisine
607063448.author: a TripAdvisor user
607063448.reviewBody: This is a good beach to eat local cuisine, there is an other beach in front of this beach, and is better to do some Snorkel, you can find a a very quiet beach

594178734.name: Horseback riding
594178734.author: a TripAdvisor user
594178734.reviewBody: Disappointing!  We booked a ride for 1.5 hours for a family of four.  When we arrived there were only two horses.  (The other two had run away).  An hour and a half late he brought only one more and as our  guide walked along and led my oldest daughter.  She is fifteen and rides her own horse all the time.  When we offered half the money they got upset and demanded the payment we had agreed on for the longer ride with four horses.  \n\nDon\u2019t recommend the guys o Playa Linda!!

593557975.name: Nature reserve near by
593557975.author: a TripAdvisor user
593557975.reviewBody: A short walk from Club Med. Local beach that has birds, crocs and turtles nature reserve. Soooo cool.

587014765.name: A ROMANTIC HIDEAWAY!!!
587014765.author: a TripAdvisor user
587014765.reviewBody: My hubby and I found this place and decided to spend an afternoon here- we had the whole place to ourselves. We did a picnic - met a few local fishermen, ate like kings and watched the sunset from the OCEAN!!! VIVA MEXCIO!! Cant wait to go back!! ( ps - take a small cooler - you will love this place and want to spend the day!)

585208061.name: Nice beach, but maybe don\u00b4t eat here.....
585208061.author: a TripAdvisor user
585208061.reviewBody: Th beach is awesome, but the restaurant service is bad. It has to do with a lack of economy and tourism to support a steady restaurant business. Don\u00b4t forget, th smell of burning plastic from the dump is not too far away, depending on which way the wind blows.

583731326.name: Nice Beach, Restaurants are a Rip-Off
583731326.author: a TripAdvisor user
583731326.reviewBody: We spend most a day with our family of eight at Playa Linda.  The beach is nice and nice to walk on.  The ocean was fairly gentle and easy swimming.  \nOur main issue were all of the restaurant owners that are all over people to sit at their place.  I wish I could remember the place that we stopped at as it was a total rip off.  We were over charged for everything and an extra 500 p was added to use the chairs.  My sense is that all the places are the same along the beach.  If we ever returned, I would make sure that all the costs were made clear up front, and that we recorded everything purchased and showed our waiter throughout the day.  \nI would recommend bringing your own chairs and cooler and set up shop for the day on your own!

574243477.name: Not for Americans!
574243477.author: a TripAdvisor user
574243477.reviewBody: We were not happy with this beach. We were the ONLY Americans on the beach (which we were told afterwards we should\u2019ve went to the OTHER side of the jetty- NOT the crocodile side!) Our taxi literally dumped us off in a giant parking lot, knowing we had no clue where/what to go or do! Not a sandy beach whatsoever. Black nasty mud IMO. People were literally smearing the stuff all over their bodies, laying on the beach... Glad we got to experience this region of Mexico, to mark it off our bucket list, but def will not be back. Caribbean next vacay!

573146384.name: Pretty
573146384.author: a TripAdvisor user
573146384.reviewBody: High waves, but pretty beach.\nThere are a lot of things to do and many places to eat.\nEasy accessible by bus.

571789424.name: Stop for a few hours!
571789424.author: a TripAdvisor user
571789424.reviewBody: Local beach!  Pretty with restaurants (Ask for Suzy Q) check out the alligator and reptile enclosure!  Lots of local shops to visit.

570281354.name: Walked from Club Med Ixtapa to see the crocs and market
570281354.author: a TripAdvisor user
570281354.reviewBody: It is about a 10-15 minute walk from the Club Med to see the crocodiles and the market. We went in the afternoon and were able to walk on the sidewalk in the shade the whole way to the market. The afternoon may not be the best time to go see the crocs as they were all sleeping. It was still cool so see them, there were many different sized crocs. There were also many birds in the trees above the lagoon. \nWe went into the market and purchased a couple of souvenirs, we were able to do a bit of bargaining. We didn\'t walk out to the beach so I can\'t comment on that. We spent about an hour in total there and then walked back to our resort.

569707220.name: Rode bikes to see the crocs
569707220.author: a TripAdvisor user
569707220.reviewBody: We rode our hotel bikes along the great path to see the birds and crocodiles. The market is quite large but we didn\'t stop to look as we were with a guide. Stopped to watch the guys flying from the top of a pole. Next time we would go on our own and explore more.

564703134.name: Sunny walk down the beach!!
564703134.author: a TripAdvisor user
564703134.reviewBody: We walked from the Grand Azul to Playa Linda and enjoyed a cold beer at one of the many local beach restaurants.  Endless beach and ocean made for a great walk and enjoyable experience....

564671176.name: Go here for the day
564671176.author: a TripAdvisor user
564671176.reviewBody: Fun, fun day and a quaint village- must do. Take city bus from Ixtapa- cheaper, safe, fun and it gives you the feel of Mexico.

564042789.name: Well worth the trip
564042789.author: a TripAdvisor user
564042789.reviewBody: Such a cool spot. Grandchildren were so excited to see the crocodiles and the turtles. That made the whole trip worth it! The market was remarkably clean and organized. Highly recommend

561284602.name: Big beach
561284602.author: a TripAdvisor user
561284602.reviewBody: Big beach with moderate waves.  After you pass the restaurants it is wide open for meandering.  Entrance to the beach is at the bus stop and tourist market.

560716162.name: easy bus ride
560716162.author: a TripAdvisor user
560716162.reviewBody: End of the line ride. 120 pesos. Excellent chance to see crocodiles, iguanas, turtles, birds. Easy walking. Nice craft market on the beach.

559926073.name: Lovely area
559926073.author: a TripAdvisor user
559926073.reviewBody: We first cycled to Playa Linda from our hotel in Ixtapa and had a look around the large beach area with nice palm trees. We saw the show with the men on the pole, and were impressed by the conservation area with the crocodiles and turtles in the water along with iguanas and pink spoonbills nesting in the trees. The souvenier shops at the entrance had many items to choose and at very reasonable prices. There are also a few restaurants and convenience stores to buy a cold drink or ice cream. \n\nWe decided to come back on another day by bus for 12 pesos from Ixtapa and spend a few hours here when we also went across to Ixtapa Island for some snorkelling. It was a very good outing both times, away from the resort and experiencing some of the different local areas.

559763867.name: Fun day trip
559763867.author: a TripAdvisor user
559763867.reviewBody: Ixtapa Island and Playa Linda beach - day trip! Great family event or just for couples.  The sanctuary has crocodiles, turtles, iguanas & flamingos to see.  Great activity for any age.  See them both on way to Ixtapa island (Great snorkeling location) and on way back.  We had a great time.  Really enjoyed it and easy to get to.

559494709.name: Breakfast and lunch
559494709.author: a TripAdvisor user
559494709.reviewBody: Healthy, beautiful, exciting food. Soup salad and entree special every week day for 80 pesos. Delicious! Organic ice cream.   The head cook is very creative and puts love into each dish. Mario speaks four languages and wants to make sure every person has the meal they are anticipating. I have eaten there twice and I am going back Monday.

558845230.name: One stop shopping before the Island
558845230.author: a TripAdvisor user
558845230.reviewBody: Small shops just like being in town better deals willing to barter and you will find everything your looking for just a 15 minute  bus ride out from Ixtapa for 12 peso see the crocodiles and turtle\'s and wild life, then watch A real Mexican show where the 5 Mexican men climb a pole 120 feet high swing up side down by ropes to the ground a part of the culture,then take water taxi for 50 peso return over to Ixtapa Island for day on one of the three beaches to swim or snorkel  which you can rent all the gear if you do not own your own gear.\n On the Island there are restaurants with lots of different  food at very good prices.

558154105.name: Beware of Crocodiles
558154105.author: a TripAdvisor user
558154105.reviewBody: We stopped by Playa Linda while on a guided tour of the Ixtapa/ Zihua area. The fenced in area where the Crocs and Iquana\'s are hanging around is very interesting. A lot of wildlife in the area as well plus a shopping market. Playa Linda is also where you will catch a water taxi over to Ixtapa Island for snorkelling and many other water activities.

558112261.name: Great place to see Alligators
558112261.author: a TripAdvisor user
558112261.reviewBody: If you have never seen alligators up close, this is the place to go. You see them in their natural surroundings, plus other animals and birds. There are restaurants, shops and another beach. You can take a tour or take the local bus to get there. No cost to see the alligators,etc.

557437744.name: Little market
557437744.author: a TripAdvisor user
557437744.reviewBody:
This is at the end of the beach where our resort was, Azul Grand. Convenient place to do a little shopping, catch the sea taxi to Ixtapa island and look at crocodiles. 

Vanilla is much cheaper at the airport. 

It was a nice walk from the hotel got massage on the beach for $200 peso. Great massage.

555659700.name: Crocodiles
555659700.author: a TripAdvisor user
555659700.reviewBody: This is the place to go to get a ferry to Ixtapa Island. When we were there is was 50 pesos round trip. It only cost us 12 pesos for the bus trip from Ixtapa.

555443674.name: not realy worth going too
555443674.author: a TripAdvisor user
555443674.reviewBody: Our beach at hotel was better...also went to the island ...again why...pebbles, and rabits. If you are a birder a fiew different types in the park next to playa linda

555252535.name: Great beach
555252535.author: a TripAdvisor user
555252535.reviewBody: Lovely little beach, cool beach restaurant\u2019s and loungers. Snorkeling just a short walk across island.

554995537.name: Beautiful beach
554995537.author: a TripAdvisor user
554995537.reviewBody: Went here for a day trip, beautiful huge and quiet beach. There was hardly anyone on the beach besides us. Highly recommend!

554394791.name: Ok beach
554394791.author: a TripAdvisor user
554394791.reviewBody: Not the nicest beach in Ixtapa/Zihua. It feels a little dirty and the waves are pretty rough, but it is worth the stop for a water taxi to Isla Ixtapa! There is a market there also, that is great for finding souvenirs, too.

554393776.name: Nice shops to visit and beachside restaurants
554393776.author: a TripAdvisor user
554393776.reviewBody: Nice little shops to visit for souvineers. Shopkeepers are friendly and not pushy. Prices are reasonable.

550510652.name: Walk alot the beach.
550510652.author: a TripAdvisor user
550510652.reviewBody: Good for morning stroll. Close to market. Very hot but nice to see. Worth the walk as long as early.

528362404.name: Neat day trip
528362404.author: a TripAdvisor user
528362404.reviewBody: The crocodiles are birds are beautiful and it\'s worth a trip.Also iguanas everywhere and the beach is beautiful. There is a small mercado with the regular touristy stuff.

527692278.name: Catching the fishing boat
527692278.author: a TripAdvisor user
527692278.reviewBody: It\'s a small fishing dock where locals hang out and fish, it\'s a bit dirty and smelled like poop due to water flowing in from the mountains and streams. \nThere are some crocodile when you first pull into the area and there are warning signs posted. \n

527433720.name: Z 2017
527433720.author: a TripAdvisor user
527433720.reviewBody: Linda\'s Restaurant on Playa Linda offered a fabulous lunch, drinks, live music, and a great day at the beach!

518549995.name: Not muy linda
518549995.author: a TripAdvisor user
518549995.reviewBody: Except for the fact that this is a public beach so everyone has access if your hotel or apartment rental is not on a beach, I wouldn\'t bother. Did not find anything "linda" about this beach which means "pretty" in Spanish.  Parking is free which helps.

515150725.name: Dirty
515150725.author: a TripAdvisor user
515150725.reviewBody: This beach is dirty, the locals leave their trash all over, the vendors are aggressive and sell nothing but junk made in China. Only good part of the day was lunch at Susie Ques, highly recommend eating there. There is old dirty and cheap plastic chairs and tables on the beach, men are bugging you constantly if you want to rent them got the day, no thanks.\nThe locals seem to be ok with this, it is what they are used to I guess

512402601.name: Family trip
512402601.author: a TripAdvisor user
512402601.reviewBody: This beach is amazing and the food is delicious and the service is amazing. Great people, great place to go...

508782839.name: Best beach in Ixtapa
508782839.author: a TripAdvisor user
508782839.reviewBody: Playa linda is the best place to visit if you are in Ixtapa.\nYou will find fine sand, you can go swimming nice and the children can enjoy the waves.

508268076.name: Meh
508268076.author: a TripAdvisor user
508268076.reviewBody: It looks like it was a great place 15 years ago, today there is so many commerce that you don\'t really enjoy your stay

500305485.name: nice little beach
500305485.author: a TripAdvisor user
500305485.reviewBody: Little beach with nice shops and restaurant and you get to see alligators (behind a fence) being fed.

493077779.name: Iguanas
493077779.author: a TripAdvisor user
493077779.reviewBody: We got to see iguanas and crocodiles and plenty of different birds.  It smelled of raw sewage and that was a bit off-putting but it was nice to see the wildlife and we also took a walk down to the beach and ckecked out the water and other sites in the area.

488737951.name: Beautiful beach park!
488737951.author: a TripAdvisor user
488737951.reviewBody: Playa Linda is directly across from isla Ixtapa .  It\'s a large park with picnic areas and lots of beach.  There is a wildlife sanctuary next to it with lots of alligators, iguanas and beautiful birds!  Also a flea market for shopping or picking up beach items!  Highly recommend!

486533146.name: Nice beach but watch out for the undertow
486533146.author: a TripAdvisor user
486533146.reviewBody: Nice sandy beach but depending on the season has a significant undertow.. Very unpopulated for the area except for some itinerant vagabonds and some relatively harmless surf bums*(not a pejorative)...Not to count all the tourist boats...Some great food but overpriced .

484967551.name: Playa Lynda
484967551.author: a TripAdvisor user
484967551.reviewBody: Great for snorkelling but watch out for the coral patches!  Forgot name of our waiter who accompanied us from ferry over. Great food and rest drinks!

482191773.name: I think all the Rocks in Ixtapa live at Playa La Linda
482191773.author: a TripAdvisor user
482191773.reviewBody: Ironic that no other beach we wnt on the whole time we were in Ixtapa had a single Rock on it but Playa La Linda was full of them. Ver natural Beach not much on it just a couple of places to eat. Nice Beach for a Walk after you go see the Crocodiles .

481736258.name: Out of the ordinary
481736258.author: a TripAdvisor user
481736258.reviewBody: This was an interesting place.  I didn\'t expect to find these types of animals so close to where I am in the water.  The place was interesting and I really enjoyed the picture taking.  The prices are a little more here for beer , food and massages than in Zihuatanejo.  Cost for us was 14 pesos each for the bus.

481082783.name: Day trip
481082783.author: a TripAdvisor user
481082783.reviewBody: Just a short walk over from Club Med, Playa Linda is a quaint and rustic place. Found a beautiful skirt for a great price. Saw some crocodiles and some men hanging upside down on a tall pole playing flutes.

477750850.name: All of Ixtapa is beautiful but...
477750850.author: a TripAdvisor user
477750850.reviewBody: This beach in particular is a bit over crowded and not as clean as the other ones. But over all it was beautiful.

477576425.name: See the crocodiles here!
477576425.author: a TripAdvisor user
477576425.reviewBody: We went to this beach twice during our week stay in Ixtapa. Once we road the hotel bikes, 16 km return, through the nature reserve park along the well marked bike trail.  We were quite pleaed to see so many crocodiles in the marsh at the beach, as well as many different iguanas and a number of interesting nesting birds. \n\nThere are a number of different vendors, including food and clothing and souvenirs. The beach is nice and you can rent an umbrella to shade you from the hot sunshine!

476873708.name: Crocs, iguanas and lots of birds
476873708.author: a TripAdvisor user
476873708.reviewBody: There is a little river along this beach that is filled with crocodiles, iguanas and all sorts of different birds. It was pretty cool seeing crocodiles in their natural habitat. Some of the iguanas seemed friendly too. Also went swimming a few times in this beach when the waves weren\'t so big. Decent beach with lots to do and see.

476097503.name: Saw crocs, birds and some Mexican musicians hanging from a pole.
476097503.author: a TripAdvisor user
476097503.reviewBody: Interesting place. It was a holiday time where we were there so we went early so it wouldn\'t be as busy. We took a boat taxi to Isla Ixtapa and on the way back checked out the crocodiles, birds and iguanas. I think my favourite part was the Mexican musicians we saw hanging upsidown from a large pole! I am not sure if they are always there but it was pretty neat.

475552636.name: A Day with the Crocs
475552636.author: a TripAdvisor user
475552636.reviewBody: Took a cab to Playa Linda for part of a day while vacationing in Ixtapa so we could take pics of the crocs. We also visited the flea market and my husband found a pair of hand made sandals which he loves. If ever back to Ixtapa for a vaca I would definitely make that trip again to Playa Linda as our cab driver gave us a wonderful description of other things to see.

474824307.name: Loved it!
474824307.author: a TripAdvisor user
474824307.reviewBody: Great local beach, with mostly locals.  Souvenir shopping with  covered walkway.  My daughter went parasailing! (about 25$ CAD) and then went on a banana boat tour of the bay. Great place to catch the water taxi to Ixtapa Island.

474710119.name: Don\'t miss this one..!!
474710119.author: a TripAdvisor user
474710119.reviewBody: What a great time. The beach is fabulous..... and the restaurants along the beach are great. What a fabulous view. I can see FOREVER...!!

474371918.name: Decent beach.  Lots of people
474371918.author: a TripAdvisor user
474371918.reviewBody: Decent beach frequented by local people.  It is near the aligator farm.  There are several restaurants located on the beach.

474369888.name: Amazing
474369888.author: a TripAdvisor user
474369888.reviewBody: We hopped in a taxi and asked to go see the crocodiles. There\'s a market there, lots of restaurants and lots of crocs. We showed up at the perfect time. A local man who collects fish scraps from along the beach feeds them to the crocs. He calls them by name. He\'s named them after soccer players (thought that was cool). He calls them up and they come in waves. Small ones first, they eat then they go and the bigger ones come up. He even sits on them. Lots of Iguanas and birds loving in the trees above the crocs. \nI never made it to the beach but from what I saw it\'s beautiful. Lots of locals say it\'s the beach to swim in

474109036.name: Crowded tourist trap
474109036.author: a TripAdvisor user
474109036.reviewBody: Not impressed with Playa Linda. It was packed with tour buses and nothing special. The market wasn\'t selling anything special, just the usual tourists stuff.  Opted to return to hotel beach.

474106839.name: Worth the trip.
474106839.author: a TripAdvisor user
474106839.reviewBody: This was about a 10 minute bus ride from the resort we stayed at. We got to see crocodiles,iguanas, turtles and birds I have never seen before. \n\nWe enjoyed it.

473920906.name: Massage in the beach!!
473920906.author: a TripAdvisor user
473920906.reviewBody: Massage on the beach. \nWe\'d heard prior to our arrival the best massage hut was the yellow shirts at the end before the pier. The referral was bang on. Was a phenomenal massage we enjoyed twice during our stay. Could have gone every day. 200 pesos for a full hour, full body relaxation massage.

473699533.name: Feeding the fish!
473699533.author: a TripAdvisor user
473699533.reviewBody: At beach #1, my kids loved feeding bread to the fish.  The little fish swim right up to you to eat the bread.  My daughter got her hair braided on the beach.  My husband enjoyed 3 beers for 40 pesos.  I enjoyed watching my family having fun!  \n\nThere is no running water on the island, so beware.

472692973.name: Fun little place to visit
472692973.author: a TripAdvisor user
472692973.reviewBody: Came here several times while at the Azul Grand.  Biked here once and walked along the beach several times to get to Playa Linda.  Lots of shopping here and a few places to eat.  Shopping is very, very reasonable.  Very close to the beach.  There is a crocodile sanctuary around the corner.

471975900.name: Nice Place to Visit
471975900.author: a TripAdvisor user
471975900.reviewBody:
My family had a great time here, we were staying just down the beach at the Azul Ixtapa.  Came here daily for something to do.  

Visit the Crocodiles...There are lots of crocs, spoonbills, storks, turtles, iguanas...
Go a night with a flashlight and you might catch the crocs eating frogs.
The croc man is there many afternoons with baby crocs to take pictures with for 40 pesos... well worth it.  

A couple of local restaurants, I did not try them.  

Decent surf for body boarding.  Took my 12 year old daughter out a couple of times and she had a blast.  Better breaks are a long way down the beach.  

Nice local vendor/souvenir market.  T-shirts, henna tattoos, sunglasses, floaties, general Mexican souvenirs.   Oysters, coconut water, fruits, ice drinks, churros sold by street vendors.  

It is a working fishing village as well.  

The pier to Isla Ixtapa is here as well.  

Lots of Mexican's come here on the weekend to spend the day at the beach.  It has a real local feel!  I would recommend it!

471820000.name: Great beach...calmer waters and thriving with residents...
471820000.author: a TripAdvisor user
471820000.reviewBody: Enjoy mixing with the friendly residents, beach shopping and smell of food cooking...my mouth waters just thinking about it...

471206765.name: Value
471206765.author: a TripAdvisor user
471206765.reviewBody: Love, great value.  Ease to water taxis, parasailing, massages, jet skiing and great shopping.  The drinka, oysters enetrtainment were awesome.

470639763.name: Long long flat waking beach
470639763.author: a TripAdvisor user
470639763.reviewBody: We were only there to catch the water taxi over to Ixtapa Island\nThe beach is at least 2 miles long, flat hard packed sand great for walking or running \nThere\'s a few souvenir shops there if you like to shop

469968567.name: Nice Beach
469968567.author: a TripAdvisor user
469968567.reviewBody: After walking the Ciclopista we ended at Playa Linda.  There are many small restaurants, each of them trying to offer you food or drinks. There is a nice small market there.  The beach is beautiful.

469690749.name: Fun shopping
469690749.author: a TripAdvisor user
469690749.reviewBody: We had a fun time shopping the local vendors for nick nacks for the kids to bring back., Great time bartering. You can also get 1 hour massages for $10 US

469413142.name: I LOVED IT!
469413142.author: a TripAdvisor user
469413142.reviewBody: I\'ve been to Ixtapa and never even knew this place existed.  I loved it, it was going to Kenya or some african vacation.  The Birds were amazing and the CROCS OMG it was something to see, never seen anything like this in any other part of Mexico.  We stayed at the Azul Grande and just walked there, it was free, which was nice.  I\'m going back to Ixtapa and will definitely go back to Playa Linda!  There is a Market very close with no aggressive sales people bothering you.  Beach is very close as well, also the boats that take you to Ixtapa Island should you wish to kill two birds with one stone!

467278160.name: Cool crocs!
467278160.author: a TripAdvisor user
467278160.reviewBody: Great place to see native species of crocodiles, tropical birds and iguanas! Some good deals at the market if you barter!

467051205.name: Beach
467051205.author: a TripAdvisor user
467051205.reviewBody: Very long beach with low surf while we were there.   You could walk for miles.  The market had better quality merchandise than the one in ixtapa.

465463183.name: Extraordinary Beach
465463183.author: a TripAdvisor user
465463183.reviewBody: You will love the vision of endless golden sands fringed by mountains and warm ocean. To reach this paradise, take a local bus from Zuihatenejo and perhaps enjoy a local guitarist as you ride. Unforgettable!

465202623.name: Just walked by
465202623.author: a TripAdvisor user
465202623.reviewBody: We walked by on the way to ixtapa island. The only attraction worthwhile is the crocodile, otherwise I would recommend going to La ropa beach

464619948.name: Feb 2017
464619948.author: a TripAdvisor user
464619948.reviewBody: Took the bus to Playa Linda. This is a public beach where the locals come. Some even living in their cars here. Just a big Marcado.

464564714.name: Do the walk through
464564714.author: a TripAdvisor user
464564714.reviewBody: The only one to Playa Linda for short time we walked around a little bit looked at the stuff and mainly were there to get a boat ride over to Ixtapa Island I believe. Either that or we just went on a boat ride. The people were polite.

464394954.name: Arts and crafts market
464394954.author: a TripAdvisor user
464394954.reviewBody: Arriving at Playa Linda it seems like a carnival type atmosphere. Lots of local vendors selling their crafts. Also plenty of food and drink to be had under the ramadas. Great souvenir shopping especially if you enjoy haggling. Opportunities for fishing guides, snorkeling and scuba tours. There are some local cultural dance performances to enjoy.  You must walk through Playa Linda to reach the pier that takes you to Ixtapa Island. The ferry is actually a fishing boat, but it adds to the charm. Have a few pesos ready for tipping, it is what the local people live on.

463811065.name: Beautiful Beach
463811065.author: a TripAdvisor user
463811065.reviewBody:
I went for the day it was a beautiful day arrive by bus I believe the bus cost eight cents from Z   and was impressed with the beach    there really isn't much to do here but swim and eat.   there are many restaurants to choose from

I went swimming and had lunch .  I went for the day it was a beautiful day arrive by bus I believe the bus cost eight cents from Z.    I  was impressed with the beach !    there really isn't much to do here 
Although  there are many restaurants to choose from
I did see a ferry to take you across the way to another beach.    
All in all a good place to visit for an afternoon.  

I went swimming and had lunch at a beautiful place

463781897.name: Beautiful beach
463781897.author: a TripAdvisor user
463781897.reviewBody: Playa Linda was a beautiful beach with golden flecks in the water and in the sand, which is something you don\'t get a chance to see everywhere.  The water was beautifully clear and the market was reasonably priced and full of wonderful vendors.  The crocodile sanctuary is fun to look at also.  A must see when you are in Ixtapa.

463517055.name: Great ride on the beach
463517055.author: a TripAdvisor user
463517055.reviewBody: Carlos picked me up, and we drove to the stable. After getting to know the owners and guide, we started out by riding down the back road streets through the plantation and out on the beach. We were facing a long white deserted beach. The ride lasted close to two hours, took us by a few beach homes, the coconut plantation and the lagoon. \nWe rode north to the cliffs and returned back the same way. It was a great ride on a perfect day, so peaceful and relaxing. Thanks Carlos.

463188317.name: Wonderful Beach; Wretched Restaurantes!
463188317.author: a TripAdvisor user
463188317.reviewBody: This was my first visit to Play Linda and I went there with a lot of pleasant anticipation, I didn\'t have lunch in Ixtapa. I was looking forward to some sensational seafood ocean side. Was definitely impressed with the beach. The two restaurantes? Not so much. On the recommendation of the taxi driver I went to La Palapa.  I ordered a Michelada for 50 pesos. Wrong! When my bill came it was 85! The waiter showed me the small print on the menu. With Clamato juice: 85 pesos. Ridiculously expensive for a 25 pesos beer and a splash of Clamato. Okay, onto my entree. Camarones Diablo. That should have redeemed my lunch. But, nooooooo, the dish was served with COLD rice and a very skimpy amount of halved and twisted shrimp ( to take up more space presumably). I immediately summoned the waiter and sent it back. It returned with the rice barely warmed. I ate it but honestly the sauce was disappointing and the lackluster shredded lettuce and one slice of tomato didn\'t elevate my dining experience ONE iota. Not even half of one iota because when the bill arrived an AUTOMATIC 10% tip/ propina was added even though I was NOT in a large group but only on my own. Just wretched and by far THE worst 235 peso meal I\'ve had here. The word horrible is an understatement! Okay, so after I left leaving NO tip I did some browsing and bought a brightly coloured beach dress which uplifted my spirits somewhat. Then I thought I\'d go to the other restaurante to see if perhaps I\'d just made the wrong choice!  I ordered a 25 pesos beer and observed the food arriving at the other tables. Looked just as bad ( and probably as overpriced!) as the driver recommended place. I was prepared to hang around longer but there were NO reclining lounge chairs on the beach so I headed back to the bus stopping at a shop for a Magnum ice cream bar. Even though it was Sunday the ice cream chest was not properly stocked and there were no Magnums. At the bus stop there was a crocodile viewing area and lo and behold the welcome sight of an OXXO! I gratefully sprinted over to get my Magnum and a cold beverage for the bus ride back to Zihautenejo.  Beach? Tres Estrellas  Restaurantes? O or actually -2 since you need to either bring your own lunch OR stop at OXXO prior to your time on the beach. My parting thought was that there were FAR, FAR too many vendors with virtually the SAME merchandise!  The concept of variety and different offerings seems to be out of the ordinary for some reason. I\'ve seen this at other mercados. 6 or 8 or even 10 side by side stalls with identical merchandise; unpriced,  of course! Overall, a lower mid level beach experience that could have doubled easily with even ONE decent Restaurante. Back to La Ropa Beach this week!

463002616.name: Best Horse back ride in years.
463002616.author: a TripAdvisor user
463002616.reviewBody: We got to ride on a beautiful beach after a short ride through trails and once on the beach NOBODY else anywhere. We had the whole beach and it was stunning. The horses were pretty healthy and not just skin and bones. good saddles and the guide was good, but limited English,

462947296.name: Beautiful!!
462947296.author: a TripAdvisor user
462947296.reviewBody: We loved Ixtapa Island!  Omar was a wonderful restaurant owner.  Great services!  Beautiful beach and the snorkeling was amazing!

462372678.name: Crocodile sanctuary
462372678.author: a TripAdvisor user
462372678.reviewBody: From Ixtapa take local bus to Playa Linda 12 pesos per ticket,at last stop is crocodile sanctuary ( dozen at least),iguanas,exotic birds and tutrtles.Also there are restaurants and market.We had fresh coconut us$1,Play Linda beach goes for miles .If you want go to Ixtapa island,take a boat from local pier for 50 pesos return .Island is beautiful with restaurants.Last boat leaves island 5 pm

461754891.name: Fun Thursday!
461754891.author: a TripAdvisor user
461754891.reviewBody: We went up the beach for food and drinks and found "Cruz" at the very end of the beach!  He was a great host and provided many laughs and conversation.  He even led us back to "Linda\'s" restaurant where we had a terrific beach meal.

461477307.name: A lot of people
461477307.author: a TripAdvisor user
461477307.reviewBody: If you want something more relax and with less people, maybe you should try on another beach like La ropa or go to la isla ixtapa, there was full, a lot of people but it\'s still a quiet beach

461441568.name: Beautiful, quiet beach.
461441568.author: a TripAdvisor user
461441568.reviewBody: This is a favourite beach of the locals, close to the road there is a market, restaurants, and some activities. This is also where you can catch the boat to Ixtapa island. The rest of the beach goes for a couple of miles and is not developed, great to walk in the mornings. Farther down there is a section to also watch  the surfers.

461273607.name: Great Beach, Cold Beer, Tasty Food
461273607.author: a TripAdvisor user
461273607.reviewBody: A bit off the main path but definitely worth a visit.  The beach is very nice, the beer is ice cold and the seafood is excellent.

461017005.name: Ice Cold Brews and Beach
461017005.author: a TripAdvisor user
461017005.reviewBody: We adventured on the local bus to spend the afternoon at Playa Linda. Did a bit of shopping and then hurried over to a happpening little beach bar. Met a few other Canadians and had a blast for the entire afternoon.\n\nbeach bar

460897282.name: Great place to visit in Ixtapa
460897282.author: a TripAdvisor user
460897282.reviewBody: We toured Playa Linda on our way to Ixtapa Island\nNice area and enjoyed the Crocodile reserve\nIf you are going there, take the the public bus for 12 Pesos

460711455.name: One of the surf spots in the Ixtapa area
460711455.author: a TripAdvisor user
460711455.reviewBody: The first time we visited Playa Linda was at the end of a bike ride on the ciclopista trail. We walked around the shops and checked out the pier, where you go to launch on a boat if you are planning to go to Ixtapa Island. At the north end of the beach is a point where you can see the surf would be good for some light surfing. There is also an RV park located at this point, right on the beach and it looked like it had hooks up for water and electricity. We only say one RV in the park, which was strange, given that the location seemed ideal.

460675145.name: Good visit
460675145.author: a TripAdvisor user
460675145.reviewBody: Went there a few times on bicycles from our hotel, Barcelo, and on a tour to Ixtapa island. Interesting to watch the crocodiles, iguanas,turtles and birds. There is a nice beach and vendors and restaurants.

459989682.name: Playa Linda
459989682.author: a TripAdvisor user
459989682.reviewBody:
This is a must to visit! From the vendors to the beach is a true experience. Watching the men climbing a pole and displaying their cultural dance is an experience you will not forget.
The beach is beautiful and many cafes to sit and experience the Mexican hospitality. Do no miss the view of the crocodiles and the iguanas in the fenced wildlife area. Some of the crocodiles are real monsters.

Ixtapa island is close and the snorkelling is one of the best in the area.

459713955.name: Day trip
459713955.author: a TripAdvisor user
459713955.reviewBody: Nice spot to spend the day.  Can see the alligators and different birds also lizards.  lots of restaurants along the beach had lunch at one and fish was great.  The market here is very reasonable

458966971.name: Playa Linda tour
458966971.author: a TripAdvisor user
458966971.reviewBody: Booked from a guy on the beach.  Transportation there and back included, lunch and an alcohol drink. Our tour guy also offered a short walking tour of the other side of island.  Great thing to do for the day.  Great service at the restaurant we sat at also.  Totally recommend to do this tour

458172535.name: Only one American dollar
458172535.author: a TripAdvisor user
458172535.reviewBody: Great ride into town for only a buck.\n Best to pick a bus with the windows wide open. \ud83d\ude00 stops at designated bus stops and hotels along the way to town.

457983249.name: Lovely Place
457983249.author: a TripAdvisor user
457983249.reviewBody: When you get here you get to see all the alligators in the swamp.  You don\'t have to pay any charges to see them at all.

457821581.name: Good food out there
457821581.author: a TripAdvisor user
457821581.reviewBody: The bus takes you to Playa Linda for twelve pesos so don\'t spend money on a cab. It is a beautiful area with some good beach restaurants.

457330949.name: Just for shopping
457330949.author: a TripAdvisor user
457330949.reviewBody: Playa Linda is a good place for the flea market, lots of stuff at good price. The people harass you a lot but if you don\'t mind it\'s o.k.\nThe beach has hard packed sand and not very nice. Better to take the boat there for 50 pesos and go right in front at the Ixtapa island if you want to swim and relax.\nThey also have a crocodile reserve as you arrive to that place, that\'s awesome.

456373433.name: So so
456373433.author: a TripAdvisor user
456373433.reviewBody: Hard packed dark sand. Murky water. Good for walks  beautiful scenery. Go to I\'d take the water re,i to Ixtapa Island for much nicer beaches

455947241.name: Best Margaritas and cheapest markets
455947241.author: a TripAdvisor user
455947241.reviewBody: wish we would have discovered this place sooner. The markets are 10x better than the once in Zihua and Ixtapa. friendlier market staff and drop their prices more.\nI had the best margarita at the red umbrella restaurant. they were like belinis. soooo good.\nparasailing was cheaper than other places, the beach is quiet as most people stick to the other side of the pier. crocodiles are fun to watch and there is an OXO store if you need drinks, smokes snacks etc

455729504.name: Playa Linda
455729504.author: a TripAdvisor user
455729504.reviewBody: I haven\'t been able to find much info on beach restaurants at playa Linda.  I went down to the beach to spend an afternoon today and most all the beach restaurants tried to get me to come in with all sorts of promises. We came across a young woman who\'s spoke exceptionally good English. It is Sunday and was very busy. She invited us in to her restaurant and we excepted. Wow am I glad we did. She was so kind, generous and very hospitable. We had breakfast there and then sat back having drinks for the rest of the day. Her place is called El Marinero. This was such a great experience. Her business was slow this day and when we asked why she said she had just opened her business last month. \nIf you want to spend some time at playa Linda (Elisa) is the lady to see. Her food and service was fantastic. She speaks English very well and also speaks French. \nDon\'t mis out on this gem.

454550301.name: Good walk
454550301.author: a TripAdvisor user
454550301.reviewBody: We would walk about 1 1/2 miles from our hotel to playa Linda.  Very fun watching thecrocadoles in the native environment, some over 11 feet.  The beach is smooth and clean with numerous stands and a swap meet/ tourist mart.  Sunday is very busy, the week days not t so much.  Enjoyable walk.

454399619.name: Walked to  playa Linda every day.   Great beach, flea market open daily.
454399619.author: a TripAdvisor user
454399619.reviewBody: Great beach.   Visit crocodiles.  Flea market .  Good walking on the beach and on sidewalks.   Nice beach for swimming.

452840724.name: Very long Beach!
452840724.author: a TripAdvisor user
452840724.reviewBody: This beach isn\'t really that special as not that much is around there and not that much happening there. But definitely it is perfect for a quiet romantic day out or jumping through the giant waves with friends! Waves over there were really the biggest waves I\'ve seen so far!

450530388.name: Bring or rent an umbrella for shade
450530388.author: a TripAdvisor user
450530388.reviewBody: When my resort was packed and all loungers were taken, I came here and found my own patch of sand. There\'s the busy end with all the markets and restaurants, but if you walk towards the other end there is lots of beach to claim as your own. There is just no shade, you have to bring your own. I saw a couple with 2 dogs rent one from an enterprising group which sets up half way down the beach away from the busy end, where there\'s access to a road. A local Mexican told me you can buy cheaper beer there than on the busy end.

449149755.name: Beautiful Playa Linda
449149755.author: a TripAdvisor user
449149755.reviewBody: Playa Linda is a great beach to swim and walk with plenty of restaurants and shopping.  Our favourite is La Palapa, great service!  There\'s also a crocodile observation area, pretty cool.

448352251.name: Good food, place to spend the day, tho a bit crowded
448352251.author: a TripAdvisor user
448352251.reviewBody: The place is generally crowded, but that is due to the lots of small resturants in the beach. You can get there early a have some seafood and spend a time in the sea, tho I wouln\'t stay too long cause it gets a lot of tourists.

446969670.name: Nice stretch of beach
446969670.author: a TripAdvisor user
446969670.reviewBody:
rented bikes in Ixtapa and rode along the path through the jungle. Very good path to ride along, mostly flat with a few small hills each way. 
Right at the beginning of Playa Linda is a bunch of shops. Prices seemed very reasonable. A number of restaurants here. 
The beach was really quiet, almost no one on it.You can walk a long way along the beach here if you like. There is a trailer park at the end of the road.
The dock is here for the trip to Ixtapa Island.
Stop at the OXXO here on the way back for a beer and water

446364271.name: Crocs and Iguanas galore
446364271.author: a TripAdvisor user
446364271.reviewBody: Been to Ixtapa numerous times but never saw this attraction.  Interesting!  Crocodiles lounging in the water and walking around. Shiver!!!  Lots of iguanas - got some videos of them eating plants that were thrown into them.  Several huge ones..interesting place... Not a whole lot to do there but still worth seeing

444752734.name: Birds, Crocodiles, Iguanas, People watching
444752734.author: a TripAdvisor user
444752734.reviewBody: We took the bus to Playa Linda from Ixtapa, and spent time looking at birds, crocodiles, and iguanas.  The dock to take a boat to Isle Ixtapa leaves from here, and there are many ourdoor tourist shops nearby.  We walked part way up along the bike path from Playa Linda too before returning on the bus.

443126711.name: Nice Visit
443126711.author: a TripAdvisor user
443126711.reviewBody: Fun experience seeing the crocs, iguanas and other animals. Lots of shops to mill around in. Try some fresh coconut water!

440936927.name: Kinda dirty
440936927.author: a TripAdvisor user
440936927.reviewBody: I didn\'t care for Playa Linda long walk from road to pier to take water Taxi to Ixtapa Island.  Nice shops though but quite a ways from Ixtapa and Zihua....the Croccodile encloser is way too cool though!

437793239.name: Great beach
437793239.author: a TripAdvisor user
437793239.reviewBody: Very clean beach with a few nice places to eat.  This beach is very popular with the locals as well. Great place to take the kids as the water is calm

433409086.name: Good family beach!
433409086.author: a TripAdvisor user
433409086.reviewBody: This is a beach that the local families tend to frequent which makes it a lovely spot. It has many makeshift spots to eat along the beach-not a commercial strip which makes you feel like you are in a more personal setting. There is a crocodile habitat near by well worth seeing. The beach area is Definitely a place you could enjoy an afternoon.

417558674.name: Very nice beach.
417558674.author: a TripAdvisor user
417558674.reviewBody: Playa Linda is a public beach with a wharf and boats to take you to the island. Nice sand to walk leading to vast area with food and souvenirs vendors. Ultra friendly and respectful. Sunday is the real experience.

412940975.name: Spend a day at the beach
412940975.author: a TripAdvisor user
412940975.reviewBody:
The family wanted to do aquatic sports so we spent the day at this beautiful beach. We rented some beach chairs, beds and umbrellas from Restaurant La Perla.
They have service at the beach so we ordered water and soda and in the afternoon we went into the restaurant to eat.
Very good mexican food and they helped us a lot since we are kind of vegetarian but we eat some fish.
Great service and great prices.

412804434.name: Rode Bikes Here
412804434.author: a TripAdvisor user
412804434.reviewBody: We stayed at Capella and rode bikes here... had a great time and really enjoyed our day! Would love to return :)

406367860.name: Day trip
406367860.author: a TripAdvisor user
406367860.reviewBody: Nice bus ride  relaxing too  Aligators were very cool  old guy had tiny one in a cart to share with groups  very nice and safe  .

405474567.name: Ixtapa 2016
405474567.author: a TripAdvisor user
405474567.reviewBody: Playa Linda is a chill off the beaten path beach with plenty of shops to buy souvenirs at for less than you hotel gift shop. Plenty of water sports available for a tiny fee.

390068671.name: Surfing beach
390068671.author: a TripAdvisor user
390068671.reviewBody: Great surfing beach, pay 50 pesos and park your car in the parking lot of the camp site. The campsite is at the end of Playa Linda, so you can shower off and use the pool. \nForget Saladita, Playa Linda is not a far paddle out and your close to Ixtapa.

385663515.name: Great open beach...
385663515.author: a TripAdvisor user
385663515.reviewBody: Good waves for surfing and bodyboarding. But be ready for the strong currents and long paddle! The waves are pretty fast too. Great place... I just need to be in better shape!

372654888.name: So much to do!
372654888.author: a TripAdvisor user
372654888.reviewBody: Walking distance from the Azul and Azul Grand resorts.  Beautiful beach.  Great shopping area, as good as anything else in Zihuatanejo and Ixtapa.  Had drinks at a wonderful little bar off the beach.  Crocodile area is right there.  Boat wharf for Ixtapa island is there.  Some quaint places to eat, that looked really good, were there as well though we did not try them as we were at an all-inclusive.  Will definitely try them next time.

370531564.name: Great Beach to Surf and Explore
370531564.author: a TripAdvisor user
370531564.reviewBody: Playa Linda is a beautiful beach to walk along and explore. There is a nice surf spot at the end of the beach near the campgrounds. Has a nice break with some really good sized waves. Make sure you check out the natural crocodile habitat near the roundabout. You will be able to get close to live crocs, turtles, iguanas, flamingos, and other wildlife. Definitely a good sight seeing spot!

368331900.name: Nice
368331900.author: a TripAdvisor user
368331900.reviewBody: Not the best beach I live on the west coast of Canada and beach seams the same gray sand also found it was a little dirty and sand fleas :-(

367863673.name: Day at the island Coral Beach!
367863673.author: a TripAdvisor user
367863673.reviewBody: I went to most of the beaches(plays) and this was my favorite! 40 pesos for a water taxi that stops at 2 different parts of the island.  Be careful as we had 4 in our group and were split up on 2 different water taxis.  Each party ended up at a different place! We were taken to meet but were surprised that they do not all go to the same destination.  Other than that surprise everything else was wonderful!  The beach, very clean and warm water, the drinks, snorkeling and swimming !  Great day!

363685160.name: Quant Busy Beach
363685160.author: a TripAdvisor user
363685160.reviewBody: This is a great little beach that is right by the boat launch to go to Ixtapa Island. Lots of locals there having a great time!! I would recommend it if you couldn\'t get to the island.

363483511.name: It is where the locals go enjoy the ocean
363483511.author: a TripAdvisor user
363483511.reviewBody: We loved walking on this beach all the way from the pier to the end where there is a camping site. Near the pier there are several restaurants and bars, but it gets quite empty towards the camping. Beautiful and quiet away from the crowd, one can really enjoy peace here.

360760303.name: Lovely long beach with crashing waves ideal for surfing
360760303.author: a TripAdvisor user
360760303.reviewBody:
Playa Linda starts off just after the fishing pier where one can watch the local fishermen catching fish and is also the place to catch ferries across to Ixtapa Island. Unfortunately the first part  was covered in litter, following the Easter long weekend. The early morning clean up crew soon had it under control, but it was sad to see such carelessness. 

 Playa Linda stretches for miles and is a great place to run. It soon becomes a deserted, pristine beach covered in driftwood and pebbles rather than litter.  A couple of kms up the beach there is a camp ground (with showers and washrooms) and just beyond that a large lagoon teeming with birds and turtles and some crocs. A few surfers were out bright and early to catch the waves. 
A cocodillario is located near the pier and the entrance to the beach and is filled with cocodillos (crocs) turtles and some incredible birds. One species in particular fascinated me. They were the colour of flamingos but not quite as tall and the perched in trees. They had white heads with a black collar and scarlet stripes across their pink wings. They also had spoon shaped bills.
 
Also near the entrance to Playa Linda is a market with a collection of Mexican shops, stocking such things as crafts, t-shirts, cover ups and swim suits.
