360224623.name: The best of the quiet beaches
360224623.author: a TripAdvisor user
360224623.reviewBody: Good for families and very close to the dock to catch the boat to Isla Ixtapa for great snorkeling.  Very easy to take the local bus from Zihua.  The buses run regularly and cost about $.25

360201926.name: A Quaint Public Beach
360201926.author: a TripAdvisor user
360201926.reviewBody: This public beach is nice, but was very busy over the Easter Weekend, which, next to Christmas, is the busiest time of year.  There are crocodiles and other wildlife that can be viewed near the beach.  The sad thing is all of the garbage people throw in by the animals.  There are some flea market stalls there as well.

360035836.name: Nice surfing beach
360035836.author: a TripAdvisor user
360035836.reviewBody: We went surfing here in march 2016, perfect location to learn to surf.  Even though it was very busy closer to town, the northern part of Playa Linda was wide open for us.  Some areas did have areas where there were stones, but plenty of sand to avoid those areas.

359354565.name: Looks a world away from the resort!
359354565.author: a TripAdvisor user
359354565.reviewBody:
I walked down to the end of the resort zone and found this gem. Beautiful, wide beach. It feels like you're miles from the tourist zone, in comparison. Palm trees stretch into the distance. 

Yet it's close to a little tourist market, some restaurants and the boats to Ixtapa Island.

Do watch for crocodiles. I met some people who had to end a surfing lesson because a croc got in with their kids. However, the hotel told me that usually crocodiles only enter the ocean in September/October when the run off is so high that the salt levels drop. I guess someone forgot to tell this crocodile that.

You can rent an umbrella for a small amount - it seemed reasonable, although I didn't feel the need.

357172263.name: Go see the crocodiles
357172263.author: a TripAdvisor user
357172263.reviewBody: We walked to this beach from the Grand Azul.  A nice easy walk on the beach.  The shopping here was good. We didn\'t find the vendors pushy.  The prices were ok... but if you are going to Zihua, save your souvenir dollars for there.  Much cheaper.  We had massages on the beach for $200 pesos and they were awesome.  Both shacks!  We didn\'t swim but the beach looked nice.  \nThe crocodile/iquana enclosure was fascinating.  Lots of birds, some turtles... and lots and lots of crocs and iquanas.

356597791.name: Shopping and a quick beer!
356597791.author: a TripAdvisor user
356597791.reviewBody: Just a 15 minute walk down the beach from our hotel. Little shops and nice beach with restaurants to stop for a cold beer!

356207664.name: Great crocs
356207664.author: a TripAdvisor user
356207664.reviewBody: Good place to bike or walk to from Ixtapa. Fun to see crocodiles n iguanas. Nice trail there and back or take bus

355402337.name: Vacation March 2016
355402337.author: a TripAdvisor user
355402337.reviewBody: Cool place to visit. Crocodiles are awesome! The shopping was fun! The pico and salsa were the best I\'ve ever had! The men dancing on the pole and swinging down upside down was fun to watch.

354577876.name: Awesome beach!!
354577876.author: a TripAdvisor user
354577876.reviewBody: Located at the base of a fishing pier which boats locate on to go to Ixtapa Island.  The beach is super clean and you could walk for miles to the north.

354317196.name: A must see when in Ixtapa
354317196.author: a TripAdvisor user
354317196.reviewBody: The Playa Linda bus will take you directly to this area.  There is a Crocodile/Iguana sanctuary when you first arrive and a local market.  There are 2 beaches available with restaurants, however if you take the water taxi there are 3 more beaches and they are great for snorkeling plus there are many restaurants with beach lounges/cold beer and great food.

353722616.name: Liked the Crocodiles
353722616.author: a TripAdvisor user
353722616.reviewBody: Decided to take the bus up to Playa Linda and check it out.  No problems finding it or getting there.  Loved the crocodile reserve.  Lots of crocs, turtles, iguanas and birds to watch.  Playa Linda beach is not a beach to spend a day at. It is the place to get to Ixtapa Island and see the croc reserve.  There are also some restaurants and shops.  Worth a stop, but not its own destination.

353684138.name: Alice
353684138.author: a TripAdvisor user
353684138.reviewBody: On the week is nothing around ther.\nVerry quiet ,but friendly resto on the beach and helpfull.Thanks

352126235.name: Crocodiles
352126235.author: a TripAdvisor user
352126235.reviewBody: We visited Playa Linda during our stay in Ixtapa.  We went to see the crocodiles and were not disappointed.  There are a lot of crocodiles to see and many iguanas also.  There was not much else to do at the beach, except there was souvenir shopping available

352117418.name: Unspoiled miles of beach.
352117418.author: a TripAdvisor user
352117418.reviewBody: This beach goes for miles and miles north...perfect for hard core joggers who want that. The south end has the usual vendors...but not bad at all. I bicycled regularly from the Krystal to Playa Linda...loved it! About a half hour bike trip for the reasonably fit. Rent a bike in Ixtapa...You can also bike all the way from Play Linda to Ixtapa to Zihua.

351561733.name: Worth a little walj
351561733.author: a TripAdvisor user
351561733.reviewBody: Cute place, visit Alonzo at the Palapa resto for amazing red snapper. The croc reserve was cool, lots of little turtles and exotic birds. The flea market is decent with lots of things for kids, some clothing/accessories and trinkets. A nice getaway from the resort for a few hrs to feel a little more local...got to see some men dressed up in folklore outfits do a performance in the middle of the shopping area. The beach itself is long & beautiful.

350506346.name: Scenic secluded beach!
350506346.author: a TripAdvisor user
350506346.reviewBody: Caught 5 Rooster Fish just off Playa Linda the end of January 2016 fishing with Captain Adan on Gitana 2. Fished here for several hours and had a very nice view of this secluded beach definitely worth a visit.

350400171.name: A stop, not a destination
350400171.author: a TripAdvisor user
350400171.reviewBody: This place has some cool crocadiles to look at and some dingy flea market areas, it\'s where you catch a water taxi to Isla Ixtapa.  Lousy Banos out here.  Wouldn\'t plan a day here, but it\'s worth a visit.

349386708.name: Another draw to the area
349386708.author: a TripAdvisor user
349386708.reviewBody: We stayed at the Ixtapa Azul Grand and discovered the crocs and flea market and beach on the way to Ixtapa Island. This was a bonus and must see I would say if you are in the area or are planning to go to the island. Lots of big crocs to view kids would have a blast if you have some!

349290455.name: Excellent long beach with markets.
349290455.author: a TripAdvisor user
349290455.reviewBody: This is a public beach that the locals come to, its clean and has a lot to offer regarding shopping. You can walk for miles on this beach.

348635018.name: Beautiful beach with live crocs to view
348635018.author: a TripAdvisor user
348635018.reviewBody: This is a nice beach, for walking, or playing in the ocean. It is also the jump off point to go to Ixtapa Isla. There is a Crocodile reserve there that has hundreds of live crocs, in their natural habitat, that you can see up close. There are a few vendor shops there, as well as a few restaurants. The beach goes on for maybe a mile or so, then you come to the mouth of the river. Take the bus there for an added adventure.

347608624.name: Long quiet walk
347608624.author: a TripAdvisor user
347608624.reviewBody: Other than the flea market down by the pier, Playa Linda is a quiet undeveloped beach. There was fishing going out out front of the beach, and the waves are generally quiet.

346344056.name: Playa Linda
346344056.author: a TripAdvisor user
346344056.reviewBody: We ate at the second restaurant from the end and they had the most delcious refried beans & tacos!  We were staying at the Azul & it was only a 5-10 min walk down the beach to Playa Linda.

346246690.name: Crocs and Shopping
346246690.author: a TripAdvisor user
346246690.reviewBody: This is great stop to see the crocodiles and do some shopping without going into town.  We go each year.

346239954.name: A must see if your in the area
346239954.author: a TripAdvisor user
346239954.reviewBody: A short 20 minute bus ride from Ixtapa at only 10 pecos per person this is a deffenate sight to stop by and have a look Turtles Large Crocodiles really neat Plan the entire dat for 40 pecos you can take a boat to Ixtapa Island were you can swim snorkell eat and have a drink Deffenantly worth the time

345889377.name: Great location for snorkeling and local shopping.
345889377.author: a TripAdvisor user
345889377.reviewBody: It\'s an easy walk to Playa Linda and look for some crocodiles under the bridge as you cross over into the village.  The local ferries offer low cost round trips over to Ixtapa island for snorkeling on the reef.

345638713.name: Nice beach and ocean!
345638713.author: a TripAdvisor user
345638713.reviewBody: Walked everyday on Playa Linda from the Azul. Ocean clean to swim in. Loved the little outdoor bars along the beach.

345166890.name: Playa Linda make my heart sing!
345166890.author: a TripAdvisor user
345166890.reviewBody: We were at Playa Linda yesterday.  If you ever imagined an unspoiled beach, this is it.  There was nobody around.  Some reviewers said it was dirty, but not when I was there.  We had lunch at Tiberon and it was fantastic as well.  I played in the waves for about an hour and had a fantastic time.  You can take the bus here for 10 pesos.  There is also a little flea market if you need your shopping fix.  I am going back there today : )

343392594.name: Great morning walks!
343392594.author: a TripAdvisor user
343392594.reviewBody: We walked here from The Azul Grand. This is also how we got to the pier to go to Ixtapa Island. Nice beach to walk and you can swim if water is not too rough. There is a market area at the end of the beach by the pier also crocodile habitat (fenced). You can also get a massage near The Azul hotel with a view of the island.

343209190.name: Great day with the locals, good shopping too!
343209190.author: a TripAdvisor user
343209190.reviewBody: We visited a number of times- walked from Azul Grand- great little shops & cold beer & really good food.

342812575.name: Awesome spot
342812575.author: a TripAdvisor user
342812575.reviewBody:
Playa Linda easy to get to on the bus.so it's on the cheap. Don't have to pay for a tour. Nice little water taxi ride over only 40 pesos each.
Big beaches tons of chairs and 
Palapas just buy a pop and you can stay all day. But the lunches are great. Servers are there to please you. OMG great service.
Paradise Escondido is very good. As we're all the others I'm sure.

341526959.name: an absolute joke for a beach
341526959.author: a TripAdvisor user
341526959.reviewBody: this is the last beach you\'d want to spend time on in the area.  It\'s like the land where no one wants to be.  Dirty, terrible facilities and locals shoving stuff in your face all day lone.  total waste of time

339286430.name: nice beah
339286430.author: a TripAdvisor user
339286430.reviewBody: this is the beach lots of people use to go to Ixtapa island. The boat are $40 pesos return and run from the pier every 15 min or so. But you can spend a day on a beach as we did. If you are coming by car you will see a crocodile reserve right next to the main parking area. We were lucky to see about 10 species resting on the sand plus a turtle and 5-6 large iguanas. Then you go on the beach and see a main pier in the middle. The hotels stretch is on the left and wide beautiful beach is on the right. The waves a big, but still ok to swim. Great beach to walk with lots of palm trees.

339242318.name: Beautiful beach
339242318.author: a TripAdvisor user
339242318.reviewBody: With just a short walk along the beach you can enjoy Playa Linda.     So excited to be heading back again in Feb 2016.

336767336.name: Dirty beach
336767336.author: a TripAdvisor user
336767336.reviewBody: We came to this beach based on recommendations by locals.  There was a lot of garbage on this beach.  The sand isn\'t really sand- it is hard packed dirt.  The surf is strong here.  You can walk on the beach a ways and there are some palm trees but it wasn\'t for us.

335846752.name: Lots of activities, food shacks but not a great beach to play in the water
335846752.author: a TripAdvisor user
335846752.reviewBody: Would only go here to enjoy the activities such as para sailing, water sofa , banana boat etc or to eat seafood cocktails and drink from coconuts. The natural habitat for crocs and iguanas was a surprise but I hope the area for these animals is bigger than what meets the eyes.

334787312.name: Not a super great beach
334787312.author: a TripAdvisor user
334787312.reviewBody: I went here yesterday with our family and the people were really nice. We road bikes from Ixtapa Centro. The bike path through the jungle was really pretty and about four miles long. The beach was a bit dirty. The sand quality was poor with a mix of soil in the sand so it stained our clothing.  We stayed for about 20 minutes and road back to Ixtapa. The crocodiles were fun to look at but I would not go back.

334480578.name: A Glorious Stretch of Beach
334480578.author: a TripAdvisor user
334480578.reviewBody: A long and glorious stretch of white sand beach facing thunderous waves. One can frequently see dolphins playing just beyond the breaking surf. A 15 minute taxi ride from Zihuatenejo.

332278112.name: Long beach to walk
332278112.author: a TripAdvisor user
332278112.reviewBody: Long beach to walk but dirty in some places. Lots of dogs running around. Once you get past vendors there\'s nothing.

329564197.name: Beautiful Beach
329564197.author: a TripAdvisor user
329564197.reviewBody: Nice and long, very few people. Simply a wonderful and beautiful beach. Beware the first restaurant, La Palapa, however, a few rip off artist that act as waiters there.

325944466.name: Only surfers and nature buffs will ilke this area!
325944466.author: a TripAdvisor user
325944466.reviewBody: The Playa Linda are is remote and natural.  Mediocre surf and crazy driftwood.  Not a place for services or comfort, but cool if you want an unspoiled beach.

325118528.name: Hot as heck in July
325118528.author: a TripAdvisor user
325118528.reviewBody: Went to Ixtapa on business and spent an additional 2 days. Beautiful town and resorts.  Temps were 105 in the shade and the water was really rough.  Enjoyed sitting by the pool and parasailing.

322505515.name: Worth visiting
322505515.author: a TripAdvisor user
322505515.reviewBody: This is the real Mexico and worth visiting. Be sure to see the crocodiles!! This is also a good place for souvenirs,

321475086.name: La Palapa Restaurant in La Playa Linda
321475086.author: a TripAdvisor user
321475086.reviewBody: I have been to Ixtapa/zau 4 times and we have met a great guy at this restaurant named Alonso he speaks fluent English and is a great help getting boats/what to do etc...we have since kept in contact with him and see him every year.  The food is fantastic especially the garlic shrimp.  If you go there ask for him and say Mike and Esther sent ya he will treat ya good.

318977869.name: Great beach spot close to Zihua
318977869.author: a TripAdvisor user
318977869.reviewBody: Playa Linda is about 20 minutes south of Zihua, accessible easily from the main road / highway that goes out to the airport.  Signs direct you to turn onto a side road not far from town.  The beach is more secluded, not too many people come from the main La Ropa beach area.  There are lots of good restaurants with friendly service to serve as a base for a day or afternoon.  If you want a quieter beach experience with bigger waves, Playa Linda will work well for you.  Caution: although the beach is is huge and mostly pristine, the water is not suitable for small children.  Swells are normally 3 to 6 ft high, plenty of undertow to be dangerous...  Adults with boogie boards (and courage!) will have a blast however!

311800976.name: Nice place to visit, got to see numerous vendors and fisherman\'s market
311800976.author: a TripAdvisor user
311800976.reviewBody: Not the most beautiful beach but does offer some adventures for snorkelers.\nCertainly nor overcrowded and those who where there seemed to enjoy the tranquility.\nWe went there via Hobby Cat

309349913.name: worst beach ever
309349913.author: a TripAdvisor user
309349913.reviewBody: first of all most of the people there tricks you telling you lies about that you cannot go to the island because you have to go so early in the morning and if you do that your best option is to stay in the beach the sand is horrible and everything is very expensive. take my advice don\'t speak with people from restaurants better follow the signs and believe me you can take the boat to the island at any time

309281915.name: Borrowed boogie boards from a restaurant
309281915.author: a TripAdvisor user
309281915.reviewBody: We had lunch at one of the local restaurants, ours looked like a shack but the food came out great. After a few beers and hanging out in their hammocks the owners lent us their boogie boards to catch the waves. The beach was very nice, very sandy, and had a decent enough surf for body surfing, and excellent surf for boogie boarding.\n\nWe were scheduled to head over to Isla Ixtapa via water taxi from Playa Linda but the storm over the last two days had made loading impossible and the water taxi\'s weren\'t running. Side note, you can not catch a water taxi from the Ixtapa Marina to isla Ixtapa. So we ended up spending the day at Playa Linda.

305323948.name: Short drive from Zihuatanajo
305323948.author: a TripAdvisor user
305323948.reviewBody: We drove our rental here from Zihua to check it out. It was a little confusing to navigate through the hotel area with the winding roads taking you from hotel to hotel. When we found the public beach, we were directed to park by the restaurant servers followed by a "let me take you to a table" as soon as we got out. Past the street venders were a few restaurants with tables with umbrellas on the beach. Many locals were amongs the tables, some brought coolers and some had restaurant food and we felt silly for buying beers and soda from the servers rather than getting them from the store nearby. After our visit we wished we were back in Zihua, when we could get more local shopping and food but as always, the views are worth seeing.

299400145.name: Fun times
299400145.author: a TripAdvisor user
299400145.reviewBody: Market has some very good deals. Beach restaurants are excellent and have wonderfully tasty food. Definitely worth a visit

297697178.name: Playa Linda  Beach
297697178.author: a TripAdvisor user
297697178.reviewBody: If you love a quiet walk on the beach then Playa Linda is the beach for you. It is a stop off point for the boats to Ixtapa Island and where the pier is.  Lots of little restaurants there, close to the alligator refuge and just a short walk from the Azul and the Azul Grnad

297233748.name: Small beach with a lot to offer.
297233748.author: a TripAdvisor user
297233748.reviewBody: Smaller beach.  Shopping at one end of the beach.  A few places to eat right on the beach.  Some entertainment on the plaza.  Not a big beach but a busy fun beach.  Don\'t forget to check out the alligators just past the shopping area.

296668144.name: Playa linda
296668144.author: a TripAdvisor user
296668144.reviewBody: Nice n calm. Iy is beautiful and hot in sumer. I really liked it. Sand is good. Foo is good too. People is nice and there are thosand of activities that you can do especially snorkeling

295987262.name: Horse-back on the beach!
295987262.author: a TripAdvisor user
295987262.reviewBody: We went horse-back riding here. On the beach, with the waves, the horses were wonderful and we did a few sprints to and fro across the beach!

286877952.name: Nice beach
286877952.author: a TripAdvisor user
286877952.reviewBody: Very clean beach, not to crowded had some good food here also. waves not too rough. suitable for kids

286830304.name: Nice stop before the island
286830304.author: a TripAdvisor user
286830304.reviewBody: Shopping (for a price!), decent bathrooms, wildlife, and swimming if you\'re not up for a boat ride! We were venturing on to the island so didn\'t spend too long but it was fun to see lizards, crocodiles, and other creatures (free of charge) on the way.

285833299.name: Local beach
285833299.author: a TripAdvisor user
285833299.reviewBody: This beach is a public , looking across to Ixtapa Island , there is a market close by with lots of cool things and good food , and lots of water sports to take part in . On the weekend the beach can get a little crowded

277647277.name: Linda it is
277647277.author: a TripAdvisor user
277647277.reviewBody: Called Playa LInda because it is beautiful and it is.  Also quite crowded, but not oppressively so.  Great place to people watch, or catch a ride on one of those ocean kite ride thingy\'s (forget what they\'re called).  Close to hotels and restaurants.

274787518.name: Beautiful
274787518.author: a TripAdvisor user
274787518.reviewBody: Beach all to yourself by taking a walk. Nice ocean and not crowed during the mid week. Shopping - food -  cold beer and a swim.... what more does one need.

272881580.name: We went here a lot
272881580.author: a TripAdvisor user
272881580.reviewBody: The restaurants are great the beach was very lovely most all the days where they\'re very clean. Towards the end of our trip some very rough waters came in as there was a storm about to come . We didn\'t go back after that the water was to turbulent

270419833.name: Nobody there.....
270419833.author: a TripAdvisor user
270419833.reviewBody: Arrived around 9 am....we were all alone on miles of beach.  Nice walk....on way back to get water taxi to Isla Ixtapa...we had 20 peso cervesas!!

269477588.name: Cool little spot
269477588.author: a TripAdvisor user
269477588.reviewBody: We did turtle releasing at playa Linda when we visited Ixtapa. The beach itself was something beautiful. It was very quiet, and we were there at sunset. You need to watch the incredible color changes! Orange, silver, pink..,  It was gorgeous. There were lots of rocks to one side. It allowed for some most amazing pictures. A man with a horse took my girls for a ride and they were thrilled. There are neat little houses and restaurants along but it is not overdone. It was very tranquil in a world of all inclusive.

268770262.name: Excellente
268770262.author: a TripAdvisor user
268770262.reviewBody: We\'ve been there twice and have never been disappointed. Always something to see or do. The person talking to the crocks was very entertaining. There was nothing there I did not dislike.

265575890.name: Meet the locals a Playa Linda
265575890.author: a TripAdvisor user
265575890.reviewBody: I like this beach when you can get on it .  It\'s very popular with the locals and if you go at Easter holidays you will see more umbrellas then the beach!  There,s a small shopping market and a gator sanctuary there to visit.

264959299.name: Playa linda...Basura beach
264959299.author: a TripAdvisor user
264959299.reviewBody: There is a lot going on on this beach, there is a market and some beach restaurants as well as a small crocodile observation area nearby. The beach is fairly large with a lot of sandy area and it stretches for quite a ways. It was so beautiful but we chose to go on the long weekend and it was extremely crowded, likely over 1000 people there celebrating the Mexican holiday. It was really unfortunate because there was SO much garbage everywhere. We visited this beach a couple times over our week vacation and it was fairly disgusting. Diapers, garbage, food, everywhere. I really hope they take the time to clean up the beach for people who visit in the future as it is a very beautiful place but not plesant to walk amongst a garbage dump. Also, be prepared to pay for the bathroom here if you need to use the facilities, like most places.

264361596.name: Nice place to go
264361596.author: a TripAdvisor user
264361596.reviewBody: I liked it here and the shopping and the entertainment and the beach is amazing there.. and the alligators are a must to see and the big iguanas :) \n

264291051.name: Busy beach, nice water
264291051.author: a TripAdvisor user
264291051.reviewBody: Lots of people visiting, restaurant on the beach, parasailing available, good place to spend the day splashing in the waves. Lots of people watching too

263806073.name: Taxi and go across by yourself a lot cheaper than tour
263806073.author: a TripAdvisor user
263806073.reviewBody: From the hotel zone you can go there for 90 pesos and go across on a water taxi by yourself. Be careful of people trying to latch on to you as they work for certain vendors who want to help you then take you to their business.\nThe snorkelling is ok and lots of good vendors to choose from. You can rent snorkel gear there and lots of good food and drink.

262790784.name: Nice Beach, Lots of people
262790784.author: a TripAdvisor user
262790784.reviewBody: Pleasant.  Market, water rental rides and other activities.\nBeach busy. My daughter went hang gliding and loved the experience.  The Oyster Bar and Disco are steps away.

262356698.name: Boat ride to Ixtapa
262356698.author: a TripAdvisor user
262356698.reviewBody: The island was closed off to public transport today.  Good ride from Zihuantanejo though. Nice looking market with affordable souvenirs.

262294067.name: Playa Linda
262294067.author: a TripAdvisor user
262294067.reviewBody: Nice beach firm enough to walk on and lots of activities from warf access to go out to Ixtapa island and to flea markets also to beach side activities such as parasailing,jet skis and etc.

262191385.name: Shorty walk and great shopping
262191385.author: a TripAdvisor user
262191385.reviewBody: Only a 5 minute walk down the beach and did it every morning we loved it and jut wanted to shop there and talk with the shop owners all morning

261814556.name: Great spot!
261814556.author: a TripAdvisor user
261814556.reviewBody: The market here was wonderful.  It was amazing to see the crocodiles, tortugas (turtles), iguanas up close.  We went via taxi with a very informative driver, Saul, who stayed with us and explained a lot about the area. We had a great time!  The restaurant on the beach provided shade and cold cerveza to cap off the day. Washroom facilities are available but there is a 10 peso charge to use the toilet. The money charged is not spent on cleaning supplies.

261643606.name: Crocks and more!!
261643606.author: a TripAdvisor user
261643606.reviewBody: We took a tour from our hotel and we enjoyed it immensely. Seeing crocodiles, iguana\'s, turtles, and birds in their natural habitat was amazing. Would like to have spent more time at the markets. Would definitely go back.

261011564.name: Great market area
261011564.author: a TripAdvisor user
261011564.reviewBody: A little more relaxed atmosphere at this location. Most of the vendors at this market are not pushy as in some other markets.

260650845.name: love the crocodillos
260650845.author: a TripAdvisor user
260650845.reviewBody: neat spot near beach to view crocodiles, iguana\'s and local birds. you can ride from Ixtapa on a beautifully paved bike path if you want and they off bike tour at the hotels with guide.

260232531.name: Great Place to Check Out the Wildlife...
260232531.author: a TripAdvisor user
260232531.reviewBody: At the Playa Linda, there is a wildlife park that is worth the visit. It is full of crocodiles, iguana\'s and many bird species...especially the Rosie Spoon Bill. It is a great place to take kids in particular, but good for adults as well. You can catch a panga (boat) ride to Ixtapa Island from Playa Linda as well. Many shops and bars in the area.

259298853.name: Very Nice
259298853.author: a TripAdvisor user
259298853.reviewBody: This was a great little place to hang out for a day.   Best to go to the other side of the island- not the first stop on the sea bus-  we went to Lilly\'s there, they helped with snorkeling and brought the most amazing drinks after!

259169192.name: Not much to see
259169192.author: a TripAdvisor user
259169192.reviewBody: Except for the crocodiles and iguanas in gated area, there is not much to see there. We sat at beach front Cafe to watch the scuba divers get thrashed around in the waves. After having a beer and buying 2 braclets from a  roaming vendor, the slow boat ride back to the main land came not soon enough. The climb into the boats was an ordeal of its own!

259150321.name: Full of garbage
259150321.author: a TripAdvisor user
259150321.reviewBody: This could be quite the beach if it wasn\'t full of garbage waste, cans, litter, etc. I would not go in the ocean here. Yet, there is still someone trying to rent lounge chairs & umbrellas, so, to each his own I guess.

259113291.name: Great beach
259113291.author: a TripAdvisor user
259113291.reviewBody: A great each to go to with younger kids as no big waves. The market is wonderful as well and remember to haggle on the prices they will come down.  Easy to get to via local bus 10 pesos per person.

259023239.name: Our Favourite Beach
259023239.author: a TripAdvisor user
259023239.reviewBody: We were able to walk here from the Azul Ixtapa Grand. Just before the pier (on the side toward the hotels) is a spot where you can view the crocodiles through the fence, then next, a massage place right on the beach. I\'d highly recommend this experience. Only 200 pesos for a fantastic massage! I added a 50 peso tip each time I went here. Just beyond this is the pier, where the water taxis leave for Isla Ixtapa, and also the walkway to the market, which is worth visiting for a bit of shopping. This walkway also accesses the street. The beach here goes on forever, it\'s definitely not crowded, and the water is amazing! On the beach, just past the pier, and in front of the market are several restaurants. If you buy food and drink from them, they\'ll often move a table onto the beach for you.

258845458.name: Worth the bike ride!
258845458.author: a TripAdvisor user
258845458.reviewBody: this is a nice little beach for a day trip, picnic, or time away from the hassles of Ixtapa or all inclusives! You can rent a bike in Ixtapa and ride there in 30 minutes or so. The bike trail is incredibly paved, and goes by the crocodile preserve. Stop there, it is crazy! Take your own supplies to the beach, it is wonderfully quiet!

258811847.name: Shopping
258811847.author: a TripAdvisor user
258811847.reviewBody: Loved the flea market and the animals. Boat takes you to Ixtapa Island from here. Nice walk from hotel to Playa Linda.

258300038.name: Loved the crocodile preserve
258300038.author: a TripAdvisor user
258300038.reviewBody: We visited the croc reserve - it had lots of crocs sunning themselves and in the water, a wide assortment of iguanas, turtles and some interesting birds.  There was also a special Mexican performance on the beach involving a very high pole, men performing a ceremony and music.  Neat little place to visit.

257854091.name: Local shopping place
257854091.author: a TripAdvisor user
257854091.reviewBody: Great shopping area close to our resort and also the local bus stop 10 pesos get you on the bus there... Local market lol before you buy...

257719886.name: Nice Beach Escape
257719886.author: a TripAdvisor user
257719886.reviewBody: This beach was way better than the one in the hotel zone for usability. Less surf so you can go in the ocean, tree shaded picnic areas, and access to Ixtapa island by water taxi.  They also have a fenced off natural area where you can safely view the wildlife - iguanas and crocodile

257165671.name: Miles of beautiful beach
257165671.author: a TripAdvisor user
257165671.reviewBody: Just to the right of the pier you take to Ixtapa Island and the Azul lies the beautiful Playa Linda . We spent several afternoons walking up and down this stretch of beach . There are a few restaurants close to the pier , but after that just beach and solitude ... just what the doctor ordered . \nIf your trekking about the area or body surfing or parasailing or renting a sea doo  , enjoy this undeveloped area. Let\'s hope it remains this way.

256747714.name: Fun - swim and shop
256747714.author: a TripAdvisor user
256747714.reviewBody: Nice beach....some body surfing area.\nAnd you can do some bartering with the locals at the market.\nWalk closer to the croc viewing area and find a family that brings in oysters each morning....get their around 10AM for fresh oysters.

255689371.name: Playa Linda
255689371.author: a TripAdvisor user
255689371.reviewBody: Long flat beach in front of the Azul Resort.  The sand is dark and hard packed.  Easy to walk on.  Lots of water activities on the beach (para-sailing, banana boat rides, sea-dos).  Some restaurants and shops at the north end of the beach along with the crocodile reserve.  \nPier for water taxis to Ixtapa Island also at the North end of the beach.  Local fisherman bring their catch by their pier each morning.

255444801.name: Not great
255444801.author: a TripAdvisor user
255444801.reviewBody: It\'s where you go to get to the Island.  Otherwise I would not need to go there again. Lots of vendors with swim or beach wear.  The weather was lousy when we went there, and that probably is why my experience wasn\'t the greatest.

255341689.name: Everything in one place!
255341689.author: a TripAdvisor user
255341689.reviewBody: A market for shopping, Fantastic beach. Watertaxi to the Ixtapa Isle Very clean area and the vendors are friendly - not pushy. Make a day of it - you won\'t be disappointed.

254939814.name: Excellent little market
254939814.author: a TripAdvisor user
254939814.reviewBody: Excellent little market, walking distance from our hotel, had fun bartering with vendors. Nice beach, crocodile conservation area lets you see lots of crocs, turtles and birds. There is a lovely walking, jogging and biking path that wonders through the forest, you can get all the way to Ixtapa on. The pier has a water taxi at the end that you can do day trips to Isla Ixtapa from.

254597928.name: Okay Place
254597928.author: a TripAdvisor user
254597928.reviewBody: Nice Beach, watched the crocodiles for a really long time, many small gift shops to choose from and also some entertainment in the square

254113801.name: Nice beach!
254113801.author: a TripAdvisor user
254113801.reviewBody: Market vendors are set up here and loved bartering. We got some souvenirs. Some vendors were very pushy. Entertainment was there as well.

253904381.name: Crocodile conservation area is great
253904381.author: a TripAdvisor user
253904381.reviewBody: Playa Linda is a nice local place with cheap souvenirs and some local eateries. The best attraction here was the crocodile and wildlife conservation area. Lots of active crocodiles. Big iguanas. Rosetta Spoonbills and Egrets. Turtles. The kids loved it. Very nice place to bike/walk to from some of the close by hotels.

253197443.name: nice local beach
253197443.author: a TripAdvisor user
253197443.reviewBody: walk and walk this long beach as you look at ixtapa island. lots of local shops to buy sovenirs and cold drinks.

252741221.name: Biked here
252741221.author: a TripAdvisor user
252741221.reviewBody: We rented bikes and followed the beautiful trail to a lovely beach restaurant on Playa Linda. We had a marvelous pico de gallo with oranges at La Palapa to recharge for the trip back.

252599721.name: Beautiful, quiet beach
252599721.author: a TripAdvisor user
252599721.reviewBody: My wife and I just returned from staying at a nearby hotel, Azul Grand.  This is a beautiful beach to walk, and is fairly deserted when you get past the restaurant area.  We had ceviche and beers twice in one of the local places on this beech, and great treat.

252120487.name: Great alternative to Azul\'s beach by a short walk away
252120487.author: a TripAdvisor user
252120487.reviewBody: We stayed at Azul, so I can\'t compare Playa Linda to other beaches in Ixtapa. It is worth the short walk to Playa Linda to shop the at the local vendors or spend the day at the beach as a better alternative to the beach infront of Azul.

251346495.name: Good for Surfers
251346495.author: a TripAdvisor user
251346495.reviewBody: I think the best part of Playa Linda is the trip. Two friends and I road our bicycle on the specially built 10 km bicycle path from Ixtapa to Playa Linda. This was built under the direction of a past Mexican president (four presidents ago I believe) who periodically vacationed in Ixtapa with his family. His daughter was a bicycling enthusiast and so he had this path built through the jungle to Playa Linda. The path is perfectly paved, painted a terracotta red, and about 10 feet wide. Its a great way to get there. There is so much to see. Lots of neat birds. \n\nOnce in Playa Linda, it is clear that this is where the surfers hang out. You have broad stretches of beach that are wide open to the Pacific Ocean providing good surf. Another highlight was the crocodiles in the river that flows out to the ocean at the south end of Playa Linda. This is at the end where you take the launch to Ixtapa Island. There is a fence along the side of the river so you can look at the crocks without worrying about your safety. There are a few restaurants there but we decided to head back and have breakfast on our return.

251271765.name: shopping
251271765.author: a TripAdvisor user
251271765.reviewBody: the market here has most of your tourist items and at reasonable prices.  Nice area but we took the boat over to the island

251201862.name: nice beach
251201862.author: a TripAdvisor user
251201862.reviewBody: Easy 10 minute walk for the Azul Grand.  Lots of typical venders there selling the usual cheap junk for almost free (as the sellers would say).

251108986.name: An Excellent Way to Spend the Day
251108986.author: a TripAdvisor user
251108986.reviewBody: Playa Linda caters to the tourists (as does all of Ixtapa) but also has a local feel as well. We rented jet skis one day and went back another day to ride horses on the beach. Cheesy, yes, but cool nonetheless. You really should visit Playa Linda if you are in Ixtapa.

250949251.name: Nice big waves like I like them.
250949251.author: a TripAdvisor user
250949251.reviewBody: Nice big waves like I like them, careful though they are dumpers not rollers so you might get to eat some sand while enjoying the washing machine effect....

250703996.name: Nice beach and crocodiles
250703996.author: a TripAdvisor user
250703996.reviewBody: Nice to walk there and enjoyed the market, the area to have a corona and the traditional dancers :) and crocodiles

250069664.name: great beach
250069664.author: a TripAdvisor user
250069664.reviewBody: Very wide,long ,clean beach right next to ixtapa island ferry. We had a shrimp cocktail at one of the small palapa restaurants on the beach....can\'t remember the name....it was very good and very well priced. There\'s a small shopping area and you can check out the crocodiles. It was just a short walk from our hotel.

247902083.name: Well worth a trip to beautiful beach.
247902083.author: a TripAdvisor user
247902083.reviewBody:
Like flea market and merchants
Like beach & scenic views
Like the warm weather
Dislike getting too close to scary looking alligators--lol

247209752.name: Crocodile pit the only thing to see
247209752.author: a TripAdvisor user
247209752.reviewBody: This was a local Mexican hang out but the tacky tourist shops were pretty annoying. If you are lucky enough to be there when a traditional rope swinging performance is happening, it is well worth it. Restaurants pretty average on the beach.

247089296.name: Many local families here
247089296.author: a TripAdvisor user
247089296.reviewBody: Not the prettiest beach, but nice water and there is a nice little market there that you can buy Mexican trinkets, beer, water etc. very cheap.\nA few restaurants along the beach where you can sit and enjoy a beer or have a meal. Many Mexican families here, not touristy like other beaches.

247034083.name: Plan to pay to stay
247034083.author: a TripAdvisor user
247034083.reviewBody: You must rent a chair or buy from local vendors to sit on this beach, so be ready for that. The tiny market is fun, and watch for the incredible men on the balancing pole right near the entrance. We went on a rainy day so the crocs and turtles were hiding, but saw many of these, and iguanas too, when we returned the next day in the sun. If you stay at the Fontan take the free bike tour with the hotel guide - 18 K return, mostly easy pedalling and lovely views along the path and at the playa.

246717088.name: Surf\'s Up!
246717088.author: a TripAdvisor user
246717088.reviewBody: Crocodile, bird & turtle sanctuary. Huge beach! Huge waves! Did I mention surfing? Public transport is 12 peso in high time. Cheaper than a taxi and way more fun! Nice people!

246124103.name: Will be changed soon
246124103.author: a TripAdvisor user
246124103.reviewBody: Went there on the way to Ixtapa Island. Looks really cool. So many families there. Our guide told us that soon there will be few hotels build there. Too bad....

246060103.name: On the way to Ixtapa Island
246060103.author: a TripAdvisor user
246060103.reviewBody: Has a flea market similar to Ixtapa and Zihua. Only 11 peso\'s to take the bus there from Ixtapa. Beach isn\'t as nice as Ixtapa.\nMake sure to walk over to the crocodile enclosure, 12 foot crocodiles behind a plastic fence what could possibly go wrong.

244430309.name: Something new?
244430309.author: a TripAdvisor user
244430309.reviewBody: I take a bike ride there often.Recently saw something new , called Danza de Los Voladores.5 men dressed in ritual costumes climb a pole , with ropes wrapped around the pole and tied to their feet at the top .They then launch themselves , and spin around , decending to then ground. All the while,one is singing and hitting a small drum .This was at 930 am on a Saturday.Not sure when this is done again , or at various times

244324806.name: Ixtapa Islend pier and end of the Cyclopista Bike way
244324806.author: a TripAdvisor user
244324806.reviewBody: Very small little spot at the end of the bus line out of Ixtapa. Pay the 10 pesos and take the local bus to Playa Linda from Ixtapa.  Have a look at the crocs from the beach side of the enclosure. Take the water taxi to Ixtapa Island for 40 Pesos. Best of all rent a bike in Ixtapa, just down the road from The Generals Sports bar at BICI RENT and ride the 9.7klm concrete red bike path through the ecological park in Playa Linda. The highlight of our trip. Life is Good! ENJOY

244157316.name: Amazing
244157316.author: a TripAdvisor user
244157316.reviewBody:
So we were visiting ixtapa
Zihuatanejo and we kep on hearing about the sanctuary of
Crocodiles at playa Linda.
So we did the our own tour
Jumped on the bus from ixtapa DT area it took about 20 it was a buetiful drive green & all the nicer resorts of ixtapa
So we get to the last stop that's playa Linda we walked the little flea market the main reason we did not do the tour with a guide is BECUASE we were traveling with out 4 yr old princess
And we didn't want to be stuck for about 4 hrs 
The crocodiles were amazing theirs a local that feeds them fish all he asks is a for a tip
All I got to say is wow amazing

243367590.name: not busy
243367590.author: a TripAdvisor user
243367590.reviewBody: ate at one of the vendors, while waiting to get over to Ixtap\nisle, some surfing at the right time of the year further down\nnot the best beach

241175147.name: crocodiles
241175147.author: a TripAdvisor user
241175147.reviewBody: crocodiles, birds, iguanas all cohabitating in one area. Amazing. Local man feeds them and apparently gets right in with them unfortunately we didn\'t get to see it. There is a flea market there and the pier to go to Ixtapa Island. No need to get a tour there. Take a local bus or taxi much cheaper

238742503.name: Sleepy
238742503.author: a TripAdvisor user
238742503.reviewBody: Sand is not white, water is not clear. No shore beak for surfing. Not very picturesque. The reason you would go is to get the water taxi to Ixtapa Island.

218922397.name: Beautiful beach!
218922397.author: a TripAdvisor user
218922397.reviewBody: I enjoyed this beach, and you can travel with your family to an island on a boat. Beautiful souvenirs available as well.

208592267.name: ehhh...
208592267.author: a TripAdvisor user
208592267.reviewBody: We stayed at Capella Ixtapa which was a reasonably short walk away from Playa Linda.  We made the walk one of the 7+ days we were there.  We went towards the end of the day.  Most of the shops were closed and there weren\'t any vendors out peddling their goods when we go there.  We thought that was a good thing.  Having been to Cabo several times, the vendors can detract from the beach experience.  I don\'t know how if that is the case here, but we overheard others complaining about vendors.  The best thing about this beach is simply that it is a beach.  Our hotel was built into the side of a cliff, so there wasn\'t a real beach to visit or walk along.  This beach was a pretty long stretch of sand, so it is a nice place to enjoy a stroll.  Other than that, it is a pretty standard beach.  On your way there, stop and check out the crocodile preserve.  I hadn\'t ever seen a crocodile in its natural habitat, so that was neat (but also smelly).  Once was enough for this beach.

207748527.name: Best beach for the money
207748527.author: a TripAdvisor user
207748527.reviewBody: You have three choices of beach here.  There is great snorkeling and you can take a nice walk on beach.  No rocks and no waves.  Great food . Just bring some money or extra water as you only get one drink per person.  We stayed ther for about 5 hours and had a great time

207588534.name: Great time!
207588534.author: a TripAdvisor user
207588534.reviewBody: This little area is full of vendors and food if you like to shop/eat. They also have a crocodile area that you can see them feeding and get pretty close. Was a nice walk from our hotel (Azul Ixtapa).  There are other activities there but we just did the shopping.

204276418.name: shore lunch
204276418.author: a TripAdvisor user
204276418.reviewBody: great stop after a morning of fishing. we stopped and had our fished grilled, and sashimi style made to order while we sat and relaxed on the beach. quite the set-up they have going on this little restaurant/snorkel/bar island.

203612254.name: Quiet beach
203612254.author: a TripAdvisor user
203612254.reviewBody: It was a quiet beach and the little village had nice shops and friendly people.  I liked the location but it was a bit far to Zihoutanejo and I like to be near a bigger town.

203529469.name: Avoid the beaches here but this is where to catch the water taxi to Ixtapa Island
203529469.author: a TripAdvisor user
203529469.reviewBody: I have been to Playa Linda on many occasions to see the iguana, beautiful birds and crocodiles in the nature area.  The beach is not the place to swim but several restaurants on the beach are delicious.  \nTHIS IS WHERE TO CATCH THE WATER TAXI TO IXTAPA ISLAND....\n Do not pay the high hotel rates to visit Ixtapa Island..Ride the bus or taxi to Playa Linda and book your own ticket on the water taxi to Ixtapa Island.  Relax at your leisure on the island.  The restaurants on the island have beaches with Palapas and umbrellas with lounge chairs-(free if you order a meal with them.).  They provide you with your water, beverages or beer and have menus.  They can even arrange snorkle gear for you...again this is the restaurants on Ixtapa Island after you have ridden the water taxi.

201938977.name: lively beach
201938977.author: a TripAdvisor user
201938977.reviewBody: Really beautiful and lively beach, music, food, crowded but you can walk and get away from it all, liked looking at the huge crocs, they were ugly but exciting to see.  I will go to this beach again if given a chance

199580124.name: Beach stroll
199580124.author: a TripAdvisor user
199580124.reviewBody: Playa Linda is a lovely beach for a stroll...and a wonderful message along the way....stop by and visit the Eco centre...

199182328.name: If you can avoid all the pestering sales people everywhere, it\'s actually a great spot.
199182328.author: a TripAdvisor user
199182328.reviewBody:
Watch out single ladies! Locals will try to swarm you to get your business if it's at a restaurant or the trip sales (too much competition). They are incessant and you almost have to be rude to get them to stop (I think I was way too polite because the trip sales guy did NOT leave me alone when all I wanted to do was quietly walk along the beach). 
If you can get away from the sales pitches, it is a beautiful long beach with lots to do (water sports of all sorts!). 
Before you get the to beach area, you pass enclosed alligators, turtles and iguanas in their natural habitat. 
If you have a bike, you can take the bike trail from the Marina which is about 8KM through a stunning jungle/forest area with all sorts of creatures and sounds (trail ends at Playa Linda). 
There are gift shops, clothing boutiques and street food vendors before you reach the beach area as well. There is ample parking and a city bus that goes to and from the beach for 9 pesos - they even accommodated my bike in the bus on the way back!
I don't think I would like to be there when it's a busy weekend, however during the weekday it was nice and quiet.

198749987.name: Feel like your miles away from the resorts.
198749987.author: a TripAdvisor user
198749987.reviewBody: WOW - what a gem.  Playa Linda is a beautiful barren beach.  Void of hotels and commercialism, it was a great place to take a walk or swim without the hub bub of the hotels.  Near the pier there are some local restaurants and the beach was filled with local families on the weekends taking advantage of the surf.  MILES long - you really feel like you are far from anything.  The surf is strong so know what your doing if you swim on your own.  Surfers galore further from the pier.  We ran into a group from the InterContinental Hotel Presidente Ixtapa Resort that came from Ixtapa to clean up one area of the beach that seems to collect sea garbage.  Hats off to their efforts.  We jumped in to help as we walked.  That kind of pride in more than just their hotel property leads me to put their resort on our list if we return to Ixtapa.  It was a beautiful area and efforts such as these will keep it that way.

198678296.name: Fun adventure
198678296.author: a TripAdvisor user
198678296.reviewBody: Great parasailing from here - easy walk with a fun little market to spend your holiday money in... from here you can also take a boat to the island and enjoy snorkeling there...

198592154.name: Stopped at the Crocs
198592154.author: a TripAdvisor user
198592154.reviewBody: A Visit to the Market and a trip to the market as well as stopping and watch in the incredible Crocodiles and wildlife at the sanctuary.

198122299.name: Beautiful
198122299.author: a TripAdvisor user
198122299.reviewBody: We biked from Ixtapa to playa Linda! It was a beautiful ride and our first trip to playa Linda. The beach is beautiful lots of beautiful shells and beautiful driftwood. Definitely something we will do again

196767668.name: Loved seeing the Crocs!
196767668.author: a TripAdvisor user
196767668.reviewBody: Enjoyed seeing the crocs in the swamp that was caged off that is towards the left after getting off the bus! Great beach in Ixtapa--lots of shore line! We had it pretty much to ourselves the time we went there! Evidently it can be surfed??

196763243.name: Playa Linda
196763243.author: a TripAdvisor user
196763243.reviewBody: Beautiful area with a crocodile enclosure. Flea market mostly filled with made in China crap. Unfortunately, due to storms, the river run off made beaches in the area unusable. Water was filled with debris..like swimming in coffee grounds. Ixtapa Island was not affected at all by this. \nWe would absolutely visit Playa Linda again, however we wouldn\'t stay here and risk not being able to use our beach again.

195033178.name: Beautiful beach with crocodile lagoon
195033178.author: a TripAdvisor user
195033178.reviewBody: This is a popular destination for locals and tourists alike.  The beach is beautiful, and shuttles leave every 10 minutes from the pier for Ixtapa Island.  City buses provide frequent service for 10 pesos.  Plenty of concession stands provided everything one might need for the day.

194468647.name: Long beach to walk
194468647.author: a TripAdvisor user
194468647.reviewBody: This is a nice beach to stretch your legs on.  It goes on for many miles.  It was very quiet the day we were there.  We ate at Restaurant Linda and had the most friendly service and nice breakfast...with Mimosas.

193282956.name: Beautiful place at the end of a long bike ride
193282956.author: a TripAdvisor user
193282956.reviewBody: We rented bikes across from the Royal (8 of us).  We took the 9 km trail to Playa Linda, saw crocs, beautiful birds and had an amazing journey.  Oxo at the end for Sol and Clam, just what the doctor ordered

193164688.name: Playa Linda
193164688.author: a TripAdvisor user
193164688.reviewBody: we weren\'t there very long. Just to see the alligators/? and turtles and went out to Coral Beach. Good shopping there.

192798408.name: Public Beach and Ixtapa Local Market Mix
192798408.author: a TripAdvisor user
192798408.reviewBody: Playa Linda\'s main attractions include: boat ride to Isla Ixtapa, public beach, local market for variety of stuff, restaurants and eating stalls (open after noon)  and, also, Crocodiles & Iguana Sanctuary. \nThe main traffic to Isla Ixtapa, by boat, is from here. It is well connected with the public bus system from Ixtapa and Zihautanejo, to draw visitors from all resorts around the area, wishing to go for fishing and/or other water sports.\nThe market is clean and a bit pricy (compared to the one in Ixtapa) to meet the budget of the average visitor. Owners of the shops are very friendly and courteous in dealing with the customers.

191938825.name: Nice Place to hang out
191938825.author: a TripAdvisor user
191938825.reviewBody: We walked down to Playa Linda almost everyday.  We had coronas at La Palalpa Restaurant.  We shopped the market had a great time.  Wish we were still there

191861646.name: awesome croc viewing
191861646.author: a TripAdvisor user
191861646.reviewBody: I was shocked they don\'t charge to see the crocs!!! Highly recommend doing this activity !!!  The market is neat and clean too

191255120.name: Nice croc\'s
191255120.author: a TripAdvisor user
191255120.reviewBody: They have crocodile sanctuary there which is pretty neat & lots of birds & other reptiles & creatures.  We had lunch on the beach & I felt it was a massive rip off - 605 pesos.  I certainly don\'t spend that much on lunch any other time so to be charged that I was really put off ~ 2 of us - 2 beer each, and the lunch "special" ~ which was certainly not $40 special which they charged us.  Beach was nice but be wary of the restaurants & get pricing before you order.

190311880.name: A bit of real Mexico away from Resorts!
190311880.author: a TripAdvisor user
190311880.reviewBody: If you are like me and sometimes enjoy the full service "all inclusive" type vacation but deep down you are really searching for that authentic Mexican ambiance away from all the commercialized hotel- then when in Ixtapa you must visit this beach! The beach itself is picturesque, the palm trees line the shoreline farther than the eye can see. The locals and local Mexican vacationers hang at the beach making it feel very laid back and not superficial, the water is warm and the beach sandy. Yes, there is also a crocodile sanctuary next to the beach which is very well worth the walk through as there are many croc\'s, birds, turtles and we even saw pink spoonbills.

189945010.name: Alligators
189945010.author: a TripAdvisor user
189945010.reviewBody: Wonderful nature reserve with alligators, iguanas, birds and turtles.   Market stalls selling keepsakes, beach toys.  Great side trip

189556267.name: If you like to leave the serenity of your resort.
189556267.author: a TripAdvisor user
189556267.reviewBody: We went to Playa Linda several times to enjoy the non-resort life. We always went to La Palapa. Susie, Brian and Jelipe always took care of us. It was fun seeing locals enjoying the Holidays and getting wild. The food and drinks were great. A short walk to the Crocodiles. Light market shopping. A must see.

189371167.name: Crocododile habitat
189371167.author: a TripAdvisor user
189371167.reviewBody: We visited Playa Linda to catch a boat ride to Ixtapa Island. There is a crocodile habitat near the marina with many iguanas and exotic birds.

188073628.name: Give it a pass, keep going to Isla Ixpapa
188073628.author: a TripAdvisor user
188073628.reviewBody: Black sand, manmade beach, smelly, small flea market, crocodile habitat with nice viewing area and the boat dock to Isla Ixtapa. We were told you might encounter a croc in the water during rainy season. It\'s where you get on and off the bus from Ixtapa

185353463.name: Crocodiles right on the beach
185353463.author: a TripAdvisor user
185353463.reviewBody: Hurricane Miguel washed away the fence from the crocodile sanctuary, now they lie directly on the sand of the beach.  Pretty fun, but I assume local authorities will fix this soon :)

175594348.name: Linda\'s @ Playa Linda Beach
175594348.author: a TripAdvisor user
175594348.reviewBody: This beach is on the north end of Ixtapa.  It has many quaint little cantina\'s right on the beach.  Nothing fancy just good food and service.  The water is very calm here because Ixtapa Island is right out front blocking the rollers from hitting this beach.  We enjoyed our day at a little beach restaurant call Linda\'s at the north end of the beach.

167567379.name: Paddle Board Out
167567379.author: a TripAdvisor user
167567379.reviewBody: We paddle boarded from Club Intrawest - took about 15 mins each way and about 2 miles total...It was a great way to get to see Zijua Bay & it beats a water taxi!

164016322.name: a great walking beach - great views w/ waves
164016322.author: a TripAdvisor user
164016322.reviewBody:
We ended up walking the beach at Playa Linda one day when the boats were not running over to Isla ixtapa due to extremely high waves and wild sea.
It was wild to walk around all the restaurants as they had to pull all their tables/chairs up away from the waves.  It really came up far into their shaded beachfront areas.
There is shopping here for souveniers.  WE tried "La Palapa" to eat, but were generally un-impressed.
This is a nice long beach so we enjoyed the walk and the fantastic views of waves and mountains and palm trees.
Worth a quick visit while in the area!

162203840.name: This Playa is not so nice, but it was quieter than the others we visited.
162203840.author: a TripAdvisor user
162203840.reviewBody: The name linda means nice. We didn\'t find it to be so nice. However, we did think it was calmer waters than the others we visited.

158917959.name: The Beach is nice, but don\'t miss athe adjoinging Parque Aztlan
158917959.author: a TripAdvisor user
158917959.reviewBody:
Playa Linda is a lovely stretch of beach a short distance north of Ixtapa. It has the usual sand and sun without the usual throng of tourists for the most part. The merchants here are clearly hoping for more tourists as there are several beach front restaurants looking for customers.
More spectacular than the beach (which is very nice, don't get me wrong) is the adjacent wildlife 
park where you can see large crocodiles and innumerable birds, including the Roseated Spoonbill, a large pink bird with a flat bill that is is fairly unique to this area. Across the street from Playa Linda and the fenced wildlife area is Parque Aztlan, an 8 km long walking and biking trail 
that meanders through several microclimates and changes of folliage to reveal one of the best opportunities anywhere to see a remarkably large number of birds.

157142300.name: Beautiful virgin beach.
157142300.author: a TripAdvisor user
157142300.reviewBody: Drive about 500 mts from restaurants and you will find a lonely beautiful beach, full of palm trees and great sand. Waves are high but ok for kids on the edge. We rented chairs and an umbrella from a lady but it was the last one. We got pescadillas from one if the restaurants.\nVery clean water. There are no toilets.

156559841.name: Long and lovely
156559841.author: a TripAdvisor user
156559841.reviewBody: The day we walked this beach, there was not another soul on the beach.  It\'s gorgeous and easy to walk.  Beautiful

155750182.name: nice place but bring water shoes cause a bit rocke and take a massage on the beach just wonderful
155750182.author: a TripAdvisor user
155750182.reviewBody: everything was great and the food that they serve you on the beach was also excellent i would go back to playa linda

155368314.name: nice beach
155368314.author: a TripAdvisor user
155368314.reviewBody: Slightly to the north of Ixtapa - short bus ride or rent a bike and follow the trail. See the crocs and the birds. SMall tourist style shopping area as you get off the bus. Get a ferry to Ixtapa Island - 5 min ride.  The beach a playa Linda is long and beautiful  good swimming. few restaurants to use for food , drinks and chairs.  Not my favourtie beach - Barra di Potosi  is much nicer. Beautiful view of the mountains inland

155354541.name: Lonely in February
155354541.author: a TripAdvisor user
155354541.reviewBody: Our visit was enroute to Ixtapa Island. There is a nice beach, worth exploring on a long walk, and a number of restaurants and vendors, but no tourists!  Some new hotels are coming on stream nearby - watch out for the Time Share sales pitches, masked as a day visit to the Hotel!

155184036.name: easy bus ride from hotel zone in ixtapa
155184036.author: a TripAdvisor user
155184036.reviewBody: playa linda is really a jumping off point for ixtapa.  upon arrival, follow the signs to the lanches.  there will usually be a lot of others doing the same thing.  rates are standard.  check with hotel.  beach is average.  crocodile habitat is interesting/

155121821.name: Great Lagoon
155121821.author: a TripAdvisor user
155121821.reviewBody: Where else can you see many huge iguanas and monster crocodiles separated from you by a small metal fence.  Awesome.

155009645.name: Great beach
155009645.author: a TripAdvisor user
155009645.reviewBody: This beach has great sand, big waves and places to just swim.  A neat little market marks the beginning of the beach and is worth exploring, ride next to the free crocodil park.  I had one learning experience.  I ordered a lemonade, the guy said sixty pesos,  I only had a 100 so gave him that.  He came back with a GIANT lemonade saying it was 90 pesos and he would keep the change.  Then I looked at the menu,  lemonade was 40 pesos.  I have traveled to Mexico probably 15 times, never had that happen anywhere else.  Caution as the usual rules of courtesy don\'t apply here

154470233.name: Would have been better without the Hassle
154470233.author: a TripAdvisor user
154470233.reviewBody: This beach was mostly locals who rode the bus from Ixtapa or Zihuatanejo.  When we got there we were followed by a restaurant owner who kept trying to get up to eat at his place.  We explored the beach and then sat down for a beer at the man\'s restaurant to relax.  \nThey gave us the gringo expensive menu and then the waiter lied to us when it came time for our bill and tried to charger up almost double.  Either he thought we had money or wouldn\'t notice or both.  I had to point out the price to him and he apologized but knew he was busted.  It may be an all right beach if you don\'t get hassled or overcharged.  If you want a more peaceful beach, staying near your resort in Ixtapa may be better.

154351371.name: Another Beautiful Beach
154351371.author: a TripAdvisor user
154351371.reviewBody: Only 9 pesos (80 cents) to ride the bus to Playa Linda. Long beach with very few people on it once you get past the restaurants and stalls as the beginning of it. Take the time to go for a stroll and make sure you go for a swim. You\'ll love it!

154251602.name: See this beautiful beach
154251602.author: a TripAdvisor user
154251602.reviewBody: This beach is an easy, inexpensive bus ride from the main Ixtapa beach and is a lovely place with restaurants, a tacky shopping area that is fun to poke around in and has a nature preserve nearby. One can get to Ixtapa island from the pier here too.

154221002.name: Beautiful beach
154221002.author: a TripAdvisor user
154221002.reviewBody: Wonderful beach, enjoyed the sunsets and birds.  Used by many locals as well, everyone was friendly, very safe.  One thing I did notice, however, was the garbage on the beach and a lack of garbage cans.  I think if there were more, people would use them.

153742629.name: Great beach
153742629.author: a TripAdvisor user
153742629.reviewBody: Playa Linda is a great place to spend the day. Really liked the beach and it has a great little ambience. Would like to go back and spend a little more time there.

152319922.name: Great restaurants and shopping
152319922.author: a TripAdvisor user
152319922.reviewBody: We stay at a nearby hotel and always enjoy going to Playa Linda.  We always eat and drink at the Crazy Lobster and then shop in the many little souvenir shops.  "Spiderman" is our favorite waiter and he remembers our names each year we go.  We enjoy watching the Indians climb the pole there and swing down about 75 feet head first tied on by their ankles.  You are near the pier to go to Ixtapa Island, too.  The sunset there is beautiful.  If you stay in Ixtapa you can take the Playa Linda bus for about 7 pesos (about 50 cents) but make sure what time the last bus leaves.  A cab ride is a bit more expensive.

151894412.name: loved the crocks and iguanas
151894412.author: a TripAdvisor user
151894412.reviewBody: I love everything here and you have to visit Fredrick he has the restaurant just as you leave to go to ferry. He is so nice and loves everyone he meets. Lots of shops to browse thru.

151666588.name: La Palapa is great!
151666588.author: a TripAdvisor user
151666588.reviewBody: Beers are about $3 each, Santos and Susanna have a boat and will take you on snorkeling or fishing trips, they are awesome!  We went here every day to see them!

151392333.name: Crocs
151392333.author: a TripAdvisor user
151392333.reviewBody: We took the bus from Ixtapa to Playa Linda.  It was a very pleasant ride.  When you get off the bus, there are crocodiles in the water under the bridge.  Quite a site to see.  Then there are shops to buy souvenirs and pelicans off the pier.  There are so many of them.  Pretty cool site

150429298.name: Ask for the Spiderman
150429298.author: a TripAdvisor user
150429298.reviewBody: A great restaurant  Langosta Loca is located next to the Iguana and crocodile enclosure.  Ask  for Spiderman and he will provide scaps of food for you to feed the iguanas, then he will take you to his restaurant and will make a frosty marguartia and prepare a meal of fresh fish or shrimp to your liking

150292584.name: Wild waves
150292584.author: a TripAdvisor user
150292584.reviewBody: Playa Linda and Playa Largo can have some wild waves, so not recommended for inexperienced wave goers.  Playa Largo however can afford you some free shade in the coconut groves.

149677692.name: smooth sand, waves, no crowds, coco palms
149677692.author: a TripAdvisor user
149677692.reviewBody: Playa Linda is a quiet undeveloped beach, with few crowds even in the busy Christmas/New Year\'s week.  The waves are mellow, break to a flat shallow beach, sand is smooth.  Pelicans and birds diving, boys selling coconuts at the public access roads.

149117956.name: Nice boat ride
149117956.author: a TripAdvisor user
149117956.reviewBody: We were greated the minute we arrived by a guy who brought us on the little boat that took us to the island.  Great service.

148181881.name: Check out the alligators
148181881.author: a TripAdvisor user
148181881.reviewBody: Take the local bus here for 9 pesos. Make sure you check out the alligators and Igaunas when you get off the bus. Interesting shops and that where you ketch the water taxi to Ixtapa Island.

145978962.name: Authentic locals hangout.
145978962.author: a TripAdvisor user
145978962.reviewBody: We were the only NA tourists on the beach that day.  It was good to relax and watch.  Parasailing, powerboat tubing, bodysurfing, and great food and music.  An R&R day after touring about.

144597896.name: Super surfing
144597896.author: a TripAdvisor user
144597896.reviewBody: Great break, can be tough to get back out if the swell is running close together. Just a few friendly locals.

144114123.name: A taste of real Mexico
144114123.author: a TripAdvisor user
144114123.reviewBody: Playa Linda means The beautiful beach...just a few restaurants and after that just the palm lined beach.Be sure to ask if it is safe..it is most of the times

137472806.name: Playa Linda
137472806.author: a TripAdvisor user
137472806.reviewBody: Interesting walk through the alligator/crocodile/,iguana preserve but the street vendors make it an unpleasant visit while trying to escape the throngs.

129894272.name: big beach but the sand is not so nice like in other beaches
129894272.author: a TripAdvisor user
129894272.reviewBody: this beach is a bit more low profile, used more by locals.

129141643.name: Avoid this dirty water taxi port
129141643.author: a TripAdvisor user
129141643.reviewBody: I\'d hate to have to spend a week on this side of the beach. Stay in the Hotel Zone.

128476987.name: Just Another Tourist Market
128476987.author: a TripAdvisor user
128476987.reviewBody: Not much to buy or see here, except for the crocodiles which are in a very small spot near the market.

128433621.name: A must in Ixtapa
128433621.author: a TripAdvisor user
128433621.reviewBody: If you are going to Ixtapa, you must check out Playa Linda. There are lots of little shops and the pier to the Island. The plam trees are quite nice for a picture.

128091797.name: Had a great time
128091797.author: a TripAdvisor user
128091797.reviewBody: Went there by taxi, no\nidea what to expect, told driver (Jesus) to pick us up in 1.5 hrs. met this mini tour guide who kept inviting us over to his bar, Frederick was his name, the one with the yellow table cloths he kept saying,Langosta something or other. Very mild mannered and sociable. Introduced us to a local oyster shucker who  has never worn a pair of shoes in his life and while he was shucking oysters his pet parrot named Pecky had a nap. When Pecky woke up, all he wanted was our jewerly. We checked out the crocs and iguanas and the beach, did some shopping, went to his bar, had some cervezas and he has a parakeet in his establishment and it repeated every word i said. The beach is unreal, so long. It was a relaxed, no pressure, good time

127676980.name: Little dirty
127676980.author: a TripAdvisor user
127676980.reviewBody: This place has a ton of stuff to see, however, there is quite a bit of garbage laying around.\nWe saw the crocs there, it was very cool and very safe as well

126238741.name: Crocodilians
126238741.author: a TripAdvisor user
126238741.reviewBody: Huge crocs rest in the sun (behind the fence) along with turtles, iguanas, beautiful birds.  Some tourist items here at lower prices than in Ixtapa.

125766330.name: So so
125766330.author: a TripAdvisor user
125766330.reviewBody: Wasn\'t impressed.  Gaters were the hilight.  Thought there was a refuge for the gaters and turtles.

125364005.name: Caught ferry to Isla Ixtapa
125364005.author: a TripAdvisor user
125364005.reviewBody: Small flea market. Dirty. Alligator and Iguana habitat. Very interesting to see.

125349187.name: nice view
125349187.author: a TripAdvisor user
125349187.reviewBody: We biked here and checked out the alligators.  Nothing special.  More shopping...

124902218.name: T-shirts/trinket
124902218.author: a TripAdvisor user
124902218.reviewBody: Great prices/quality stuff. very quiet/friendly place. Very relaxing just sitting in chair catching breeze off bay.

124873650.name: Playa Linda
124873650.author: a TripAdvisor user
124873650.reviewBody: Another beautiful beach in Ixtapa!  Not one negative to say!

124810531.name: Gateway to Isla de Ixtapa
124810531.author: a TripAdvisor user
124810531.reviewBody: This is where you catch the water taxis to Isla de Ixtapa, which is awesome... other than that, there\'s not much here and the beach is kind of dirty.

124792223.name: crocs
124792223.author: a TripAdvisor user
124792223.reviewBody: absolutly loved the crocadile birds and turtles there, the people in the flea market were very frendly and not at all pushy. also had some good natchos in the restraunt.

124138968.name: A Good Place To Experience Some "Local Color"
124138968.author: a TripAdvisor user
124138968.reviewBody: Liked the realness of what we saw; nothing is gussied up here.  The Croc Lagoon was interesting and we walked around the side of it to get many different angles (and saw a ton more crocs in the process).  Also we walked down the paved bike/hike path a ways to experence that and had a good "commune with nature."

123221982.name: Very dirty!
123221982.author: a TripAdvisor user
123221982.reviewBody: Not at all like the pictures on the internet!  Crocodiles were very interesting but the beach itself was not welcoming.  If you like quiet and don\'t mind the garbage it might be a nice relaxing day.

122992277.name: Great gator watching in nearby lagoon
122992277.author: a TripAdvisor user
122992277.reviewBody: Playa Linda is a narrow beach but has calmer surf than Ixtapa\'s main beach because it is sheltered by Ixtapa Island. There is an eco-preserve nearby with crocodiles in their natural habit. From Ixtapa\'s main tourist area, take the local bus to Playa Linda for 8  pesos  as opposed to a cab that will cost 120 pesos. You can also walk or cycle on the bicycle path, which is about 8 km one way.

122685807.name: big garage sale
122685807.author: a TripAdvisor user
122685807.reviewBody: wildlife was fun and interesting, food was good, huge area of tacky junk for sale by very agessive merchants. This is where you take the boat to Ixtapa Island, don\'t bother

121610302.name: Take the boat ride
121610302.author: a TripAdvisor user
121610302.reviewBody: If you like to snorkle take the boat ride out to the island. It\'s a perfect way to see the Ixtapa shore line from the water and the food on the island is great.  You can rent all your snorkliing equipment from a variety of very nice people.  I recommend arriving very early other wise it gets crowded.

120079724.name: Our hotel was on this beach.  Nice with lots of people
120079724.author: a TripAdvisor user
120079724.reviewBody: Big flea market to shop and didn\'t have to travel to town; old-style zoological park with crocodiles, iguanas, birds right at the beach

116702630.name: Don\'t bother
116702630.author: a TripAdvisor user
116702630.reviewBody: We visited Ixtapa recently and stayed at the Capella Ixtapa hotel. Since the hotel has no beach, the staff recommended we go to playa Linda. It was saturday and we found the beach overrun with local turism. Smelly, dirty food stands, crummy "shanty" shops and not a particulary pretty beach... Would not recommend it. Go to nearby playa quieta instead.

667874389.name: Not worth the money
667874389.author: a TripAdvisor user
667874389.reviewBody: You can go view them on your own and just pay the fee at the museum rather than the $200 through a tour. The museum was interesting the pyramid seemed fake though.  And honestly was nothing exciting.  Best part of the trip was the scenic drive there .

address.streetAddress: La Chole

660341308.name: Very interesting and informative -Jose an excellent guide!
660341308.author: a TripAdvisor user
660341308.reviewBody:
We happened to visit on the  21 March solstice, a special day for the community of Le Chole.
Jose our guide was excellent taking great pains to explain the history and the artefacts at the museum and the two sites we visited. As an added bonus he took us to his village to see additional pieces. We also toured the local village festival for the solstice and sampled/watched some local crafts including soaps, oils, home made juice made from fruits and flowers, mezcal (in many flavours!!) and cigar making. A very special and fortunate day to be included in local culture and celebration!!

Finished off with a swim at Berra de Posoti and the scenic route back to La Ropa!

address.streetAddress: La Chole

660249261.name: Waste of money
660249261.author: a TripAdvisor user
660249261.reviewBody:
This is a waste of  210$
You can see tons of garbage on the side of the road, o ce you get to the site there is something that resembles a dried out swimming pool,  the piramed looks like was recently built, for sure  ot 1000s of years old. The guide points out two hill covered with trees a d other vegetation and claims that there are two more piramids under the dirt and trees. Do not waste your money

address.streetAddress: La Chole

659120196.name: Nice tour of the Archeological site
659120196.author: a TripAdvisor user
659120196.reviewBody: We enjoyed a very nice tour of Xihuacan today with Carlos.  He was very well versed on the site and answered all of our questions.  We had a very delicious lunch of grilled chicken along the way.  Best meal we\u2019ve eaten in Mexico so far this trip.  Carlos also toured us through Zihuatanejo, showing us the tourist district there.\nOverall we were very happy we booked this tour, booked through Viator.

address.streetAddress: La Chole

657186091.name: Interesting
657186091.author: a TripAdvisor user
657186091.reviewBody: This area is still under development, so it will get better with time. The tour guide was fantastic. So knowledgeable.

address.streetAddress: La Chole

655324604.name: Irvin was great and informative guide
655324604.author: a TripAdvisor user
655324604.reviewBody: we were 2 couples staying in Ixtapa, the drive wasn\'t long to get there.  we learned a lot and would recommend this destination

address.streetAddress: La Chole

654887856.name: Great tour with Franco
654887856.author: a TripAdvisor user
654887856.reviewBody: We took this tour with a 4 year old and an infant, and we had a very informative, interesting and comfortable trip.  Franco shared so much information with us.  We learned so much about the culture.

address.streetAddress: La Chole

654294940.name: Not at the location shown in Ixtapa
654294940.author: a TripAdvisor user
654294940.reviewBody: I do not know where this location is so cannot update - web indicates on the way to Acapulco. Can definitely confirm not in Ixtapa. This may help a wasted journey.

address.streetAddress: La Chole
