653241331.name: Feb 16 Annual Festival so enjoyable!
653241331.author: a TripAdvisor user
653241331.reviewBody: We visited on this day to attend a special annual festival which we highly recommend to anyone who may be visiting the area in mid February of any given year.  We have been visiting this archeological zone for over 20 years, and in that time it has become an official government archaeological zone. In the early days, we viewed amazing artifacts in the homes of local villagers, and a stele was mounted in front of their church. Today, true artifacts and reproductions of original artifacts are on display in a nicely curated museum. Sadly, the stele stone and many of the most prized artifacts have probably been transported to the archaeological museum in Mexico City for safekeeping, though hopefully not surreptitiously sold to private collectors. The displays and exhibitions in the museum here are however very enlightening, and well presented. As my title suggests, we attended on February 16, which is the annual Fuego Nuevo (New Fire) celebration, and as a result, we were the beneficiaries of a charming young woman named Gema, a university student from Petatlan volunteering as a guide for the festival day!  Our Spanish is serviceable, so we learned so much more information from her about the museum on this visit than we had from just the printed exhibit descriptions before. We greatly enjoyed her interpretation of the ball court facility, and the pyramid. It is a commanding view from the top of the pyramid facility that gives you the sensation of what is to come. Off in the distance, you see a hill, and realize it is not a hill, but in fact another pyramid buried and waiting to be excavated! On this one day of the year, they hold a big celebration in the village field, with food vendors and arts/crafts vendors and indigenous dance performances. I purchased some darling baby booties, some coconut soap, and a fabulous bottle of hibiscus flower infused Mezcal! We purchased some beautiful homegrown tomatoes, star fruit, and an alarmingly hot habanero pepper!  We really enjoyed a glass of fermented pineapple juice, that I would equate to a kombucha type drink. It was wonderful! This is an archaeological zone with ongoing excavation, so new artifact finds and structure reveals are always taking place!  It is worth a visit anytime, but especially on any given February 16!

address.streetAddress: La Chole

649754833.name: La Soledad de Maciel and Xihuacan ruinsZihua Eco Tours
649754833.author: a TripAdvisor user
649754833.reviewBody:
We had an excelent tour with Zihua Eco Tours  owned and operated by Norma Blanco. 52  755 127  0982
nblanco16@hotmail.com. 
Norma was a very friendly and knowledgeable tour guide
She has been a resident of Zhuatenejo area her entire life and has much insight to the surrounding areas, history and knowledge a variety of plants. On this particular tour  our first stop was a tile and brick laying business which came with a hands on lesson in tile making, complete with animal farm. 

Our next stop was La soledad de Maciel where the MesoAmerican Museum is located with the Xihuacan ruins adjacent. We were given a tour by a native to the 
Area by the name of Aden Valez Romero. He and his family have personally unearthed many of the artifacts in the museum prior to it being recognized as a ruin. Read the wikipedia article regarding Xihuacan ruins. He was a very impassioned guide and Norma did and excellent job of translating from Spanish to English. 

We then visited the ruins beginning with the ball court, one of the largest in the country . The ball court game ended in 
the winning team being sacaraficed!  Next we climbed to the only one of three unearthed pyramids. The entire ruins were covered in mud after a tsunami . Its truly one of Mexicos hidden gems because it hasn’t been turned into a huge tourist zone yet. They have only just begun to excavate the site . The work they've done to date is pristine. 

Our final stop on the tour was the village of La Soledad de Maciel. Here Norma took us to her family friends house and  they proceeded to make us coffee , show us how to roll cigars, and feed us a meal of homemade frijoles, tortillas, quesso ,salsa and shredded pork . All the food and tobacca was grown in their town. The Senora cooked everything on a open flame complete with tortilla grill. Completely authentic with an opportunity to make tortillas and then share a meal with this charming family. So welcoming!

The best part of this tour was the personalized service we received from Norma. She went out of her way to show us a good time. I felt completely relaxed and at home with her. She never rushed us through any part of our day. 
I would like to note that the tour price which , is very resonable for 6 hours does not include tips which are given to the various guides and hosts in the form of buying their handmade whares such as pottery , embroidery and cigars. 

Norma also offers a variety of other tours including hot springs and turtle releases. She can accomodste 2 to 14 people in a air conditioned car or van.

address.streetAddress: La Chole

666466483.name: SUPERB
666466483.author: a TripAdvisor user
666466483.reviewBody: So beautiful, and so much marine life to see. You can walk into the water and see beautiful colourful fish, or you can gather some snorkelling equipment and swim a bit further out (maybe another 10 meters out) to see puffer fish, parrot fishes, starfish, and underwater sculptures.

640909941.name: Beautiful beach for snorkeling
640909941.author: a TripAdvisor user
640909941.reviewBody: Excellent beach with numerous restaurants that offer snorkeling equipment. Best to visit early mornings during the week. Weekends and afternoons can be very busy because of numerous tours to the area. The whole of the Isla Ixtapa is an environmentally protected area because of the Coral reef marine life. The area is patrolled by guards to ensure protection of marine life.

568260170.name: Snorkeling and a siesta
568260170.author: a TripAdvisor user
568260170.reviewBody: This is pretty good snorkeling, the coral is in tough shape from all the people touching it in the relatively shallow water, but there is a pretty good variety of fish. Stay away from the exposed rocks and be alert, there are some interesting currents running along the shoreline. I recommend a life jacket as the best snorkeling is quite a ways off shore and it\'s nice to be able to just float and rest, and it will keep you from being yet another tourist standing on the coral. Service is good and prices are reasonable at the restaurants. I recommend getting here in the morning when the water is clearest and calmest. If you get tired, an afternoon siesta in the shade with a cerveza is very relaxing here. When we were here, low tide was around 3 in the afternoon and snorkeling was virtually impossible then, so be aware of tide times.

562582479.name: great time on the beach
562582479.author: a TripAdvisor user
562582479.reviewBody: went for the second time, no need to do a tour, cost us about 50 dollars US for the taxi both ways the water taxi , lunch and rental of life jacket, we brought our own gear. We do the second stop on the water Taxi and walk over to the other size. You can use the tables and chairs as long as you order something, very good service. lots of fish and good snorkeling we went early about 9:30 am on the water taxi and beat the crowds.

560469223.name: always come here
560469223.author: a TripAdvisor user
560469223.reviewBody: We took our Friends and Family who have never been to the Island and they just loved it from the snorkeling, food and great service. They would definitely come back here

559928163.name: Clear water for snorkelling
559928163.author: a TripAdvisor user
559928163.reviewBody:
As soon as we got off the water taxi at Playa Coral, Johnny met us to come and check out his two sides of the restaurant at Marlins. The reef side where all the fish are is at the back of the restaurant and we were sat at a nice table under a freshly made palapa. Johnny informed us that everything was free as long as we purchased some food or drinks we could use the shade of the umbrellas, a locker, showers and bathrooms. They also rented full snorkel gear for 150 pesos. We brought our own and had fun in the water. 

The beach sand here is coarse and there are a rocks and coral in the water which is great to see a lot of colourful fish. It's a gradual entry and the water was fairly calm and very clean and clear. Our underwater camera took some very good pictures here. Families with small children were also having a lot of fun. They do have life jackets available. Massage tables were also set up on the beach if you wanted to purchase one.  

While eating our really good guacamole and chips and having a cold beer, we noticed two bunny rabbits standing on hind legs underneath our table and begging for food! Never seen that on any other beach before!! They were cute. But the roosters crowing in the afternoon was odd. 

We enjoyed spending a few hours here and felt very welcome and safe. Friendly staff and the beach is clean.

542086487.name: Great for more than one day.
542086487.author: a TripAdvisor user
542086487.reviewBody:
We went to playa Coral and had lots of fun. We took the boat for MX$50 per person and paid one of the restaurants for food and drinks so we could use their palapa or big umbrella. Prices were very reasonable. Playa coral was amazing for snorkeling. We paid one of the guides MX$90 for 3 people tour on the coral reef. Great service and enjoyed the time. You can rent the snorkel equipment or bring yours. Pay the guide since they know the safest places for snorkeling. Great time looking diferente fish and coral. Worth the money and the time.
We also spent time on the other beach were the dock is. Great for swimming with kids.
Good at the restaurants was delicious and affordable.
We spent 5 hours, but next time we will spend the whole day. 
Definitely a must.

532185883.name: Go to Snorkel and Relax with a message
532185883.author: a TripAdvisor user
532185883.reviewBody: The snorkeling was OK. The sad part is the coral there is dead and broken washing up on the shore. The abundance and variety of fish were OK not great just OK. The food was really nice and fresh. I had fajitas, good sides, and fresh guacamole. The people there are very friendly and helpful. The surprise was they offered messages. The girls there have fantastic hands, I was like Gumby when I was finished and the price was 400 pesos which was about $37.00usd. for 1 hour.You can get a guide to take you out that cost 60 pesos. The current can be a little strong and it was easier having the guide pull you out, you hang onto a floaty. The guide dives down and finds a variety starfish and brings them up for you to see and hold or touch. I suggest you wear water shoes due to the broken coral.You will enjoy your time at Playa Coral and it is family friendly just protect your feet. If you plan to spend the day there I would suggest wearing a rash guard to keep from sunburning.

671994727.name: Bring your chairs
671994727.author: a TripAdvisor user
671994727.reviewBody: Beautiful beach, with some public use. No chairs available to rent so bring your own. Not a ton of shade.

655004012.name: Quiet beach for a quiet walk
655004012.author: a TripAdvisor user
655004012.reviewBody: Nice beach that allows you to take a short stroll in the sand/water. Not many people on the beach and not much happening there but it\'s was a nice for a quiet morning walk. There were a few larger yachts that added to the breathtaking view.

648175338.name: Nice Beach!! But an be very busy with locals enjoying the day
648175338.author: a TripAdvisor user
648175338.reviewBody: I like this beach, but it can be busy.  It is a public beach and there are hotels that share it as well as local.  There is a massage hut there and on week-end they open up a very little type market.  Most of the time we did feel safe there, we had a couple of uncomfortable  encounters with some that were totally sloshed!  It was a little scary, we hurried back to our hotel.

603600943.name: Name sums it up!
603600943.author: a TripAdvisor user
603600943.reviewBody: We visited most of the Ixtapa/Zihutanejo beaches and all had some rough surf and or overcrowding.  Playa Quieta is different because mose of the property fronting the beach is taked by Club Med. That means that there are very few hawkers and or informal eating places.  Towards the end of the beach the surf is quieter as it somes up against the end of the bay. You will need to take everything (towels, chairs, drink, etc).  Very beautiful and quiet.

581457885.name: Beautiful, clean but owned by hotels.
581457885.author: a TripAdvisor user
581457885.reviewBody: The beach is awesome! I went there at noon when there was almost nobody. The only problem is that most of it is owned by hotels.

520314871.name: Great for sunset walks
520314871.author: a TripAdvisor user
520314871.reviewBody: We were staying at the Azul Ixtapa Grand and walked on this beach after supper almost daily. A great 3km round trip through the warm water! Next time we will bring our own towels so we can spend more time on this beach which was gorgeous and not crowded. Did not try any of the restaurants or spas. On a Wednesday night, Club Med was releasing turtles that we stopped to watch.

498047869.name: Mostly Club Med Beach
498047869.author: a TripAdvisor user
498047869.reviewBody: Most of the length of the Playa Quieta is taken by Club Med resort, though the beach is public. The ocean has some waves in January, that though not so big, quite strong for kids. The water temperature was very warm during the summer.

475884556.name: This beach is really quiet. Ideal for not experienced swimmers as well as for more expert swimmers.
475884556.author: a TripAdvisor user
475884556.reviewBody: An ideal spot to expect a few hours enjoing either sun or shade. Food and drinks are OK. Prices are ok, not cheap not expensive.

464394698.name: Nice Beach
464394698.author: a TripAdvisor user
464394698.reviewBody: This is primarily Club Med and a few other private condo type buildings.\nNice walk - clean and relatively quiet.

403781009.name: Quiet Beach
403781009.author: a TripAdvisor user
403781009.reviewBody: Clean sand and fun waves to play in.   No load music and no too many people. I was worried that the sea may be cold but no way.  The sea was like a hot bath.  Pure joy to relax and swim on this beach.

359019882.name: Beautiful beach with great views
359019882.author: a TripAdvisor user
359019882.reviewBody: This beach was adjacent to my hotel. I walked down the service road and public access lane beside Club Med. While there were many people on the beach, they were spread out and I was able to hang out on my own. The view of the rocks was great and there were lots of pelicans there. Kids seemed to enjoy swimming in an area overseen by a lifeguard.

356598048.name: Gorgeous beach and sunsets.
356598048.author: a TripAdvisor user
356598048.reviewBody: Beautiful walk down Playa Quieta beach. Nice little restaurant to stop for food / drinks on your way down. Make sure to go here at least one evening around 6:45 p.m. for the beautiful sunset.

353127759.name: Quiet beach
353127759.author: a TripAdvisor user
353127759.reviewBody: This is a small beach bordering the property of Club Med.  It is very quiet, very few vendors, and the water is usually calm.  It is really lovely.

351448370.name: Playa Quieta is Great
351448370.author: a TripAdvisor user
351448370.reviewBody: Beaches are shorter than some  (e.g. Nyarit Vallarta) but are still  very nice.  Warm water with some sandy stretches ; can be rough at times but is swim able. Not really a snorkelling beach

347103120.name: Jackpot! !
347103120.author: a TripAdvisor user
347103120.reviewBody: If you want good service and good food, I recommend you go to a different resort! ! Same food served 2 days in a row . Should bring your own lounge chair if you want to lounge by pool, not enough there. Learn Spanish because there is only a few workers that speak a little English. Pool bar is closed everyday at 6 p.m. Make reservations for meals because a lot of people go out to eat and the restaurant\'s book fast. Bogart restaurant is right beside the Tersero and has amazing food as well the service is first class.

343340703.name: Great morning walks!
343340703.author: a TripAdvisor user
343340703.reviewBody: My wife and I got up early to go exploring, we decided to go left from The Azul Grand to this beach. Very nice, took about an hour or so to walk and explore. Waves weren\'t too bad but we just went shin level. Massage hut right at start of beach.

340345101.name: Couples Get Away
340345101.author: a TripAdvisor user
340345101.reviewBody: Very nice beach.  Water is calm unlike many other beaches in Ixtapa.  Nice clean sand beach once you get away from the entrance from the street.  Gradual drop off.  I believe the beach is sheltered by Ixtapa Island which makes the waves not so high and rough.  great swimming beach.  We stated at the Azul Grand which is right next door to this beach.Night and day difference between the two beaches.

332277789.name: Very nice
332277789.author: a TripAdvisor user
332277789.reviewBody: Visited here when we were on Ixtapa. Great waves lots of fun. Very quiet during the week. Locals come here on the weekends but it wasn\'t too bad

299428019.name: an excellent beach
299428019.author: a TripAdvisor user
299428019.reviewBody: Before you go, plan way ahead by ordering from your city library a book out-of-print: Judith Bruns\' HIDDEN BEACHES OF MEXICO [Univ. of Cal-Berkley Press- 1070s]. This is one of her hallmark beaches [God bless her now departed soul].

279296090.name: Very Comfortable Beach
279296090.author: a TripAdvisor user
279296090.reviewBody: If you want to rest all day and have a nice time just come here.\nThe beach is Really Quiet, there are restaurants that sells food and beverages if you want

277645402.name: Nobody there
277645402.author: a TripAdvisor user
277645402.reviewBody: Had it all to ourselves.  Mid week, off season, good food and beer.The beach is long, beautiful and free of hordes of tourists.

264959687.name: If you\'re going to stay at Azul Ixtapa go to playa quieta
264959687.author: a TripAdvisor user
264959687.reviewBody: We only discovered this beach on our second last day in Ixtapa sadly, it was amazing! It is a public beach so it is fairly busy but it is very beautiful and perfect for people staying at the Azul Ixtapa and Grande that does not have a beach. Lots of palm trees, the water is very clean and beautiful.

264896637.name: Great Sand and good swimming
264896637.author: a TripAdvisor user
264896637.reviewBody: This beach located in front of Club Med or between Azul Grand and Club Med. There is public access to the beach behind Azul Grand. \nWe visited when the waves were high, not very common apparently, and still enjoyed our visit. The sand is great to play with if you have kids. \nThere are occasional rocks in the water on the closer end of the beach, but if you\'re wearing water shoes it\'s not an issue. There is a small restaurant where we did not eat but grabbed some beer.

262790572.name: Wonderful Beach
262790572.author: a TripAdvisor user
262790572.reviewBody: Next door to Azul Ixtapa Grand which doesn\'t have much of a beach so we were pleased to be able to spend time there. Beach was lovely, nice sand and warm waves.  Great.

259020164.name: Nice Beach
259020164.author: a TripAdvisor user
259020164.reviewBody: This gold sand beach is right next door to Azul Ixtapa Grand, where we stayed. It\'s in front of Club Med, but not too busy. Lots of waves, and a bit of undertow. Check for the green flag before going in the water. White flag is debatable.

257520995.name: Nice beach as the beach at Azul Ixtapa Grand poor.
257520995.author: a TripAdvisor user
257520995.reviewBody: Decent sand, massages, palm trees to lie under and not s super wide beach so walking for a great distance to get to the water was not an issue!

256747488.name: Excellent for walking along the beach
256747488.author: a TripAdvisor user
256747488.reviewBody: If you are staying at Club Med, Azul Grand this is a beautiful beach to walk along.\nMassage shack at end of beach closer to Azul.  $40US = great massage.

256252776.name: My favorite place to swim in the area
256252776.author: a TripAdvisor user
256252776.reviewBody: Playa Quieta is just that the quiet beach, it has public access at the far end but is mostly monopolized by the Club Med and you can guess why they plunked their resort there!!!!  Great  place to stop for lunch and a swim on the return bike trip to Playa Linda.

255690516.name: Playa Quieta Jewel
255690516.author: a TripAdvisor user
255690516.reviewBody: Beautiful beach about a mile long.  Located south of the Azul Grand.  Nice golden sand that gets very hot to walk on.  Can get massages there for $40US.  Great place for a walk or swim.

252968334.name: Beautiful beach tto walk, great small resteraunt at entrance
252968334.author: a TripAdvisor user
252968334.reviewBody: My wife an I stayed at the Azul Grand next door to this beach, and walked this beach multiple times.  It is beautiful, and the swimming here is top notch.  There is a small bar/restaurant at the public entrance called Neptunios that we stopped at multiple times for beers and ceviche.  It was great!

252114311.name: Nice small beach
252114311.author: a TripAdvisor user
252114311.reviewBody: Small beach good sand we accessed from beside the Club Med resort. Mostly access to resort properties not many restaurants.

248296899.name: Beautiful Beach
248296899.author: a TripAdvisor user
248296899.reviewBody: A short walk from the Azul Grand, but one of the best & quiet beaches in the area. Spent mornings walking the soft sand, and wading out into the clear & calm water.

247502321.name: nice but not great
247502321.author: a TripAdvisor user
247502321.reviewBody: no shade, eccept for the palm trees at the very end or the playa, where security from resorts are constantly checking on you that you are not trespassing...otherways it\'s a great beach to go with kids, almost no waives. There is dirt with sand, so it gets a little dirty in the beginning, but then water is really clean in about 2 meters

244984353.name: Chula Vida
244984353.author: a TripAdvisor user
244984353.reviewBody: Sashimi is great as is the fish filet...you can be assured that your meal is fresh and all is terrific.

198004612.name: love this beach
198004612.author: a TripAdvisor user
198004612.reviewBody: Great walking and swimming beach. Very clean and uncrowded. We walked this beach everyday, with a swim here and there.

197598362.name: Beautiful beach
197598362.author: a TripAdvisor user
197598362.reviewBody: Such a beautiful beach and the ocean is gentle for swimming. Only a short walk from the Azul Grand and a fabulous place to spend an afternoon.

196437101.name: Clean, Clear Waters, Gorgeous Sunsets & Safe
196437101.author: a TripAdvisor user
196437101.reviewBody: The half of our resort beach was Playa Quieta.  There was an amazing massage hut located on the beach that everyone in our family went to over our week there.  They did an amazing job and were quite reasonable ($40).    The sand is soft and the water warm.  Sunsets on this beach are absolutely breathtaking.   if you are nearby take a look, its totally worth it!

193566219.name: Wonderful beach
193566219.author: a TripAdvisor user
193566219.reviewBody: Beautiful beach which is very wide with soft sand ... you can walk out for a long before it gets deep. Great for anyone to enjoy!!

192969562.name: BEACH THOUGH VERY SMALL
192969562.author: a TripAdvisor user
192969562.reviewBody: Playa Quieta Beach, next to the Azul Ixtapa Grand Resort  was just enough to have access to sandy stretch of the beach and warm water of the Pacific Ocean and have a swim. The water can be a bit murky at times.Water sport rentals were available. \nIn fact, there were other choices, apart from the pools, one could walk up to Azul Ixtapa (Azul Ixtapa Grand\'s sister Resort) which has a much longer beach, stretching all the way to Playa Linda. . \n Most of  the time we walked to longer stretch for our walks on the shore line.

192164753.name: Lovely, quiet beach
192164753.author: a TripAdvisor user
192164753.reviewBody: This beach was located right beside our hotel - Azul Ixtapa Grand and we enjoyed swimming here since the beach at the hotel was almost non-existent. The people staying at Club Med are very fortunate to have this beach right in front of their property. Water was very warm and there was a sandy bottom.

190664789.name: Beautiful and one of the best beaches in Ixtapa
190664789.author: a TripAdvisor user
190664789.reviewBody: Playa Quieta was very, well, quieta!  The sand was soft and fine, the waves were calm and rolled in softly.  The water was warm and great for swimming.  The beach was long and walkable and we really enjoyed it!  There is a small restaurant on the North side of the beach as well as a massage hut.  Water sport rentals were available at the South end.  We were so bummed that we didn\'t discover it until the last day!  Club Med and Capella are located directly on this beach, Azul Grand is right next door to it.

170945324.name: terrific beach
170945324.author: a TripAdvisor user
170945324.reviewBody: The water is so warm though the water can be a bit murky at times. Very mellow so that you can stay in the water for hours at a time. Very safe for kids, water always spits you back onto the beach rather than drag you out to see. If you are looking to go sailing, this is not so great, no wind.

162203509.name: This Playa was NOT quieta, in spite of its name!
162203509.author: a TripAdvisor user
162203509.reviewBody: We went there thinking it might be calmer than the beach at our hotel: Las Brisas. We didn\'t find it to be quieter. Quieta means steady, calm in Spanish. We found it rather rough.

153076198.name: Lovely
153076198.author: a TripAdvisor user
153076198.reviewBody: Best kept secret in Zihua. A beautiful romantic place for fish on the beach, a cold beer or two, watching the world pass by to the sou d of the ocean

151103002.name: Quiet beach
151103002.author: a TripAdvisor user
151103002.reviewBody: Playa Quieta means quiet beach and it is just that.  It is a bit secluded, smaller and truly beautiful.  The beach is populated by people at the all inclusive hotel that runs along most of the beach but the north end is for locals so you really get a great family feeling.  There is a place at the north end where you can rent chairs or lounges and a shade cover if you want.

127613356.name: Great Beach, stay at Club Med
127613356.author: a TripAdvisor user
127613356.reviewBody: Gorgeous beach, great for open water swims, but stay at Club Med, as if not, the beach is really inconvenient

124419542.name: Dirty
124419542.author: a TripAdvisor user
124419542.reviewBody: Sewer runs into ocean. Beach full of debris.stay away

123324241.name: Barry quiet
123324241.author: a TripAdvisor user
123324241.reviewBody: Very few services but easy to get there by bus and beautiful

123237984.name: Beautiful Beach
123237984.author: a TripAdvisor user
123237984.reviewBody: We spent a day at Playa Quieta!  It was a nice quiet little beach :)

672830669.name: Great Experience!!
672830669.author: a TripAdvisor user
672830669.reviewBody: We had a great time with the dolphins. It\u2019s completely worth it. All the staff are kind and helpful.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

666399908.name: Dolphin show
666399908.author: a TripAdvisor user
666399908.reviewBody: We didn\u2019t know what to expect & we were pleasantly surprised by our experience! The staff is very friendly, the facility is lots of fun & it was reasonably priced. The facility not only has dolphins, there are parrots (that you can get photos with) & a small aquarium with clown fish (Nemo!) We got front row seats to the dolphin show, so our little kids were able to see it all. The announcer spoke English very well & made the experience that much more enjoyable. Before the dolphins did all their tricks, the announcer taught us all about bottle nose dolphins. After the show we were able to touch & give a dolphin a kiss! (They took photos of our family with the dolphins) We loved this experience!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

665324457.name: Awesome experience for a family
665324457.author: a TripAdvisor user
665324457.reviewBody: We absolutely loved our family dolphin encounter.  We felt that it was priced reasonably, and it was a good value for what we paid.  All 4 of us got to spend 20+ minutes in the water with the dolphins, and a very knowledgeable and friendly guide.  He spoke excellent English, so it was easy to ask questions.  He was very accommodating and told us not to worry about time, when one of the dolphins wanted to go and play instead of staying by us.  This was a late Christmas gift for our 7 year old daughter, and she absolutely loved it. Our son is almost 6, and he was a little more timid, but also loved it, and has been talking about it.  We also watched the dolphin show, the day before we did the swim. That was very fun and entertaining as well. It was a nice way to give the kids a preview of the swimming experience, so they weren\'t scared or surprised as to how it would be.  The only slight downside that I had was dealing with buying the photos.  One of the guys gave me a price, and when I came back with my money to purchase the disc, it seemed as though the people didn\'t believe that price.  Finally it worked out, but then they wouldn\'t accept some of the American dollars that I had, due to some writing and/or small tears.  As I didn\'t want to come back a third time, I wasn\'t able to get all of the photos, and spent 1/2 the amount that I was going to spend on all the photos, to buy only 6.  It all worked out, but that piece was time consuming and a little bit irritating.  The photo people are different that the trainers, and the experience with all of the trainers was nothing short of exceptional.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

656411773.name: Highlight of our trip!
656411773.author: a TripAdvisor user
656411773.reviewBody: We really enjoyed the dolphin show that we saw at Delfiniti!  We had 3 kids with us (all under age 10) and this was really fun for them.  Very talented dolphins and exciting show, with LOTS of tricks!  Wished we were able to take our own photos though! My husband wasn\'t there and thus wasn\'t able to \'see\' any of it!  Would like to visit again if back in Ixtapa.  Thanks!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

656309237.name: Informative
656309237.author: a TripAdvisor user
656309237.reviewBody: I had a 20 minute swim with 2 dolphins. It was awesome and I learned some things I had not known before.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

655432546.name: Unique experience!
655432546.author: a TripAdvisor user
655432546.reviewBody: Swim with dolphins, or just watch.  Tickets can be purchased and reservations made at Krystal Ixtapa, too.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

655039564.name: Day show
655039564.author: a TripAdvisor user
655039564.reviewBody:
We came on a Sunday for the show and it was very entertaining. A good way to escape mid day heatstroke. It was roughly $15 cdn each plus costs for photos. 

They seem to treat the dolphins well and it seemed reasonably clean. The announcer could speak very good English which helped for the show as he flipped between languages. 

Photos with your own equipment was encouraged except for the parrots and the dolphins jumping to your hand.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

650207154.name: Good experience.
650207154.author: a TripAdvisor user
650207154.reviewBody: A friend of mine is a Therapist here, and I decided to try the "Dolphin Therapy". I am a natural skeptic and also don\'t believe that dolphins or killer whales should be kept captive for the purpose of entertaining humans. After long discussions with my friend and assurances that the dolphins were rescued (rehabilitated after being hurt) and not exploited.I wanted to give it a try, the dolphin would lay on you and I suppose send sonic vibrations throughout ones system. I have had EMS before and spinal adjustments when I kept getting awful headaches and felt great after the sessions. The Dolphin would lay on my neck and I felt the same sensation as the EMS, like tiny electrodes pulsating through my neck muscles.It was a very unique experience and relaxing. As far as cost, they do offer discounts at certain times of the year. I would recommend it and if you feel relaxed after a message on the beach (which is a favorite thing tourists love to get done here), then this will blow you away. I was skeptical at first but came away a believer and feeling much happier and less stressed.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

641220556.name: doesn\'t worth it
641220556.author: a TripAdvisor user
641220556.reviewBody: very expansive, water is dirty, you are not allowed to take pics and video. they sell each pic for 150 pesos, not super quality. if someone from group is not coming but wants to watch the rest of the family - has to pay 60 pesos.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

639766462.name: Excellente.Another safe adventure.
639766462.author: a TripAdvisor user
639766462.reviewBody: Wife enjoyed about 30 minutes in the deep pool with 2 Dolphins in 2015.She wore a life vest.Rings must be removed to not cut the very friendly Dolphins.She pet them,hugged and even kissed them.She like shook hands with the fin.She posed in between each one. The 2 Dolphins did a parallel leap as my wife raised both her hands in a victory type position.She bought the professional photos as personal cameras are not allowed.There is a gift shop.Friendly staff.It is located on the beach but with entrance on side street .She plans on returning in March 1919.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

633653235.name: fun time with the dolphins
633653235.author: a TripAdvisor user
633653235.reviewBody: they are super nice here and we got to interact with the dolphins and the staff was very nice and explained everything

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

633219993.name: Loved the dolphins!!
633219993.author: a TripAdvisor user
633219993.reviewBody: Swam with the dolphins!! Amazing how intelligent they are!! ..the trainers are great with them!!! Water is cold!! So be prepared for that!!!  We bought the video and just recently watched it again!!! Great memories!!!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

616097050.name: Swimming with Dolphins
616097050.author: a TripAdvisor user
616097050.reviewBody: Awesome experience for the whole family. No entrance fees. If you like to swim with the dolphins you have to pay. There are different prices and timings. A video and pictures will be taken and you can choose afterwards which package you would like to buy. Because of the unique experience you definitely will buy something and the prices are not so expensive. We paid for 52 pictures and a video 3.000,- Pesos, received in a DVD/CD including a printed picture!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

607661516.name: Incre\u00edble experiencia
607661516.author: a TripAdvisor user
607661516.reviewBody: Excelente experiencia, los entrenadores muy amables, el personal muy atento, y los 45 minutos de actividades con los delfines son iincre\u00edbles! Muy muy recomendable \n\nThis is a must if you want to swim with dolphins, it is a wonderful experience to have fun and very nice place! The trainers are so kind.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

599955984.name: Very fun time
599955984.author: a TripAdvisor user
599955984.reviewBody: Excellent experience in Delfiniti  Great family atmosphere, small groups, but a little expensive,  Be prepared to drop some money on the excellent photos which are hard to pass up but also expensive.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

594179483.name: Two week adventure ALL OVER Mexico and this was one of our best stop.
594179483.author: a TripAdvisor user
594179483.reviewBody: The trainers were great!  Were able to communicate in several languages.? Taught us some dolphin...we got to hug/kiss a dolphin, get pushed. Strongly recommend it

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

589055571.name: An experience
589055571.author: a TripAdvisor user
589055571.reviewBody:
My 15 yr old son was very excited to try swimming with ththe dolphins. It was about $130 US.
I thought it sounded a bit high but after the amount of time spent in the water (about 30 minutes) playing and doing tricks with the dolphins it was well worth it.
Capping off the day was when the dolphins pushed him by the feet from under water catapulting him through the water like Superman!
Tip: no personal pictures or videos.
They have people taking them (and selling them) for you.
It was actually refreshing to just be able to enjoy the moment for a change.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

587940404.name: Family Time with the Dolphins
587940404.author: a TripAdvisor user
587940404.reviewBody: The kids had a great time and Diego was awesome with our kids especially our youngest who was hesitant about going in with the dolphins. \nI recommend anyone to do it, greatest experience...

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

580469426.name: Love the Dolphins, but...... : (
580469426.author: a TripAdvisor user
580469426.reviewBody: The dolphins were awesome but the extremely high cost, and not being able to capture your own memories with your OWN camera is very disappointing. It cost us an arm and a leg for a couple of pictures and in USD... between the high cost of this excursion and in US currency(I\'m Canadian).... sadly we will never go back and will not recommend this excursion to our family and friends. Delfiniti needs to modify their prices and allow pictures to be taken with our own devices. The quality of the pictures we got was sub-par.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

577214900.name: Great time with dolphins but insanely expensive pictures and video that didn\'t even work!
577214900.author: a TripAdvisor user
577214900.reviewBody: We had a great time but it was an expensive with with the dolphins. I enjoyed the time but then you can\'t take pictures and they rushed us to pick, so they could close. We picked some and they were ok. However I splurged for the video. They showed me it on the computer (must have been from the file) because I got the dvd back to our hotel and it wouldn\'t play on the computer. It made a funny sound and refused to even register. I called the next day and they gave me an email to send a request to to get the video file and promised they would take care of it. (I couldn\'t go back to the place, as we were flying out that day). So sent the email and never heard back! So I have a $100 dvd that\'s useless. Feel very ripped off. Enjoyed the dolphins but don\'t bother with the ridiculous pictures and video. So sad to spend the money and now it\'s too late to complain to visa, as I was waiting for the email response. This when I called the day after our show the get the video issued fixed at Christmas. Don\'t waste your money.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

575598411.name: Once in a life time
575598411.author: a TripAdvisor user
575598411.reviewBody: I say once in a life time because Im glad my kids did it once but they never asked to go back. It was a small area with some parrots we were in and out in about 1 1/2 hours. I don\'t remember what we paid. The staff was very nice

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

567898164.name: What a surprise
567898164.author: a TripAdvisor user
567898164.reviewBody: Ok...You\'ve got to go here.  It\'s a high quality dolphin show for very little money.  Been coming to Ixtapa for 35 years and this was our first time taking in their show.  Talk about up front and personal with the dolphins.  Always saw the signs walking down the beach but didn\'t give it a try.   Dolphins  treated VERY WELL.  Great for all ages.  Charges are 1/4 of what you\'d pay anywhere else to see a quality show like this.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

564040646.name: Double Rating
564040646.author: a TripAdvisor user
564040646.reviewBody: As far as the swim with the dolphins and the show our grandchildren loved it and were all smiles which is what the experience was about. Unfortunately for myself and the parents we were frustrated with the lack of information when we purchased our tickets. I had 6 grandchildren swimming at $100 US per child. This was a reduced price from the $116 he started out with. I paid that and then was told that we had to pay extra to go and watch the children which I did. At this point we were a little ticked that this was not mentioned up front. We then proceed to try and take pictures and were immediately told that was not allowed - again another cash grab! This was a very expensive 45 minute swim and unfortunately we don\u2019t have pictures as we refused to pay the inflated prices. We are Canadian and by the time we did the US exchange this would have been a $800 to $1000 swim fo 6 children ages 5-11. Crazy! They certainly don\u2019t make it affordable for families. Make sure to get ALL the costs up front

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

561984996.name: Once in life time experience
561984996.author: a TripAdvisor user
561984996.reviewBody: The dolphins were so friendly and funny.  We loved every second with them in the pool.  So glad to have the opportunity to encounter the intelligent and great animals.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

560736059.name: Just dropped in while out for a walk
560736059.author: a TripAdvisor user
560736059.reviewBody: We were just passing by and went in for a look.  The staff let us watch them feed and check the dolphins and then even did a little show and explanation for us.  Definitely worth a visit.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

553408638.name: Bad experience
553408638.author: a TripAdvisor user
553408638.reviewBody: I would like to begin saying that this placa has many promoters all around Ixtapa and they manage different plans. I was convinced to go there. They told one price and once in the place it was something far more expensive. So when I left, I could see that they don\'t show prices to the public nor the schedules for the activities they offer.\nI wouldn\'t go there again.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

548138775.name: Great memories with our 7 month baby
548138775.author: a TripAdvisor user
548138775.reviewBody: Its a great experience in Ixtapa. Dolphins are great, trainers are great and prices are affordable, specially if you get a coupon on your hotel or in the streets. \n\nMy grade is nos excellent because the photo staff sucks in attitude and they are not even pros. Also pictures are expensive and they don\'t have good and affordable photo packages.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

506855650.name: Nice experience
506855650.author: a TripAdvisor user
506855650.reviewBody: Delfiniti is definitely awesome! Staff crew is very kind and helped a lot to have an extraordinary experience with dolphins. Amply recommended!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

503569769.name: Dolphins!
503569769.author: a TripAdvisor user
503569769.reviewBody: This was actually very good. Trainers were great, spoke good English. Paid about $10 for a picture after. No cameras allowed.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

494427306.name: Beautiful Dolphins
494427306.author: a TripAdvisor user
494427306.reviewBody: So much fun to swim with the dolphins and spend a bit of time with them.  Downside is they take a lot of great pictures that are very expensive to purchase.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

487547118.name: Not great!
487547118.author: a TripAdvisor user
487547118.reviewBody: To be honest I prefer to spend my money out on a boat seeing dolphins in the ocean rather than seeing them in captivity. The place is small for that many dolphins, also they charge a bit to high for the time you get. Not a great idea.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

480042630.name: Fun dolphin experience
480042630.author: a TripAdvisor user
480042630.reviewBody: We did the dolphin excursion with my wife and 2 girls 12 & 10.  The event was fun and we each had plenty of time interacting and swimming with the dolphins.  The trainers all speak very good English and explained things very well throughout the experience.  We also did one in Puerto Vallarta last year, which I thought was a little bit better, but this was still fun.  The one downside is the prices they charge for pictures and video are ridiculous.  Make it a little more reasonable and people would buy more of them...

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

476417350.name: Great spot to see marine life
476417350.author: a TripAdvisor user
476417350.reviewBody: This place is great to visit for a family vacation. Kids would love to go swimming with the animals and people of all ages enjoy this destination.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

475882028.name: A little dissapointed
475882028.author: a TripAdvisor user
475882028.reviewBody: The facities and de enviroment aren\'t what I expected. And the prices for pictures, video are way overpriced.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

475817624.name: Worth every penny!  Exciting and beyond expectations.
475817624.author: a TripAdvisor user
475817624.reviewBody: Great value, check out the rates on Thursday morning, 3 for 2 - water is chilly so just be aware.  Bring towels.  Kids got to swim with the dolphins in 3 different scenarios and was worth every penny.  They loved it!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

470444378.name: Great experience, but expensive.
470444378.author: a TripAdvisor user
470444378.reviewBody: Loved the experience and the staff that is with the dolphins is great. Be prepared that you cannot take any of your own photos, not even one, not anywhere on their property. And they charge you around $5 per picture. So if you go with a family of 6, you have already paid over $680us for the experience and now to get a couple pictures of each of you be prepared to spend another $100. That\'s silly. You should be able to take pics and still have the option to choose from some of their photos.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

468310964.name: Swimming with the dolphins.
468310964.author: a TripAdvisor user
468310964.reviewBody: It has been a couple of years since I swam with the dolphins at Delfinity but I had a great time and the staff was very friendly. I have done it twice in the 13 years we have been going there and would recommend it to anyone that is interested in swimming with dolphins.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

467278841.name: Close up encounter with dolphins
467278841.author: a TripAdvisor user
467278841.reviewBody: My 9 yr old daughter had never seen dolphins up close and this place delivered. The show is about 20 minutes but for 10usd it is worth it, great close up views of bottle-nose dolphins- fun little show.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

467217908.name: Beautiful
467217908.author: a TripAdvisor user
467217908.reviewBody: We went with our 3 yr old and 1.5 yr old. They loved Cali and we had so much fun with her. She was truly beautiful. But unfortunately we were not allowed to use our own water camera and their pictures are so expensive. They don\'t negotiate their prices at all.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

466290079.name: surprised at how great this was
466290079.author: a TripAdvisor user
466290079.reviewBody: i got dragged in her by a friends son and i unwillingly relented and to my surprise what a great experience   it is not overly expensive the facility is immaculate the animal care is obviously lovingly done and i sat in the bleachers and watch the smiles on the folks in with the dolphins..was 60p to watch and i recommend just go in and watch a one hour session you will leave with a smile on your face

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

465179076.name: Torn
465179076.author: a TripAdvisor user
465179076.reviewBody: Are dolphins happy in captivity? Are dogs happy to have owners? Some might be happy to not have to contend with the wild, while certainly others would prefer to be free. The experience here is nearly great. How the place is managed is poor. My hope is the dolphins are better cared for than the bipedal guests. Not that anyone is rude, in fact, every employee from street corner to trainer is very polite. But the business doesn\'t make sense. The price is negotiable from what you see online, for me that\'s a problem. The packages are bizarre and awkwardly designed all with fluctuating price points. But in away, in Mexico, I guess that\'s normal. They do not allow you take pictures. Rather they will charge you 9.00US per picture or $95.00 for the video. Add this up and the pictures alone can cost more than the actual experience, which is again, quite surreal. They will not negotiate on this price. A $1.00 CD with 15-20 (x $9US) pictures on it, which they took anyway during the  experience. I walked away, because plainly that\'s idiotic. If they sold these at even $50.00 they\'d make more money. Too bad they lost my money and many others.  It Could have hopefully been used wisely.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

462955281.name: Swim with the Dolphins
462955281.author: a TripAdvisor user
462955281.reviewBody: We had 2 groups, 1 with a child and one with adults.  The younger children\'s session is about 20 minutes (price includes 1 adult).  It was the perfect length.  The adult session is about 45 minutes and it will not disappoint.  Great experience.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

462773695.name: Have seen better.
462773695.author: a TripAdvisor user
462773695.reviewBody: This is a bit of a mickey mouse operation.  Have enjoyed dolphin swims in Cuba, Cancun and Dominican which were more organized and offered more contact time with the dolphins for a better price.  As guests at the neibouring hotel, I could have saved myself the money and watched from the stairwell!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

462468511.name: A fun activity
462468511.author: a TripAdvisor user
462468511.reviewBody: We booked our experience here at Club Med and overall the experience was amazing.  Definitely tailored to the tourist and somewhat on the expensive side (especially if you want to buy the photo\'s afterwards) but for us and our kids (8 and 5) and amazingly memorable experience.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

459718318.name: Trip from resort
459718318.author: a TripAdvisor user
459718318.reviewBody: Our resort offered a visit to this one day. My sister and I went the show was very enjoyable also they offered a swim with the dolphins and they took your picture which cost 200 pesos for picture.  Good trip for kids.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

457185271.name: Great experience but expensive!
457185271.author: a TripAdvisor user
457185271.reviewBody: My daughter, mother and I did the longer dolphin experience.  We had a very nice time.  It is apparent though that they are all about making money here.  Every single interaction with the dolphins was videotaped and photographed.  (great if you want to spend the money to get them).  You can\'t take your own pictures of anything.  \n\nExperience in the water seemed longer than expected.  We had a great time.  Video and pictures afterwards were another $100 if you wanted to spend the money.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

456974880.name: Great experience for the kids
456974880.author: a TripAdvisor user
456974880.reviewBody: Took my 11yr old step daughter here, she absolutely loved it. The staff was very nice. Great experience!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

455776802.name: Unforgettable
455776802.author: a TripAdvisor user
455776802.reviewBody: Amazing experience swimming with the dolphins. The trainers were informed and caring. Don\'t wear sunblock

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

453066256.name: Hate poor animal treatment
453066256.author: a TripAdvisor user
453066256.reviewBody:
I really wanted to swim with Dolphins.
But when I got there, I was disgusted by the conditions that the animals were kept in.
I could not bring myself to exploit the animals for a few pictures.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

450047708.name: Loved the Dolphins
450047708.author: a TripAdvisor user
450047708.reviewBody: I swam with the dolphins excellent experience, my grandson did the kid swim with dolphins and loved it. So fun to be right there face to face with the dolphins.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

449749869.name: Swimming with the dolphins what an adventure of a life time!!
449749869.author: a TripAdvisor user
449749869.reviewBody: One adventure off my bucket list! Well worth the money to swim, to learn and see how smart they are and don\'t for get hanning on to their fins for a fast ride around the pool. The staff are very friendly and knowledgeable.  A once in a life time experience!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

447636199.name: Who doesn\'t love dophins
447636199.author: a TripAdvisor user
447636199.reviewBody: Great place to swim with the dolphins and have a one on one experience with them. Staff was very friendly and did a good and professional job. The only but I find is the cleanliness of the pool. \nOverall a great experience, I went with my wife and kids 7,5 and 3 years old and everybody was very happy.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

446363635.name: A must!!!
446363635.author: a TripAdvisor user
446363635.reviewBody: This was one of the major highlights of our trip to Ixtapa.  We picked the package where you can play with and also get rides with the dolphins.  Our instructor was awesome and you really get up close and personal with the animals.  The experience was just wonderful.  Everyone in our group was raving about  it.  You can purchase pictures and a video at the end.  Its a memory we wont ever forget

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

443892930.name: Ixtapa
443892930.author: a TripAdvisor user
443892930.reviewBody: It was a great place, went with my mom who has a hard time walking, staff was very helpful and friendly.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

440135248.name: Amazing
440135248.author: a TripAdvisor user
440135248.reviewBody: Canadian, French and Mexican friends of all ages enjoyed enjoyed an amazing and magical time at the Delfiniti center. Very well organized, professional, and international. We were delighted to see how well they take care of these beautiful mammals and the staffs friendly and charming manner made us learn many interesting facts. A DEFINITE recommendation if you are in IXTAPA!! \n

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

439990936.name: Horrible
439990936.author: a TripAdvisor user
439990936.reviewBody: We booked ahead for a group of 12, 6 children and 6 adults. They split us in to two groups, then want to charge us $89 per group for the video. We didn\'t ask to be put in two groups, we should not have to pay $178 for two videos!  Be prepared to be price gouged!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

437794336.name: Swimming with the dolphins is an amazing experience.
437794336.author: a TripAdvisor user
437794336.reviewBody: We have been here about 4 times.  The kids look forward to visiting every time we are in the area.  The attention is very clean,  the staff are wonderful.  Keep in mind this is a tourist attraction and there are quite a few ways to spend money there.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

437657565.name: dolphins are great
437657565.author: a TripAdvisor user
437657565.reviewBody: this place is a nice experience be in contac with dolphins if you want go into the pool with dolphins  for the 20 minutes session they charge  1.300.00 pesos us dolar about 76.00 dls but its worth it  you get to be close to them them  they put you facing dowm the water and th dolphins from behind oush you by your feets over the water its fun and unique when you fisrt entrance they take your pictures with the cacatu that you holding in your hands and also have stan by the edge of the pool and you put your arm horizontal the dolphin jumps to touch your hand and ththis girl take your picture with the dolphin touchin your hand avove the water very nice don\'t misset

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

425073732.name: Fun family day
425073732.author: a TripAdvisor user
425073732.reviewBody: I took my 5 year old son and we both enjoyed our visit. We were able to walk as it\'s located in the middle of the beach between all of the hotels in Ixtapa. Price was a little high for pictures, but I was expecting that.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

423172380.name: Spectacular
423172380.author: a TripAdvisor user
423172380.reviewBody: Its quite spectacular they put on shows for half an hour and it\'s amazing to see all these tricks you can take pictures with them and swim with the \nAlthow they do have little space to swim it\'s kind of tight

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

413922016.name: Nice visit
413922016.author: a TripAdvisor user
413922016.reviewBody: We had a great time, we went on the off season so it was quiet. Everyone was friendly and helpful. If you love animals and the chance to get closer to them this is the way to go.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

409097548.name: Fun, Safe & Clean
409097548.author: a TripAdvisor user
409097548.reviewBody: So much fun. Well organized, clean. Good for adults and children and easy to get to. The staff was friendly and we were able to buy photos of our experience that were of very good quality.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

408375715.name: Good experience but overpriced
408375715.author: a TripAdvisor user
408375715.reviewBody: Swimming with dolphins was my little daughter\'s dream so we went for the top package. Different activities were proposed from petting, feeding and kissing the dolphin. She then was able to swim with them by holding their fins, but the coolest part was when 2 dolphins got under her and lifted her across the pool, surfer style.  Pictures were not allowed and we got the sticker shock when offered to purchase some pictures (~$8-10/each) or movie (~$90!?!). Overall a good experience, but a bit overprice.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

407216768.name: Great experience
407216768.author: a TripAdvisor user
407216768.reviewBody: Dolphins and parrots are very well treated. My children loved the experience. I\'ll come back soon. Thanks

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

396280149.name: Rip off
396280149.author: a TripAdvisor user
396280149.reviewBody: If you are a gringo and don\'t speak Spanish well you WILL get ripped off/taken advantage of. They will charge you double because of your skin color and vulnerability. When we showed up they said our reservation that was for 5 people at 2400 pesos was wrong it should have been just over 4000 pesos. When we were done I was told the pictures and video would be 360 dollars us. We walked around and waited for our 23 pictures at 220 usd and I talked to a guy selling tickets like I hadn\'t just done and he told me it was 1/2 of what I paid and I showed him my receipt for the pictures and he said they charged me double because I\'m white. When I got back to dolfiniti I asked a local Hispanic woman what they were charging her per picture alone and she looked at the staff, looked at me and shook her head. The time with the Dolphin was ok, nothing to write home about. I would never in my lifetime recommend anyone going here who has any sense of right and wrong and minds having people screw you because of your skin color.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

394752499.name: Ok for the kids, a little overpriced
394752499.author: a TripAdvisor user
394752499.reviewBody: Dolphins were fine, but water was a little dirty, price was a little to much for the time spent with them .

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

391716195.name: Great for Kids
391716195.author: a TripAdvisor user
391716195.reviewBody: Staff were very friendly and fun, and their English was excellent. Brought my four-year old son to swim with the dolphins and he loved it.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

379437169.name: Good not Great
379437169.author: a TripAdvisor user
379437169.reviewBody: We took our daughters to swim with the dolphins. The rate through our resort (Club Intrawest) was 98 dollars compare to the regular rate of 124. The facilities were not nearly as nice as other dolphin habitats I\'ve seen. The pools were adequate I guess, but seemed a bit small. I swam with dolphins in Grand Cayman. These facilities do not compare. The actual experience was fun for my daughters, but I was frustrated that they would not let us take pictures. In Grand Cayman you could take as many photos as you wanted. This did not impact people purchasing the professional photos in my opinion. There is no way anyone could take the same kind of photo from the distance onlookers had. I bought the professional photo from Grand Cayman but was happy to have action shots too, and I have to think very few people would buy many pics at 9.00 per pic. The video of the experience was 88 dollars. Good grief. We bought two photos of each daughter. Then we waited Forever for them to put them on a cd. I left feeling that they were trying to squeeze me for every peso I was worth.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

375301758.name: Swimming with teh dolphins at Delfiniti was the best part of our entire trip
375301758.author: a TripAdvisor user
375301758.reviewBody: Buy your tickets at Delfiniti because it is cheaper than getting them on the street.  The experience is worth every penny.  Wear your swimsuit and nothing else.  No lotion, oil or jewelry.  The pictures and video are expensive but worth it.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

374846183.name: Better than expected...
374846183.author: a TripAdvisor user
374846183.reviewBody: We had a great time here, and it was reasonable, only about $105 USD in May of 2016. The staff was great, and the Dolfins did not disappoint, amazing creatures. Fun for all, at a fair price.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

372449187.name: Amazing Experience!!
372449187.author: a TripAdvisor user
372449187.reviewBody: I was hesitant on booking the dolphin experience and did not know if I wanted to actually have the dolphins push my feet so I went into the air. I must say that the staff and trainers at Delfiniti made me feel at ease from the minute I got there.  I am in my 50\'s and not the thinnest of people so I did not know how comfortable I would be in the water with the dolphins.  When I finally went in the water with them and started to interact with them I couldn\'t get enough.  I was in awe of these animals and how smart they are.  I was able to feed them and they took me for a ride on their belly.  I even did the foot push and LOVED IT!!.  The experience lasted about an hour and then we spent the extra money for the video ($88.00 US).  A bit on the costly side but a once in a life time experience.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

368953922.name: Fun once
368953922.author: a TripAdvisor user
368953922.reviewBody: OK, I can say that I have spent time with the dolphins, check it off the bucket list. Do the minimum offering and get a photo for your memory chest !

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

367012097.name: Did a family swim with dolphins
367012097.author: a TripAdvisor user
367012097.reviewBody: Having visited Sea World as a child, I was extremely moved by the experience and now spend my life working for and in the environmental movement and do coastal cleanups with my kids, etc, but now I don\'t think I can bring my own kids to SeaWorld to have that experience. I was hesitant about this place, but I wanted my kids to have a similar experience. Delphinity is small scale, focused on dolphins only, they have dedicated trainers, and don\'t perform for large audiences.  I took the trade-off and we had a wonderful experience.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

366106964.name: do not let to visit
366106964.author: a TripAdvisor user
366106964.reviewBody: If you go to Ixtapa you must visit this place! They take care of the dolphins like no one others delfinarios in the world, the experience is perfect for the family and kids!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

362807057.name: Awesome time with dolfins
362807057.author: a TripAdvisor user
362807057.reviewBody: Trainers were great, gave clear instructions. Dolfins were gentle and amazing. Bring a credit card because they get you when it comes to the pictures. We paid 2250 pesos for five pictures and a video of our experience. Granted this only comes along every once in a while. No outside cameras are allowed.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

361163645.name: Great Experience
361163645.author: a TripAdvisor user
361163645.reviewBody: My daughter has been hounding me for a dolphin experience. This was a very well put together experience. She enjoyed it and it was a good amount of time with the dolphins.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

359865105.name: Loved the Dolphins and Foot Push - Bring a towel!
359865105.author: a TripAdvisor user
359865105.reviewBody: We booked the swim with the dolphins on the company\'s website and saved a premium vs booking at our hotel.  My husband paid a minimal fee to watch and got a great show.  The kids and I had a wonderful experience and the foot push was fast and so much fun.  The dolphins were well behaved and the trainers were very caring and knowledgeable.  the only issue we had was after swimming we were hoping to shower off.  There were cold showers but no soap and they had no towels.  You couldn\'t even rent towels (you could buy them from the gift shop).  One of the other customers lent my girls a towel which was great as they were freezing and we were not going back to the hotel.  Overall a wonderful experience!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

357156046.name: A Wonderful Dolphin Close Encounter!
357156046.author: a TripAdvisor user
357156046.reviewBody:
My wife and I had a fabulous Swim with the Dolphins Experience with Delfiniti while on our vacation in Ixtapa!

The program was very professional with excellent friendly trainers making our experience as enjoyable as possible. It definitely was one of the major highlights of our trip.

I would certainly recommend adding this experience into your travel plans and budget. It is certainly worth every penny and will leave you with memories that will last a lifetime!

For more detailed information and photos, be sure to visit My Travel Blog at Gr8TravelTips.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

356402300.name: loads of fun
356402300.author: a TripAdvisor user
356402300.reviewBody: swimming with the dolphins was a blast. riding on their stomachs, hugging them, then being pushed thru the water like superman was such a thrill. Kids LOVED it. Pictures and video offer after the experience was very pricey and taking your own pictures was not allowed. That was disappointing.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

356080736.name: Swimming with dolphins
356080736.author: a TripAdvisor user
356080736.reviewBody: Swimming with the dolphins was fun! It was kind of sad, however. There was algae along the walls of the aquarium, dark water, there were marks on the dolphin (could just be from the dolphins fighting or something), and the tank separators to separate the dolphins were so small I felt bad for the dolphins that were confined to such a small area. I wont go back - it was an experience, though. Just not for me.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

353141790.name: Swim with the dolphins
353141790.author: a TripAdvisor user
353141790.reviewBody: I went with my 2 6 year old boys and they loved it! The dolphin (mia) was so well trained and for this age it was great. They got to take pictures with her give her kisses swim around with her. I saw groups of older kids and adults doing a more involved swim with the dolphins pushing them out of the water, looked like fun, but they kept it very age appropriate for my boys. They were very focused on getting pictures, but it was great. The pics were great too, but a bit expensive, but worth it. My children\'s smile said a thousand words.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

352971547.name: My 8 year old loved it but it has it\'s ups and downs
352971547.author: a TripAdvisor user
352971547.reviewBody:
We recently booked Delfinity through Club Med Discovery Center. I think the price was definitely worth it if you book it for kids 8 and older or for adults. They all seemed to have great time. Dolphins were amazingly trained and tamed. The dolphin instructors were very helpful and making sure everybody had a great time and got what they paid for. In addition they were very gentle with animals. I was glad to see that dolphins looked in good shape and healthy. 
My younger child who was 4 at the time was quite scared so we did not finish our session. So be aware of that if your kid is on a cautious side. 
The one thing that was annoying is that we were not warned in advance by the agency that booked our adventure that we will not be allowed to take any pictures ourselves. That was not allowed because Delfinity has it's own photographers and cameramen that record everything. I am not sure what they were asking for a video of adventure but each photo was $8. 
My last comment relates to the pool water where we swam with dolphins:  even though they kept sweeping the surface of it with a net it still felt very dirty and made me feel filthy for days after words. So if you are a germaphobe this may not be for you.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

351128068.name: Dolphin Dream Realized
351128068.author: a TripAdvisor user
351128068.reviewBody: Except for the few mosquitos (and no bug spray allowed for the safety of the dolphins) this was a dream come true.  The interaction with the Dolphins was such a great experience.  The amount of time we had with the Dolphins was more than I expected :)!  We were with a family group of five of us, so we had our own section of the pool with a dad, mom and baby dolphin all to ourselves.  Must do experience at least once in a lifetime if you can.  Priceless memories.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

351065433.name: Fun times with the dolphins
351065433.author: a TripAdvisor user
351065433.reviewBody: This place was great for everyone... The people who work there are great, and know everything about the dolphins....Everyone who swam with the dolphins loved it!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

345428547.name: Pretty Awesome!
345428547.author: a TripAdvisor user
345428547.reviewBody:
We bought a package online through Expedia for a 30 minute encounter with the dolphins. We needed to call at least two days in advance to secure our reservation. I did that at least a week in advance while we are still in the US using a 1-800 number. They told us to show up 20 minutes before our scheduled time and offered transportation to pick us up, but I declined because we were staying not far from there and decided to walk.
 
When we showed up the receptionist told us that we had a 20 minute encounter with the dolphins. Nowhere on our voucher did it say 30 minutes unfortunately. The 30 minutes was only advertised on the Expedia website. 20 minutes turned out to be enough though.
 
They have a list of things that you have to do before you get in the water like make sure you are not wearing sunscreen, take off any rings and jewelry of any kind. We were wearing sunscreen and had wings that could not come off, so we asked them what to do, they said it was fine. A little contradictory but it was ok.

The actual dolphin encounter was amazing. You literally get to pet dolphins touch them all over and interact with them. They are amazing animals and I will never forget this opportunity. We had been to SeaWorld in the past where are you can't get near these things, so this was a real treat to be swimming with dolphins.
 
The pictures that they sell at the end are not outrageously priced. $8 for each picture it does not matter if they're printed there or if you get them on a CD same price. They offer a HD video for $79.
 
 It was fun, you should check it out.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

344457460.name: Have my own thoughts but our daughter really  wanted to do this.
344457460.author: a TripAdvisor user
344457460.reviewBody: I know there is controversy about dolphins in captivity. I agree. Our daughter really wanted to do this and it was our last year contract at our resort there. Our  daughter in law also took our granddaughter. Yes they make a killing on gauging you on the pictures they take (you are not allowed to take any). First I read many reviews and read the price is cheaper than many other areas people have done it. They charge USA $8.00 a pic. $79. per video. I will start with their experience they loved it. All opinions aside. Was it worth is yes. I believe if you do your research on prices and DO NOT book through your hotel you will def save and be able to spend more on pictures. The people who are out   of Ixtapa and staying at the fancy AI note you can take a bus into Ixtapa and if it\'s late taxi back. The dolphins seem to be well cared for and if you are ab;e to stay for the over 8 swim stay it is an awesome show.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

342449922.name: AWESOME
342449922.author: a TripAdvisor user
342449922.reviewBody: I did the 45-minute tour and swam with the dolphins. It was one of the best experiences of my life. Highly recommend it.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

340997059.name: Best experience
340997059.author: a TripAdvisor user
340997059.reviewBody: The trainers were very helpful and they made the experience a great one!!! My husband does not know how to swim, but the trainers made it so easy for him to participate in all of the activities. It is kid friendly and the dolphins are extremely friendly. The event is about 2 hours, it ends with a show the dolphins and trainers do together.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

340830702.name: Well worth it!
340830702.author: a TripAdvisor user
340830702.reviewBody: Great experience for our 8 and 11 year old, as well as my 68 year old mother. We did the 45 minute adventure. The staff were amazing and made sure we were all comfortable with the Dolphins through the entire process. The Dolphins were friendly and very easy. We also had a spectator and they were very accommodating to him as well.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

340810675.name: Swam and played w Dolphins
340810675.author: a TripAdvisor user
340810675.reviewBody: We traveled there with another couple who had a son who was eight my son was 6 and my daughter was 10. We had the greatest time we played with the dolphins we\'s swim with the dolphins. The people were so nice. My husband had swim with dolphins before and Mexico in Cancun and said this was nothing like that. \nAsk at the hotel for the two different packages. the package we had allowed us to play with the dolphins but not grab the fins and actually swim around with the dolphins. I truly would\'ve wanted to do both.\n Bring money or a credit card because they take some great pictures and they have a cute store

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

338302495.name: Experience the dolphins
338302495.author: a TripAdvisor user
338302495.reviewBody: We have done the swimming with the dolphins experience twice now.  The dolphin trainers seem to really care about their animals but the management of the place is lacking.  I made a reservation twice online and confirmed it through my hotel concierge, but somehow they didn\'t have my reservations.  Also, you can\'t take pictures so be prepared to pay eight dollars per photo.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

334890556.name: Fun swimming with dolphins
334890556.author: a TripAdvisor user
334890556.reviewBody: It was clean and entertaining. They had parrots too. The water was warm and the staff was really helpful and nice. It\'s a good activity while in Ixtapa.
