address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

333292705.name: Swimming with the Dolphins
333292705.author: a TripAdvisor user
333292705.reviewBody: This was a wonderful experience with our Grandchildren.  Unfortunately upon returning home, We became more educated on the environmental impact of this activity...that being said we are now torn about the activity.\nWe were the only family at the facility which seemed clean and well maintained!  Unfortunately it is a money trap!  You are not allowed to take your own pictures, you can only buy theirs.  They take a full video of your entire experience, then pose you with the dolphins to get good shots...NOTE: The dolphins were never harmed, you could not touch them rings had to be removed etc..in other words they did have a huge emphasis on the care and safety of the dolphins!\nAfter about a half hour in thevpool with the dolphins you shower then stand in the geat reviewing 134 stills and a video!! Thanks but no thanks!!!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

332355211.name: Once in a lifetime
332355211.author: a TripAdvisor user
332355211.reviewBody: Lots of people talk about how it is expensive and also that it is not right for the dolphins. Is it expensive, yes. Was it worth it, also yes. As for dolphins in captivity, all I can say is that they were born in captivity and after the experience my 10 year old daughter said it was now important to her to preserve them in the wild. \nGo for the full meal deal and expect it to cost about $175 a head, all in with pics and video. Also expect it to be a once in a lifetime experience!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

331240645.name: Fantastic opportunity to see these amazing animals up close
331240645.author: a TripAdvisor user
331240645.reviewBody: We booked this experience somewhat reluctantly because of our mixed feelings about marine animals in captivity. The bottom line is that these dolphins were bred in captivity and will never be released into the wild, offering us and our 10 yr old the opportunity to learn and appreciate their social and extremely intelligent personalities.\nTake the "plunge" and purchase the top level tour. Standing on the side of the pool is definitely cheaper, but if you are only going to do this once, do it right and get in the water and play. The official photos and video purchase are expensive, but honestly, what tourist attraction anywhere else in the world isn\'t? We will never look at dolphins in the wild the same way again.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

331077939.name: What an experience!
331077939.author: a TripAdvisor user
331077939.reviewBody: Dolphins are just the most amazing creatures, and here you get to swim with them, touch them, interact and even dance and sing with them. The personnel at the front desk and the photo/video team are just not the best in terms of warm service, but they are ok. The trainers though, they really know their business, you can tell they are experts. The animals are in a very good shape, they treat them nicely and with respect.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

315193061.name: Expensive, bring your credit card!!
315193061.author: a TripAdvisor user
315193061.reviewBody: This is a GREAT opportunity to interact with dolphins, we love it!. What we didn\'t love was the price of the pictures, its outrageous! They don\'t let you take picture inside or take your go pro. The cost of the picture was triple what we pay for the entrance!!!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

303691749.name: Expensive and bad!!
303691749.author: a TripAdvisor user
303691749.reviewBody: You think you will have a good opportunity to swim with dolphins and is only toching them and thats it i would not recommend this!!!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

300566883.name: Sad and awful experience!
300566883.author: a TripAdvisor user
300566883.reviewBody: I went there expecting to have an incredible experience with the dolphins. When actually I had an awful experience around 10 dolphins are kept in a small confined swimming pool. These sensitive and highly intelligent animals should be roaming free in the ocean not in a small swimming pool as tourist entertainment. It was so overpriced and the staff were unfriendly. It upsets me to think that these Dolphins have to spent the rest of their lives in a small pool instead of being in the ocean where they belong!!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

295134522.name: Expensive Tourist attraction
295134522.author: a TripAdvisor user
295134522.reviewBody: Located in Ixtapa, the "Dolphinarium" is all about the tourist money and not so much about the dolphins. The dolphin aquariums are super small. Anyone in your party not paying to get in the water with the dolphins will need to pay to see you get in the water. The aquarium water was not clean at all.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

288690454.name: Amazing Experience
288690454.author: a TripAdvisor user
288690454.reviewBody: What an incredible opportunity to get up close and personal with these beautiful Dolphins.  They are amazing and intelligent creatures and Delfiniti does an excellent job of creating a safe environment for people of all ages to actual get in the water and interact with these incredible animals. It also appears they do take wonderful care of the dolphins and seem to focus on their health and safety which is extremely important!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

284910324.name: Adrenalix experience
284910324.author: a TripAdvisor user
284910324.reviewBody: Try and book on your own than through hotel for better price.  Discovered how much "tourist price" was paid when speaking with other participants.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

281419729.name: OK OK
281419729.author: a TripAdvisor user
281419729.reviewBody: Although the experience is good, I really wish it was cheaper. The pool is of course just ok size wise . No clicking or shooting is a major drawback. If I want to carry that experience with me in my camera, why not. Its not gonna ruin your show. If only they were priced more reasonably, more tourists would visit.\n Anyhow, the handlers were good and managed everything perfectly. The show was wonderful... My family of 5 with a toddler as well as a 60 yr old granddad.. all had fun.\n

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

280029155.name: Nadar con Delfiniti (Swimming with the Dolphins) \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd
280029155.author: a TripAdvisor user
280029155.reviewBody: Like most reviews, the Dolphin experience is costly all in (including the $79 video and $8 per picture and $124/pp)- BUT the experience itself is priceless (and cheaper compared to Hawaii and Cancun). We opted for the 45- minute experience and were paired with another young sibiling couple. The dolphins are such gentle creatures and gave us their undivided attention (they were bribed with lots of fishes and squid). Besides being in the water with them, petting them and watching them up and close and personal, we got to swim with them, and they also propelled us into the air with their noses (pretty awesome!). This is a must if you are in Ixtapa and while many may think its just for kids or for tourist, the BIG 6\'5 hubby rather enjoyed himself as well.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

274680140.name: A fantastic family time
274680140.author: a TripAdvisor user
274680140.reviewBody: This is the second time we went here my children LOVED it so much my husband and children were so happy !!!! A never forget experience !!!!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

266504954.name: Was fun.
266504954.author: a TripAdvisor user
266504954.reviewBody: I do not like to see animals in captivity. However I could hear the show regularly being next door. So we checked it out, just pay there, do not go through the westjet guys. Its cheap, and I think the dolphins are like the puppies of the ocean and they are bonded with their trainers.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

266045065.name: If you\'ve never swam with Dolphins..... DO IT!
266045065.author: a TripAdvisor user
266045065.reviewBody: I was with a friend and she convinced me to do it after some time. I thought it would be cheesy and super touristy. Although it is touristy it was alot of fun, a cool experience with some amazing animals. The experience is worth it entirley.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

264039304.name: WOW
264039304.author: a TripAdvisor user
264039304.reviewBody: Such an awesome experienced to really interact with dolphins! It was cheaper than we\'ve seen in several other places. Downside is the pictures are $8 a piece or like $80 for a full video, but the experience was worth it!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

258568212.name: Very good show! Worth going
258568212.author: a TripAdvisor user
258568212.reviewBody: Our daughters just loved it. Inexpensive for the quality of the show. Never been to these kind of places becore but I feel that due to the small size of the place, you get a closer experience with the daulphins.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

256366957.name: My highlite of trip
256366957.author: a TripAdvisor user
256366957.reviewBody:
While I do not approve of dolphin captivity, I couldn't resist a swim with them...a once in a lifetime opportunity for me.  
They did not have my reservation on record although I booked online.  I had to pay again, but when I got home I had to double check that I wasn't charged twice (thankfully not).
Photos are taken with birds and the dolphins to be bought later.  No hard selling, but prices are high.  $8 USD per photo or $79 USD per DVD.  No photos or cameras are to be in the dolphin area.
We had a fun time overall.  I would have liked more interaction and swimming with the dolphins though instead of the talking or the tricks.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

255078741.name: Great memories, but at a price!
255078741.author: a TripAdvisor user
255078741.reviewBody:
My husband and I swam with dolphins here 6 years ago and had a wonderful time (but spent about $350 for 2 adults and 7 pictures). At that time I would have given it 4 stars, not 5 only because of the price. I do think its too high.

We returned with our 5 year old son for him to experience it. The childrens program isn't the greatest, especially for babies. Not worth the money for the 20 min or less time in the pool (adults get 45). We did get some great pics and overall our son had a blast, but I would not return to do this again until he can do the adult show. The foot push is the highlight and its only available in the adult program. $125 US for 20 min in the pool was a bit of a disappointment considering he enjoyed the 10 peso city bus ride better....

Watch out, you are not allowed your own camera and pictures are $8 USD each.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

252836903.name: Very interesting attraction
252836903.author: a TripAdvisor user
252836903.reviewBody: For people who have wanted for a long time to swim with the dolphins, this a safe and friendly place to realize your dreams.\nAlso the show put up by the dolphins after the quiet swimming is spectacular.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

252783942.name: Amazing
252783942.author: a TripAdvisor user
252783942.reviewBody: Once in a lifetime experience! Beautiful friendly animals, excelent show, and a great service from the staff. \nLoved it!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

252752818.name: Memories
252752818.author: a TripAdvisor user
252752818.reviewBody: I think it is a good place for a photo op with young kids, but of course it isn\'t cheap, but if it is a one time thing it makes good memories.  They charge $8 US for a photo, and $79 US for video.  You can\'t take your own photos.  There are lockers with a key that you keep to store your valuables.  Good staff

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

252320970.name: Better then Cabo
252320970.author: a TripAdvisor user
252320970.reviewBody: More interaction then in Cabo, but the picture prices will gouge you. Delfiniti is will give discounts for groups,so ASK!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

251497895.name: Best dolphin experience
251497895.author: a TripAdvisor user
251497895.reviewBody: The staff was very friendly and did not rush us at all. Spent alot of time with the dolphins and then they put on a up and close show

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

250007305.name: Great place for the whole family
250007305.author: a TripAdvisor user
250007305.reviewBody: Fun afternoon, It was my kids favorite thing in the whole trip!  we bought the whole package of pics and video to remember

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

247079439.name: fun to swim with dolphins
247079439.author: a TripAdvisor user
247079439.reviewBody: Opportunity to swim with the dolphins.  It cost a significant amount, but did get multiple chances to interact with the dolphins.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

247035365.name: Extra layer of service
247035365.author: a TripAdvisor user
247035365.reviewBody: Super accommodating for a last-minute visit, some confused visitors, and even an extended splash in the pool.\nWe arrived late for a last-minute booking due to a wrong turn on the beach (don\'t ask). But they still let us in, and even extended our visit after the rest of the group had left, to pet and feed the dolphins. Most accommodating!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

245026253.name: Great, up to a point.
245026253.author: a TripAdvisor user
245026253.reviewBody: The actual swimming with the dolphins is an experience that you will never forget. The price is a little high. The only problem that I had is the fact that I make pretty good pictures myself but was not allowed to because you have to buy photos at an exhorbitant price from the photographers on staff. Great time but my kids and I will not be back. The optional " do you have photos to add" on this page should be deleted cos you can\'t take any.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

241148345.name: Fun At Delfiniti
241148345.author: a TripAdvisor user
241148345.reviewBody: The experience was amazing and we swam with the dolphins for about an hour which was a good time. The dolphins did the belly ride and the foot push which was such a thrill. I hugged and kissed the dolphins. We definitely recommend.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

240322504.name: Memory for a Lifetime
240322504.author: a TripAdvisor user
240322504.reviewBody: Our 10 & 12 year old will cherish the memory for their lifetime. Yes they are captive dolphins raised in small enclosures but I\'ve been around animals all my life and I know when they are happy. The dolphins were super happy "working" with the kids. Like any intelligent animal they need to be kept working and challenged. We loved watching the kids in with them. We were very glad we did it. Just be prepared for the video & picture sales at the end as you are NOT ALLOWED to take photos during the time in the water. Just buy the video and you\'ll have something you can watch for years to come. The staff was excellent and super helpful. So glad we did it.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

233523122.name: VIP Treatment
233523122.author: a TripAdvisor user
233523122.reviewBody: My fianc\u00e9 and I made arrangements for a 45 minute encounter through the Viceroy hotel. We arrived and waited. When the previous group ran late, the dolphinarium sent additional staff to distract us with a lynx (a medium sized wild cat with tall ears) and colorful parrots.  When the 45 minute event began, we were escorted into the pools where we were introduced to two dolphins. Other dolphins were in the same tank as well as other tanks near bye.  The trainer explained to us how one of the two dolphins was actually born there, so unlike other dolphinariums, these dolphins are not collected in bloody collection processes as shown in some of the horrific documentaries that are quite popular right now. He introduced us to the dolphin\'s mother and father.  They had the dolphin do tricks and planned interactions with us while we were in the tank.  After the first 25 minutes, we got out of the first pool and climbed into the main show pool where two of the more mature dolphins engaged us in actual stunts.  Both my girlfriend and I had the pleasure of being lifted out of the water as the dolphins pressed their noses simultaneously into the bottoms of our feet and propelled us upward.  We were given the opportunity to hold onto the dolphin\'s fins and be pulled through the water, and after all of this, we were given a private show while our feet dangled in the water and the trainer took the dolphins through all the regular show stunts that people usually watch only from the stands.  My fianc\u00e9 and I were able to watch as another family who only got the 25 minute experience interacted with dolphins from the edge of the pool on a platform, and we realized how lucky we were to opt for the longer experience. We were treated like VIPs from the very first moment to the end.  We are very impressed.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

231875419.name: Sky high pricing with little compensations
231875419.author: a TripAdvisor user
231875419.reviewBody: 1. The presentation is very poor for the entry price you pay per person.\n2. They don\'t allow the visitors to take pics, cuz the establishment has their own photo team.\n3. The pricing for the photos are very abusive for poor composite pics.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

226420171.name: Fun, Fun and more Fun
226420171.author: a TripAdvisor user
226420171.reviewBody: This excursion was one of the best we went to in Ixtapa. Here is your chance to be close to Dolphins and watch how they interact with a crowd of adults and gleeful young\'uns.  Bring a towel and bathing suit. You will be provided a life jacket, good instructions and a never to forget experience. The staff will take lots of photos of you, your family and everyone else. I cannot say enough good about the event and the trainers as they work with tourists and dolphins. Listen to the trainers and the time with the Dolphins will only whet your appetite for more. I have only one criticism for the attraction. It is a gosh awful pain to figure out where and how to get and pay for pictures of you and your family having the experience. There are display screens flashing photos all over the entry and you have to watch to see which monitor your family shows up on. Then a numbering system for ordering certain pics is needed. When you get all of this down, find a young attendant to fill out the order form.  The photos are very pricey so limit the amount you choose. Next, the counter to pay.Then, wait, wait and wait some more. Make it fun and affordable.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

219834780.name: Swam with the dolphins
219834780.author: a TripAdvisor user
219834780.reviewBody: My oldest daughter, her husband and the two grandkids swam with the dolphins.  The kids enjoyed it.  The youngest (4 Years old) was a little intimidated by the dolphins.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

218272676.name: Amazing
218272676.author: a TripAdvisor user
218272676.reviewBody: It was so much fun! My friends and I enjoyed it very much. I felt in love with the dolphins and it really looks like they are such in good hands. We had a great time and everyone was so funny and kind.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

217315086.name: I loved getting to interact with dolphins!
217315086.author: a TripAdvisor user
217315086.reviewBody: I have been here once before so this time I got to watch my 10 year old daughter interact and enjoy the dolphins, it did not disappoint!  The trainers all seemed very kind and were great with both the humans and the dolphins.  The whole experience was pretty magical and I am so glad I went and watched her interact with one of my favorite animals of all time!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

207974306.name: docile creatures
207974306.author: a TripAdvisor user
207974306.reviewBody: although this wonderful experience was back in 2004, it will always be like yesterday ..  in all my travels i\'ve never had the opportunity to swim with dolphins in the open sea.. it\'s the best excursion ever!!!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

203537100.name: Absolutely horrible, extremely over charged, ripped off
203537100.author: a TripAdvisor user
203537100.reviewBody:
My daughter and I went but we were charged for 3 people, we were charged 367.82
We got 4 (4x6) pictures and a video, they charged us $134.56
So horrified when we returned home!!!  
KEEP YOUR RECIEPTS

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

202316399.name: Expensive for what it is
202316399.author: a TripAdvisor user
202316399.reviewBody: Myself and my 8 year old did the Adrenalix package. It was good fun and we really enjoyed it. However the area that the dolphins are kept in is quite small and limited space. I have swam with dolphins in the Bahamas before and felt the dolphins were kept in much nicer pools.\nWe did the foot push and pulled by them. But it seemed it was more about taking photos so they can try to sell photos to you at the end. They claim to have a 20 min show at the end but there was no way the show was 20 mins. We had the photos put onto a CD and these were ok priced.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

199573697.name: Swimming with the dolphins
199573697.author: a TripAdvisor user
199573697.reviewBody: To experience the dolphins up close and personal was great, but the kids said it the best when they were asked what they liked. "The staff did not force the dolphins to work if they did not want too."

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

199518735.name: Great time for all ages!
199518735.author: a TripAdvisor user
199518735.reviewBody: My husband and I took our teenage girls and my mom to Delfiniti and it was magical. The girls absolutely loved the adventure, the dolphins, and my mom was smiling the whole time. My husband and I were equally amazed with Chacho and his brother. They are so gentle and amazing to be around. Well worth every penny. We bought photos and my mom ended up buying the video (which is overpriced, but a nice memory). \n\nLoved it and we recommend it to anyone!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

196540354.name: Great experience!
196540354.author: a TripAdvisor user
196540354.reviewBody: Great experience, I did it with my kid and wife and was great to be there! The time is short, and is expensive, but is one of those things that you must invest money on it, is not an expense is an investment. Do it!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

193673556.name: Very nice
193673556.author: a TripAdvisor user
193673556.reviewBody: The trainers were kind and fun and put even the shyest at ease.  The dolphins look healthy and well cared for.  The experience was fun and certainly worth the money.   What we did not appreciate was being watched constantly to make sure we would not pull out a camera as no pictures are allowed to be taken, not even of the dolphins themselves or of the dolphin show.  They then charge $8 per picture they took or $100 canadian for a 20 minute tape of part of the experience and part of the show.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

192743781.name: Do your homework before going-we should have
192743781.author: a TripAdvisor user
192743781.reviewBody:
Not sure why this has become the number three attraction in Ixtapa. It shouldn't be on the list. Although our children enjoyed this when we went (and why this rated a "poor" and not a "terrible") we felt very uncomfortable with our decision and certainly would never return.  The space for the dolphins seems very small and I worried about how well the dolphins are looked after. Certainly the way Delfiniti treated their other charges (chained up for another expensive photo op) suggests what the motivation is and it isn't about animal welfare or educating us. 

I have no idea how other reviewers can sense the "happiness" of the dolphins….its possible the dolphins are happy in captivity and being treated like pets but its also possible that this is wishful thinking…dolphin's snouts make them look like they are smiling. Doubt that is a reflection of how happy they are.

This is a very expensive outing (lots of extras and, as other reviews have found, some misrepresentations around what you get) and I didn't feel good about supporting this enterprise (unfortunately I did my homework after the fact). By going to Definiti we felt we were ensuring that dolphins would continue to be captured from the wild.  The "dolphin encounter" industry is not well regulated and dolphin deaths (and visitor injuries) are underreported (especially outside the US). Consider the fact that Sea World, one of the most recognized captive dolphin facilities in the U.S, reported 93 dolphin deaths between 1971 and 2002. That's an average of three dolphins per year, assuming that all dolphin deaths were accounted for. These animals are replaced with other captured dolphins. How they go about obtaining dolphins for places like Sea World or Delfiniti is also a concern. No idea on the stats for Delfiniti around dolphin deaths or visitor injuries but if this occurs at Sea World in the US what is happening in a smaller place in Mexico? 

Suggest a pass on this.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

191889356.name: Rip off
191889356.author: a TripAdvisor user
191889356.reviewBody: They won\'t let you take pictures, obviously because they want to sell you theirs at 10$ each... They charge 160$ to swim with dolphins, it is overpriced, I did the same in cuba for 60$ !

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

191840453.name: My second time
191840453.author: a TripAdvisor user
191840453.reviewBody: It was amazing, It was the first time 4 years ago too.  Its pricey and they get ya on not letting you take photos and having to buy theirs.. also very pricey but man...it is a thrill and a must!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

190946042.name: so/so
190946042.author: a TripAdvisor user
190946042.reviewBody: it is allright but not in the same quality as the other dolphin places in mexico , its small and more costly and you cant take pictures when viewing

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

190057489.name: Wonderful experience for kids and adults
190057489.author: a TripAdvisor user
190057489.reviewBody: Our group went to swim with the dolphins.  4 kids swam and 6 adults watched.  All the kids had a wonderful experience and have been talking about it ever since.  The age of the kids ranged from 9 - 15 and all enjoyed it equally.  All of the adults also totally enjoyed watching the kids.  It is a great time and something that everyone should be able to experience.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

188168306.name: Animal Cruelty?
188168306.author: a TripAdvisor user
188168306.reviewBody: They have 10 dolphins kept in two very small pools for the amusement of tourists. These highly intelligent and sensitive animals belong in the open seas. I refused to pay for their perfomances and would encourage others to do the same.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

187164328.name: Swimming with dolphins
187164328.author: a TripAdvisor user
187164328.reviewBody: Imagine wet velvety skin, big toothy grins, and flying across the water like Superman. An experience that is unforgettable!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

185397216.name: My Dolphin Swim Experience
185397216.author: a TripAdvisor user
185397216.reviewBody:
Delfiniti is amazing. I was gifted a dolphin swimming excursion by a friend that no longer wanted to use it for herself. This is a pricey excursion, but certainly worth every dime. 

Those who know me, know that I am not a good swimmer by any stretch of the imagination, but my roommate convinced me to try and do it anyway because they provide life vests. And it was after all, a gift that I did not want to waste. I am so very happy that I went through with it because it was an awesome experience!

I stayed closer to the platform near the end of the pool, and the dolphin trainers where completely accommodating. They sent the dolphins over to me, and worked to make sure that the experience was an awesome one. They were personable and just exciting to be around. 

I would definitely do this again...Well worth it.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

177719686.name: Amazing experience!!!
177719686.author: a TripAdvisor user
177719686.reviewBody:
It was a dream come true to swim with the dolphins!!
We chose the 2nd option (swimming with them) that is a little bit more expensive than just meeting them but it was worth it!!!
We hang out with them almost 1 hour and in the end there's a show you can just sit and watch!
The trainers were really nice, funny and polite to us!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

172298486.name: Pricey, but good experience
172298486.author: a TripAdvisor user
172298486.reviewBody: THe kids will never forget the experience they had up close and  personal with the trained dolphins.  Now, the organization wants to get you there early to take pictures with a baby leopard and birds ($$).  They will not allow photos of the bird or jaguar.  If you don\'t want to see animals manipulated, it\'s not for you.  Yet, the show that was put on was better than the Dolphin show at sea world. If you have the funds do it!  Your kids will talk about it forever.  They did the show with 6 year olds to 40 year olds.  You have to pay to simply observe, so not cheap.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

170948859.name: What a lifetime experience
170948859.author: a TripAdvisor user
170948859.reviewBody: What a great experience for the kid in you at any age. They seem to take great care of the dolphins. A little expensive for the full experience but well worth spending about an hour and a half in the water with them.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

170319644.name: Swimming with dolphins
170319644.author: a TripAdvisor user
170319644.reviewBody: My son had an EXTREMELY good time swimming with the dolphins!  It is pricey, but looks to be cheaper if you book your appointment with Delfiniti directly instead of through your hotel excursion desk.  If you don\'t swim they still charge you to sit there for the \'show\'.  Mostly it is just watching your kids/adults interact with the dolphins, but there are some trick performed.  It is about $20 to just sit & watch.  Sorry to say, you can\'t take any pictures ~ you must purchase from Delfiniti for around $8 each.  They will take US$ or credit cards or pesos.  The dolphins appear happy, healthy & well fed ~ lots of fresh fish treats given & happily consumed.  :)  Easy to have a taxi take you there.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

169434725.name: Swim with Dolphins?
169434725.author: a TripAdvisor user
169434725.reviewBody: It was a wonderful experience that everyone should try once. I know, Dolphins in a very large pool may seem cruel and going here may seem to encourage their captivity but it was a blast.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

167402830.name: Amazing experience swimming with the dolphins
167402830.author: a TripAdvisor user
167402830.reviewBody: Visited Delfiniti in our trip to Ixtapa last week. It was an amazing experience to swim and interact with the Dolphins. It is better to choose the package were you can hold them and interact more with them. The trainers are experienced and make the visit very funny. The pictures are pricey, almost $10 each..

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

164022346.name: Excellent
164022346.author: a TripAdvisor user
164022346.reviewBody: This was an amazing experience.  We spent 45 minutes swimming, hugging, kissing, feeding these amazing mammals with a guide who was very entertaining.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

160755465.name: Best Birthday present!
160755465.author: a TripAdvisor user
160755465.reviewBody: What can beat having dolphins sing Happy Birthday to my son\'s best friend for his 8th birthday! Priceless!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

158235443.name: Our Dolphin Experience
158235443.author: a TripAdvisor user
158235443.reviewBody:
We took a cab from our resort to Delfinit.  Make sure you make a reservation ahead of time. They have lockers but try not to bring to much as the lockers only hold one beach-bag worth of stuff.

The staff are all extremely friendly and knowledgeable.  They were very engaging with our children and spoke multiple languages.

Photo's for purchase are extremely reasonably priced.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

155620572.name: delfiniti is a great experience with a friendly and very , very polite and professional team
155620572.author: a TripAdvisor user
155620572.reviewBody:
delfiniti is a great experience that i never forget. the team is extemely polite and friendly. they all helped my wife that  she's  very, very scared by water.
 my wife got his own goal to get in touch with dolfins, she always loved to make it, but she could't get becouse of his deep scare by water.she get it, finally, and enjoyed this unforgettable experience.
luigi turchi patrizia pirini 
cesena italy

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

155015314.name: An Amazing Day!
155015314.author: a TripAdvisor user
155015314.reviewBody: If you\'ve ever wanted to spend time with dolphins this is the place. I had an amazing day and would do it again. The staff were great and the dolphins were more fun than you\'d expect. It\'s right on the beach so it\'s not far from most Ixtapa hotels. Only thing I didn\'t like was the $8 per photo and you can\'t take your own camera.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

154889072.name: Expensive - but fun
154889072.author: a TripAdvisor user
154889072.reviewBody:
The dolphins appeared well cared for and we had a great time. The people answered ALL of the kids questions!

 They did charge $8 per picture - no cameras allowed.  And they wanted $79 for the video - too much for us!  

One thing we did find very upsetting - they had a lion cub there on a chain for people to take pictures ($$) with, the lion was not happy to be there and it seemed very inhumane.  Our kids (and us too!) were quite upset by that.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

153537641.name: Amazing dolphins
153537641.author: a TripAdvisor user
153537641.reviewBody: I was pleased to see they appeared well-treated and happy.  The kids and my wife loved being in the water.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

152994247.name: First time and loved it!
152994247.author: a TripAdvisor user
152994247.reviewBody: My 12 and 9 year old boys did the full experience and didn\'t stop smiling and laughing the entire 45 minutes with the dolphins. My wife and I did the family experience with our 2 year old and was blown away on how amazing and gentle the dolphins were. Staff was great and you could tell they really love and took great care of the dolphins. BTW you might see a lion cub there. That was a surprise at a dolphin excursion. Highly recommend it

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

152889321.name: What a great opportunity!!
152889321.author: a TripAdvisor user
152889321.reviewBody:
We have two animal-loving kids, & this was one of the most amazing things we've ever done.  First of all, they had a REAL baby lion there, on loan from the zoo, to pet & sit for pictures with.  Wow!  Second, the dolphins are incredible: apparently well-loved & cared for, well-trained, & so, so cool.  We've never done anything like this before--maybe the ones in the states allow for similar experiences--but we couldn't believe they let us swim with, pet, hug, kiss, feed, & even (if you're eight or above) surf on the backs of dolphins!  The dolphins put on a show for us & the trainers answered all of our dolphin-related questions. 

It was expensive: our family of four did the "family experience" for parents & kids under 8, & it cost around $300 (yikes), plus the price of pictures they took & sold us at the end.  (They won't let you take your own pics, but they take tons & have them for sale for $8 apiece at the end.)

Our particular trainer was a bit grouchy, but everybody else seemed super friendly.  The place was clean & well-run, & all in all, in spite of the shocking price, totally worth it for the experience & the memory.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

152630308.name: smile from ear to ear
152630308.author: a TripAdvisor user
152630308.reviewBody: I\'ve done this before and enjoyed it so much, I did it again. Both on valentines day. I\'m a huge animal lover and would love having this job :)

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

152500521.name: A little pricey, but you can negotiate
152500521.author: a TripAdvisor user
152500521.reviewBody: I\'d heard bad things about this place, but I tried it last year and was pleasantly surprised. It was a wonderful experience - and the dolphins looked/seemed very happy.   Worth the price - although high - but if you get a group you can often negotiate a "group" rate.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

151754644.name: This just shouldn\'t be
151754644.author: a TripAdvisor user
151754644.reviewBody: My son loves dolphins so I took him and now that I have seen this in person, I have to say I just can\'t support having dolphins in a pool like this.  It just is not right.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

151681874.name: Well worth it!
151681874.author: a TripAdvisor user
151681874.reviewBody: Fantastic opportunity to be in the water with these beautiful creatures! They do a great job of making you feel welcome and comfortable with the dolphins.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

151307100.name: dolphins
151307100.author: a TripAdvisor user
151307100.reviewBody: wonderful experience swimming with the dolphins.  you will get wet if you are just watching your party swim with the dolphins as the dolphins like to splash the spectators but that is part of the charm of this wonderful experience.  the parrot experience at the start of the program was fun and the pictures with the parrot were a fun experience for the youngsters in our group.  watching the interaction of the dophins with the visitors and trainers was wonderful and a must see when you are in Ixtapa.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

150458518.name: Your kids will love it!
150458518.author: a TripAdvisor user
150458518.reviewBody: Took our 3 year old to Delfiniti. He loved it! The dolphin we met was beautiful, gentle & so smart. It was a great time. They will not let you go if you are over 4\nMonths pregnant and don\'t tell you this before you pay so just be aware. My husband went instead so it worked out fine for us anyway.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

150367393.name: So much fun!!
150367393.author: a TripAdvisor user
150367393.reviewBody: My first experience swimming with dolphins, and it was fantastic! Delfiniti is a short taxi ride from Zihuatanejo. A trip to Delfiniti is definitely worth tearing yourself away from the beach. The staff is so helpful and friendly (English speaking of course). Before you enter the pool, they walk you through exactly what to expect and what to do. They give clear instructions while you\'re in the pool. The facility is clean and state of the art. And the dolphins are magical! It\'s just a wonderful experience not to be missed while you\'re in the area! We did make the mistake of walking around Ixtapa looking for a place to eat before we headed back to Zihuatanejo, because we hadn\'t been to Ixtapa before. I would suggest just heading back to Zihuatanejo. The restaurants we found were super touristy. We chose the best one of the bunch, but the meal was average at best, and the sound of the pounding waves was grating after a while. The waves in Ixtapa are much stronger than they are in Zihua. The beaches in Zihua are more peaceful, enjoyable and relaxing.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

149887665.name: Like big Labrador puppies but way smarter...
149887665.author: a TripAdvisor user
149887665.reviewBody: An experience you\'ll never forget. They are  so beautiful and gentle despite their incredible power. It\'s disappointing not being able to take amature pictures but they rely on this for income so forget your cameras and I phones. They are diligent!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

149221796.name: Delfiniti
149221796.author: a TripAdvisor user
149221796.reviewBody: Great experience, not good if you think you want to take photos.  They don\'t let you take your own pictures.  You have to buy them.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

148725449.name: Great experience for our whole family!
148725449.author: a TripAdvisor user
148725449.reviewBody: This was an awesome experience.  There were 6 of our family in the pool with the dolphins and we thoroughly enjoyed it!  We were somewhat disappointed though that family members watching could not take pictures after we paid a hefty amount for all of us to participate.  Also, you can "purchase" pictures at the end and with the amount you spend to swim with the dolphins I would expect at least one picture is included in your fee - especially if you can\'t take your own pictures.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

148656691.name: amazing
148656691.author: a TripAdvisor user
148656691.reviewBody: My 6 year old son was completely floored.  He will remember his time with the dolphins forever.  Well worth the money.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

147634554.name: Once in a lifetime experience
147634554.author: a TripAdvisor user
147634554.reviewBody: Spent an hour with the dolphins.  Truly a magical experience to interact with such beautiful animals.....something touches you soul when you look into their eyes.  Highlight of our trip.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

147577287.name: Swim with Dolphins
147577287.author: a TripAdvisor user
147577287.reviewBody: It was fun to swim with the dolphins and watch them jump out of the water and do flips, they also had birds that you could get your picture taken with. It looks like the dolphins are being cared for, feed and exercised.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

147518487.name: Dolphins
147518487.author: a TripAdvisor user
147518487.reviewBody: Very fun! Short walk from our hotel in Ixtapa. Worth the price to swim and interact with the dolphins. Staff was great as well.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

142864095.name: Outstanding
142864095.author: a TripAdvisor user
142864095.reviewBody: My son\'s Favorite Phrase is now "Oscar is soooo Crazy" The trainers were as entertaining as the Birds and Dolphins. Can\'t wait to return and see if Carmelo has taken up Basketball.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

139858492.name: Either closed for renovations or closed hopefully for good
139858492.author: a TripAdvisor user
139858492.reviewBody: Do not patronize places like this.  When are we going to stop capturing and exploiting animals just for fun???  I don\'t know what happened to this place but it didn\'t look open when we walked by.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

139701606.name: Fun with dolphins
139701606.author: a TripAdvisor user
139701606.reviewBody: The staff and trainers are very caring, and the dolphins seem to be very happy and playful. We love animals and are especially sensitive to those that are mistreated.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

138925493.name: Awesome Dolphin experience!
138925493.author: a TripAdvisor user
138925493.reviewBody: Way better than any other "Swim with Dolphins" experience we\'ve tried.  The dolphins are very happy and seem to love what they\'re doing.  Pay for the full package, including the ride and the "push" -- you won\'t regret it!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

137811789.name: Definitely swim with the dolphins
137811789.author: a TripAdvisor user
137811789.reviewBody: It was money (a lot of money!) well spent!  Kids loved it, we loved it.  It was an Ixtapa Highlight, for sure.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

137216072.name: very pleasant experience, very nice time to spend with kids specially
137216072.author: a TripAdvisor user
137216072.reviewBody: i like everything during this tour, the time we spend there, the transportation, everything...specially the dolphins\n\n

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

136436648.name: Dolphin encounter
136436648.author: a TripAdvisor user
136436648.reviewBody: One visit my good friend and I swam with the dolphins for our bucket list and this year my kids and grandchildren came and swam with the dolphins also. It was my grandaughter\'s favorite part of the trip. It is a great opportunity to be  upclose and personal with the dolphins and a great opportunity to see a dolphin show firsthand. The staff are very informative and teach as well as demonstrate what the dolphins are capable of doing. We all learned a lot and had a great time. It is a little pricey ,but well worth it. We did the dolphin encounter rather than the actual swim because of cost and it was great. We were in the water with the dolphins for at least a half hour and the entire experience lasted at least 1 hour. So worth it.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

136148789.name: A great experience
136148789.author: a TripAdvisor user
136148789.reviewBody: We had a wonderful time with the Family Program first (our 1 year old son loved the interaction with the dolphins) and then the swim with the dolphins afterwards. It was super fun and a dream come true. I strongly recommend it!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

134452526.name: Wonderful experience with the dolphins
134452526.author: a TripAdvisor user
134452526.reviewBody: The 25 mins experience was amazing as it allowed us to swim with the dolphins, kiss, hug, and feel what they are like.  The dolphins are very gentle and responds well to the trainers\' commands.  It is simply delightful being up close to these wonderful creatures.\n\nSuggestion for Delfiniti to get better video equipment and a videographer as the DVD we purchased was of poor quality.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

133587950.name: Delfiniti Ixtapa June 2012
133587950.author: a TripAdvisor user
133587950.reviewBody: Do this!  However, be prepared to spend too much on pictures.  Swimming with the dolphins was an amazing experience, the staff was having so much fun themselves, you can tell they really love these creatures.  You have so much freedom in the water to pet and swim and play. Very rewarding experience.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

133515220.name: Great experience!
133515220.author: a TripAdvisor user
133515220.reviewBody: If you can swing it, do the Delfiniti swim with the dolphins.  All 4 of us went, it was 1500 pesos each.  An absolute blast and a memory you\'ll have forever.  We were concerned about having to take a cab (from Club Med) to and from the excursion.  You needn\'t be.  It was fine.  Our cab driver even waited around for us to be finished to take us back.  He gave us his card too.  It was very professional and safe.  \nAs for the dolphins, you\'re in the water with them for around an hour.  They swim all around you and like your touches.  You get to ride on their belly while they swim on their back.  You get to hug and dance with one.  And the grand finale two of them push your feet and you ride their noses across the pool, really fun.  They end with a bunch of acrobatics.  The pictures are a bit pricey ($8 each, I suggest buying the DVD at $79 since there are no cameras allowed there).  We talked to a neighbor who did the dolphin experience at Sea World and said you barely got to touch the animals (for $50).  This is an absolute steal at $120-150 compared to that.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

133374881.name: Kids liked it
133374881.author: a TripAdvisor user
133374881.reviewBody: Staff friendly and experience is nice. You are not allowed to take pictures

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

132859932.name: The video has no audi but like cheesy porno music
132859932.author: a TripAdvisor user
132859932.reviewBody: Great experience.  Kids loved it!  BUT when we got home and loaded up the video we paid $89 dollars for.  That\'s right...$89, it had not the audio of the event - kids talking or sounds of dolphins, but it was dubbed over with this really awful and incredibly cheesy elevator/dentist/porno music.  Major disappointment.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

131674915.name: Swim with dolphins
131674915.author: a TripAdvisor user
131674915.reviewBody: Took 20 minute tour and that was plenty of time to interact with dolphin.  The trainer was with me and the dolphin one on one. Truly amazing animals.  Pool was warm and I recommend this tour.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

131352371.name: Front row seat!
131352371.author: a TripAdvisor user
131352371.reviewBody: Delfiniti was great value! They provide small dolphin shows planned for about 25 viewers. Everyone gets a front row seat!!! We also saw the macaw show and got pictures with the birds and dolphins. The show was in mid afternoon so a fantastic way to be in the shade during the hottest time of the day. All around a wonderful afternoon for young and old :)

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

128679811.name: 2 Boys favourite memory of their vacation
128679811.author: a TripAdvisor user
128679811.reviewBody: Our 12 and 8 year old boys absolutely loved the swimming with dolphins experience.  They were thrilled with the warm water and the fact that they got to swim and touch dolphins for 45 minutes.  A few hours after they asked if they could do it again.  We\'ll save it for the next time we are back.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

128476834.name: A Wonderful Experience
128476834.author: a TripAdvisor user
128476834.reviewBody: It\'s expensive, but well worth it. We loved swimming with the dolphins!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

128005209.name: Swim with Dolphins
128005209.author: a TripAdvisor user
128005209.reviewBody: Don\'t miss this activity.  You can "swim with dolphins" in the US or really swim with them in Ixtapa, Mexico.  It was a wonderful experience.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

127943508.name: Good experience..not much about dolphins but selling your photos
127943508.author: a TripAdvisor user
127943508.reviewBody: We liked being with the dolphins. They were amazing animals.  We loved touching them and playing with them.  The staff was nice and friendly.  However, there was no talk or information about dolphins, their habitat or their  life.  There was no information about the dolphins that played with us except their names.  Every move the dolphins did or we did were for the benefit of the photographer.  At the end, we were there to buy pictures.  Wish it was not that commercial.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

127676688.name: So Cool!
127676688.author: a TripAdvisor user
127676688.reviewBody: The rate was really good if you have over 3 people in your group and the experience was like none other! Very cool and very kid friendly too!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

127613465.name: Awesome to be with the dophins, however.....
127613465.author: a TripAdvisor user
127613465.reviewBody:
I'd like to start off first by saying the best deal your going to get is by going through Delfiniti
alone for the lowest rate. Check the lobby area of your hotel, there may be a representative
there that will book your trip for you. You can go either 10am-12pm-4pm. He won't take any money up front, you must pay when you arrive. He offered us 20% off the regular rate which was a nice bonus. You will need to have your own transportation. If you hop on the local bus, you can ask the driver to let you off closet to Delfiniti. It's a short walk from the bus stop to the dolphins, they also have taxi-drivers right outside should you chose that route. Before you go, they will ask you not wear sunscreen for the dophins safety. They don't provide towels, so bring one from your hotel. We were super savvy and brought extra dry clothes for the kids to change into afterwards, realizing we were going to shop in Zihua afterwards! They do offer showers to wash off afterwards, however expect OUTSIDE showers with freezing cold water and absolutely barely any privacy. I use the word "however" in my title because I felt the entire experience, aside from being able to interact with the dolphins, rushed and poorly managed.
Happy to say I can speak and understand the spanish language so I could understand all the instructions from the folks who work there, there were quite a few people that did not. Finally someone asked them to translate in english, the translation was very broken english and I feel the folks who paid A LOT of money for the 30 minute show didn't get the full experience that the rest who understood the speaker. My son and I did the family experience, which cost 80.00 for the both of us. They strapped on life jackets and led us to a pool where with one dolphin, asked us to get in and attempted to have all of us stand far apart from each other, yet close to the instructor who with hand movements was able to get the dophin to swim near us for us to touch. The ENTIRE time, there were 4 people on the side screaming "LOOK AT THE CAMERA! LOOK AT THE CAMERA!" it was awful.  When it was time for my son to kiss the dolphin the experience was completely shattered by these people who were more interested in snapping a picture for us pay for at the end of the tour and was lost! 10 minutes later, they guided us out of the pool.  My daughter in the meantime was experiencing the Ride with the dolphins show which lasted much longer with more one on one time with them along with the grand finale ride from the two pushing her feet. It was wonderful to see and she had a great time. Afterwards people where just lost as to where to go and what to do, they said they had showers but nobody told anyone where and it seemed as thought all the workers disapeared. I could tell some people were frustrated by lack of communication from the people who worked there. When we went to the front desk to check out the pictures which run from several cameras out front, they ask you to write down which picture you would like to buy ($8.00 a picture or $80.00 for a video). We opted for 3 pictures and not the video. My word of advise is this, if you do this. Ask them right away for an english translation so you can understand it all.Completely ignore the people on the side of the pool screaming at you to look at the camera after you give them ONE shot of you smiling, then focus on the actual experience because it is truly amazing to be so up and close to these sweet dolphins. Bring a towel or plan to go straight back to your hotel to wash off unless you like cold cold showers. Plan ahead if you want to buy the video and let them know right away. A couple told us it would take them 1/2 hour to make the video for them. The pictures took just a few minutes!  Hope this helps!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

127613287.name: Really fun, I just hope that they are as happy as the trainers say
127613287.author: a TripAdvisor user
127613287.reviewBody: It was a dream to swim with dolphins, and the experience was amazing... but a I was a little concerned about the happiness of the animals, as they are doing the same thing all the time.... But I have no evidence that they were not as happy and healthy as the trainers said.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

127147412.name: Lots of fun
127147412.author: a TripAdvisor user
127147412.reviewBody: worth it to pay for the best experience and dolphin push!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

127095342.name: Wonderful dolphin experience
127095342.author: a TripAdvisor user
127095342.reviewBody: We liked everything about the experience except that we were not allowed to take photographs ourselves, but we understand that they need to earn additional funds with their photographs, which were excellent.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

126686047.name: OMG - I flew like Superman!
126686047.author: a TripAdvisor user
126686047.reviewBody: Unbelievable! I got to hug, kiss, swim and fly with the dolphins!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

126612712.name: Lovely experience, but something not quite right....q
126612712.author: a TripAdvisor user
126612712.reviewBody: We took our little girl here, as she was so keen to swim with these beautiful mammals.  Overall it was a nice experience, but  I would have prefered to see them in their natural habitat. It was our choice to go, and I only hope they are really well looked after and have some release from being in those pools all day long. . The pre Dolphin, Parrot show,  seemed  just another way of making money from taking average quality pictures ( such a shame after spending a lot of money on the Dolphin experience, that you can\'t even take your own pics!)  We did of course purchase some pics with the Dolphins, but find it shocking that they can charge 80 dollars for a DVD! You would think that they would, for a reasonable set price, put all your pics on a cd too. I asked about a cd and was told that for each image put on the cd it would be 8 dollars! Yes they need to make money, but come on!\nThe other annoyance was that my Partner and Daughter took a shower after and there were no towels provided, we didn\'t know we would have to bring our own. For the price, would it be any hardship to provide them? When we asked about this no one seemed to want to help. \nOverall lovely thing to do with little ones, but personally would think twice about doing again.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

126090075.name: 3 of us did this highly recommended
126090075.author: a TripAdvisor user
126090075.reviewBody: It was agreat time by all. From Little kids to grown ups

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

125612936.name: Swimming with dolphins, an incredible experience
125612936.author: a TripAdvisor user
125612936.reviewBody: Swimming with the dolphins at Delfiniti met all our (high) expectations. With 3 generations present, we chose the 25 minute "encounter" so that all six of us (ranging from 3 years old to 70+) could be in the water with the dolphins together. The staff of Delfiniti provided good explanation and took the time to answer any questions we had. Once in the water, being so close to them was an incredible experience. The dolphins circled around us and seemed to enjoy being stroked. After 25 minutes interacting and playing with the dolphins we stepped out of the water. The overall facilities were good. The only slight negative would be the price of the photos, at $8 per piece not exactly cheap - at the same time we all wanted a memory of this special experience. Still, an incredible (albeit not cheap) experience and very much recommended.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

124818001.name: Swimming with Dolphins
124818001.author: a TripAdvisor user
124818001.reviewBody: Great experience.  Get to be right with the Dolphins and even have them push you.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

124191090.name: AWESOME!!!
124191090.author: a TripAdvisor user
124191090.reviewBody: well worth the $$$ for this once in a lifetime experience. Thanks Delfiniti for helping with our daughter to make her experience the same as everybody else :) \nOur daughter has CP and can\'t do all of the "events" that come with the 45mn swim...but the trainers adapted and helped to ensure that she had the full experience...AWESOME!!!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

123910849.name: Experience of a Lifetime
123910849.author: a TripAdvisor user
123910849.reviewBody: I had the opportunity to actually swim and ride on the dolphins.  They were so beautiful and very gentle. No comparison to Sea World which I have done previously.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

123260913.name: Remember to let go when the dolphin goes under water.
123260913.author: a TripAdvisor user
123260913.reviewBody: It was fun, you get to hold on to the fins and swin with them and then they swim around you and then lift you out of the water.. fun...

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

121355969.name: best experience of my life!
121355969.author: a TripAdvisor user
121355969.reviewBody: this was so incredible! book through ur hotel for best price, but do it!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

121144874.name: Great upclose and personal interactions
121144874.author: a TripAdvisor user
121144874.reviewBody: Great experience for the family to touch and see the dolphins.  Knowledgeable and fun staff.   Definitely worth bringing the whole family since there are options for kids and adults of all ages.  Facilities are not lavish - simple lockers and showers.  Also, no picture taking - they take all photos and sell them plus video options at conclusion.  Pretty expensive -  but feeding and caring for the animals is expensive, so I didn\'t feel like it was inappropriate.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

120256350.name: What an amazing experience.
120256350.author: a TripAdvisor user
120256350.reviewBody: My son and I had the opportunity to swim with the dolphins while off our cruise ship for the day. We were told Ixtapa had one of the best places to do it so we made sure we signed up for it. Everything I had been told was true. We got to spend 2 hours with the dolphins. We had about a half hour lesson of things you can and can\'t do and then it was all about the guests. The dolpins are so well trained and so lovable. We got to try all the tricks and got some amazing photographs to cherish our memories too. This was the highlight of my entire trip. I would recommend this to any family or couple forsure. You just can\'t understand how awsome it is until you do it. The instructors and staff were very friendly and funny. We had an amazing experience. We would do it again in a heart beat. And the cost was very reasonable.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

119950754.name: Truly memorable event"
119950754.author: a TripAdvisor user
119950754.reviewBody: The dolphin encounter was a once in a lifetime adventure! To be that close to such a magnificent and smart animal is unforgettable. Pay the extra for the encounter, it is well worth the hour and 5 minutes you get in the water. Having two dolphins stand  you up in the water and carry you for what seems like a football field is something you will never forget!!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

119570822.name: Sweet Dolphins
119570822.author: a TripAdvisor user
119570822.reviewBody: Great location for this attraction and really helpful staff and trainers.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

114578677.name: Kids review
114578677.author: a TripAdvisor user
114578677.reviewBody: Delfiniti is the most fun place for kids. The dolphins are so kind and well trained and the staff are so funny and nice. It is expensive but you are swimming with doliphins. It is interesting but don\'t tell you much about the dolphins. The place is cool looking but not the best. Overall the place, staff, and dolphins are kind and cool. That\'s what I have to say. By Mikhaele:)

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

105165286.name: They stole my sisters credit card number and charged it up.
105165286.author: a TripAdvisor user
105165286.reviewBody:
Well, all in all the Dolphin Experience was pretty good. It wasn't busy, just my sisters 2 kids and another local family with one girl. Spent some time chatting with the trainers and they were likeable and friendly.

My major problem is the purchasing of photos afterwards. Firstly, they charge an outrageous amount for each picture. My sister actually paid for the excusion and photos with credit card only to find out that they are thieves. Within 2 days, they had charged over 5000.00 worth of stuff on my sisters cards. Please do not use your credit card here at all. I am disappointed that this criminal behaviour has since tainted my experience. 

Bottom line, don't trust them as far as you can throw them.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

103937675.name: Whole family loved it!
103937675.author: a TripAdvisor user
103937675.reviewBody: I took my two sons ages 8 and 15 to swim with the dolphins here in October of 2006 and we all loved it.  The animals are well kept and well loved and the staff was very professional.  We bought a video of our adventure and some photos as well.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

59356324.name: Trainers Do Not Care About Dolphins And Ivan The Photographer Is A Thief
59356324.author: a TripAdvisor user
59356324.reviewBody:
DELFINITI will lose a lot of business as long as the trainers do not take control and IVAN photographer works  there!!.
I went swimming with the dolphins on March 17, 2010, my four and a half year old and I. At  the hotel they one price and once you get to delfiniti the price goes up 300USA at the end.  Plus the picture package IVAN,the photographer, you really represent the bad image people have of MEXICANS!!! priced a package for 110USA.  At the end he wanted 200USA.  Just a plain THIEF.
There is only one animal trainer that greets you and has the birds doing tricks with you.  He is actually concern about the animals and your experience. 
This trainer once he knew that I was pissed offer to show me a mommy and baby dolphin swimming in their own tank.  We saw them from the platform and never got close!!!
EVERYONE else is horrible.  During our time in the tank this family had a one year old he cried, and cried until he turned blue out of fear and lack of oxygen.  These parents, they look to me like locals  should get the worse parent of the year award.  The parents decided to stay and ruin the swimming for everyone else in the tank. The Kid cried and the Dolphin made a sound to answer back!!! These trainers should had said something to the parents and take charge. The problem is that they are NOT going to give money back. HELLO Parents forget about the $$$$  But if a child is in distressed the safety of the child and dolphins comes FIRST.
 These trainers talk to the guest like you have been in contact with dolphins before.  They assume you should KNOW!!!.  
My swimming with the dolphins experience became a big head ache after we left, I was so stress out and kept my calmness for my child. I came back to the hotel got a massage to relief all that tension.
 SAve your money and make a donation to a sanctuary for dolphins IN CAPTIVITY.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

52015463.name: Good contact
52015463.author: a TripAdvisor user
52015463.reviewBody: My kid wanted to swim with the Dolphins and the experience with Delfiniti was good. They form group which go into the water and at the beginning the dolphins swim between the group so everyone can touch them, then they do the same good the dolphins singing. The next exercise was a hug and a kiss, that is individual, so each member of the group passes and gets a hug and kiss from the dolphin, and then each one gets a ride in their stomach then a footpush.\nFinally there is a small show where the dolphins jump and splash water everything while the group is inside the water and they have the first line show.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

50073629.name: Swim with the Dolphins quite an experience
50073629.author: a TripAdvisor user
50073629.reviewBody:
To swim with the dolphins is a memorable experience that will last a lifetime.   What gentle giants they are.

Delfinit was run timely and the guide/insturctor was easily understood.  His english was excellent.   They do  not allow photos by individuals however they take a good quality photo and allow you to preview and purchase any you wish at $8. each.   Not an outrageous amount for the quality.   You can purchase prints or request a cd of the photos you request.

All in all a great experience if you are a lover of animals,  They are like big puppy dogs and I am certain they sense when you like them.   If they sense that from you it is a great experience.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

50065908.name: DO not buy from this web site or company!!!! It is a SCAM!!!!!!!
50065908.author: a TripAdvisor user
50065908.reviewBody: We paid online for tickets to go to the DELFINITI attraction in Ixtapa and they took our money and never sent us our tickets.  I have emailed them like 20 times, I have paid a fortune calling them and it either just rings or the man says "I will have someone call you back" and NOBODY calls me back.  On the website it stated once we paid with our credit card, the ticket vouchers would immediately be emailed and they WERE NOT.  I haven\'t gotten ANYWHERE with these guys other than ripped off!!!  PLEASE DO NOT PURCHASE from these guys online, ITS A SCAM!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

26701785.name: Great Fun but Hidden Costs for Pics and Video
26701785.author: a TripAdvisor user
26701785.reviewBody: Great time. I took my three year old son. Do be aware that you are not able to take pictures of family in the pool with the dolphins. They want $8 US per picture that they take or $80 US for a poorly made video. If family want to watch, they also want $5 US per person. They love quoting everything in US $, so if you are Canadian, ask what it is in pesos.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

23106566.name: Great time at Delfiniti!
23106566.author: a TripAdvisor user
23106566.reviewBody: Had a great time doing the dolphin swim. Don\'t forget to grab a towel from the hotel before you go, because they do not have any there..  English instruction in the pool was fine. There are several people around who know Spanish and English..  it was a great experience!!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

11524793.name: An Experience Not Soon Forgotton
11524793.author: a TripAdvisor user
11524793.reviewBody: Swimming with Chico (a Cuban dolphin) and Mia (a Mexican dolphin and the bebe) was one of the coolest things we\'ve ever done.  My husband and I and two Canadian ladies had these two delightful creatures all to ourselves, under the watchful eye of their trainer, Rafael.  They swam in figure eights around us.  We got to pet them, hug, and kiss them.  They swam around with us on their bellies while we held onto their fins.  They propelled us through the water with their noses on the bottoms of our feet.  It was just an exceptional experience.  This was worth every penny.  We bought printed pictures, pictures on CD, and the DVD of our group!!  (we watched the DVD as soon as we got home!)  DO THIS... it\'s money well spent.  You\'ll LOVE IT!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

7484950.name: great fun .. but .....
7484950.author: a TripAdvisor user
7484950.reviewBody: it is a great experience that everyone should do at least once. the staff is wonderful and the dolphins are beautiful. The only recommendation would be for women to wear a full piece bathing suit. When the dolphins push you by your feet, a two piece does not stay where it should. even though the photos are expensive...  they are worth it.\n

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

7215541.name: Delfiniti was Spectaclur
7215541.author: a TripAdvisor user
7215541.reviewBody: I went to Delfinit March 16, 2007. This was  my first dolphin encounter. Words can not explain how beautiful the dolphins are i had a chance to meet the father dolphin Chocho and his baby. I found the staff from delfinit to be friendly and more then helpful. The photographer took great pictures, and the trainers were fantastic you can tell there is a incredible bond between the trainers and there dolphins. THUMBS UP all the way - \nI defintly recommend delfiniti.\n

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

7190033.name: Worth doing
7190033.author: a TripAdvisor user
7190033.reviewBody: Not as much fun as I expected, but still worth doing if you have not done before like me. Trainers were generally friendly, but their assistants did not speak good english, and were not helpful. They take pictures of you with the Dolphins and you can buy copies, but the person helping us was useless and provided incorrect information. We paid 140 pesos for two pictures to be emailed to us and should have received them three days ago, but have not. Now I will have to try to reach them to get the pictures or attempt to  get our picture fees returned.\n

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

6314667.name: Wow, only words for it!!
6314667.author: a TripAdvisor user
6314667.reviewBody: My husband and I went in March of \'06.  We loved it.  It seemed like a lot of money but after you do it, it seems very affordable.  We are going back to Ixtapa in March of \'07 and we plan on doing it again.  Dolphins were well cared for and the trainers made sure you were comfortable with everything.  Definitly something you should do.\n

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

4690539.name: Great!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
4690539.author: a TripAdvisor user
4690539.reviewBody: We loved Delfiniti.  We have a 8 year old daughter and she loved it.  It was worth every penny. Would go again in an instant.  As soon as we left our daughter wanted to go back the next day.  Order the video before you swim with the dolphins, it is only $24.00 instead of $30.00.  Book it yourself, don\'t go on a tour....ask them for a discount.\n

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

4111774.name: Do not pass up this experience
4111774.author: a TripAdvisor user
4111774.reviewBody: A group of 4 of us went to Delfiniti in 11/05.  I have swam with dolphins before, but this was a better experience by far.  We paid for the full program ($104 USD) through Apple.  We were in the water with the dolphins for an hour.  They swam among us, did tricks with us, even gave us a hug & kiss!!  The trainers were friendly, informative, relaxed.  It was one of the best experiences of my life.\n

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

3099662.name: Swimming with Dolphins
3099662.author: a TripAdvisor user
3099662.reviewBody: I had the experience of a lifetime as well !  I arranged for the Delfiniti experience as a land excursion offered thru the Carnival Spirit cruise that was absolutely wonderful itself.  The Delfiniti experience was worth every penny.  A member of my group had a previous \'swimming with the dolphins\' experience somewhere else and exclaimed how the Delfiniti experience was absolutely so much better.  I highly recommend this adventure and I would do it again.  The staff / trainers were kind, informative,  and patient.  The photos / video speak more than a thousand words.\n

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

1644405.name: Amazing event...
1644405.author: a TripAdvisor user
1644405.reviewBody:
Visiting Delfiniti was one of the highlights of our trip.
