Though I initially thought it was pricey (I think we paid 2500 peso for the two of us, booked through the Hotel) and even though my wife promptly informed me before we left to ignore the price because we were doing it, I would have paid 5000 peso for the experience (I'm sure she would have paid more than that).

The session was extremely professional, and I genuinely thought that their number one priority was the Dolphins. We had to remove all jewelry, wear minimal to no sunscreen, and follow all instructions carefully. English or Spanish is a necessity, or there will be problems and you might miss out on the full experience.

You get to not only interact with the Dolphins as they swim around you, you also get to give them a hug, ride on their belly as they swim inverted, and have them push your feet as you 'superman' along the water.

There were a number of Kids that participated in our group, and by the looks on their faces it's an event they will never forget.

When all is said and done you can buy pictures (which we did because we didn't have anyone else there to take pictures for us. 70 peso/pic), and a video (again we bought that too. 300 peso)

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

1628182.name: Wonderful trip
1628182.author: a TripAdvisor user
1628182.reviewBody: Four of us went to Zihuatanejo in January 2004 (2 couples). We had a wonderful trip. The weather was perfect for us. It was over cast and poured down rain a time or two, but just for a few hours. We were happy that it wasn\'t that unbareable heat. I went swimming with the Dolphins at Delfiniti in Ixtapa. It falls into the "Best experience of my life" category. It was wonderful. The employees were all very friendly. They spoke spanish to the others in the pool and english to me. We had no problem communicating. They can be reached at www.delfiniti.com . We hired a local man to take us around one morning to see banana trees, coconut trees, papaya trees and a real mexican village. He also took us to where they make the tiles for the buildings. It was all very interesting.We also took the bus to Petalan where they have a gold market in the street in front of the church. Beautiful pieces. So many it was hard to choose just one. It was a wonderful trip with a lot of time for shopping.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Ixtapa s/n Lote Anexo 6 B, Zona Hotelera

579486857.name: real water life and very interesting
579486857.author: a TripAdvisor user
579486857.reviewBody: To get there there is a traveling company assoiated with the hotel Tesoro Ixtapa; and the food the locals are serving are fresh and good means delicious

360483555.name: spring getaway 2016
360483555.author: a TripAdvisor user
360483555.reviewBody: awesome beaches... very clean and upkept.  but be wary of high waves if swimming as they can vary wildly

358769187.name: Incredible Value in a Beach front Hotel
358769187.author: a TripAdvisor user
358769187.reviewBody: Have stayed at Vista Hermosa on four different occasions and would highly recommend it for beachfront accommodations in Melaque. Oceanfront rooms with kitchenette are the best bet. Well equipped with all the basic cooking needs. If you are missing something let the staff know and they will do their best to accommodate. Top floor rooms are huge with separate kitchens and dining areas.Beautiful beach right out the front door and you can rent umbrellas/tables for the day on the well kept Sandy beach. Rooms around the central courtyard are basic but excellent value for the money. Good restaurant directly adjacent on the beach open for lunch and dinner.

333184811.name: beautiful private beach on the Las Brisas Resort
333184811.author: a TripAdvisor user
333184811.reviewBody: water is very clean, sand is fine and no vendors.  the water was very warm last time we were there.  not very many 10 footers but we saw them every day.  Always red flagged but always have to pay attention.

246123977.name: Private and beautiful
246123977.author: a TripAdvisor user
246123977.reviewBody: This beach belongs to Las Brisas. It\'s private no vendors will be there just ocean chairs and restaurant. They have life guard till 6pm. Must see

245918983.name: Best private beach
245918983.author: a TripAdvisor user
245918983.reviewBody: This is the beach that belongs to the Las Brisas Hotel. In truth, all beaches are public but the hotel controls the access in and out. This means no vendors or people peddling you junk. Add great beach bar service and it\'s awesome sauce!\n

190664886.name: Heaven on a beach!
190664886.author: a TripAdvisor user
190664886.reviewBody: The #1 beach in Ixtapa, hands down!!  It is private at Las Brisas Hotel.  The sand was light in color and so soft and sugary.  The water was reminiscent of the turquoise Caribbean waters.  The waves were perfectly crashing and flowing up the beach.  It was lovely for walking, swimming, sunbathing, photography....everything!  A lifeguard was on duty and that was reassuring.  We were so sad to leave :(

175905419.name: Las Brisas Hotel beach
175905419.author: a TripAdvisor user
175905419.reviewBody: You can\'t get here unless you stay at the Las Brisas...well, I guess you could if you boat or parachute in. Usually big waves but clean and fun.

375303077.name: You need water to have a water park.
375303077.author: a TripAdvisor user
375303077.reviewBody: The park was closed the entire time we were there and didn\'t[\'t look like it had been open in a long time.  The place was locked up.  The pools at the hotel were dirty, but they had water.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. de las Garzas s/n

342393020.name: A waste of water
342393020.author: a TripAdvisor user
342393020.reviewBody: For what little water there was. Most attractions didn\'t have enough water running to make them useful. Wave pool is only functional at certain times. Very run down and dirty.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. de las Garzas s/n

260622971.name: Could be great!!
260622971.author: a TripAdvisor user
260622971.reviewBody: Ixtapa is an awesome, family friendly resort location & a water park here is a great idea. Idea is what they had. The so called \'lazy river\' is lazy alright, it doesn\'t move, by brother in law had to make waves to push us along, it was quite comical actually. The 2 waterslides that were working had no attendants & you flew down them like a speeding bullet. We were the ONLY people there at that time. We had fun but at that time, there was nothing safe for kids to do, no lifeguards. They could make this place into a real great waterpark for adults & kids if they put some effort & time into it. After-all, who doesn\'t want to go to a waterpark, in 90 degree & bright sunny weather? We\'d definitely would go back if it turned into a real waterpark, add a wavepool & more slides that have large tubes that hold a family, those are the best! It certainly is no \'CiCi\' waterpark in Acapulco, now that is a true waterpark for family, friends, couples, has a huge wave pool, lifeguards, & the owner keeps it looking brand new & upgrades slides etc, & you feel safe on their slides. This place should expand & mimic CiCi & it would be a blast for tourists & a goldmine! I hate seeing Ixtapa go down hill. It started with only having all inclusives, losing great restaurants bc of it, & the once gorgeous city go to pot bc Fonatur is not keeping up with it. Very sad bc its a gorgeous & hot location on the cleanest beach in Mexico!

address.streetAddress: Blvd. de las Garzas s/n

238953941.name: unique and fun
238953941.author: a TripAdvisor user
238953941.reviewBody: if you expect seaworld like scenes this is not for you.\na few slides and pools is what it is. A practical location within walking distance from almost every hotel in Ixtapa, inexpensive food, not fancy but decent and clean, gerat place for a day with children around.  enjoyed once in our stay

address.streetAddress: Blvd. de las Garzas s/n

218925059.name: Enjoyed it!
218925059.author: a TripAdvisor user
218925059.reviewBody: I was here with the family, which included 2 kids, 3 teenagers and 2 adults. We all enjoyed it, but specially the little kids. Its more of a kid attraction place than an adult. Food is great. Feed the whole family of 6 for $20 which included fries, burgers and drinks! Not a good choice if only adults going they only have 2 big slides.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. de las Garzas s/n

193376553.name: Go only if you are close by and looking for a quick diversion
193376553.author: a TripAdvisor user
193376553.reviewBody: When we went to Magic World, the pirate ship with the smaller slides for kids (mentioned in the previous review) was not operational but the two large slides were.  It was priced accordingly with the entry fee being only 30 pesos per person (less than $2.50).  The water wasn\'t the cleanest and the bathrooms were not functional but we all had fun going down the 2 slides--my kids (7 and 11) went on the slide so many times, it was pennies per slide.  We were staying right across the street so it was a good diversion toward the end of the trip.  Check before you pay (they let us) what is operational--and if you can\'t simply walk over there, I wouldn\'t bother. When you first get there they do try to get you to buy some food or drinks (with a pleasant but persistent handing off of various menus) but after that they left us alone. There were very few people there so there was no line at all for the 2 slides.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. de las Garzas s/n

4690522.name: All right but not great.
4690522.author: a TripAdvisor user
4690522.reviewBody:
Magic World is for little kids. Our daughter is 8 years old and had a good time.  It opens at 10:30am.  There is a big cement pirate ship, with about 7 waterslides off of it.  They are small slides but good for kids.  The pool is about 2 feet at the deepest part.  Parent can go on the slide with the kids.  The two big slides opened at noon, but when we went to try them, they weren't on anymore at about 1:30.  There are a couple of restauants, which they come out and ask you if you want to order anything.  The prices were good.  We had Fries, chicken fingers and a drink for 50 pesos.  There is a long canal swimming pool that goes throughout the area, and you can walk in it.  There is supose to be a wave pool but it wasn't working.  

Magic World is good for something different to do if your kids are bored of the beach. It is only $6.00us to get in.  We couldn't find anyone who spoke english.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. de las Garzas s/n

664782440.name: Food was delicious
664782440.author: a TripAdvisor user
664782440.reviewBody:
Snorkelling was only ok
Prices are very reasonable.
Some of the staff sat around and talked behind us for several hours

651848460.name: Beautiful beach
651848460.author: a TripAdvisor user
651848460.reviewBody: This is a great place to spend a day. There are many places to choose from to eat and drink. Beach is great and the water is warm.

651275008.name: Beautiful hideaway.
651275008.author: a TripAdvisor user
651275008.reviewBody: Herby at Princess Coral is FANTASTIC! We met him with one of our local friends about 6 years ago. He will take great care of you. If you need snorkel equipment and great food and great prices, go visit Herby on the backside where you snorkel with some amazing fish!

638614011.name: Relaxing Day of Snorkelling
638614011.author: a TripAdvisor user
638614011.reviewBody: Our guide, Antonio, took me around the coves and the fish were plentiful and was lucky to see a hawksbill turtle and a puffer fish.  The lunch included was tasty and good value.  On the short drive to Playa Linda to the pier, Antonio provided history and anecdotes for the area in Spanish and English.  Bring a few coins to tip the boat handlers.

635592574.name: Island breeze
635592574.author: a TripAdvisor user
635592574.reviewBody: We had a great day over on the island. Swimming  was great wave weren\u2019t bad at all. We ate on the beach some Maui Maui.

573839011.name: Serene
573839011.author: a TripAdvisor user
573839011.reviewBody: One our most favorite part of our vacation. From jumping on the local bus to the fishing boat ride to the island to eat at our favorite restaurant..

567324430.name: Day  outing and snorkeling
567324430.author: a TripAdvisor user
567324430.reviewBody:
One of the Family's favorite outings, with good local food, we even saw the fresh fish come in and picked out our lunch a nice Red Snapper... 
went over the other side to snorkel a bit.. the fish very friendly... so too
stayed right with you.. 
very reasonable day outing a bus ride and ferry.. and you are there
waiting for the bus and watching the Crocodiles kinda neat too... 
rode bikes out there a few days before.. 
and some good silver venders on the beach  Ixtapa Island 
also on our to do list..

565818899.name: Be careful
565818899.author: a TripAdvisor user
565818899.reviewBody: We took a tour which picked us up at the hotel and included meals for everyone.  We we added a couple of buckets of beer and upgraded two meals (one to coconut shrimp), they tried to charge us an extra $100.  Some of the waiters are very dishonest.  Be very careful.  Our travel guide did get us the money back that was a scam, but it was upsetting.

563210478.name: Always the best day and most wonderful experience of our Ixtapa vacation.
563210478.author: a TripAdvisor user
563210478.reviewBody: Sometimes you hesitate to write a good review about a place because you don\'t want too many other people to find out about it. Well, this place is that great, but there\'s still room for a few more people to enjoy. Take the Playa Linda bus from the hotel zone for 12 pesos to the end of the route at Playa Linda. Then find your way a short distance toward the ocean to board the launch for 50 pesos each for the round-trip to the island. Find an establishment you like, then lounge chairs, a beach umbrella, a palapa, and a table, lay back, relax, enjoy, and let the host spoil you you with "rustic" ambiance, good food and drinks. The second beach, north facing beach is the best, in a small cove with nice quiet waters. Don\'t miss the last launch back to the mainland around 4 pm. Ixtapa Island is paradise!

562193271.name: Go on your own
562193271.author: a TripAdvisor user
562193271.reviewBody: Take a city bus to Playa Linda. Walk to the water taxis and you are there.150 pesos return. Cross the island on foot in 3 minutes and you can snorkle walk the beach  or swim. Fish come right up to you A great way to spend a few hours. remember tables and chairs on the beach belong to restaurants. Just buy a drink and a snack and you can sit in the shade for a lonh time. Reall well worth the visit

561132353.name: Beautiful!
561132353.author: a TripAdvisor user
561132353.reviewBody:
We took the water taxi over to the island which is 50 pesos/person round trip. It is a short ride over to the island. The water is so clear and perfect for snorkelling. We didnt book a tour just did it on our own as it is easy to do on your own and then you go at your own pace. Lots of restaurants to choose from to eat and drink at. I would suggest going early in the morning as it gets very busy. We went at 9am and it was the perfect time to go at.
You have to chrck out the croc and turtle habitat located at Playa Linda where you catch the water taxi.
It is worth doing and a beautiful area of Ixtapa.
The Pederson Family
Saskatoon, SK

555737433.name: very relaxing place
555737433.author: a TripAdvisor user
555737433.reviewBody: The view was spectacular. We were taking to the beach where they can snorkel and walking into the water it was so clear you could see the fish.The restraint Lili Cipriani and server Carlos was fantastic.

555446479.name: not worth it
555446479.author: a TripAdvisor user
555446479.reviewBody: As mention for playa linda I think that the island is worth going to if the beach at your hotel is bad. If you like a pebble beach, lots of rabits and crakles...then yes. You could consider the taxi/boat crossing as your ocean trip !...nothing else to do than sunbath and drink

522381546.name: Nice
522381546.author: a TripAdvisor user
522381546.reviewBody: Nice boat trip. You can buy in the beach Nice bracelets, necklaces and other stuff, for nothing. A lot of different fishes and local people doing guide.

487830998.name: fun
487830998.author: a TripAdvisor user
487830998.reviewBody: This island is nice if you like to eat at an outside restaurant. its nice to explore the island, and you can swim there also.

475883166.name: If you are a foreigner you might be a little dissapointed.
475883166.author: a TripAdvisor user
475883166.reviewBody: As a Mexican living in USA I found the place acceptable and the prices are OK. Don\'t expect nothing fancy.

467442725.name: fun and fantastic
467442725.author: a TripAdvisor user
467442725.reviewBody: It was a really short boat ride 20mins and what a gem on the other side, Beautiful clear blue water.

465188768.name: Wonderful restaurants and safe swimming and snorkeling.
465188768.author: a TripAdvisor user
465188768.reviewBody: Wonderful place to spend the day. Take the bus from Zihuatanejo or Ixtapa to Playa Linda. Get off and admire the crocodiles. Walk across the beach to the dock and purchase a ticket to go to the Island. It is close enough to see clearly from shore. The panga boats go back and forth all day until 5? or 6?. Your ticket pays for both ways so be sure not to lose it! Many restaurants to choose from. We went to Siete Mares on time and Paraiso Escondito another. Both were wonderful on different beaches. There are 3 beaches to choose from. All are great. The one facing Playa Linda is the calmest for tranquil swimming.

461511850.name: Great Day
461511850.author: a TripAdvisor user
461511850.reviewBody: Ixtapa Island is easy to access, and a really fun day. you can snorkel on one side and swim on the other side, Beer is cold and people are friendly.

461295181.name: Sailboat tour
461295181.author: a TripAdvisor user
461295181.reviewBody: We went on sail boat tour in the morning about one hour, was relaxing, and our captain was informative

459717375.name: Day trip
459717375.author: a TripAdvisor user
459717375.reviewBody: Do not pay for a tour for this, it is to go to Playa Linda by public bus or even a taxis.  We opted to go by bus really cheap for the 3 of us bus driver even will give you change if you use pesos.  Then the water taxis was 50 pesos which is for both ways out to the island but remember last taxis leaves at 6.  The island has many cafes to chose from one side the beach is great for swimming this beach was much nicer to swim at than the one at our resort, The other side is good for snorkeling and you can see little fishes swimming around.

453200013.name: Bait and switch-Be careful at restaurant Luilui
453200013.author: a TripAdvisor user
453200013.reviewBody:
We went for lunch to restaurant Luilui (or something close to it) and Tony provided wonderful and warm service throughout our stay. Great waiter!!! I ordered a shrimp cocktail and my dad ordered coconut shrimp. 

The coconut shrimp were DELICIOUS. But instead of my shrimp cocktail, I was given shrimp tacos.  I didn't want to make a big deal of it, so I said OK. They tasted really good. 

When the bill arrived, both the shrimp cocktail and the coconut shrimp were priced much higher than the menu price. Tony told me, " I mentioned this to you when you ordered. I gave you the jumbo shrimp for both".

You can see where this is headed. Of course I never had this conversation with Tony.  I was steamed but since he provided excellent service, and because we were with a group,  I didn't  want to argue or raise a stink, but the experience left a sour taste in my mouth. I will not be visiting this establishment again.  Not cool, Tony.

453080417.name: great day at the beach
453080417.author: a TripAdvisor user
453080417.reviewBody:
The island is pretty much 2 beaches - 1 is for swimming (where the boat lands) and 2 is for snorkeling (walk right across through the restaurants).
We went to 2, picked ay of the restaurants, that give you a base for your stuff and you go:
We rented snorkel gear (they all rent it and they are all about the same price and quality) and we went out to play with Fishes. There are so many of the fishes all over.
We then got a massage for an hour - make sure to negotiate the price down with the guy, but then tip the ladies generously
The boats (Pangas) leave by 5:00, so no sunset, but what a great day

451095402.name: Not a great beach to go to
451095402.author: a TripAdvisor user
451095402.reviewBody: We spent the day there but the beach is on such an angle its hard to get comfortable in your chair without sliding out, the beach is  a bit rocky. We still had fun but don\'t set the expectations too high.

442498807.name: Great island
442498807.author: a TripAdvisor user
442498807.reviewBody: Great time.lots to do.calm waters.enjoyed it immensely.would return.saw alligators on the way back.pretty amazing.Great day.

441448705.name: Crystal clear waters
441448705.author: a TripAdvisor user
441448705.reviewBody: We spend the day here swimming and relaxing .  The water was clear but would advise water shoes for the snokling beach. This beach has lots of fish to see , though not especially colourful , kids would still find it interesting. The food offered at most beach restaurants was grilled and fresh. The elaborately decorated Pin Coladas not to be missed . One is enough to share. Belen massage is recommended.

438279131.name: Laid back fun
438279131.author: a TripAdvisor user
438279131.reviewBody: I love the island.  One side has calm waters, the other snorkeling delights!  Getting there is half the fun in the little boats.  A treat for everyone not to be missed

421475595.name: Ask about the price before ordering
421475595.author: a TripAdvisor user
421475595.reviewBody: Beautiful island, had a great time. But also got ripped off paying almost 1000 pesos for a fish. Our lunch was included in the price for the tour. My husband upgraded his lunch but did not ask what the difference in price was. This so far was the most expensive experience we had here in Zihua. \nMy tip, don\'t pay for the tour just go by your self it costs a fraction of the price.  The island is definatly worth a visit. Would have given a 5 star if not for the over priced meal.

410245678.name: Best Snorkel
410245678.author: a TripAdvisor user
410245678.reviewBody: It was an amazing place. I had a wonderful time in the water so many fishes!! The snorkel was the best!!

375304819.name: Wish we had gone to the other Island
375304819.author: a TripAdvisor user
375304819.reviewBody: The island was fine, the food was fine. the snorkeling with a guide was great, but we got ripped off by the waiter.  We had paid for the whole day beforehand at the hotel, but when it was time to go the waiter said we owed $30.00 each for the food.  When we saw our tour guide the next day, he told us he had paid the waiter for our food from the money we gave him and that we had gotten ripped off.

374023909.name: Beautiful
374023909.author: a TripAdvisor user
374023909.reviewBody: Got to go it makes for a nice inexpensive day.We had a great lunch and 5 beers apiece for under 30 dollars

361724109.name: Vacation
361724109.author: a TripAdvisor user
361724109.reviewBody:
Absolutely beautiful 
Kayak around the corner in clear green blue water  private beach and coral reef near by    

Great time 
     Ok

356902013.name: Great Day Trip. Service and food terrific.
356902013.author: a TripAdvisor user
356902013.reviewBody: Always a great getaway for the day. We always take the bus from Ixtapa for 70- 80 cents. The shuttle boats are fun. The large number of restaurants leave you numerous places to sit. We always go to the far side where the snorkeling is  better. The hand carved pineapple drinks are pricey but just fun to have just once. This time we ordered the catch of the day which was prepared beautifully but lots of other things to order on the menu. It\'s just a very relaxing day for all. You can feed the fish while standing in a foot of water. Recommend it to everyone.

352961441.name: Go for a Great Morning or Afternoon Snorkel & Brew
352961441.author: a TripAdvisor user
352961441.reviewBody: Ixtapa Island is a great place to go snorkeling...especially in the am before the crowds arrive. There are plenty of fish to see and you can rent snorkel gear there for about $10USD or so, complete with a table and chair under the umbrella. Make sure you go to the beach with the snorkeling...not where you get off the boat. Also, make sure you ask for the price of something before you order it...some places will UP-charge you for what ever you order...if they think they can get away with it. Pay the price on the menu and KEEP the menu with you.

345891470.name: A nice short excursion from the nearby resorts.
345891470.author: a TripAdvisor user
345891470.reviewBody: It\'s an easy walk to get here from the nearby resorts and there are some crocodiles hanging out in the canal under the bridge at the entry to the village. Walk to the docks to take a ferry to the island which has some good reef snorkeling and a number of beach side restaurants where you can rest and relax.

344502273.name: Snorkling
344502273.author: a TripAdvisor user
344502273.reviewBody: Snorkling is good but you need to early. Then in the your go to the other side of the island for a noise afternoon swim and a cold drink\ud83d\ude0e

343618603.name: Amazing Day
343618603.author: a TripAdvisor user
343618603.reviewBody: Kayaked over to the island and spent a wonderful couple of hours.  Snorkeling was very good on the day we were there.  Lots of fish.  Restaurants on the island are very good and take good care of you.  You can leave your belonging  their and enjoy your snorkeling.. Its a must.

339778429.name: Great place to relax and enjoy
339778429.author: a TripAdvisor user
339778429.reviewBody: I will be going back to Ixtapa. Very laid back and friendly, clean and helpful. This was my first trip to Mexico. We met some incredible people, both local and from around the world. Not a party town.\n

339244669.name: Great day
339244669.author: a TripAdvisor user
339244669.reviewBody: Must visit for all travellers.  Looking forward to my next trip in 2016.  Plan on spending more time here.

336767643.name: Ok island to check out for a day
336767643.author: a TripAdvisor user
336767643.reviewBody: There are some restaurants on this island.  We ate at one and the service was quite slow.  The water is okay to wade out in but the swimming area is pretty small.  Good scenery to check out if taking a boat from the new pier over to the island.

320989718.name: ALWAYS  review your bill
320989718.author: a TripAdvisor user
320989718.reviewBody: Have enjoyed many trips to this island over the past 9 or so years, food is good (average) but often when the bill comes the prices are higher than the prices which are listed on the menu. It is not uncommon to find errors in the addition of the total price. A fun place to play!

318771104.name: Relax and enjoy the beach!
318771104.author: a TripAdvisor user
318771104.reviewBody: Was pleasantly surprised by the Great time to be had on Ixtapa Isalnd. \nSpent a Sunday there and was treated to an array of wild life from Wild deer and rabbits to the most amazing sea creatures.\nA must for your to-do list. Best meal ever at Paraiso Escondido. (last restaurant on Coral Beach)

307487023.name: Getway
307487023.author: a TripAdvisor user
307487023.reviewBody: No fresh water; we got sick from the food served on the island. Pineapple & alcohol drinks with little umbrellas were good.

284490550.name: Great time
284490550.author: a TripAdvisor user
284490550.reviewBody: A most do this is little island with a  5 minute boat ride from Ixtapa with 3 different beaches to enjoy and lots of water sports to enjoy. Good food and even better cocktails

274796604.name: Great place to relax!
274796604.author: a TripAdvisor user
274796604.reviewBody: Although I got sun poisoning on this trip and I was hung over this was a great place to relax and swim!

270659239.name: Awesome seafood and snorkeling
270659239.author: a TripAdvisor user
270659239.reviewBody: We took a motor boat ride, a short 10 minutes from Club Med, and landed on a nice sandy beach which was fairly crowded and uninviting. However, once you cross between the restaurants to the other side, you will find simple, wonderful, inexpensive, fresh out of the water seafood and great Snorkeling. \nI highly recommend this wonderful little escape, you do not need to spend there more than 2-3 hours, but you will enjoy the real, friendly, eager to please locals.

270645891.name: snorkel
270645891.author: a TripAdvisor user
270645891.reviewBody: great snorkeling and great little island for calmer waters and swimming. lots of little places to sit, eat and enjoy friends company great for smaller kids to play in water, and if your lucky you can do a turtle release..

270419224.name: Beautiful beaches and good food!!
270419224.author: a TripAdvisor user
270419224.reviewBody: 10 pesos on bus and 40 pesos per person for water taxi.  DO NOT take tour...$45US...do it yourself!! Awesome beach, great snorkeling and fresh catch seafood!!  DO NOT go on weekends!!

265487326.name: Great place to visit, amazing beaches.
265487326.author: a TripAdvisor user
265487326.reviewBody: Loved the beach and the surrounding areas. Very good food as well! A must visit. The snorkelling isn\'t incredible but it is still pretty fun, calm clear waters.

264712500.name: Good food, good service, couldn\'t ask for more. Fish in the water, too.
264712500.author: a TripAdvisor user
264712500.reviewBody: Take the bus and enhance your experience two ways; save money in your pocketbook and have a new adventure!

264039587.name: Great Place
264039587.author: a TripAdvisor user
264039587.reviewBody: The island is great, such soft sand, and fantastic snorkeling, but so much cheaper to travel their on your own rather than pay for the excursion because your food option for lunch is lacking.

263451733.name: Amazing Experience
263451733.author: a TripAdvisor user
263451733.reviewBody: We watched our 2 girls (9 and 11) experience the dolphins.  What an amazing adventure for them.  Definitely do the 45 minute experience.  The instructor was awesome.  My one daughter always volunteered to go first so she wasn\'t really sure what she was doing so the instructor would jump in the water and help her.   These dolphins are absolutely amazing!

262673674.name: Adventure tour... to Ixtapa Island
262673674.author: a TripAdvisor user
262673674.reviewBody: Great tour!  includes a really beautiful bike ride to LaPlaya.. only 4.5 miles each way but really nice start to the day and guide was very knowledgeable... End at the crocodile location.... also beautiful birds.  Take water taxi to Ixtapa island and kayak.  Was very rough that day but was a lot of fun.  Trip was to include snorkeling on Ixtapa but unfortunately too rough and murky to snorkel.. Lunch was nice and then return by water taxi and bike back.  The biking on the path was my favorite part of our trip!

260911182.name: Relaxing fun
260911182.author: a TripAdvisor user
260911182.reviewBody: Wonderful snorkelling and great beach time.. lotsa fish to see and good time with friends and family.

258737984.name: Fun 1/2 day trip
258737984.author: a TripAdvisor user
258737984.reviewBody: Great 1/2 day trip.  The snorkeling is great. Many fish to see. This is a great place foe the novice snorkler. The restaurants are clean & safe. If you have kids, it\'s a great family outing.

253603917.name: Beautiful peaceful spot.
253603917.author: a TripAdvisor user
253603917.reviewBody: Loved to see the clear water with fish around our feet. Nice restaurants. Peaceful   Great if you snorkel.  We didn\'t. Not much to do other than swim or eat at many restaurants on beach.

252754645.name: Snorkling at the Beach
252754645.author: a TripAdvisor user
252754645.reviewBody: Loved the FOOD!  The staff were so friendly; purchased a number of wonderful wood carvings; relaxing, and a place I would go again!

250968359.name: Nice place to see tropical fish
250968359.author: a TripAdvisor user
250968359.reviewBody: Enjoyed the day sunbathing, swimming, snorkeling etc.. The water is beautiful and fish were easy to see in the shallow water.

249750174.name: Get a guide
249750174.author: a TripAdvisor user
249750174.reviewBody: It was a fun way to spend the day. The boat ride over was great and only 40 pesos a person ($2.80) round trip. We didn\'t have a guide for snorkeling and wish we had, you can find a guide when you get to the island. Many places to eat and drink. All are reasonable.

246756391.name: Snorkeling
246756391.author: a TripAdvisor user
246756391.reviewBody: We visited Ixtapa Island with guide but you can do it by yourself. Take w taxi to Playa Linda then water taxi 40 pesos per person to Island itself. There are 3 beaches there and restaurants right there with great section of food and drinks. Pack snorkeling equipment as there is 300 years old coral to be visited not to far away from main beach itself. There are vendors coming and going all day but if you will say no Thank you or no gracias they go away. Enjoy !!!

203530121.name: Escape the crowded beaches to Ixtapa Island
203530121.author: a TripAdvisor user
203530121.reviewBody: Do not pay the high hotel rates to visit Ixtapa Island..Ride the bus or taxi to Playa Linda and book your own ticket on the water taxi to Ixtapa Island.  Relax at your leisure on the island.  The restaurants on the island have beaches with Palapas and umbrellas with lounge chairs-(free if you order a meal with them.) \n  They provide you with your water, beverages or beer and have menus.  They can even arrange snorkle gear for you...again this is on Ixtapa Island after you have ridden the water taxi.    I ignore the guys who want a tip for helping you on or off the water taxi...you can too.   .

191154569.name: Isla Ixtapa
191154569.author: a TripAdvisor user
191154569.reviewBody:
Snorkeling is the word, though great beaches, interesting food, massages, and nature walks are included at no extra charge.
We took the water taxi, and yes there is a young man waiting to help you off then ask for a tip.  There are many people who offered more service and didn't ask for a tip.  I really think charging a bit more for the trip and paying the helpers would not be so hard on the reputation.  We did give a tip to the helper  of 50 centavos as we had been warned but noted that most did not, and did not appreciate the solicitation.  No one asked on the return trip and it seemed much more professional.
There are numerous restaurants on the smooth beach side and a couple on the snorkel beach side.  Rebecas, the snorkel side, did not rent table but did want you to order.  The shrimp, ceviche, and guacamole were great and moderately priced.  I really like the lemonade there.  
Snorkeling was so fun, there are fish everywhere.  You can guy fish food (which looks amazingly like cat food) to draw the fish but really not necessary as there are lots of fish to see.  There are guided tours which offer a raft to hang onto and guide.

177943943.name: Swimming in an aquarium
177943943.author: a TripAdvisor user
177943943.reviewBody: We had this tour island with swimming, snorkling and sunbathing. The tour includes pick- up, lunch and guide. Our guide is Miguel, he speeks good English. He brought us at Playa Linda, from there we took a small boat at the island. Upon arriving at the site. He told us information about the beach and rules and regulation that it is not aloud to snorkle alone. A swimming vest is compulsary and a complete swimming gears needed because of lots of sea urchin. According to Flip, my husband it is like swimming in an aquarium. He saw a lots of tropical fish, blowfish, eel, etc. I find the water in this area not so clear as in La Ropa. It is because the water is brackish(fresh and sea water).

166274105.name: An afternoon having lunch on a Yatch near the Island
166274105.author: a TripAdvisor user
166274105.reviewBody: We went with my friends yatch near the Ixtapa Island , it\u00b4s a 30 minutes from the beach and apart the food we take with us , you can order a lot of Mexican food there and they bring it from the Island to the boat , it\u00b4s really a relaxing time to be there waiting the sunset.\n

162558709.name: An island. Not sure what you are escaping.  See Marc Anthony.
162558709.author: a TripAdvisor user
162558709.reviewBody: It was a rough boat road to get there from Zihua.  Got there, and they expect a tip for grabbing your hand for helping you off the boat.  (Get a real job.)  We went to the snorkeling side of the island and it was a bit wavy.  Of course we start walking to pick out a place to land on the beach, and one guy after another is almost desperately trying to sell us a table (One of whom stated that the conditions were "perfect" for snorkeling).  We do find a place to crash on the far side of the beach to limit the harassment.  (I will come back to this later).  My gal smartly passed on the snorkeling, but I went anyway because it wasn\'t like were were going to come back anytime soon to experience it.  I snorkeled to one side of the cove, then to the other.  When I reached some coral, There were some nice small fish, a few colorful ones.  Kind of like you would see in a fish tank.  Dummy me, the closer you get to the coral, the wavier it gets, and I got a little scraped up.  That was fine.  I needed a little excitement.  \nThe one very serious recommendation I have is this:  When you get to the beach, walk past ALL of the guys trying to take your pesos for a table until you get to the last place on the beach, to your right as you face the beach.  There was only one other family sitting at the place having a bite to eat.  No one came out to help (believe it or not, it was a relief at that point.).  One guy was prepping to go snorkeling, and I asked him if there was someone I should talk to, since we were using one of the tables.  He said that he would send someone out.  Anyway, we had the BEST guy come out to take care of us.  Marc Anthony (not kidding) came out and asked what we wanted to drink, gave great advice for snorkeling, and was funny.  He actually but out a bucket of beer in ice and said that we could just pay for whatever we drank.  He checked up on my gal while I was out, and he helped me with my scrapes when I got back.  SUPER COOL GUY.  My only recommendation for this island:  On the snorkeling side, go visit Marc Anthony.  He is what made the experience worth it to us.

157211431.name: Paradise
157211431.author: a TripAdvisor user
157211431.reviewBody: Spend the morning in this beautiful Island\nThe most beautiful beaches, you\'ll ever be\nIt\'s safe and paradisal

153881593.name: Snorkel
153881593.author: a TripAdvisor user
153881593.reviewBody: Enjoy swimming and watching the beautiful reef and fish. Walk trough the island and visit all its beaches!

153789013.name: peaceful and beautiful
153789013.author: a TripAdvisor user
153789013.reviewBody: It is a short boat ride to the island and it is worth it. One side is walk in snorkling(rent equipment there) and the other is a war, sandy tranquil beach. The food is great and they have awesome fantasy drinks.

152632357.name: Best of two worlds two beaches
152632357.author: a TripAdvisor user
152632357.reviewBody: This is a really cool Isla.  One side of the beach is tranquillo with super soft sand, light surf and snorkelling.  Just walk through a path to the other side of the isla and there are more people with a rougher beach due to coral etc.. washing up from the reef right in front. Way more people than the other side.  There are about 20 deer on the island.  The Islander make sure the animal have fresh water.  It was a thrill to see the dear.  Love this place.  Later in the day most were gone and the beaches were left spotless. 5 stars for this La Playa too!

151893670.name: snorkling heaven
151893670.author: a TripAdvisor user
151893670.reviewBody: We did the Island twice while down and would loved to have come back more. Had the little hut down on the beach and loved the food, beer and best the snorkeling...

151699706.name: Great snorkeling
151699706.author: a TripAdvisor user
151699706.reviewBody: Best snorkelling in Ixtapa, better than Las Gatas. Good places to stop and eat as well. Easy to get to, quick boat ride across to island 40 pesos.

151083690.name: Best shrimp tacos
151083690.author: a TripAdvisor user
151083690.reviewBody: This is an annual visit for us. We always have the same table and umbrella. We had our customary two buckets of beer, guac and shrimp tacos. These are the best shrimp tacos we have and they will be hard to beat.\nI don\'t snorkel but, Dea does and conditions were excellent. You did have to be careful of the surf. The waves were the biggest I have seen here.\nIsle Ixtapa is an always on our schedule when we are down.

150584911.name: Great escape
150584911.author: a TripAdvisor user
150584911.reviewBody: Pickedup on time returned on time. This a great day trip. The food at the restaurant on the beach that is included was wonderful. Best fish I have had in zih in two weeks. \nGreat snorkeling. You would think you are in Hawaii .\nGino was our guide and stayed and watched all our stuff while we were swimming.

145752414.name: Beautiful Island
145752414.author: a TripAdvisor user
145752414.reviewBody: The trip there was fast and Tony, our tour guide operator was very informative with really interesting information on the area.  We took a small boat over to the island and once we were there it was fun in the sun! We got our snorkelling gear right away and we ordered our lunch meals. They serve very tasty fresh fish and great drinks although we werent sure about the ice on the island as it was not potable water...I had ice in my drink however and was fine so I assume it is packaged ice they get delivered.  We walked over to the other beach and had a wonderful time snorkelling as a group.  Tony made sure that there was lots of fish for us to see by bringing fish food with him and he even swam and got a puffer fish to show us, it was all inflated and SO COOL! We spent the rest of the afternoon swimming and lounging by the beach, even petting a beautiful local parrot who just hangs out at the beach with us! The bathrooms were questionable but that was very minor and didnt matter much. Amazing time!

143494767.name: Good snorkeling
143494767.author: a TripAdvisor user
143494767.reviewBody: Was a good day, probably the calmest waters we found on our trip.  Picked up and dropped back at hotel.

142920520.name: Beautiful relaxing day
142920520.author: a TripAdvisor user
142920520.reviewBody: We did take a tour from amstar tours in the lobby of las brisas hotel.  The money was well worth it.  Our tour guide was very knowledgeable.  He kept us comfortable at all times.  The ride in the car to the marina was air conditioned, many taxis are not.  There were plenty of people to make sure I did not fall in the water getting on the boat and off the boat.  Once on the island ther were plenty of comfortable lawn chairs and palapas for shade.  The water was beautiful and we swam and floated and read books.  So relaxing. The tour provided lunch a drink, fresh fish prepared any way you like guacamole and chips rice andsquash.  Delicious, fresh and good.  Our guide would take us to the other side of the island for snorkeling and to see the deer, but we were happy just to float and relax.  We also went to see the iguanas and alligators in their protected environment.  Awesome trip.  I highly recommend it.  This is one of the top 2 tours, the other one is the sunset catamaran ride.  Must do.

140169543.name: Must visit!
140169543.author: a TripAdvisor user
140169543.reviewBody: We had Juan from Ixtapa Tours take us there. We didn\'t snorkel cuz the water was pretty rough and kinda murky. We did get some food and just drop it in the water and all the beautiful fishes swam around us. We did do the massages so worth it. We also ordered the seafood platter which feed like 6ppl for only 40pesos which is like $38. Highly recommend it. We also saw some great big crocs!

137654754.name: Ixtapa Island
137654754.author: a TripAdvisor user
137654754.reviewBody: This is a fun trip on a 15 minute boat ride to the island. Eateries are situated all along the beach. Take any of them because they\'re all good. Water sports of all kinds on the one side and snorkeling on the other (a very short walk over the hill). Do not take a tour! It\'s way too expensive. Arrange your own transportation for a very fun and reasonably-priced day.

137216203.name: very nice island with 3 beaches to visit,
137216203.author: a TripAdvisor user
137216203.reviewBody: i liked the island, it was very nice, snorkling was good, kayak was good, even though the ocean was wav, the only thing about this tour was the service, we didn{t like. the food was yummy, but the service wasn\u00b4t good enough

486492073.name: ok but not Vegas style
486492073.author: a TripAdvisor user
486492073.reviewBody: small casino in Ixtapa,,,good for slots but table games are not as good...house rules are confusing and accordingly are losing...good for an hour or so is you are so inclined.

address.streetAddress: Blvd Ixtapa Diversion

469467312.name: Fun Casino
469467312.author: a TripAdvisor user
469467312.reviewBody: Tiny little casino but lots of fun. First drink is free and at about 11pm the servers bring around free bowls of soup and tortillas.  we played black jack and slots and went home winners from both.

address.streetAddress: Blvd Ixtapa Diversion

464762464.name: Very small....almost funny....weird business  hours?
464762464.author: a TripAdvisor user
464762464.reviewBody: We never did actually play here...walked there a couple of times during the day but they were closed. No hours of operation posted. One evening on the way to dinner they were open so we peeked in.... Super small...like one room casino. I wish they would have been open when we had the time to stop....might have been fun to gamble with pesos.

address.streetAddress: Blvd Ixtapa Diversion

451726040.name: Fun
451726040.author: a TripAdvisor user
451726040.reviewBody: We played  a few  slots  and lost  60 pescos.   Different  than Las Vegas  but worth  saying you  were  there ...

address.streetAddress: Blvd Ixtapa Diversion

444358141.name: Service and Beverages
444358141.author: a TripAdvisor user
444358141.reviewBody: Surprised to find this casino.  Fun and it paid out winnings\nwith no problem.  Great premium drinks.  Management\nfriendly.

address.streetAddress: Blvd Ixtapa Diversion

438254883.name: Nice Casino
438254883.author: a TripAdvisor user
438254883.reviewBody: One of the nicest casinos we have visited in Mexico. First drink on the house for players and inexpensive afterwards. Smoking allowed in table game area. Blackjack tables had 50 peso minimum bet. Would return again.

address.streetAddress: Blvd Ixtapa Diversion

407125337.name: Nice place to visit
407125337.author: a TripAdvisor user
407125337.reviewBody: The casino was easy to get to, very close to shopping and restaurants.  What I liked the most (as it was low season and very hot and humid), is that the WinClub is the only place we ever found with air conditioning.  There is about 50 slot machines, and after 4pm, they open a back room that has a blackjack table, a texas holdem table, and maybe two other tables.  Service was great.  No smoking in the slot area, but you can smoke in the back room with the table games.  The bar was a lot more upscale than I was expecting and the drinks were good.  Visited the casino three times during our 2 week trip.

address.streetAddress: Blvd Ixtapa Diversion

423535017.name: Little treasure chest
423535017.author: a TripAdvisor user
423535017.reviewBody: This is a small art museum located on the lovely CUC campus in Ixtapa. It is next to the reptile enclosure which is interesting in itself. The art museum with it\'s friendly staff and student assistants has special exhibits that change and has permanent art. There is a guarded parking lot that you can park in and then it\'s a short walk (signs will direct you) to the art museum. It is not open on the weekends. They have limited resources which makes finding information about the museum difficult. If you have time, it\'s best to go and check it out and enjoy!

address.streetAddress: Av Universidad 203, Delegation Ixtapa Centro Universidad de la Costa

189115935.name: A Crown Jewel of the Puerto Vallarta Art Scene!
189115935.author: a TripAdvisor user
189115935.reviewBody:
My previous review was mis-located to Ixtapa, Mexico and I have not been able to correct it.  Actually, in Puerto Vallarta, The Peter Gray Art Museum is on the campus of Centro Universidad de la Costa (CUC), a University of Guadalajara Branch.   Taking a taxi was easiest. 

It was a gem with an extensive art collection on display ranging in scope from 18th Century to more contemporary work, by Mexican and International artists, both paintings and sculptures.  Prominent artists on display include: Joan Miro, Beatriz Castaneda, Carlos Merida, Jose Luis Cuevas, Pedro Coronel, and Pedro Friedeberg, among others. It was delightful!  My family and I will go again any time we visit Puerto Vallarta.

Peter Gray was a strong advocate for many local cultural activities and the museum was named in his honor in 2005. With his passing, responsibility for the museum passed to a non-profit Board that includes his wife, Buri Gray.  She is also on the City Cultural Commission.  For further information regarding the museum contact Buri Gray at (322) 221-5285.

address.streetAddress: Av Universidad 203, Delegation Ixtapa Centro Universidad de la Costa

165582252.name: World Renowned and Highly Regarded Local Art on Display!
165582252.author: a TripAdvisor user
165582252.reviewBody: What a cultural gem of a museum!  Located on the beautiful campus at the University of Guadalajara for Puerto Vallarta, Mexico called Centro Universitario de la Costa (CUC) the visit is well worth the effort.  Some works were previously exhibited in the Louvre Museum in Paris.  There is a wide variety of art in oil, watercolor and charcoal.  Also, beautiful tapestries are shown, along with works from well known Puerto Vallarta artists, such as, Barragan, Meg Munro and Ada Colorina. Telephone Hector at 044 322 17 46 053 or 044 322 13 25 215 to be sure the museum will be open.  Enjoy yourself, I did!

address.streetAddress: Av Universidad 203, Delegation Ixtapa Centro Universidad de la Costa

668392419.name: Challenging course ... but a forgotten one.
668392419.author: a TripAdvisor user
668392419.reviewBody: We are avid golfers ... and when going on vacations Golf Clubs are a part of our luggage. \nWe heard about this course and was only 10min away from our hotel, always a great option when wanting to come back quickly.\nThe Course was pretty bang up after the Quake in 2017 ... and this has taken a toll on its once beautiful fairways and challenging sand traps. The last ones are non existing now, so grass has replaced the sand. The course its pretty challenging and a tough one at parts, this makes it a cool one to do, but you feel left out of the full experience when you have to Winter Rule your ball at almost every two or three holes. But still for the price and closeness ... and if you are not an demanding golfer ... then you are good to go in it ... just remember to bring cheap or second hand balls ... cause well ... I lost over 12 new balls in the course of 3 days.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

663756280.name: Disappointed
663756280.author: a TripAdvisor user
663756280.reviewBody: We visited the Marina course in mid March. This course appears to have suffered severe storm damage some time ago and has not been restored. The course is in very poor shape and we would not recommend it.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

656061600.name: Don\'t waste your time or money
656061600.author: a TripAdvisor user
656061600.reviewBody: This golf course has been going downhill for a number of years and has now hit rock bottom.  The bridges, all 7  over lagoons with crocodiles swimming below are frightening. They are held together with barbed wire and tree trunks. Fairways are thin and need of re-seeding and some holes are missing grass. Bunkers have been let go, full of weeds, no sand. Greens aren\'t bad. Not enough carts, had to wait 45 minutes for carts to come in. We waited in what had been a bar with broken chairs and the palm roof mostly missing. I feel sorry for the staff, they do try but are fighting a losing battle.  Unless the owner puts some money into this course it will remain a goat track.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

614156409.name: To Spend a couple of hours walking
614156409.author: a TripAdvisor user
614156409.reviewBody: Just an amazing place to see the sunset. You can also see some crocodiles in their natural habitat. Its quiet and perfect to finish your day if you go in family.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

583729872.name: So Much Potential!
583729872.author: a TripAdvisor user
583729872.reviewBody: We really enjoyed our round during our recent vacation.  The place has so much potential.  There was almost no one else golfing, so that likely explains why there is not much income available to be put back into the course.  \nThe layout is great with a variety of holes.  There is water hazards on most of them and sand traps that are becoming waste bunkers.  The fairways and greens aren\'t terrible, but some attention would go a long way to bringing the course up to where it should be.\nThe staff are nice and the pro is very accommodating.  The front desk isn\'t open too early in the morning, but we golfed and paid after we were done.  It is wise to get out fairly early so that you don\'t have to play during the heat of the day.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

568235640.name: Great Experience, but needs improvements
568235640.author: a TripAdvisor user
568235640.reviewBody: Ixtapa is hot and humid when we visited this March of 2018, mucho callor,  in the afternoon so it is best to play in the morning before the sweltering afternoon heat.\nI played around 10 Am and my wife came along as a rider. The golf cart had almost no brakes and could use some TLC, but it did the job. The bridges over the canals where a bit rickety and scary with many Crocs underneath them on guard, but all this amounted to a fine 9 holes of affordable tropical golf with Iguanas and raptors running around like it is Jurassic Park. 850 pesos for a very fun morning of golf although I wish the course was watered better and the sand traps fixed up, someone needs to rake the leaves, a little love would go a long way on this otherwise spectacular golf course.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

567371559.name: Golf Course needs some work
567371559.author: a TripAdvisor user
567371559.reviewBody: Puckco the caddie looked after us really well.  The golf course at one time must have been great.  Since the hurricane no one has fixed the damage done still had a good round with friends.  Some money and maintenance would make this a great course again.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

563500648.name: Fantastic greens with desert fairways...
563500648.author: a TripAdvisor user
563500648.reviewBody:
The green fee was same as Palma Real Golf Course as 1600 pesos before 2:00pm, after that apply as twilight 1000 pesos.
The power cart was not working the break. Ooooops.... there are many bridges over the waterways and may appear alligators in front of you... At the 3rd hole, we met a worker who drive a cart, then we asked to exchange the cart with his, but that was just a little bit better.

Because of the area climate( I believe), most of the fairways are not good conditions even a lot of irrigation. The distances between holes are long more than enough. It’s not recommendable to play without a power cart.
The greens are almost fantastic condition compare to the other things.
It’s very interesting course, if I have a chance to visit this city, I have to come back again to play a round of golf.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

560137470.name: A good course - a great experience - and an amazing value
560137470.author: a TripAdvisor user
560137470.reviewBody: I\'ve played golf at the Marina every time I\'ve visited Ixtapa - it\'s a sentimental favorite. There are some areas in need of care - three or four parts of fairways where grass was killed from flooding a few years ago that have not been repaired. But the tee boxes are in good shape - and greens are in very good condition. The layout of the course is fantastic - challenging, yet fun. And you\'ll likely see a chameleon or a crocodile. The staff has included the same friendly faces every year (Paco has been driving the beverage cart there 15 or 16 years!) The other course in Ixtapa (Palma Real) gets the majority of the play, understandably. The benefit is that you can play a round at the Marina in 3 hours. If you are only going to play once, and are used to name-brand championship golf courses in more luxurious Mexican vacation destinations such as Cabo - then I might suggest you pass on golf and enjoy other activities. But if you are from a northern area like me (Minnesota), you might enjoy a round in 85 degree sunshine and a light ocean breeze at the Marina.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

557985636.name: Great layout - excellent value
557985636.author: a TripAdvisor user
557985636.reviewBody: Having read some of the negative reviews, I was at first hesitant to play the Marina Ixtapa golf club. However, I had played it 12 years ago and it kicked my butt so I wanted some revenge. I arrived early by taxi (7:15 am). It was clear the facilities were somewhat run down. I was told I could head out right away and pay later as the pro shop wasn\'t open yet. There was a heckuva clatter as I drove over the bridge to the first tee (some wooden slats had been replaced with tree limbs - there were several such bridges throughout the course). However, I never felt unsafe as the main structure of the bridges is steel. I played through a couple on the second hole and after that felt like I had the whole course to myself. I do remember the course being more lush 12 years ago. However, I was pleasantly surprised at the overall condition. The fairways were fine (except one washed out area on the 8th) and the rough wasn\'t bad at all. No complaints about the greens either - a few had bare spots but that didn\'t seem to affect the putts. In fact I had 6 one-putts and one 3-putt which is considerably better than my average. I did notice that there was very little sand in the traps, but I was fortunate to have gone in only one (a fairway trap) the whole round. The course design is excellent with a variety of holes. I found it very playable (i.e. not that hard to keep it in play off the tee as long has you aren\'t too crooked). The finish is as dynamic as it gets with the pretty 154 yard par 3 17th requiring a carry mostly over water where I saw an alligator to add to the excitement. Then their signature hole the demanding 570 yard par 5 18th with water all down the left. I was finished in less than 3 hours. And, it was 34% cheaper than the neighboring Palma Real. About the only negative was that parking brake of my golf cart didn\'t work, but I managed to get around without it as the course is quite flat. Oh, and I beat my previous score from 12 years ago by 8 strokes adding to my enjoyment. If you are looking for a well-designed, challenging course at good value and are willing to overlook some imperfections, this course will not disappoint.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

555421729.name: Beyond Terrible
555421729.author: a TripAdvisor user
555421729.reviewBody: Horrible condition.  Bridges falling apart.  No brakes except the stop break on the rickety old golf cart.  Lots of dead areas with no grass.  Cost was 1,050 pesos - more than the Robert Trent Jones course at Palma Real which is in much better shape. Would not play again.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

546095299.name: "Fairway good, rough lose ball"
546095299.author: a TripAdvisor user
546095299.reviewBody:
So I thought I would review since most of the reviews are old.  I played both Ixtapa courses, Ixtapa golf course and the Marina in November of 2017.  While planning my trip I had trouble figuring out which course was which as the names have changed over the years I guess.  There are only two, Ixtapa is at the south end of Ixtapa and the Marina is more North.

Anyway, while playing Ixtapa I was talking to Francisco the caddy and he told me "fairway good, rough lose ball" and boy that was the truth.  Apparently they no longer have the equipment to adequately take care of the rough.  I am a 12 handicap, played well and lost three balls that on any other course would have been easily found.  A foot out of the fairway and you are searching.  

The fairways are tight, quite a few dead patches, but playable.  You take your life in your hands crossing the bridges, broken boards have been repaired with tree branches.  Our cart was mostly dead after 14.  I walked in while my wife drove the cart.  I walked faster than the cart.  Greens are fast and mostly really good.  Some great views.

Everyone was fantastic.  The staff doesn't arrive until late so Francisco the caddy just had us play and we paid for our round afterward.  The beer cart guy was all over us, probably came by every two holes.  The woman at front desk recommended a restaurant for lunch and called us a cab afterward.

The clubhouse is a fantastic old building and the course has great bones, they just need to throw some money at it.  It is a sad state of affairs but I would play it again.

Our cab driver had trouble finding it, there isn't any signage, when you see the tennis courts with the trees growing out of it, you are 20 yards away on the right.

Ask for Francisco the caddy, give him your golf schedule and he will meet you at either course.  He says he is about a 10 handicap and was very good with reads and suggestions.  His English is way better than my Spanish.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

460315256.name: watch out for the crocdiles ...........
460315256.author: a TripAdvisor user
460315256.reviewBody:
While on a recent vacation to  " Zihua " we enjoyed a few rounds of golf , well  if you are the adventurous type  then this is a course for you ......
WILD life in abundance , is just part of the round , forget about looking for a stray ball you may not return to the greens .....
18 holes of challenging golf await you , thankfully a  refreshment buggy comes round with cold refreshments .
Oscar and his team of caddies and groundstaff are pleasant and helpfull on you round .
my only concern was the state of the bridges !!!!!! the wooden slats were once in a better condition , but hey you are in Mexico ...... 
no pressure from behind so a relaxed round is guaranteed .
well worth the visit.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

455164328.name: Great challenge of golf with nice views
455164328.author: a TripAdvisor user
455164328.reviewBody: I love playing this golf course by Robert Trent Jones.  Challenging, great greens, nice fariways, and beautiful views.  The grain of the greens will be a factor in putting!  The sand traps need some attention, but otherwise a great experience.  Enjoy the nice folks working there.  You will see iguanas and crocodiles.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

453592071.name: Decent course
453592071.author: a TripAdvisor user
453592071.reviewBody: Nice layout some challenging holes. Definitely play early morning as it got very hot in the afternoon. The staff was friendly and helpful.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

451358078.name: so much potential
451358078.author: a TripAdvisor user
451358078.reviewBody: Second year in a row playing this golf course.  I am  not an expert and only played for the last 4 years or so but was disappointed that this golf course was not in better shape. Last year, much was said about being under construction on fairways, etc.   Nothing much has happened since then.  No golf shirts or anything in what could be one of the most beautiful 19th holes around.  It is cheap but there is a reason why.  Sure hope the owner  can either spend some money and get it in the shape it could be or sells to someone who will.  There are many bridges around the course that you sometimes feel you are taking your life chances going across them in the cart.  I have hope for this course as it could be a truly beautiful place to enjoy golf.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

444728310.name: Casual course. Interesting lay out. Not overly challenging
444728310.author: a TripAdvisor user
444728310.reviewBody: We played mid week and teed off at 2 pm. Had the course to ourselves. Rental clubs are not the greatest but they are fine for a round. Watch out for the crocodiles!!!!!\nSome very nice views on the ocean side.  Our round only took 3 and a half hours.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

444260038.name: Would be great if they worked on it.
444260038.author: a TripAdvisor user
444260038.reviewBody: Cow pasture, Just terrible.  Old Not so good rental clubs. If taken care of it could be better than and another choice for golf besides Palma Real.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

423615366.name: great place
423615366.author: a TripAdvisor user
423615366.reviewBody: We went for a walk down there beautiful well kept cant wait to go back and enjoy the peaceful life that this place offers.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

417245369.name: The course well kept and the caddy very friendly
417245369.author: a TripAdvisor user
417245369.reviewBody: The condition in February and March was very well played at least 3  a week and was there for 82 days  Did not play in January  very friendly  people love it

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

363741843.name: Course just comiining into its own
363741843.author: a TripAdvisor user
363741843.reviewBody: For some reason this nice course has taken a while to mature, but now the trees are starting to grow and provide some shade along the way. I would suggest golfing early in the morning as part of the course has little shade and gets very warm.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

358769113.name: Great layout but no maintenance
358769113.author: a TripAdvisor user
358769113.reviewBody: The price is right, half of Palm Real, layout is challenging and professionally designed, and there is simply no maintenance going on.  All the sand traps have been emptied, they are rock and clay, fairways and greens unplanted, watered and dying, the bridges are like out of an Indianan Jones movie, I don\'t know what is going on.   Either they put some work into this place or it will be dead and closed soon.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

357824338.name: great potential
357824338.author: a TripAdvisor user
357824338.reviewBody: A great layout that is in critical need of maintenance. I hope someone buys it and puts some money in it. Condition in January was not good. They do have the best greens of the two courses in Ixtapa.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

354831270.name: Great Greens and Friendly service
354831270.author: a TripAdvisor user
354831270.reviewBody:
We preferred The Marina over the Campo course. We played the Campo course (Palma Real course) first. And then we went to The Marina course. After playing the Marina course , My wife and I decided not to go back to the Campo course. The staff was Friendlier at the Marina and the  service was great. The greens were perfect. A couple fairways were thin and might need some more sand in the bunkers but other than that we loved the course. That's another reason why we played the Marina course 3 times. With a little more money the Marina course would be a 5 star course. Beautiful scenery and  with crocodiles.
Vicki in the pro shop was super friendly.
The Caddie master was excellent. 
The grounds crew was excellent and friendly.
Francisco the Beer cart man was excellent. He took great care of us. He would ask us what hole we would like to see him next and he would promptly show up at that hole. 
Francisco our Caddie made the whole trip!! He was fantastic. He caddied for us every round and he was on time waiting for us at the car park to take our clubs. He was a 5 star caddie in every respect.

We cant wait to go back to Ixtapa a play the Marina course next year and have Francisco caddie for us.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

345253755.name: Very poor conditions
345253755.author: a TripAdvisor user
345253755.reviewBody: Title says it all...... Really wanted to say something nice :(\nPaid full price - no negotiation possible.....Absolutely not worth the price to play...

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

342143431.name: Well worth playing- yet lack of investment hinders the course potential
342143431.author: a TripAdvisor user
342143431.reviewBody:
In February 2013, I posted a review on TA about this course called “Possibly a New Life!” (refer to this for a more detailed description and narrative).  Unfortunately, this has not happened since the owner, who develops local real estate, has not committed the necessary resources to infrastructure (bunker, fairway repairs and solving the salt water seepage) other than daily maintenance.  Also, the former GM, Tim Sullivan the architect of the course improvements, is no longer there.

So, this leaves the course in the hands of some very dedicated and passionate local works who with limited resources try to make the best with what they have and of Mother Nature ensuring enough rain water to take care of this course located in a normally dry geographic area in the winter.

On the “Plus” side-
-	Excellent caddies and friendly staff
-	Good price and fast round
-	Challenging course
-	Fast and frequent beverage cart … with good bloody Mary’s

On the “Minus” side-
-	Lack of critical overall investment has clipped the course’s potential, shame.

As in previous ones, I have divided the review into a variety of topics for a more expanded description:

Course design and layout- upgraded to 4 from 3 stars

The course architect, Robert von Hagge, is an extremely experienced and prolific golf course architect.  He has built many courses around the world with his signature small mound course contour.  

One nice option is that there are four different tee boxes which appeal to a variety of golfing capabilities.  Even though the course it not particularly long, 6700 from the Blue/Championship, 6300 from the white and 5700 from the yellow tees, it demands in accuracy with each shot.  With considerable water on the course and bunkers, you need to plan your shots.

For now, there are no houses on the course (although it is has a plan for this type of development).  Hence, you are playing with a very natural eye-pleasing surrounding.  The abundance of local flora and fauna makes it a great nature preserve for these animals.  Add to this a moister season in 2015 and for these winter months and the greenery is very striking.  

This is the motive for the upgrade.

Conditions- downgrade to 1.5 from 2.5 stars

The course requires some significant investment of dollars.  The main issue is that the course was built on a mangrove.  Without proper drainage and years soil settlement including the 2014 earthquake of a 7.2 magnitude, the course has serious salt water seepage from the Marina next door.  

On the front nine, the fairways on Holes 5 and 8 (two great holes by the way) are dead zones.  The left side of the green on the second hole is a mosh pit.  While the 9th hole which is visually appealing and requires a target 1st and 2nd golf shot is a “mess” from 135 yards into the green.

The back nine seems to have less damage and confined to the fairway of the 12th hole which also will require two well struck shots for a par.

The bunkers are not something you want to get into and are proximate to industrial quarry pits.  Although, after I removed the ubiquitous rocks leaving hard-pan dirt, the shot turned out okay with great backspin.  

The Bermuda greens are properly cared for, fertilized and cut so that the grain is relatively consistent and the roll of the ball is true.  The greater seasonal rain created moister greens so you can aim for the flagstick and your ball will pitch and stop.  Yet, the excess water has caused some damage for instance on the 16th hole.

Notwithstanding these serious impediments, you can have a satisfying round.

Price- still 4.0 stars … can even add a ½ star due to favorable currency exchange

The course has maintained a very smart policy of multi-round packages for golfers including senior pricing, hotel pricing and twilight rates- Kudos as it is a competitive advantage.

The packages range from 4 to 50 rounds.  I purchased the 4 round package for 3,200 pesos converting to a total of $213 USD or $53 per round.  The stronger USD has its advantages since the actual exchange is more like 18 pesos to the dollar making the price per round $44 USD.

If the package deal is not for you based on your playing frequency and length of stay, you can choose the individual round hotel or twilight rate ranging from $850/$900 pesos, around $56 USD or $77 CAN.

I also availed myself of a caddie for all the rounds.  The cost is very reasonable, $300 pesos plus tip.  I would strongly encourage my fellow players to hire a caddie.  Apart from helping the local staff, you are benefitting from local course knowledge, assistance with locating balls (and you will indeed need that) and understanding the greens.

Pace of Play- still 4.5 stars

The pace of play was excellent.  Perhaps given the course condition which has (unfortunately) scared off golfers, I found very few golfers.  Although in prior years’ visits, I never found there to be an issue.  If one tees off in the morning between 7/8am, it is nice and cool.  Yet, do not discount the afternoon 2pm tee times and later tee times to benefits from the refreshing ocean breeze.

Staff- 4.5 stars

All the staff is very friendly and welcoming.  My caddie, Marana', was superb and a quite a philosopher.  The beverage cart frequently makes the rounds and has plenty of choice in drinks with strong bloody Mary’s!

In summary, do not discount this course altogether since it does have its merits, variety and enjoyment.  My golf game rewarded me with 5 birdies on one round to three triples on another!  

But that’s golf and why we continue to come back.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

336004679.name: A great test of golf.
336004679.author: a TripAdvisor user
336004679.reviewBody: Beautiful layout.between hole 5 and 8 always washed out from storms.repair was done by building raised playing areas.greens are usually good. Fun to play.staff is very friendly and beer cart comes often whenever I\'m there .multty game package is available as far as I know. Visited jan. 2015 and going back jan. And feb. 2016. I will update next year.     Brent Clague  winnipeg

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

335238780.name: very sad to see!!!
335238780.author: a TripAdvisor user
335238780.reviewBody: this course has the \'bones\' of something great, actually felt that it had a better concept and more challenging design than the Palma but grossly neglected.  the front nine is under repair and virtually ungolfable.  Very frustrating to not be able to strategize your game.  the back nine is fair but none of the bunkers have had any care and the greens are in need of attention.  The bonus?? less costly than the Palma and less costly than many of Mexican courses.  Encourage you to golf at twilight and do the back nine.  still fun.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

335087649.name: Not good
335087649.author: a TripAdvisor user
335087649.reviewBody: This is not really a golf course; it is a bad design, completely uninteresting, has no shade or trees or redeeming features and is in the middle of a bug infested swamp

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

299428669.name: YOU ARE IN MEXICO-NOT AUGUSTA
299428669.author: a TripAdvisor user
299428669.reviewBody: This is an old Robert Trent Jones course with naturally slow greens, but, great layout and fairways. One slightly on the Pacific\'s crashing waves, all within a few 4 irons form the ocean. Bring your clubs, cause clubs rented are old. Still, super friendly and beautiful course to play.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

257285363.name: Interesting
257285363.author: a TripAdvisor user
257285363.reviewBody:
Better golf course than the Palma Real course. Greens were awesome but some fairways need lots of work. 

Very challenging (12 handi cap). Bunkers need some more sand. 

Over all, cheaper than the other course, nobody out there, bring a caddie if you plan on playing yourself.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

252519278.name: Wasted potential, what a shame
252519278.author: a TripAdvisor user
252519278.reviewBody: Most people play at the Palma Real course and now I know why. We played here once in Jan/15 just to check it out for ourselves. This course has a great layout and so much potential. I\'m sure it was beautiful and a great play back in the day. It appears the course has been majorly flooded at some point. Huge sections of multiple fairways are nothing more than sunbaked mud/dirt. What used to be sand traps are either filled with course gravel that I wouldn\'t even swing a rental club in or have become weed beds. The various bridges over the many water hazards feel like they could give way at any moment. We could not park on any type of incline because the golf cart we were given had no brakes.\n\nRemarkably the greens were actually pretty good for the most part. We saw no evidence of any restoration work. It appears they have just given up. If this course was in half decent conditioin it would be a better, more interesting play than Palma Real.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

250576576.name: Vacation golf
250576576.author: a TripAdvisor user
250576576.reviewBody: There are two golf courses in Ixtapa. I choose to play Marina because the pace of play is under four hours for 18 holes. There are some rough patches but some challenging holes as well. Always have a good time

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

248528824.name: an adventure
248528824.author: a TripAdvisor user
