248528824.reviewBody: I am being kind. The layout isn\'t bad but what a dump!. I will struggle not to use the word dump too often. Crappy clubhouse. Indifferent staff. Old carts with no brakes so you have to plan how to stop. Bridges, of which there are many, that you fear to cross as the skinny planks are broken and could give way at any moment. Absolutely no sand in any bunkers, just hard pan crud. And they wanted a $100 US! . The place is devoid of golfers so what part of the golf business don\'t they understand. All of it. Still, in spite of all this, an interesting golf adventure

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

244585381.name: WildForestReview
244585381.author: a TripAdvisor user
244585381.reviewBody: By most standards this track is needs work. Rates are high and the course needs maintainence. Get the twilight rate for a better deal. The carts are old and don\'t get a caddie. Of the two courses  that are available, this one is has very little shade. Bring a hat.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

244431026.name: Marina golf
244431026.author: a TripAdvisor user
244431026.reviewBody: After 2pm  is a discounted price.Went before the tourist season, so the course needed a little work.Watch for the crocs on the water hazards.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

240171540.name: An enjoyable experience!
240171540.author: a TripAdvisor user
240171540.reviewBody:
I have been going to Ixtapa for almost 40 years.  Appox 15 years ago, I golfed the other golf course - found the staff rude and most discourteous (query a single female golfer)- reluctant to let a single out even when the course was deserted.  The scenery was great.

Four years ago, I tried again at the Marina course and did 7-10 rounds for each of my visits.  Staff were courteous, made sure I had a good time and offered up advice about safety on the course - as I went out alone.  When looking for a ball, staff on the course joined in to help me find it.  Did have some local men who seemed annoyed - it is hard not to get too close when you get a good shot.  
  
There has been work on the course but detours have been well marked.  Beverage cart came by at least once each round.  I store my clubs at the club and feel very comfortable.  It would be nice if there were items in the pro shop as souvenirs.  I agree that the pro shop is difficult to find the first time.  I look forward to trying out the restaurant after reading the great reviews.

I would appreciate it  if the web site would indicate if package rates are available for multiple rounds.  However, we will be in Ixtapa in 10 days and enjoying three weeks of golf - in weather that is much better than -20C.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

239335635.name: SAD BUT TRUE
239335635.author: a TripAdvisor user
239335635.reviewBody: Have played the marina course many times over the years, and haven`t been there for 3 yrs now. Sad to read the recent reviews. Going again for a month this  nov15th, and will probably take my clubs to give it a try. I emailed the course manager and even the minister of tourism 3 yrs ago on our last visit. Told them their only problem down there is CHARGING WAY TOO MUCH TO GOLF AT MARINA. If they charged $40 a round, it would be FULL of high handicap golfers who don`t mind a cow trail to golf on, as long as its affordable. WE just wanna go out bang a few balls , have a few beers and laughs and enjoy the views and weather.\n  AM VERY GLAD to see there is a reply from "TIM" the manager. I hope he`s someone who can talk some sense into the strange folks that run golf in IXTAPA.  HERE`S HOPING. smerkal

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

236517321.name: Puzzling
236517321.author: a TripAdvisor user
236517321.reviewBody: I\'m an avid golfer with a single-digit handicap and have played all over the world.  Based on several favorable reviews here, I was looking forward to playing Marina Ixtapa.  What a joke!  It\'s hard to find, with no decent signs.  The parking lot is small.  The pro shop - when we finally found it - was closed, and we had a hard time rousing staff to take our money.  No posted prices.  We ended up paying cash to a couple of folks we found in the cart garage, about $100 each for greens fees, cart, and trashy rental clubs.  The route to the first tee took us over one of several rickety bridges on the course that we always felt were in danger of collapsing.  Someone on the first hole offered to sell us beverages, but that was the last we saw of any staff till we finished.  My cart had bald tires and squishy brakes.  My companions\' cart had no brakes.  The condition of the course would be improved if they turned it over to a herd of goats.  I challenge you to find a local muny in the States in worse condition.  The tee boxes and fairways were weeds and crabgrass, the greens were shaggy, and the bunkers were dirt.  The puzzling thing about this place, considering its condition, is the layout:  it\'s just brilliant.  Every hole is interesting and subtle, with good length, smart positioning of mounds, water, and bunkers. The four finishing holes are about as challenging as I\'ve seen anywhere.  Overall, it\'s like finding a gem of a course that\'s been abandoned.  A real shame.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

229333551.name: Nice course
229333551.author: a TripAdvisor user
229333551.reviewBody: Nicest golf course in Ixtapa.  Liked the the course, nice setting can be very challenging. Nothing I didn\'t like about it.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

206973216.name: Not much left after years of neglect
206973216.author: a TripAdvisor user
206973216.reviewBody: On arrival, the course seemed quiet with hardly any one in sight, including golfers.  We got our cart and putted on the practice green which as it turned out was much slower then the greens on the course.  Off to the first tee over a rickety bridge, the first of many, and as it\'s planks rattled, we were wondering if it was going to give out.  The course showed signs of pedigree in its layout and mounding but many years of neglect made fairways hardly discernible from the rough.  Weeds had taken over most fairways.  We also noticed what appeared to have been recent flooding which left large sections of \'fairways\' unplayable.  Bunkers were a wasteland without sand .... and of course no need for rakes.  The only acceptable part of the course were the greens which ran true and at decent speed.\nWe finished our round at a good pace having encountered only one other group, determined never to return to this course again.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

205726325.name: Enjoyable layout
205726325.author: a TripAdvisor user
205726325.reviewBody: I decided to see if I could fit in a round of golf during a visit to Ixtapa.  I took a cab to the Marina Ixtapa and asked if I could get a round in as a single player. The staff was courteous  and set me up with some rental clubs and a caddy.  I was off to the first tee within 10 minutes.  I had never had my own caddy before so I decided to ask a few questions. He gave me some excellent advice on the first tee. He said "hit the ball straight!"  I laughed out loud and then hit one of the straightest longest drives of my life!  So maybe his obvious advice made me relax. The rest of the round was not as good as the first tee drive. I lost a few balls in the water. I found this course to be pretty challenging. It is kept in decent shape. Not the worst I have ever played.  I thought the greens were a little bumpy but I am not the worlds best putter anyways. But all in all I really enjoyed playing here and it was a memorable experience.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

202071629.name: Super Golf and Fun
202071629.author: a TripAdvisor user
202071629.reviewBody: If you are looking to play a challenge then the Marina is your choice. The fairways are firm and the greens are tough. A good caddy will help with green reading and where to aim off the tee and place shots on the par 5\'s and short par 4\'s. The fairways are narrow and lined with moguls and salt water canals. You cannot help but enjoy the round and the beautiful scenery. Listen for the Chachalaca along the fairways as the singles and pairs raise a ruckus. You most likely will not see them, but you sure will hear them. Go to this url to listen. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=egFWcCRf6SA&list=PL8587169D835AF91A\nIf you didn\'t have a chance to meet Tim Sullivan, General Manager when you checked in for your round then stop by the pro shop on your way out. Eat a super breakfast on the veranda after your morning round and enjoy. I am sure you will want to come back for another round.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

200998390.name: Beautiful, but tough course
200998390.author: a TripAdvisor user
200998390.reviewBody: The course was absolutely beautiful, they are still working on fixing it up after it suffered some damage a few years ago but still in good shape considering. It was my first two rounds of golf this year so my score wasn\'t very great but I enjoyed myself both rounds. Defiantly worth the money, apprx $102 USD  which included the cart. The staff were extremely friendly and I will be going back next time I am in Ixtapa.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

198964572.name: Golf at the Marina
198964572.author: a TripAdvisor user
198964572.reviewBody: It is a good golf course. The greens are more consistent and faster than Palma Real.  Not a lot of shade - bring sunscreen!

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

198639559.name: Great course!
198639559.author: a TripAdvisor user
198639559.reviewBody: The Marina Golf Club is a very well deigned, well routed golf course.  Every hole is unique and well thought out.  It\'s in need of some money to enhance the presentation. It wouldn\'t take much to make it one of the best golf courses in Southern Mexico.  We live in Ixtapa most of the winter and play there often.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

198569628.name: Beautiful Marina and Golf views
198569628.author: a TripAdvisor user
198569628.reviewBody: Gorgeous golf club and marina, nice ambience surrounded by restaurants and bar. Good service and location in the middle of Ixtapa.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

198116724.name: My 11 golf games at the Marina Golf Course February 2014
198116724.author: a TripAdvisor user
198116724.reviewBody:
My family and I have been coming to Zihuatanejo, for the last seven years.  We usually stay for about three weeks, and I try to golf at the Marina course in nearby Ixtapa about 6 six times during our visit.  This year, we were there from February 1-22 and I hit the jackpot as I was able to golf 11 times during our stay.  One of my friends played with me for our 1st six games, and then another friend came and we played five more games.

I have to say, the course was in the best shape I have seen in the last seven years, particularly the greens.  I had the pleasure of meeting Tim, the new manager of the course who is doing an excellent job in making Marina golf course the best it possibly can be.  I have never seen so many people working on the course doing all sorts of maintenance.  Hopefully, Tim will be able to get new sand for the bunkers to make them more playable before I come back next year.

We used a terrific caddie, Umberto who was unbelievable finding our golf balls no matter where we hit them.  I highly recommend using one of the caddies.

Tim and his staff were incredibly friendly and welcoming to their golf course.  One could sense the pride they take in improving it in some way every day. I highly recommend the Marina course to all.

I look forward to our next visit next February. Hasta proximo anno!

Jerry from Canada and his friends Len and Bruce

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

197338526.name: Best course in the area
197338526.author: a TripAdvisor user
197338526.reviewBody:
The Marina Course has an exceptionally imaginative design. The course appears to occupy more acreage that it actually does through the architect's creative use of sand mounding to isolate the parallel holes from each other. Good offerings of risk reward shots with a premium on accuracy verses distance.
The course was in very good condition despite the drought conditions.
The course has a friendly and helpful American pro and the clubhouse sports an inviting bar.
By far the best course in the area and well worth playing.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

195723849.name: Great times
195723849.author: a TripAdvisor user
195723849.reviewBody: We have come to Ixtapa many times since 2001, and golf is always part of the holiday. We spent 3 weeks there from January 18, 2014.  Both my husband and I bought 2 four-packs for 8 rounds each.  It worked out to about $75 per round with cart. As the back nine had just opened,  that part of the course was a little overgrown the first week, but the maintenance crews were awesome.  They were out there every day in that heat working to bring the course "up to par".  By the 3rd week, it was in good shape. It was nice to see more people playing it too. This is a great course. Lots of water and waste bunkers make it harder than it looks.  My husband who is a 6 handicap lost 9 balls the first round!!!  He kept mumbling something about sea level and ball distance haha.  The caddies work hard for their tips, club storage is a great amenity, and Paco is fabulous on that beverage cart.  We look forward to seeing him every time.  We met Tim, the new manager, and think he is doing great things there. I don\'t understand some of the bad reviews. I think some people aren\'t happy unless they are complaining. We will definitely be back, it wouldn\'t be Ixtapa without the Marina Course.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

194779347.name: Worth playing-great layout
194779347.author: a TripAdvisor user
194779347.reviewBody: I think storms played havoc with course. With Tim back I would expect great improvement in course conditions. Again worth playing. Mike in Milwaukee

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

194776395.name: Wow wow wow
194776395.author: a TripAdvisor user
194776395.reviewBody: Beautiful course. It\'s still recovering from the hurricane damage but totally worth the money. The rental clubs were good quality and in good shape. The cart was zippy, not slow. The crocodiles stayed in the water. The course was not busy so we did not get paired up and we were not rushed by people behind us. The breakfast at the clubhouse was good and high value!

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

194648897.name: still my fav...
194648897.author: a TripAdvisor user
194648897.reviewBody:
Just back from Ixtapa.  I had read the poor reviews of the course with much sadness as Marina is by far the better 'golfers' golf course.  I played both tracks several times on this trip, and while there are still lots of areas for improvements to be made, this is still a much better golf experience.  I will say Palma real appears to be in much better shape to the eye, where it really counts (ie; greens, tees, fairways and track) Marina has it beat.  It is also less expensive.  One of the comments I heard was 'the rough was awful'...true, but in fairness it will take a couple of years to get those areas back.  I didn't have one bad lie in the fairway in four rounds.  The bunkers at both courses leave much to be desired but I also would say aren't you supposed to stay out of them anyway?  No comparison as to the quality and roll of the greens.  Much cleaner and better rolls here than Palma.  

I can't say enough good about Tim and the staff.  They were fantastic (not to say Palma wasnt!  they were awesome as well)

I would sum it up this way - if you fancy yourself as a player, and  you want to play a real good test of golf, step up to the tips here and let it rip....loads of fun!  If you want a quiet round with your wife, Palma is just up the road.....happy to answer any question you may have

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

193176741.name: Much better choice of the two courses!
193176741.author: a TripAdvisor user
193176741.reviewBody: Of the two courses in Ixtapa, choose this one.  It has some challenges and limitations, but for the \'value\', it\'s no contest!

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

192903145.name: course reveiw
192903145.author: a TripAdvisor user
192903145.reviewBody: Just had the pleasure of golfing the marina course for 2 weeks in Jan with 10 friends cannot say enough good things about the course or staff

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

191479671.name: Marina Course Improvement
191479671.author: a TripAdvisor user
191479671.reviewBody:
I have just arrived back this week from vacation in Ixtapa and made a point of going to play the Marina Course this past week. I had played the course 4 years ago and loved the layout but did not play it again over my past 2 visits to Ixtapa due to the reviews and "word of mouth" that the course was in poor shape. I ended up playing all my rounds at the Palma Real Course (including once more this past week) I had been following the reviews of the Marina course over this last year and was very impressed by Tim Sullivan's (the Marina Course General Manager) comments and answers in regards to the condition of the course and the work that they were putting into the course to try and get it back to being a very good golf course. Tim was always very "up front" about the conditions and challenges for the course and always answered the difficult questions he was being asked. 
I have to say that it was a real pleasure to play the Marina Course again. The fairways were in good shape and the greens were outstanding the day we played! The bunkers definitely needed some work, but this is very easily said about the Palma Real Course as well! (and all of the greens at the Marina were a ton better than the Palma Real as well) The back 9 had a few holes/fairways where there was still some damage and cleanup needed due to the large storm a few months ago, but they are working on that as there were workers out on the course tending to the cleanup. 
We had 3 golfers in our group ( a 7, 10 and 16 handicap) and all 3 of us said that the Marina Course was the highlight of our golfing in Ixtapa this year, and that we should have played all our rounds there. I will definitely be playing the Marina Course in the future, and would recommend that everyone give this great layout another "shot", because if they don't get the play, we all may be limited to only the one choice for Golf in Ixtapa and that will not be good for anyone.
The carts and driving range do need some work, but at this time I would rather have the course put their efforts and resources into the course, and this seems to be what they are doing. 
We also found all of the staff very friendly and appreciative of our coming there to play and our caddie Arik, was outstanding and probably saved everyone at least 4-5 strokes on the greens. I did also get to meet Tim Sullivan, as he was out on the course visiting and talking to the golfers so I believe that he is trying his best to ensure that the improvements to the course continue on.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

190621233.name: Update on previous review-Marina Ixtapa Golf Club
190621233.author: a TripAdvisor user
190621233.reviewBody: We own a condo in Ixtapa located on the Palma Real Golf Course (where we live for four months of the year) and have been traveling to Ixtapa/Zihua for the past 31 years. However, we choose to play each and every year at the Marina course because of its layout and challenges posed, the lower greens fees as well as the friendly atmosphere we encounter on each visit. Each year we purchase a package and play as often as we like.\nUnfortunately, over the past few years we\'ve noticed a continuing deterioration of the course. This, we believe, is no reflection on the laborers and management but is more a reflection on the world economy -- especially the US, Canada and Mexico.\nWe\'ll be returning once again this year (2014) on April 7 and sincerely look forward to playing the Marina course. Sadly, the prospect that the course may be closed indefinitely or permanently is disturbing to us and we, of course, hope that neither is the case. The caddy masters are great, friendly and helpful and the reception we receive every time we play the course is unmatched. This in comparison to the Palma Real course which is owned and operated by FONATUR, the huge Mexico tourism conglomerate. Additionally, management is no where near as friendly and accommodating as at the Marina course. Palma Real has been through several "new" managers and can\'t seem to hold onto the good ones. The fact that FONATUR doesn\'t appear to care the slightest whether anyone plays or not and that they insist on maintaining the $1,200. peso green fee plus cart fee keeps us away. All we do at Palma Real is walk the course with our little dog. We\'re rooting for the Marina course!

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

189664892.name: Worst ever
189664892.author: a TripAdvisor user
189664892.reviewBody: I have been playing golf for 45 years.  This is the very worst course I have played in my life. Practice range, tees, fairways and greens are awful. The bridges are dangerous. I would truck in the cows for its appropriate use.  The rental clubs should be given to the Smithsonian.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

189368465.name: Wondering about course shape
189368465.author: a TripAdvisor user
189368465.reviewBody: Reviewed before but just wondering what shape the course is in lately. We are back Jan. 26/2014 till Feb. 9/2014 and really like it, but have seen some reviews that have disparaged the course over the summer and fall. Are there any recent experiences that would encourage my husband and son to play in a few weeks?

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

186480635.name: Not getting better - Horrible
186480635.author: a TripAdvisor user
186480635.reviewBody: I played this course in July, 2013.  It was so bad that I haven\'t made time to write a review.  By far, the least maintained course I\'ve ever played -ever, anywhere.  Words can\'t do this justice - see my photos.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

182765046.name: Very poorly maintained
182765046.author: a TripAdvisor user
182765046.reviewBody: This place had so much potential HOWEVER...... It was in such bad shape that we did not get past 9 holes. The grass in the fairway was so tall that when we hit it down the middle we still could not find our balls. It was frustrating and our group finally decided to call it quits. It was depressing. It\'s too bad too because the course could be a great place to play.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

180476076.name: cannot say enough good about this place
180476076.author: a TripAdvisor user
180476076.reviewBody: since it was taken over by tim all aspects of this golf club and restaurant have taken a dramatic turn for the good  you will not be disappointed make sure you add breakfast or lunch to your golfing day

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

179595845.name: Sorry, but not worth the money!
179595845.author: a TripAdvisor user
179595845.reviewBody:
I was the only person who played this course that day.  I paid $120 including club rentals.  It is rainy season and I can understand the growth and waterlogged fairways.  But, it is ridiculous when the rough is so high (a foot) that you can easily lose golf balls. I must have gotten one mosquito bite per two holes.....very annoying!  The course was fun but if I knew it was in such condition.....not being maintained from lack of business, I would not have played.  It was a waste of money. I would say $30 green fees plus cart fee would be more like it.  And, if the price was lower, there would be more players taking advantage of the experience.  Of course I paid just to say I played in Zihua!! I must say....I've travelled all over the world and golfed at hundreds of courses.....and member of 4 golf courses at this time.  I would say that this is one of the poorest and worse maintained courses in the world. Such a pity. I was embarrassed I paid that much and decided not to mention to my family how the course was because I did not want to be reminded. 

There is no food for sale. Restaurant closed. No change provided so you must have exact change or charge by credit card.

The best thing about this course was Modesto, my caddy.  He made the play tolerable coz he was the nicest there being very informative, and a what a good guy. Thank you Modesto.

Normally, I always religiously take pics of the courses I play at.  But, I had no desire to take my camera out but once to take a pic of the large iguanas scampering around.

I wish I could have played the other course for comparison but didn't feel like paying another $100 and be disappointed.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

176790012.name: Fonatur employees do very little year after year at this course
176790012.author: a TripAdvisor user
176790012.reviewBody: This course is very poorly maintained and if there were more than one other choice, the Marina, which I greatly prefer, maybe some higher up would get after the management and employees. Compared to what $100 buys you in the U.S. or other resort areas in Mexico, this is a joke. I realize it is low season, but the range was grown over when I went to hit some balls yesterday. Therefore, the cart to scoop up balls wouldn\'t work and they sent a kid out to pick some balls up. So, I got a pile of balls with mud all over them and hit into an overgrown field. I asked if anything had been done to the bunkers since I was last here in May and was told no. You roll your ball in the bunkers here because there are gaping cracks and little sand. As I walked in past check in, the scene was the same; half a dozen guys, employees I guess, sitting under a palapa near the club storage and another dozen, lower in the pecking order, sitting around the corner behind the building. That being said, they have repainted and there are some newer golf carts, but no leadership. Probably federalized employees that are impossible to fire no matter how little they do.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

171229548.name: Fun layout, but overpriced for the quality
171229548.author: a TripAdvisor user
171229548.reviewBody:
I've played a lot of places around the world and this is not a $100US course.  I would price this as a $50 course. 

I played both courses in Ixtapa two days apart and this was my least favorite of the two. On the good side: the layout is challenging, and the greens were quick (lots of sanding).  On the down side: the tee boxes and fairways needed some serious TLC. There were whole sections of fairways that were dead grass.

The tee sheet wasn't busy so I had the course, basically, to myself in peak tourist season. There were lots of iguanas, birds and a few gators.  It was an enjoyable round, and ladies can easily play from the fronts or whites.  I just think the price was a little steep for the quality.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

169434312.name: Good but Challening
169434312.author: a TripAdvisor user
169434312.reviewBody: This golf course is pretty much one of a kind. A links type course which is times long and narrow. Every hole gives you everything that you can give to either keep it in bounds or hit far enough to par. I\'ve played it 25 times at least, I know.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

166273478.name: Play at Marina Ixtapa Golf Club
166273478.author: a TripAdvisor user
166273478.reviewBody: A friend invited me to his home at Ixtapa , Zihuatanejo , it\u00b4s a 30 minutes  flight from Toluca airport very near Mexico City , we were 4 friends and we really enjoy to play Golf at the Marina Golf club that at the same time it\u00b4s very near to his home , one difference at the other Golf club you can find at this city , it\u00b4s that at this you don\u00b4t see houses near the fairways , so the views are really like on a tropical green area , you can also see cocodriles without risk and a lot of birds .\nWe begin to play after 2:00 pm because the rate is cheaper and the heat is much much lower and it\u00b4s really nice to see when you are finalizing to play  the different sky colors .

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

159060968.name: Fun and Challenging course.
159060968.author: a TripAdvisor user
159060968.reviewBody:
I bought a 3-pack of rounds.  Price was affordable.  I found the course very challenging my first round because I didn't know where all the hazards were.  The course has a lot of water but there's usually a bail out on the other side of the fairway, though you'll have to navigate the rolling mounds.  There were some dead spots in the fairways but they were in areas that were not in play, at least for me.  The greens weren't the fastest, for good reason.  Some greens have extreme slopes and they would probably be un-puttable if the greens were slick. 
 I'm a decent golfer, play to a 4 right now (used to be scratch), and I found the course challenging.  I lost a few balls the first round because I hit in areas I didn't know there were hazards but the next 2 rounds, the only golf balls I lost were from bad shots. 

 It was very hot when I played and I was pleasantly surprised how often the beverage cart came around.  I was one of the only players on the course but I was still impressed.  All the staff was very friendly, from the lady in the pro shop to the caddies, etc.  I ate at the restaurant every round and it was excellent and extremely affordable, I highly recommend.  

Overall, I'm satisfied with my experience and would highly recommend Marina Ixtapa Golf Club to any traveler.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

157333117.name: This course was fun.  Lots of water.
157333117.author: a TripAdvisor user
157333117.reviewBody: First week of April we played this course. We decided to play after 2pm to get the better rate. The weather was nice and the temperature was around 90F.  The greens were in pretty good shape. The fairways had some ground under repair but in general they were in good shape.  The staff was polite and refreshment cart came by every two or three holes. The only complaint that I have is the cost.  To play after 2pm, rent clubs (I couldn\u2019t see bring my clubs for one round of golf), a dozen of used golf balls and a packet of tees it ran over $160.00. Yes, they made me pay 6 peso for a dozen tees and a ball mark that didn\u2019t even have the club logo on it. You would thing for $160 US dollars for 18 holes of golf (ended up only playing 15 holes ran out of light) they could give you free tees.  Also, when I asked to see the rental clubs before I paid, that didn\u2019t happen either.  We had to pay then go get our cart with the clubs there.  The clubs were over ten years old. They were in bad shape. The putter was probably even older then the clubs. The cost to rent the clubs was 455 peso. That was around 40 dollars. My advice is not to rent clubs and bring everything to play.  If you can handle a little heat, play after 2pm. It will run 950 peso for as many holes you can get in before dark.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

155846003.name: Look for the wonderful new changes here
155846003.author: a TripAdvisor user
155846003.reviewBody: Under New Management -  the Marina Ixtapa Golf Club is reinvigorating its restaurant and serves a generous and beautifully presented breakfast and lunch menu  for a great price.  The view off the traditional style Spanish veranda is great and its potential is being recognised by the new manager, Tim Sullivan.  Great start!

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

154706383.name: Major improvements at Marina Golf course
154706383.author: a TripAdvisor user
154706383.reviewBody:
The first time we played the Marina Course in early December, it was in pretty rough shape.
We played today,and the improvements are amazing. The new GM Tim Sullivan is making a difference. The greens, tee boxes,and fairways are in good shape. Sand traps still need some work. 
In addition to the golf the food and beverage department does a terrific job. We have enjoyed our breakfasts at the course,while enjoying the view. Great value. 
The staff are friendly and strife to look after your every need.
If you are looking to golf during your vacation in Ixtapa, we recommend The Marina Golf Course.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

154587917.name: Interesting course
154587917.author: a TripAdvisor user
154587917.reviewBody: I am just learning to golf.  My husband has golfed many courses.  He said it was a good course.  It was challenging and fun.  The scenery was beautiful.  There is a stream throughout the whole 18 holes.  We lost many balls in the water!

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

154517653.name: this is a great golf course
154517653.author: a TripAdvisor user
154517653.reviewBody: the grounds were lush and you can see the new management under tim is starting to make this a must play course..reasonable rates well kept course and great breakfast and lunch and a super friendly staff make this a great outing

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

153220974.name: Possibly a New Life !
153220974.author: a TripAdvisor user
153220974.reviewBody:
This will be our fourth trip to Zihuatanejo-Ixtapa since 2010 and have thoroughly enjoyed all the visits.  Beyond the beaches, the local residents are very genuine, helpful and gracious.  While we regularly stay at the Club Med, this trip we did a little more “exploring” than a sedentary vacation.  Naturally, our vacations have a golf theme as I carry a 4 handicap index and take advantage of the opportunity to play.  Among the many activities, I thought that I would give Marina Ixtapa Golf a try.  

It should be noted that there is a new General Manager, Tim Sullivan, at the Marina Ixtapa Golf Club.  In the two/three months of his arrival, he and his team have made noticeable strides and improvements to the otherwise abandoned course.  More details on this in the review.

So, let’s begin:

Course design and layout- 3 stars

The course architect, Robert von Hagge, is an extremely experienced and prolific golf course architect.  He has built many courses around the world.  It was on my second visit to Marina Ixtapa Golf that I realized he designed it.  I played on three of his famous courses: one in Miami, Doral Gold and in Montego Bay, Jamaica- Rose Hall Cinnamon Hill Plantation and the Ritz Carlton White Witch.  They are spectacular in all ways.

At Marina Ixtapa there are four different tee boxes which appeal to a variety of golfing capabilities.  The three times I played there I was able to play twice from the Blues (74.1 and slope 138) and once from the Whites (71.8 and a slope of 130).  The course is not particularly long with 6,700 yards from the tips.  Yet, what it lacks in length, it demands in accuracy.

The fairways are very narrow and have the omni-present mounds (lomitas) in the rough which make for very uncomfortable lies.  Couple this with at least 75 bunkers throughout the course and it will make for a very demanding round.

On the front, I found the 5th hole, uphill par 4, the 7th, a 211 yard par 3 and the 8th, a target driver and second shot par 5 very stimulating.  As to the back, a three hole sequence of the 11th, par 3, the 12th tough uphill par 4 and an into the wind delicate par 4 can wreck havoc to your score card.

Conditions- 2.5 stars

It is evident that Tim and his crew have focused on some key priorities throughout the course.  First and foremost the greens and tee boxes are showing results from some good TLC (tender-loving-care).  The Bermuda greens are properly cared for, fertilized and cut so that the grain is becoming more consistent and the roll of the ball is true.  On some greens there are harder and firmer areas than on others.  Yet, you can aim for the flagstick and your ball will pitch and stop.  

This is the most immediate and apparent enhancement to the course.

The tee boxes are being cut, mowed and watered.  The improvements here will take a little more time to take hold and be as noticeable as the greens.

Peculiar to this course which was built on a mangrove, is the seepage of salt water into several holes from the marina.  In particular, holes 5 and 8 and 12, they are dedicating efforts to rebuild these areas that have high concentrations of salt where no grass can grow.

According to Tim, there are numerous other significant projects that will need attention from irrigation to the bunkers (which are true hazards for your clubs since they are rock quarries).

Price- 4.0 stars

I should have purchased a package (they are available in options of 4 or 5 rounds) but with our other activities/excursions I wanted golf to be the filler.  So, I paid for each of my three rounds separately.  A little shy of $1,000 pesos provided you greens fee, plus the cart plus 50 range balls.

I also availed myself of a caddie for two of the three rounds.  The cost is very reasonable, $25 plus tip.  I would strongly encourage my fellow players to hire a caddie.  Apart from helping the local staff, you are benefitting from invaluable local course knowledge, assistance with locating balls (and you will indeed need that) and understanding the greens.  

It is guaranteed to make for a more relaxing and enjoyable round.

Pace of Play- 4.5 stars

The pace of play was excellent.  The two rounds as a single were completed in three hours while the round as a foursome was completed in 4:45.  This was slightly longer than expected because we stopped (three times) to let singles and a twosome pass through.

Please be mindful of this golf rule so that all can enjoy a great round.  In several instances, as a single, I had to wait towards the 14th hole due to slow play.  Yet, you should know that the tee times (unlike Palma Real) are not cross-over times permitting all to start form the first hole and maintain great momentum.

Staff- 4.5 stars

The staff is very friendly and welcoming.  My caddie, Mara, was superb and a philosopher too.  The beverage cart frequently makes the rounds and has plenty of choice in drinks. 

With Tim’s leadership, the re-invigorated existing team, the small but necessary improvements, future significant monetary investments in the course should make Marina Ixtapa a strong golf attraction in the area.  

I am looking forward to returning next year to see how much has positively changed.  The current trajectory is certainly most encouraging.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

152988329.name: Enjoyable golf
152988329.author: a TripAdvisor user
152988329.reviewBody: I love the greens and the staff.  I have been playing the course since the second week of Jan.  I play maybe 2 times per week there.  New manager this year and I see positive changes.  Angie is welcoming as you check in and Paco the beverage guy comes around often. I played many times last year and will continue to play until 1st week of Apr.  Two fairways next to each other get washed out I think during the rainy season however I think they are trying to solve the problem.  Thank you new mgr Tim Sullivan for a fun place to play.  I bring friends there that have never played and they want to come back.  I play the other course as well and the two courses are quite different from each other. I do like that you get a better price when buying a package of tickets. I come for 3 months each year.  Ixtapa/Zihautanejo is a most beautiful place!

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

152890131.name: Good time
152890131.author: a TripAdvisor user
152890131.reviewBody: Course was in good shape and the drink cart came by frequently.  Take lots of balls, there is a lot of water.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

152882048.name: Hit or Miss
152882048.author: a TripAdvisor user
152882048.reviewBody: I played here the past two years and it seems to be hit or miss.  Two years ago it was in decent shape, but last year there was a ton of ground under repair.  Some of the fairways were either scorched or simply not watered enough.  I am going back next month and I am leaning towards playing "the other course" in the area.  Regardless, the staff has always been great at the Marina.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

151435296.name: Golf at Marina ixtapa
151435296.author: a TripAdvisor user
151435296.reviewBody: alot of the ground was under repair.  Pretty basic course, for the price we paid  $80 + rental per person.  We thought we could go twice for what the other courses charged.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

150309937.name: Golf day
150309937.author: a TripAdvisor user
150309937.reviewBody: Nice layout but in need of more grass on the fairways.  Decent golf for a decent price but not sure i would go back.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

149972653.name: Marina Golf
149972653.author: a TripAdvisor user
149972653.reviewBody: We liked this course better than the other.  A little more rustic but we still liked it better.  Close to the Maina but no ocean views.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

144680305.name: Don\'t be fooled, this course is NOT up to par.
144680305.author: a TripAdvisor user
144680305.reviewBody:
I have made four different trips to Zihua and each time I checked the trusty Tripadvisor site for the recommendation to either play Marina or Palma Real. Each time the reviews have applauded Marina and slammed Palma Real. So I had always played only Marina but always thought what I could see of Palma Real from the street looked far superior. This trip I took the time to play both. 

I am fully convinced that the positive reviews on this site for Marina Golf have to be coming from folks with a financial stake in the Marina course. 

Let's start with the Marina course:
"Goat pasture minus the goats" pretty much sums it up. There are barren patches in the middle of most fairways, weeds thick in the "sand" traps, more like rock traps, the greens are very coarse and slow. The carts are likely third generation hand me downs. It is still a viable golf course though. It has 18 full size golf holes but they are crammed in behind and across the street from the hotels on the beach. You are actually playing along the mangroves and stinky ditches that hold brackish water and alligators (those I don't mind, they add local flavor).

The staff:
If you are lucky enough to find someone in the golf shop, they will likely make you feel like you have just been taken advantage of by the time you walk out. They quote you in US dollars but then convert everything in to Pesos using a ridiculous exchange rate then MAKE YOU pay in Pesos. Nevermind if you wish to purchase a souvenir. Nothing, NADA, ZILCH is for sale in the Pro shop.

If you play Marina, you are basically getting in 18 holes and paying for the longitude and lattitude.

Like I said, I played Palma Real as well on this trip. It was in very good, not exceptional shape. A local told me later that it had recently been mowed or we would not have been able to find our balls outside of the fairway. This was not the case when we played. It was beautiful. It was challenging. The carts were well maintaned. The caddies were very helpful. The beer cart came around on a regular basis and even ran a tab for us rather than demand payment for each round of drinks. Lots of alligators. Let the caddy look for your ball! The Pro shop did not have any merchandise either but the staff was actually helpful in trying to save us money by proactively demonstrating that we could pay less if we combine our rounds in to a package and pay up front. This proved to save us quite a bit and coming back 2 days later even without our proof of purchase was not an issue.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

144114076.name: Great place for a romantic dinner
144114076.author: a TripAdvisor user
144114076.reviewBody: Ixtapa Marina has nice restaurants with great food:the ambiance is romantic and the night view is great

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

137472576.name: Marina Ixtapa Golf Club
137472576.author: a TripAdvisor user
137472576.reviewBody: This golf course, while very challenging, is a beauty especially when compared to Palma Real. If you buy a 6-round package the price equals about half thsat of Palma Real and even includes a cart. Give it a try!

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

135849349.name: Very fun day golfing...  Course is very playable for all...
135849349.author: a TripAdvisor user
135849349.reviewBody: Course was in good condition for a public course.  Lots of great wild life.  I\'ve played the other course and they are both great...   Lots of fun...

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

125969541.name: Good Golf Packages
125969541.author: a TripAdvisor user
125969541.reviewBody: My husband loved playing golf here. They had some very reasonable packages for playing multiple rounds. He found the course challenging... but a great time. One word of caution... if you lose your ball.. do not go looking for it... there are crocodiles in that water. Take extra balls with you! He lost 10 on the first day. He got better as he played more than once. He thought the greens and grounds were well taken care of and the course lay out and pin placement logical but challenging. Also if you get one of the packages they will hold your clubs for you (clean them too). He took the bus to the marina every day the bus driver was great and for under a dollar he got to the course.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

123973665.name: good time
123973665.author: a TripAdvisor user
123973665.reviewBody: hubby and son went golfing and enjoyed this course the best..lots of Iguanas seen a crocodile. Can\'s wait to golf again

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

123441737.name: Interesting golf course but overpriced
123441737.author: a TripAdvisor user
123441737.reviewBody:
I played this course three times last week. There are two strong positives. First, the course has a very interesting layout that's very beautiful in its way. There are doglegs, hazards and forced carries. Lies in the fairways are very tight with sparse grass overlying mud near the watered greens. Second, the greens roll well. They have considerable interest, many are large allowing for a number of interesting hole locations. The greens will hold shots. Another positive is that you can always get on the course. It appears to me they have maybe 20 people a day play the course, so you feel like you have it to yourself. Carts are inconsistently maintained. Test the brakes.

As for negatives, much of the course is brown and dusty. It's not only from lack of water, because the course is watered. It's more of a drainage problem. Some areas are muddy. There are no rakes in bunkers. There are no ball washers.

The pro-shop contains about 6 hats, no shirts and little equipment. It looked like they had a few gloves. Don't ask for a clean, dry towel. People will always be around to handle and clean your clubs.

I guess what I'm trying to get at is if this is worth the price, which was $97 US plus $33 for a cart, but there are packages available for less and it's less for seniors. Practice balls cost extra and are ancient. Range is not maintained at all. This is clearly not a $130 golf course. I'd say $80 including the cart would be reasonable for the experience here.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

121915992.name: All Alone
121915992.author: a TripAdvisor user
121915992.reviewBody: Price was a little high compared to the states but most of Mexico is.  We had the course all to ourselves.  Greens rolled quite well.  Course was in decent shape considering the lack of precipitation.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

121458161.name: nice course, too expensive for what you get
121458161.author: a TripAdvisor user
121458161.reviewBody: The course is in pretty good shape and has some very challenging holes. Unfortunately, it has some pretty sketchy business practices that are not only maddening (think bait and switch) but also have the loyal, long serving staff confused and frustrated.  For example: on December 1st, we visited the course and were told that until December 16 the price will be $53 (seniors). Made a tee time for December 2nd @8 a.m. all of a sudden when we show up the price is $89 (S) $99 (regular). This year he has also eliminated packages.  The owner apparently does not care about the feedback that his staff gets from loyal customers and has told them not to bother him with the reactions of long term customers. In our case 14 years in a row, in other cases at least 50 rounds a year over more than a decade. We played it on the 2nd, only because we were there, but packed up our clubs, said good bye to all of our dear friends that we have made at the course. Apparently many other have done the same and the staff are very understanding of our decision as their hands are tied, the owner is not allowing them to try and rectify the situation. Needless to say we were not happy campers. We are now happily golfing at the Palma Real course about a mile down the street. (Not quite as nice, but has wider fairways and great views of the ocean and Ixtapa) [By the way, at the time of writing this, it is still really low season in Ixtapa, hotel vacancies are at almost historic lows, which makes the whole situation quite ridiculous]

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

120842741.name: Reasonable value
120842741.author: a TripAdvisor user
120842741.reviewBody: Played early morning to beat the heat - $53 per person, includes cart - they want you to hire a caddy - we don\'t & it isn\'t a big deal. Course has some challenge to it & a fair amount of sand & water hazards (canal / river).

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

99298752.name: Great Course for the Money.  Talk to the Pro (Oscar Cole) if you have a group.
99298752.author: a TripAdvisor user
99298752.reviewBody: Excellent course - I highly recommend the course professional, Oscar Fernandez Cole, who was very helpful arranging tee times and  a negotiated rate for our group that ranged in size from 2 to 4 carts each day for four days.\n\nThis coures is much nicer than the Campos course that is in the center of town and suffers from a complete lack of maintenance.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

81784989.name: A scam, never again!
81784989.author: a TripAdvisor user
81784989.reviewBody: The Palma Real Golf Club, was closed because of the heavy rains the weeks before. Marina was opened,but no mantainance at all. The grass was so tall that we lost balls in the middle of the fairway! And don\'t talk about the ones that were fairly out!\nA snake pit!\nNever again.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

80086253.name: Unfortunate arrogance
80086253.author: a TripAdvisor user
80086253.reviewBody: First the pros, it is one of only two courses in the area, it is a links type course, nice layout and design, carts and caddies avaliable. The cons are: you are not allowed to walk the course, not even with a caddie, or the caddie can drive the cart and you walk the course, ridiculous! The course is not in good shape for the price. The staff is not very helpful and not professional. I have been going to Ixtapa for 30 years and always prefer the "Palma Real" course much nicer and better value for money.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

78417616.name: Robbed on Hole 16th also!
78417616.author: a TripAdvisor user
78417616.reviewBody: I wished I had read the review dated last year. We were here 2 weeks ago to celebrate my husband 40th. It\'s low season, we didn\'t see anybody else playing. We had our camera and camcorder with us - to capture the \'big day\'! The only people we saw are the ground staffs, hence we pretty sure this was an inside job. When we found out we\'ve been robbed, the golf course administrators are very unhelpful. They won\'t even help us in getting police to file a report. Cameras can be replaced, but the memories we have captured is irreplaceable. We stayed at Club Med Ixtapa (VERY RECOMMENDED!) and had a great time. It\'s a shame it\'s tarnished by this incident. Don\'t go to this course!

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

70564378.name: The high-end option for golf in Ixtapa
70564378.author: a TripAdvisor user
70564378.reviewBody:
Winding through mangroves around that marina, this is a water course. Every hole, it seems, requires a water carry. That will mean some precision club selection and good ball striking. It also makes for a challenging but enjoyable day. The amenities at this spot are nice, as well. Typically not heavily played, but you never know when a convention or tour ship is in town. Check out fotos and more details of Mexico golf at my blog:

www.hastalapistagolfista.com

Best, Patrick

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

27914286.name: Robbed on Hole 16
27914286.author: a TripAdvisor user
27914286.reviewBody:
First I will say that the course was decent, and in a great location by the marina (especially to grab lunch after the round).  It was not too busy, so we didn't get backed up too badly on any of the holes.  The staff was pretty friendly and the beverage cart came around every 3 holes.  My rentals were pretty old, and needed new grips.  We paid $125 for the round and the rental set.

Most importantly, we were putting on hole 16, and were walking back to the cart, when we witnessed a shirtless mexican man in our cart, rumaging through our things.  When we ran towards him, he took off through the dry creek that lies next to hole 16 (and 12) and up the hill into the tall grass.  Needless to say, he has definitely done this before, as he left my camera and credit cards, and just took the cash.  I am thankful for that, but it did put a damper on the day.  Do not leave anything on the carts throughout the course.  It is not protected.

Our hotel staff told us that Campo is a safer course because it is protected by the naval base, and also fenced in.  We did not have time to play both courses, but thought this may be helpful.

Happy golfing!

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

15083533.name: We recommend it
15083533.author: a TripAdvisor user
15083533.reviewBody: We played this course in March 08 as an excursion from our Carnival cruise.  When we pulled up to the course and parked, you would have never guessed that you\'re at a golf course.  The parking lot is small (maybe 10 cars) and looks like one that is used for residential parking.  However, you walk around the building out back, and you see a beautiful, very scenic layout.   I can only compare this to courses I\'ve seen in southern Ca.  I give this an "above average" due primarily to its layout and background scenery.  The holes have alot of diversity and challenge with a canal that traverses the entire course.  We saw two crocodiles.  No ocean view, however.  The fairways and greens are in nice shape.  However, the areas immediately off the cart path are not well kept and just look unsightly.  The hole signs look cheap.  Obviously, these two distractions don\'t really affect the playability of the course.\n\nClubhouse only carrys balls (very limited stock) and gloves.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

4443903.name: Course Evaluation
4443903.author: a TripAdvisor user
4443903.reviewBody: You probably read my review of Palma Real and should now post about the Marina course.  The prices here are better.  When you are quoted a price, the price includes a cart.  Palma Real cart is extra.  The package rate gives you the best price.  Overall the course layout is nice.  They do have some challenging holes.  Hole 1 is a Par 5.  Easy hole to par if you stay out of the traps that are in front of green.  Hole 2 is a short Par 3.  You do want to be long and in the trap behind the right of the green.  The 3rd Hole is a dog left up the hill.  If the pin is in the back use an extra club.  It is a 2 tier green.  The 4th hole aim for the 150 marker.  Do not try to go any further.  Right is water and any thing much further the fairway narrows.  The 5th is slight dog leg left, aim to the right of the fairway trap.  Green has traps in front.  The sixth hole is fairly simple.  Keep it right and let the ball roll back to the fairway.  The 7th hole is a Par 3.  Depending upon the tee and pin placement you may have a 180 yard carry over sand.  The 8th hole long Par 5.  Long hitters, beware you can reach the lagoon with your drive.  Critical third shot into the green is needed.  The ninth hole is guarded by the lagoon on your left and a fairway trap on your right.  Your second shot is over water.  The 10th hole a dog leg right.  If you push your drive right you are in the driving range.  Beware of the traps on your left with your second shot.  The 11th hole a short par 3.  Green can be tricky.  The 12th hole is a dog leg right.  Hit the ball straight, stay out the touble on the right and behind the green.  The 13th hole is a long Par 4.  Aim for the traps on the right and draw the ball back to the fairway.  Green slopes normally right to left.  The 14th hole - short Par 4.  I believe ther are 10+ traps on this hole.  Aim fir the 100 yard marker and hope your short game good.  The 15th hole, you have an option to fade your tee shot over the lagoon , if you are long hitter to begin with.  Distance off the tee is not as important than keeping the ball right and out of the lagoon.  The 16th hole, is a dog leg left.  Aim for the 150 marker.  You do not want to be left of the marker.  The 17th hole a short par 3 over water.  Accuracy counts here.  The 18th hole, is unreal.  Long Par 5.  Hit your drive safe up the middle.  Stay away from the lagoon on the left and the fairway mounds on the right.  2 of the mounds have traps also.  The second shot aim for the 150 marker.  Accurate 3rd shot is required to the green.  My only complaint about the Marina course are the cart paths and 2 or 3 fairways.  Some tender loving care would make this course a gem.  Though the course may not have the scenery of Palma Real, I enjoy the course and the challenges it offers.  When you are there, say hello to Paco, one of the the beverage cart guys.  He used to caddy for me at Palma Real and would appreciate the opportunity to swing a club if offered.\n

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

3297235.name: Enjoyable Golf at Marina Ixtapa
3297235.author: a TripAdvisor user
3297235.reviewBody: Visited Ixtapa February, 2005.  We played golf at Marina Golf Club.  Short cab ride or about 1 mile walk from Hotel Krystal.  We left our bags at the course for multiple play.  No charge.  We purchased a multiple-play package.  4 rounds including cart cost 250 Dollars.  One catch was that the charge was made in pesos at a premium conversion rate of 13peso/$, thus costing in dollars about 10% more, but still a good deal versus single play price of about $92 (before conversion).   With exception of one or two holes the course was in good condition.  Challenging, with many traps, rolls on greens, lagoons, etc..  Overall enjoyed it and would return.\n

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

1711708.name: Dishonest pricing on web site!
1711708.author: a TripAdvisor user
1711708.reviewBody: I printed out their web page quoting $47.00 for 18 holes of golf after 1:30. When I got to the course, they refused to honor the price. I asked to talk to the manager and he also refused to honor the price. He said the prices were old, but if you look at the "update date" on their web page, it says it was updated 4 months ago and has not been changed. \nIf they are going to quote a price, they should honor it. Rather than $47.00 they charged us $64.00 each. Nice honest way to run a business!

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

1651623.name: The Marina Course is the best in IXtapa
1651623.author: a TripAdvisor user
1651623.reviewBody: Contrary to the two other reviews the Marina is the far better course. \nI was there Jan.9-23/04, the Marina was in far better shape than Palma the package was $360.00us for six rounds anytime of the day. We golfed at 1:30 and no tee times were required which is a big relief because it saves all the hassle, we just showed up and away we went it was almost deserted. The green fee includes cart and they were like new. They cut the greens and fairways everyday. If you go to Ixtapa try both courses but you will go back to the Marina.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

1073228.name: Good Golf at the Marina course
1073228.author: a TripAdvisor user
1073228.reviewBody: There are two courses just behind the beach in Ixtapa. The Marina is the better of the two, more interesting and more challenging. There are multiplay packages which make the fees around 75-80 US dollars per round, not bad for resort areas in Mexico. Last year it was $125 at Las Hadas and hardly an adequate course compared to the Marina. We stayed in Zihuatanejo, a short $12 cab ride away, leaving our clubs and shoes at the Marina, which were cleaned and stored for us. I am looking forward to going back this December and playing there again.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

418177.name: Nice course TERRIBLE CARTS
418177.author: a TripAdvisor user
418177.reviewBody: After playing the Marina course I came to two conclusions. First the course was a little out of shape but nice.  Second ALL old carts from the states end up at this course.  I thought our axle was going to break and the cart lost about 80% of its power after eight holes.  On the positive side we got our 25 USD back for the cart since we pushed it up inclines for 10 holes.  The Palma Real is a much better course for an extra 5-10 bucks.  Make sure you check with your hotel about any discount they may have available.  Happy golfing!\n

address.streetAddress: Paseo de la Darsena s/n Int. Casa Club

671966813.name: Take a ferry from Playa Linda
671966813.author: a TripAdvisor user
671966813.reviewBody: Small boats (ferries) run regularity from Playa Linda to the island, and make a pleasant trip, especially if you are staying in the nearby Qualiton or Grand Azul Hotels. Once you are there, it\'s possible to swim from the beach, or just sit and have a fresh coconut at one of the many beach front bars.

670205336.name: Worth the trip
670205336.author: a TripAdvisor user
670205336.reviewBody: I\'m glad we went to Isla Ixtapa because it offers a different view than the other beaches in Ixtapa/Zihua, but I\'m also glad we didn\'t spend the whole day there. We went earlier in the day which I recommend as it gets crowded in the afternoons. We walked to the beach on the other side of the island and set up camp at Restaurante Cuachalalate (red umbrellas). Omar made our experience great. Get  the catch of the day, whatever it is. The food and drinks were excellent, and our stuff was safe on our chairs while we swam. We also took the trail to the former nude beach, which was beautiful to see but not somewhere to set up camp because you can\'t go in the water (coral right up to the beach). We were there about 3 hours and it was a perfect amount of time if you\'re not snorkeling. \nFor what it\'s worth, the water wasn\'t as turquoise as I was hoping based off of reviews, but it was still beautiful. The most turquoise water we found was at Playa Las Gatas.

670187881.name: Fun to visit
670187881.author: a TripAdvisor user
670187881.reviewBody: Fun to visit for 30 minutes.  Beaches were crowded and with the amount of boat traffic, not somewhere I would swim except on the back side for snorkeling but the wave were much stronger there.

669891406.name: Nice break from resort
669891406.author: a TripAdvisor user
669891406.reviewBody: We took the water taxi across to the island to check out the coral snorkeling beach. Beautiful clear water with fish close to shore to excite the kids. I recommend going early as it tends to get busy.

668067204.name: Don\u2019t miss this!
668067204.author: a TripAdvisor user
668067204.reviewBody: We had so much fun! You buy the ferry ticket at the end of the pier, exact change only. When you get off the boat at the island, don\u2019t park yourself at that first beach. Go through to the back of the island, a short walk. The beach on the right is perfection!

667953049.name: Fun day in the sun.
667953049.author: a TripAdvisor user
667953049.reviewBody: We kayaked around half the island and snorkeled in the bay. The water was a bit cloudy but there were tropical fish of various sizes.  The bird Life was amazing and the deer and the rabbits that frequent behind the restaurants were darling. Bathrooms were challenging but the food was quite good.

667927292.name: Bicycle tour package
667927292.author: a TripAdvisor user
667927292.reviewBody: This place was awesome and busy go there early.  We biked there saw the wildlife in their natural settings, went to the island kayaker, snorkelers.  They do massages as well eith very good food available at several locations.   It\'s worth checking out \n

667893941.name: Bit overrated but worth seeing.
667893941.author: a TripAdvisor user
667893941.reviewBody:
6 of us took the local bus for 14 pesos each/ each way from Ixtapa.
Loved the alligator sanctuary when you get of the bus (no charge) and the beautiful birds in it.
50 pesos each for a round trip water taxi. However, the guys helping you on and then off the boat want tips both going there and return...  carry some 5-10 peso coins. 
We went early to beat the tours.  As soon as you get off the boat they start trying to get you into their restaurants.  It is the same restaurant on both sides (the snorkelling side and the swimming side).  
We went to the swimming side of l Indio with the RED Umbrellas.  Service was really bad even though there were not many people. We had to keep getting up to go get our server who was sitting and chatting with his friends.  Coconut shrimp and garlic shrimp were good.  When our friends returned from their great massages, they ordered coconut shrimp and they got served Garlic shrimp, server was no where to be found to tell him it was wrong.  El Indio does not have any fresh water showers to rinse off after swimming or snorkelling yet we heard one of the other restaurants do.  Rabbit came up to us an we found it wanted fresh water more than food, it drank 2 saucers full.  We kept track of our drinks because there were 6 of us and we heard that they will add extra drinks onto your bill at the end of the day.  Our server saw we were keeping track of the cost, at the end the bill was accurate BUT he added on his own tip amount.  
Because of the very bad service, the addition of of his own tip and no fresh water showers we would not go back to El Indio with the red umbrellas.

Snorkelling on Ixtapa Island had some great fish to see but it has a lot of large coral with the current pushing you into it.  Wear flippers and be careful with young children.  Tours had a float board that everyone hung onto so as not to be pushed around by the current.

Swim areas were zoned off by restaurants and had a lot of boats in them.  Ocean got deep fast.  

We didn't find all the trails but didn't look for them either.  We did go up the stairs and found the other restaurants that face the main land just as we were leaving.  They looked much quieter but we don't know how good the water was for swimming there?

Overall, if you like snorkelling, it was okay, busy with tours.  Swimming was so so. Quite a money grab but worth seeing once.  Not sure we would go back?

666465975.name: Absolutely Beautiful
666465975.author: a TripAdvisor user
666465975.reviewBody: We got to see many different beaches at Ixtapa Island, as well as got a meal at Las Palmas restaurant on the island. Amazing beaches, crystal clear water and lots of marine life that you can see close to shore. Food at the restaurant was amazing.

665567046.name: Loved it.
665567046.author: a TripAdvisor user
665567046.reviewBody: A great day.  Wish we found this earlier.  Kayak, snorkelling, nice calm water for swimming.  A beach chair, lunch and a margarita.  Couldn\'t get much better.

665206656.name: Nice Island
665206656.author: a TripAdvisor user
665206656.reviewBody: Had a great fresh fish lunch. Nice water for swimming. Good service. Not much room on beach between your chair and the water.

664569199.name: Good snorkeling
664569199.author: a TripAdvisor user
664569199.reviewBody: This was a great place for snorkeling, would recommend going first thing in the morning as the afternoon is busy. 150 pesos for 3 people to get to the island was pretty fair I thought, but once you get over to the island it gets very expensive, 200 pesos for one kids life jacket and mask for 45mins. Also they are very on you to come to certain resturants. There are some nice places to take pictures and swim in the ocean. I would go back especially knowing what to expect for the next time around

664344643.name: Great island !!!
664344643.author: a TripAdvisor user
664344643.reviewBody: This amazing place must. \nEasy to get to via water taxi\nThe restaurants and rental for snorkeling with instructor is available. Can spend all day relaxing.

663332518.name: Ixtapa Island Visit
663332518.author: a TripAdvisor user
663332518.reviewBody: We traveled to Ixtapa Island via banana float thing behind a boat. The cost was $5 usd per person.  There are 2 sides to the island. One side is for swimming and the other side for snorkeling.  It is worth a visit, but it is very busy and overcrowded in the snorkeling area.  We had a great day, but be sure to double check the cost of things before you order any drinks or snorkeling gear, as they try to change the prices on you.

663283179.name: Awesome way to spend a day!
663283179.author: a TripAdvisor user
663283179.reviewBody: You can do day tours from the resorts, but I took the local bus to Playa Linda, then walked to the pier and took a water taxi  ($40 or $45pesos $4cdn) for round trip. There are 3 areas to explore, with 1 beach the best for snorkeling, the opposite best for swimming, less rocks, calmer, and great for the food at the end of the day. You can rent snorkel gear in expensive. The coconut shrimp is fantastic! As is fresh lobster or fresh fish! Beers are cold and you can even get a fancy cocktail in a pineapple dish. Excellent massages available throughout the 3 beaches. 1 hour  for $250 -300 pesos ($20-25Cdn) Also nice hiking trail for the fit, with great views and some wildlife. (deer come out towards the latter part of the day) The snorkeling beach has the clearest water in Ixtapa

662856443.name: Must see while in Ixtapa!
662856443.author: a TripAdvisor user
662856443.reviewBody: Book your tour with Jose Luis Maza- I included his contact and a picture of him in the picture section\ud83c\uddf2\ud83c\uddfd. Ixtapa Island is a must see. Jose will pick you up from your hotel and accompany you on the short boat ride and then on the Island. You must snorkel while on the Island. Amazing amount of fish. You will also stop by the crocodile sanctuary on your way back. Total tour time is amount 6 hours. Completely safe with the family.

662782344.name: As pretty as the Caribbean
662782344.author: a TripAdvisor user
662782344.reviewBody: We took the local bus to the ferry where you can buy tickets.  There are many food vendors on the island so all you need is sunscreen, and a towel.  Each restaurant has lounge chairs, umbrellas that you can enjoy for purchasing something at their restaurant. Fish tacos were excellent.  If you have snorkel equipment you\'ll want to use it here. The water is very clear and turquoise in color.  A very enjoyable day.

662429449.name: Snorkel and a snack
662429449.author: a TripAdvisor user
662429449.reviewBody: Visited this island twice during our stay. First as part of our fishing excursion where a restaurant prepared the fish we caught (delicious). The second time we took the public boat ferry over and enjoyed lunch and snorkelling at our leisure, We ate at the restaurant with the yellow umbrellas both times. Service was great. Food was great. Staff was helpful. Beautiful beaches lots of aquatic life to see if you rent snorkels on the island or bring your own.

662260729.name: Family enjoyed it
662260729.author: a TripAdvisor user
662260729.reviewBody: Great place to go visit. Definitely a must in the area. Kids had a great time snorkelling and food was good. Only con is found the prices a bit high for food. Staff is very accommodating everywhere you go!

661758008.name: Alright!
661758008.author: a TripAdvisor user
661758008.reviewBody: It\u2019s ok! An experience getting there on the water taxi, not what we were expecting but good Enough to spend the day there!

661487015.name: A must to do in Ixtapa!
661487015.author: a TripAdvisor user
661487015.reviewBody: Spend the day at Ixtapa Island! The swimming is great, much calmer than on the mainland. The snorkelling is good, and the water taxi trip to get there is fun. You pass a crocodile habitat on the way out to the pier. A perfect family adventure. Be sure to eat at Restaurant Paraiso Escondido on the island. There are many places to eat and drink, but this place has amazing food, great buckets of ice cold cervesas, and the friendliest staff on the island. They have lounge chairs and palapas to keep you shaded while you enjoy the beach right out front. Look for their sign on the surfboard on the beach. You wont be disappointed!

661245887.name: Fun place. Great service.
661245887.author: a TripAdvisor user
661245887.reviewBody: The staff will do anything to keep you happy. Corona with fresh limes was fabulous. Beach was great. Fish come right to shore.

660575768.name: Nice little island
660575768.author: a TripAdvisor user
660575768.reviewBody: Great trip over, water taxi is so reasonable, 50 pesos return! Water is beautiful and much calmer for swimming. Snorkling was ok but rather busy. Lots of guides with bogey boards to assist you if needed. Beach restaurants have lots of chairs, just ask prices before you commit. Enjoyed the crocodile retreat at playa linda before boarding the water taxi. A must see

660450705.name: Very nice to visit while in Ixtapa
660450705.author: a TripAdvisor user
660450705.reviewBody: We had a very enjoyable day on Ixtapa Island. Good snorkelling off of coral beach, lots of very friendly colourful fish and sea creatures to see.  Wear swim shoes as the sand runs out quickly away from the beach and you are walking on rocks.  Clear calm water that is easy to swim in right off of the beach.  Watch out for sea urchins in the rocky areas.  Lots of restaurants on the island.  We booked a tour which included round trip hotel transfers to the island, lunch with a beverage and a bit of a tour of the crocodile sanctuary.  This could all be done on your own if you wanted to figure it out.  Snorkel gear rentals are available on the island.  Avoid weekends and holidays as it gets very busy.

659751218.name: Must visit
659751218.author: a TripAdvisor user
659751218.reviewBody: Hidden gem. Must visit. Great place to spend the day and relax, snorkel and chill. Will be back many more times

659699076.name: Ixtapa Island
659699076.author: a TripAdvisor user
659699076.reviewBody: Very clean, no garbage island. A short 5 minute boat ride from the mainland. Great kayaking and snorkeling areas. Lots of fish and birds.

659174267.name: Nice place to take lunch
659174267.author: a TripAdvisor user
659174267.reviewBody: We took an organized trip and it was really good, the gide was knowledgable and offered some good information. We also visited a crocodicle den and it was avesome.

658712006.name: Cool Day Trips
658712006.author: a TripAdvisor user
658712006.reviewBody: Great island to go for a day trip. Do it yourself . get on bus, walk to boat. this way it is way cheap.lots of free chair when you order drinks or food.

658128688.name: Fabulous - but be careful.
658128688.author: a TripAdvisor user
658128688.reviewBody: Went to Ixtapa island yesterday.  The water taxi was super efficient, and the island not at all crowded.  Omar, at the very first restaurant you encounter, was great, provided us with snorkeling gear (at a very reasonable price) and a locker in which to leave our belongings, then walked us over to the snorkeling beach - not far, maybe 50 metres.  The snorkeling was good, but I was pretty stupid.  Should have stayed in the middle of the bay, where other snorkelers were, but instead decided to head to the far end of the bay.  All it took was a couple of rogue waves and I was thrown onto the coral, and worse, a bed of sea urchins!  When I got out, blood was trickling down my legs, but a super nice man (don\u2019t even know his name), took charge, got a first aid kit, and spent the next 45 minutes treating my scrapes and removing urchin spines from my legs and hands.  He was truly amazing, well prepared, and incredibly gentle.  Possibly not the first time he\u2019s done that!  If you see this, whoever you are, thanks again!  He would not take any payment, just a donation to cover supplies etc.\nI would go back to Ixtapa island, it\u2019s beautiful.  Next time I\u2019ll be more careful!  If you\u2019re not a strong swimmer, don\u2019t go too close to the far end of the bay!

657830634.name: A bit of a tourist trap
657830634.author: a TripAdvisor user
657830634.reviewBody: Ixtapa Island is a must-see but be prepared for a very touristy experience - lots of people and higher food and drink prices. We visited first week of March so it may have been busier than other times. Boat ride over is quick and efficient. We took a bus to get there - hop on one destined for Playa Linda and ride it all the way to the end. There are two main areas - the beach where we got dropped off and then Coral Beach where you snorkel.  We had to walk down the beach and then cross the island to get to Coral Beach (5 minute walk) but other people seemed to get dropped off in that area so maybe you have an option at the boat launch?? Snorkelling was surprisingly good but lots of people in the water with lots of guided tours making the experience less serene.
