331076464.reviewBody: You\'ll feel like in a movie, is a 5 minute ride on a boat and you arrive at a beautiful island with some quiet and delicious beaches, we went to Varadero but it happens to have a passage for a "back door" beach called Coral, wow! just to put your feet in the water you can see a lot of different kinds of fish. I you want to, you can bring your snorkeling gear or rent some at the place including instructor and photo session. You don\'t need to swim far from shore, just 20-30 feet are enough to be at a coral reef . We went there on a rainy day with our 2.5 yr old boy and it was just perfect!

331029291.name: Beautiful Beach
331029291.author: a TripAdvisor user
331029291.reviewBody: Great place to snorkel or just sit on the beach.  You can even rent life jackets if you need for snorkeling.  There is a few restaurants on the beach that you can sit back and enjoy a few drinks.

329616836.name: Fun Side Trip
329616836.author: a TripAdvisor user
329616836.reviewBody: We went on the Kayak trip to Ixtapa Island.  It is free for resort guests so I made reservations and my teenage daughter and I went.  The kayaks are the double person type that you sit on top of (not strapped inside).  They are buoyant, stable in the water and easy to paddle.  The trip to the island takes about 15-20 minutes.  By the time we got to the other side our arms were tired but it wasn\u2019t an impossible journey.  All the other kayaks made it over without any difficulties as well.  Once on the island we did some snorkeling for about 30 minutes.  The tour guide kept us all together and guided us along the way.  The visibility was only about 10 feet when we went but the temperature was in the mid 80\u2019s and it was fund to just swim around.  The tour guide had snorkels and masks for everyone to use.  We didn\u2019t need to borrow theirs because we almost usually bring our own when we travel to Mexico.  This was a fun excursion and the price was right.

328623843.name: rip off
328623843.author: a TripAdvisor user
328623843.reviewBody: ixtapa beaches are just as nice--water too rough for snorkelling-big waves muddy your views  -better just to stand at edge of water and you can see some fish--restaurants there super expensive--one guy in our group paid 18 american for a virgin pina colada! 70 pesos for fozen french fries-- overall not worth seeing

327912875.name: Nice break from Ixtapa
327912875.author: a TripAdvisor user
327912875.reviewBody: Just a quick boat ride away for snorkeling, relaxing, drinking, eating and hangin out with the locals.

327857757.name: Great Day Great Place
327857757.author: a TripAdvisor user
327857757.reviewBody: If I was staying in Ixtapa, I would be out here all of the time. For 40 Peso\'s you can catch a short shuttle to the Island. There are three beaches located here and you can swim at them all. We snorkelled and saw a lot of marine life right off of coral beach. There are a lot of restaurants that you can visit here, with very good food. \n

327832237.name: Fun for an afternoon
327832237.author: a TripAdvisor user
327832237.reviewBody: Tides were bringing in a lot of debris... lots of garbage floating in the water.  We did however have a fabulous meal of fresh fish and the kids loved the banana boat and tubing!

327689556.name: Snorkel. Relax. Enjoy.
327689556.author: a TripAdvisor user
327689556.reviewBody: We had a great day here kayaking, snorkeling and dining. A 20 peso boat taxi and voila- you\'re on a charming island.

327239193.name: Wonderful scenery!
327239193.author: a TripAdvisor user
327239193.reviewBody: For the price it was a great day trip.  We paid extra for shrimp, but the meal was great and the snack was very good.  The scenery was the best.  I took a lot of pictures!  You can snorkel. The beautiful fish come right up to the shore. There is plenty to do and relax, but it is not modernized with a working bathroom.  Bring your hand sanitizer and sun tan lotion!

326814445.name: Incredible place to relax
326814445.author: a TripAdvisor user
326814445.reviewBody: Located very close from Playa Linda, is the perfect option to relax and enjoy a day of snorkel in Playa Coral or just swimming in Playa Varadero. Great views and a very laid back atmosphere. You will also find very good options for lunch. I will come back very soon!

326531083.name: Day trip for snorkeling
326531083.author: a TripAdvisor user
326531083.reviewBody: good snorkeling if the water isn\'t too churned up.  many vendors and facilities are challenged.  Nice place to spend an afternoon on the beach.

326241584.name: Snorkling!
326241584.author: a TripAdvisor user
326241584.reviewBody: The snorkling is awesome here.  Take the tour so they can show you where to go, plus they supply lunch.  Take your gear.  Walk around the paths on the island, it\'s quite quaint.  The marketplace, cafes, stores, and places of business out there are all only there during the day, as no one owns any portion of the island.  The massause there took off my gold toe ring, and forgot to give it back!  So watch your jewlery.

325547249.name: Quiet and wonderful beaches
325547249.author: a TripAdvisor user
325547249.reviewBody: I loved the beaches as they do not face the open sea, they have quiet waters (no waves). The only drawback is when they offer fishes .500 - .600 grams size and they want to charge you as if they were 1.5 Kg.

325368983.name: A great day
325368983.author: a TripAdvisor user
325368983.reviewBody: Wonderful to spend the day there it\'s cheap to go there and they have the real deal pina coladas in the pineapples love that place it\'s great the employees are awesome too it\'s fun taking the panga over there and there\'s always the locals to help you in and out of the boat.

325159410.name: Island
325159410.author: a TripAdvisor user
325159410.reviewBody: My husband and my step daughters went they went snorkelling and the current was to strong for them and it just was nice water there

322803245.name: Quite touristy
322803245.author: a TripAdvisor user
322803245.reviewBody:
There isn't much to do around Ixtapa so the trip to the island did give us something to do but I wouldn't rush back here.

As soon as we boarded the boat one of the restaurant guys wouldn't let us go and was hard selling his restaurant to us - even after we disembarked he wouldn't leave us alone. 

I get that people have to make a living but I wish they would respect tourists and let you have a nice and relaxing time and choose a place through free will rather than coaxing us into settling at his restaurant.

322038377.name: Private Beach Experience
322038377.author: a TripAdvisor user
322038377.reviewBody: We paid $40 pesos each to take the water taxi to the island and had a great experience at Paraiso Escondido. Had the restaurant and beach to ourselves. It was paradise!

321944553.name: Day trip form Ixtapa
321944553.author: a TripAdvisor user
321944553.reviewBody: Great calm beach on one side and nice reef with lots of fish on the other side. Bars on the beach are great, food is good and the prices are reasonable

321475347.name: Ixtapa Island
321475347.author: a TripAdvisor user
321475347.reviewBody: Great day trip especially getting a massage cheap and the girls do a great job.  the boats across are cheap and easy can pick a spot and everyone is more than happy to accommodate you.  great snorkeling.

320546195.name: Beautiful beaches warm water
320546195.author: a TripAdvisor user
320546195.reviewBody: A must do trip to the island when in Ixtapa. As everywhere we went the people were the highlight . So friendly and kind. Snorkeling was fantastic.

319166644.name: One of our favorite days!
319166644.author: a TripAdvisor user
319166644.reviewBody: A quick water taxi ride over and you have two gorgeous beaches to sit on, relax and have fantastic margaritas or tacos! The one side has fantastic snorkeling! Also, fun fact...they have people friendly rabbits and deer!  Kind of cool to see them walking around so comfortable!  Take your sunscreen and buy a floatie!

317790319.name: Poor snorkeling
317790319.author: a TripAdvisor user
317790319.reviewBody: Interesting crocodiles and iguanas at the mainland side in the fenced off area.  We went for the snorkeling, and we\'re sorely disappointed. Visibility was 1-2 feet, and although there was abundant sea life, we really couldn\'t see it.  Constant pressure to go one place or another as you walk down the beach-- we knew where we were going, and went there.  Nice day-- not great.

317730650.name: Great day trip
317730650.author: a TripAdvisor user
317730650.reviewBody: If you\'re in Zihua or Ixtapa definitely take the time to visit this little gem. Access is super easy via 12 peso local bus from Zihua to Playa Linda and 40 peso return trip water taxi from the Playa Linda wharf out to the island. We preferred to hang out at Playa Cuachalalate with it\'s clean water, soft sand and friendly comedors. We didn\'t experience aggressive touting at all and found the waiters super friendly and helpful. 25 pesos for a beachfront cerveza was fine by us. Loved chilling in the water soaking up the sun and the view back at the mainland. Playa Coral was a but sad as it is a coral graveyard. Dead coral is piled up at the far end of the beach. Snorkelling was not possible as the waves were churning up the sea floor and the visibility was poor. Fun beach to explore though. Loved the water taxi ride, slow, cruisy and super helpful staff. Big tick :)

314870161.name: ixtapa island
314870161.author: a TripAdvisor user
314870161.reviewBody: Lots of activities, be careful of proprietors trying to get you to come to their restaurant .Beautiful beach good snorkeling.

314541546.name: Spend the day at Ixtapa Island
314541546.author: a TripAdvisor user
314541546.reviewBody:
Excellent service,friendly,walking paths ,good food,
Just a beautiful place .
Some locals were a little aggressive in the tip expectation .
I would recommend taking the bus to Playa Linda and then the water taxi.

314501864.name: Beautiful--But Expect to Be Harassed to Buy
314501864.author: a TripAdvisor user
314501864.reviewBody:
On a trip to Zihuatenejo last January, we decided to visit Isla Ixtapa, so that Husband could snorkel. We took a cab there, and were stunned at the pristine Disneyworld that is Ixtapa. Not a leaf out of place on a tree, all shiny happy people, everywhere. But, no matter; we weren't there for the resorts. We were heading for the harbor, and the island.

Once we arrived at Isla Ixtapa, it was a short walk across to the ocean side, where the reef draws snorkelers. We were approached by several owners of beachside cafes, and decided on the one closest to the end of the beach, where it was still quiet enough to hear the waves. 

All was fine. We ordered drinks, the proprietor couldn't be kind enough. I read a book, Husband went snorkeling, reported that the rocks were a bit daunting, and the reef was vast and could be confusing. I was glad I stayed on the beach. 

All around us, people were ordering thousands of pesos worth of food and drinks. The proprietor suggested a platter for us; about a thousand pesos, and more food than we could have eaten in three days. We decided on fish tacos and nachos, another couple of beverages. 

Proprietor turned cold. We laughed.

The island is truly lovely, and the rough and tumble of the cafe owner was actually a relief from the faux perfection of Ixtapa. 

Would we go again? Absolutely. And this time, we'd be prepared to be loved, then abandoned, once it was clear we were there for the scenery, not for a baccanalia.

312384167.name: Great for first time snorkeling
312384167.author: a TripAdvisor user
312384167.reviewBody: Definitely not the most spectacular snorkeling but good for the first timer. Staff on the island were friendly and attentive. Gear can be rented onsite. Multiple beaches to visit. Minimal beach vendors. Great food.

309977839.name: Not for us!
309977839.author: a TripAdvisor user
309977839.reviewBody: There may have been a time when I would have enjoyed plastic lounge chairs, constant solicitors peddling their goods, peer pressure to toss back as many beers in an afternoon as possible and eating in restaurants that just didn\'t seem all that clean or appealing. I\'ve just outgrown it. The views are great with a beautiful bay on the back side, waves crashing into  the jagged rocks. Truly our highlights were the alligators prior to the water taxi, the water taxi ride itself and viewing the pelicans as they dove for midday snacks. Check our the iguanas on you way back too.

309275035.name: nice and lonely beach
309275035.author: a TripAdvisor user
309275035.reviewBody: this is a nice beach very calm to rest the while day, if you enjoy to see a nice view this is your place, you can come with your family and have a good time together or if you want to be in a relaxing place reading a book this is your place. my recommendation come with food and water and don\'t expect a great dish at the local restaurant

308340927.name: A Fun Day at La Isla
308340927.author: a TripAdvisor user
308340927.reviewBody: One of the activities we chose to do when staying at Capella Ixtapa. This beach was very busy with locals and tourists. It requires a boat taxi to get there where locals will try to make you pay them for a "private boat" taxi. Never do this. While getting there was a little difficult, the Island itself was very beautiful and the water was clear and warm. Overall, it was a great experience. Pointer for travelers: the Restaurants own all of the beach fronts, so you will need to choose one to sit in and "order something" (I usually just got one beer) in order to secure your spot on the beach. It\'s a little annoying because every server from EVERY restaurant will approach you to try to have you sit at their place. Don\'t feel pressured. Take your time and enjoy the day! The Island also offers other amenities like kayaking, boating, snorkeling, jet skiing, etc. Be safe and have fun!

307956635.name: A must
307956635.author: a TripAdvisor user
307956635.reviewBody: The cost is good, around 400 pesos per person. But you can do it yourself for less. Amyway the island was awesome. Food is ok and make sure you buy beers and drinks in advance so you spent less.

306488699.name: Peaceful!
306488699.author: a TripAdvisor user
306488699.reviewBody: Had a lovely relaxing day on Ixtapa Island. If you are looking for somewhere to relax, eat, drink and swim - this is the place! The snorkelling was absolutely beautiful and lots of fish. We spent the day at Marlen\'s beach restaurant.

306124027.name: SUPER VIEW & SWIM
306124027.author: a TripAdvisor user
306124027.reviewBody: Great way to spend an afternoon with food, swimming and snorkeling.  This is so relaxing you just want to kick back and have a bit of liquid refreshment and stare at the beautiful view.  All food is cooked over open flame and has special flavor.  Put this on your list of things to do in Ixtapa.

304093069.name: For first time Snorklers
304093069.author: a TripAdvisor user
304093069.reviewBody: Its a beautiful island. Here are the caveats; If you\'ve been snorkeling before in the Caribbean, you will be disappointed. The bay coral is mostly dead. The beach is littered with broken coral. There are a good number of fish, mainly due to the guides feeding them, just not a large variety. The swimming side is wonderful. The beach is soft and barely any waves. There are many walking merchants to buy goods from and open air restaurants.

302657594.name: 10 minute getaway from Club Med
302657594.author: a TripAdvisor user
302657594.reviewBody: Too commercialized, and not awfully clean. We came there for snorkeling and jet skiing. Enjoy jet ski. Snorkeling wasn\'t great, although the water was clean, better than Club Med.  My teenage daughter refused to eat outside in one of those seafood places: wasn\'t clean enough. I would give it a try.

301527809.name: Peaceful and Fun
301527809.author: a TripAdvisor user
301527809.reviewBody: Waves are big, but peaceful. Definitely one of the best beaches. You could go jet skiing, parasailing ( only with good weather ), you could go on a banana boat, ect. We had a blast!!

299425175.name: GREAT PLACE - DON\'T DRINK THE WATER
299425175.author: a TripAdvisor user
299425175.reviewBody: The ride over and stroll around the little Island (very small) is a fine diversion from laying on the great Ixtapa beach. However, we got the worst case of Montezuma\'s Revenge from the ice in our drinks on the island. Drink the cold beer from the can (after using hand sanitizers or handi-wipes to clean the tops. Watch out for bacteria in the fish and lobster dinners. Eat before you go at the Hotels. They are fine. Otherwise it IS BEAUTIFUL.

299399929.name: Averagely good
299399929.author: a TripAdvisor user
299399929.reviewBody: Although very nice beach, it is nothing very special. You can lay on the beach anywhere, but here you have to pay the vendors to have beer brought to you

298799910.name: Istapa Island....everything I would imagine an island getaway to be
298799910.author: a TripAdvisor user
298799910.reviewBody: Our plans were to visit this Island earlier but got stuck "touring" for a time share =/.  Wish we had arrived earlier.  Grat food and amazing snorkeling!!!

298122213.name: Island wonder
298122213.author: a TripAdvisor user
298122213.reviewBody: We visited the island on our second trip to Ixtapa. Would recommend it to anyone. Take a water taxi over and back for about 4 bucks a person\n

293889779.name: Don\'t commit before you get to the water taxi!
293889779.author: a TripAdvisor user
293889779.reviewBody: Water was beautiful and sand was soft!  Don\'t commit to anyone as you are approaching the water taxi dock.  Just tell them you are going over to look around.  We made the mistake of telling a guy we wanted to go snorkeling and he rode with us, took us specifically to the company he worked for and then we were stuck.  We had to rent our equipment from him, buy beer and food from him and didn\'t have the option to do anything else.  It worked out "ok", but we wish we had been able to walk around the island and determine where we wanted to eat and drink and if we really wanted to snorkel or not.  Warning: Snorkeling equipment is used by many people...they don\'t sanitize the mouth pieces or anything, so kinda gross.  Not sure what to do about that except maybe plan to bring your own snorkel.  There wasn\'t a ton to see and we only did it for about an hour, so I\'m not sure it was worth it.  Equipment was $12 each.  I would suggest sharing it and only renting a few sets for (like 2 sets for 4 people) and splitting the cost.  We split into 2 groups and 2 of us sat on the beach with our bags and clothing so it wouldn\'t get stolen anyway... so we only used 2 sets at a time.  Also, bring your own towels if you have access to some.  We were not offered towels as part of the snorkeling...so we had to drip dry and sit on hard plastic loungers with nothing underneath us.  Kind of uncomfortable.  Take some time and shop around before you commit to any one certain place!!

293039080.name: Ixtapa Island
293039080.author: a TripAdvisor user
293039080.reviewBody: Our resort was overrun with children on the weekend, so this was our great escape! Only a few dollars to take the boat across and we had our own snorkel equipment. The water and fish there was amazing. I would definitely recommend a day trip over to here. They had an amazing lobster dinner and lots of cold refreshments!

292763504.name: Snorkeling fun
292763504.author: a TripAdvisor user
292763504.reviewBody: We spent a day at the Island and really enjoyed the snorkeling. It really is worth going for a relaxing day.

292354923.name: Must see
292354923.author: a TripAdvisor user
292354923.reviewBody: There are many great outdoor restaurants to relax and enjoy fresh seafood. The clear ocean water is excellent for snorkeling and swimming.

291556908.name: Day Trip to Ixtapa Island
291556908.author: a TripAdvisor user
291556908.reviewBody: We had a relaxing day outing to Ixtapa Island.  The food and drinks were delicious under the shade of palapas.

291465812.name: Excellent to Spend the Day!!!
291465812.author: a TripAdvisor user
291465812.reviewBody: Excellent to Spend the Day there.. Great Experience"  Great Seafood and very inexpensive, we took the bus  from our hotel left us in front of the harbor where you take a small boat to the island... must bring water shoes in one part of the Island there is a lot of coral and is hard to walk  you can see a lot of fish ..if your in Ixtapa this little haven is a must!!    one more thing you  pay for your food at the restaurant and you will have Chairs  with umbrela  all Day cant wait to go back !!

288689386.name: Great Snorkling
288689386.author: a TripAdvisor user
288689386.reviewBody: This is a great location to snorkel with the entire family, enjoy a beach massage and also a great Mexican style seafood lunch.

288216727.name: Shopping
288216727.author: a TripAdvisor user
288216727.reviewBody: We went shopping and got to see the fishing and harbor, lots of Cats, small little town near the beach

286829287.name: Lots to do and see!
286829287.author: a TripAdvisor user
286829287.reviewBody: After an inexpensive, short, boat ride (hardly a wait for it even though we didn\'t plan ahead) we got to the island. The first day we ate and swam. For a non seafood eater even I found this fresh catch delicious! We as a family ordered one of the large platters available from Juan & Julio which was inexpensive for what we would\'ve paid in the US. It was a whole lot of food and worth the money even though it was a little spendy for Mexico terms. They took excellent care of us, adjusting the palapa to provide more adequate shade for us. \nThe second day we went to another spot on the island to Coral beach, for snorkeling. We were very well taken care of there as well, my first time with this but once in the water I felt very safe with the rented hear and the guide. It was amazing! Lots of fish and sea life up close! Then across to the other side for some straight up swimming. \nThere\'s also a hike that can be taken on the island to see non aquatic animals living on the island. You can spend as little or as much as you like to do things on this island and there is plenty of assistance if you need it, or you can leave it if you don\'t with a simple No, gracias.

284870898.name: clear, clear, water
284870898.author: a TripAdvisor user
284870898.reviewBody: This beach was worth the trip.  The water is so clear and calm...I felt like I was in Cancun!!  There are many restaurants there...We had rented a fishing boat, fished for a while and then went to Ixtapa island to a restaurant the fisherman recommended to have them cook our fish.....I liked the prep of the fish but not the fish so much...Bonita\'s...a little too fish for me but that wasn\'t their fault. The island had snorkeling but we did not do...worth the time to get to see this beach!!

284787653.name: A pleasant visit
284787653.author: a TripAdvisor user
284787653.reviewBody: Nice boat ride.OK if you into water activities.But for us older folks not too much to do except drink beer.

283595979.name: Great excursion!
283595979.author: a TripAdvisor user
283595979.reviewBody: Great little island to visit. You get a water taxi at the pier, there are at least two drop off points on the island where there are several beaches and restaurants. The restaurants have tables and lounges in the shade or sun and will sell you beer, drinks, seafood, snacks, etc. the first visit we went  to Playa Coral. The snorkeling is amazing but the beach is made entirely of rocks and rough coral pieces. Water shoes are recommended. The surf can also be more rough there. There are men who will assist with snorkeling and guide you through safely (for a small fee) if you don\'t feel comfortable venturing alone. The other beaches we visited were sandy and more serene. There are showers, restrooms, wild deer and rabbits that come right up to you. Some salespeople on the beach but I did not find them to be overbearing. You should bring lots of small change pesos because there are lots of people who will help you along the way (on and off the water taxi, restaurant recommendations, etc.) and then expect a tip. Remember your sunblock and have fun!

282840661.name: Wonderful place .. amazing views .. beautiful water
282840661.author: a TripAdvisor user
282840661.reviewBody: Really enjoyed this place and enjoyed the activities there .. there are 4 beaches and different activities .. the wheather was beautiful

280955124.name: Fun day trip
280955124.author: a TripAdvisor user
280955124.reviewBody: Fun day trip. Take a water taxi from Playa Linda pier. There are three beaches, great snorkeling (bring your own gear if you can, otherwise you will pay through the nose fro rentals). Bring enough water, because buying water there is expensive. There are several little restaurants that offer tables, lounge chairs, bathrooms and showers. The toilets are literally fancy outhouses, as there is no sewer system on the island   (its too small and rocky to lay one down). We camped out at one of the restaurants, ordered their sampler dinner for 2 - insane amount of stuff-your-face delicious seafood. Definitely recommend this fun day trip.

278877731.name: hike, massage and drinks
278877731.author: a TripAdvisor user
278877731.reviewBody:
So learn from some of our mistakes and I think you'll have a better time of it. I spoke to some Americans on the Island who had been there several times over the coarse of several years and had always had a good experience. I would like a do over. How to do the island. 

We went June 1st, which was a Monday. It was not crowded at all and that part was great. Going in the morning is also much more comfortable due to the lower temperatures.

First I would highly recommend you know which restaurant you want to go to before arriving. This way you can avoid the hassle of being solicited since you've already committed yourself to a restaurant. The restaurants also rent snorkel gear if you decide to go.

Our mistake.  We arrived by taxi and that part was fine, no issues there. We walked halfway through the market before arriving at the pier and someone wearing a white Ixtapa Island T-shirt asked if we wanted to go to the Island. My mistake? I said Yes. How to avoid my mistake just walk to the pier by yourself and buy your round-trip ticket there. The price is listed, you pay, you get a receipt which you keep for your return trip back. It's straightforward, easy, cheap and not a hassle. 

The people on the boats do ask for a tip for their "assistance". At the exchange rate was 15 pesos to the dollar. 10 pesos is roughly 66 cents, that is nothing to me, but to them it is significant. So anytime you are out and about I would recommend you bring small local currency. I would say tip the boat boy's some small local currency, 25 cents U.S., 60 cents, even if you feel it's a non-service. They greatly appreciate it since of course they are impoverished and it makes the the interaction less uncomfortable and really you're out nothing, so I'd say be nice and get over that part.

Back to my mistake, I just wanted to relax and enjoy the Island and maybe snorkel if it wasn't too choppy, it turned out to be pretty choppy so we skipped the snorkeling. 

The guy who offered to take us to the Island turned out to be a waiter for one of the Island restaurants and of course he was trying to get us to go there. He was up front about this once on the island. I tried to lose him by telling him we were going to hike first and then we'd be back. We started hiking and we arrived at a small secluded beach with no buildings and then five minutes later he showed up. I tipped the guy about a dollar U.S. to leave us alone and his "help", but he came back later in our hike. Part of what compounded my mistake was that not everyone in party was willing to the handle the situation the same. So while I was telling him I wanted to be alone the third person in our party wanted to be friendly and of course that made the guy want to tag along. 

Not being on the same page with how to get rid of the guy obviously led to me feeling supremely annoyed, frustrated and really not enjoying the Island at this point. 
(I always felt safe, if annoyed, he was actually nice, but super insistent and therefore supremely annoying.)
So this guy finally did disappear, I was happy, but too tense to enjoy finally being alone. Making this guy disappear turned out to be super easy and it didn't require one word or a tip or anything confrontational. 

How did I do it? As we continued our hike we simply walked on to  a third beach, named Coral beach and this guy disappeared immediately and never came back! Why? Because of course the other restaurants would not appreciate him soliciting his restaurant while we are standing or walking past their restaurant. So this turn of events got me what wanted and kept me from blowing a gasket with the guy and the other member in our party.

I found a restaurant that some other people I spoke with said they were enjoying, I sat down and tried to figure out how to recover the Ixtapa Island experience. I decided to just have drinks at this restaurant, skip the snorkeling, then get a massage and then head back to our resort. The drinks were great at Paradisio, I never felt pressured there, the waiter was friendly. 

The massage was inexpensive and just took the price I was offered, because it was already low (Also I never try to get a local price on anything, I  just ask myself if I think I am getting a reasonable price for something I'm interested in. I have never understood tourists who try to nickle and dime the poor in order to get a locals price in order to save a few dollars or cents which I will hardly miss and they greatly need.) The women who give massages are employees of the massage stands and only receive a fraction of the massage money, so of course I tipped them on top of what the massage cost, just like I do when I get a massage in the U.S. The massage was also a good experience and I was able to leave Ixtapa Island on a good note despite the bad start.

278489719.name: Fun, quick day trip
278489719.author: a TripAdvisor user
278489719.reviewBody: We took a quick boat ride to the island and enjoyed snorkeling, swimming, and a fresh, delicious lunch. Service was great and swimming is much more fun here than was at our resort because the water was much calmer.

277864178.name: Great day trip while in Ixtapa!
277864178.author: a TripAdvisor user
277864178.reviewBody: Cool little Island just off Ixtapa! Arrange a boat (Ponga) trip out of Zihuatanejo (20 minutes south of Ixtapa) and either fish your way out or just enjoy a slow cruise out to the Island. Once there you can swim or rent Kayaks right on the beach or enjoy the primitive restaurants and eat right on the beach. We had them cook our catch and serve us right on the beach! Very inexpensive and they of course have cerveza\'s y bebidas!

277381875.name: snorkling
277381875.author: a TripAdvisor user
277381875.reviewBody: like going to island on taxiboat,great for snorkling,good resto on island.use local bus to go to playa linda or cycle on a great trail to the warf(9km of ciment

277307678.name: Nice but overcrowded
277307678.author: a TripAdvisor user
277307678.reviewBody: It is a nice, small island with some restaurants and coral reef (when I was there it was to windy, with big waves, so really difficult to enjoy the views under water). A bit to turistic and crowded.

275642584.name: Great Escape
275642584.author: a TripAdvisor user
275642584.reviewBody:
My wife and I went to the island for a day trip and really liked it. Taxi was easy and the boat ride was short. Bring some cash. 

We arrived at 10am and it was empty. It's low season so we had the entire beach to ourselves for most of the morning. We spent the morning laying out and enjoying the quite beach. We had lunch at one of the major restaurants on the front side of the island.

We stayed until 3:30pm and took the water taxi back. We didn't do more then layout, drink and eat. 

I would recommend taking a cab to Playa Linda and paying the 40 pesos to take the water taxi. Don't book through your hotel. Be prepared to have restaurant owners or employees follow you from the Playa Linda pier, to the water taxi to the island. It's a little creepy but just tell them you are good to go and sit down where no one is bugging you.  Also be prepared to spend some money on food and drinks if you are planning on using the beach chairs and umbrellas.

274786503.name: " Must See"
274786503.author: a TripAdvisor user
274786503.reviewBody: You won\'t be disappointed. Bring beach wear and lots of money.Feed the fish tortilla shells and watch the school of fish eat. Calm water to swim in. Great food and cold drinks.

272881885.name: Great island
272881885.author: a TripAdvisor user
272881885.reviewBody: Wonderful island every time we vacation in  Zih / ixtapa we go very beautiful the water is great a very nice day  fantastic massages . \nThe sad thing is it is to quick and you must go home.  Unfortunately most of the coral was  damaged from one of the really bad storms last year

269986746.name: Excellent adventure
269986746.author: a TripAdvisor user
269986746.reviewBody: Luillas restaurant, ask for Oscar. the guy is amazing, and truly fun, the food is amazing. Best jumbo prawns and super good ceviche. get the Garlic prawns and the Coconut prawns. If travelling with kids, Oscar will take them and show them the fish and truly have fun.

269480631.name: Snorkelling, a seaside restaurant and coral everywhere!
269480631.author: a TripAdvisor user
269480631.reviewBody: We took a boat out to Ixtapa island and did some snorkelling. It was a great, relaxing day. There are piles of coral along the beach so water shoes would have been nice to have. There are two sides of the island to snorkel off of. One side was quiet and perfect for our kids, and the other was more rough, but lots to see. We also found some good vendors on the island and purchased some artisan work. Bring extra money for this reason!  Lots of palapas line the island so you won\'t fry in the sun. When you arrive back from the island, there is an area filled with iguanas and crocodiles. A lot of people miss this. We got a load of amazing pictures on this trip as well. Go pro cameras come in very handy!

269221927.name: Can\'t beat Ixtapa Island...if you want to get away from the all inclusives!!
269221927.author: a TripAdvisor user
269221927.reviewBody: My wife and I spent the day here and it was awesome!  A PERFECT getaway from Ixtapa.  we did some snorkeling (the water was a bit rough so hard to see that much) and some \'laying around\' and eating/drinking...our waitstaff was really good and the food was good as well...DON\'T DO THE TOUR...take a cab to the market and walk out to the end of the pier and take the water taxi...this way you can go at your own pace and stay as long as you like...

267559002.name: A must when you are in Ixtapa
267559002.author: a TripAdvisor user
267559002.reviewBody: Beautiful beaches and great snorkling.  Lots of places to hike around.  Good restaurants.  A must to see for all tourists.

266676749.name: Added Tips
266676749.author: a TripAdvisor user
266676749.reviewBody:
Respect the Black Flag, it means it is dangerous to swim due to high and powerful waves, and a  very bad undertow that could pull a child or adult out to the deep water.
 The week before and after Easter is the  Mexican Holy time the hotel is at 100% capacity, so try to avoid this time frame.
When you arrive trust the bellhops/porters with your luggage they are just trying to make your  arrival  a pleasant one. Don't tip them with American or Canadian coin the Banks won't take  it.
Check out Frank's and try his Amazing Shrimp.
Book all trips excursions thru the Hotel

266508210.name: Interesting Experience
266508210.author: a TripAdvisor user
266508210.reviewBody: I\'m not sure what I was expecting, but this was definitely not it. It was certainly an interesting experience, but reminded me of a third world version of the Jersey Shore. It\'s a small island with 3 separate beach areas. Behind each are restaurants/businesses that provide the seating, food, etc. They basically accost you in an attempt to get you to sit in their area. It was mostly filled with locals, or at least Mexians on vacation. There were some other foreigners, but not many. It was very crowded, which was not at all what I wanted or expected from an island only accessible by boat. The taxi/boat ride was interesting as was the overall experience, but unless you\'re desperate for something to do outside of your hotel it\'s not worth going.

266506874.name: Not sure how this place gets a 5*.
266506874.author: a TripAdvisor user
266506874.reviewBody: We came here to snorkel and later dive. Very busy in the water and the beach. Which means I suppose that there should be glass and smoke butts all over the bottom of the ocean. People swimming and stepping all over a growing ecosystem. So many boats... Just was not the Island experience they put it out there to be?

266470063.name: Great day on island
266470063.author: a TripAdvisor user
266470063.reviewBody: Take your own snorkel gear, go early, pick a restaurant with beach front loungers and table and you will have a fabulous day.  Great to relax and have a great day at the beach! Have some local cuisine and a few cervesas, all is well in paradise!

265831810.name: Great Day
265831810.author: a TripAdvisor user
265831810.reviewBody: We took a fishing expedition and they brought us (and our fish) to Ixtapa island, where they cook up a delicious feast for us and pampered us with tropical drinks while we waited.  We went snorkeling, and it was great!\n\nWould definitely recommend a trip to the island!

265634931.name: Interesting stop
265634931.author: a TripAdvisor user
265634931.reviewBody: I\'ve been to Ixtapa island during my visit to Mexico. To be honest I had done no research in advance about the place and usually when that happens, I do not take advantage to the maximum of my time or have the best experience. Ixtapa was different. It was a pleasant surprise. You have easy access there for only ~40 Pesos and (at least when we got there) there was no line to wait at. Once you get there you have an array of services you can choose from: snorkeling, skijet rides, massage (it\'s amazing, you should try it). The food is average, but all in all good. I was particularly impressed by the service. People there would pretty much do anything to make you feel good and welcomed. I enjoyed it very much! \n\nQuick tip: don\'t forget to bargain (for services mostly), there are a lot of places that offer the same services there and you get tourist prices anyway ;)

265487556.name: Great!!
265487556.author: a TripAdvisor user
265487556.reviewBody: Beautiful clear waters, great food, tons of exploring and three very different beaches! I loved it here.

265334620.name: Lovely
265334620.author: a TripAdvisor user
265334620.reviewBody: Lovely boat ride over, great celection of places to eat, walking trails, a great place to spend a part of the day

265094570.name: Great Place!
265094570.author: a TripAdvisor user
265094570.reviewBody: Good snorkel and swimming beaches, lots of good seafood restaurants, we go there every year!! Just a quick ride on boat from Playa Linda Dock

265083228.name: Snorkelling fun, but watch for
265083228.author: a TripAdvisor user
265083228.reviewBody: The snorkelling on the island was fun (corale beach? was best) but definitely make sure not to get to enthralled with your viewing and end up where the coral is closer to the surface as you may find yourself getting pushed by the waves onto the coral (not good for the coral, or for you, as it scrapes) and there are lots of sea urchins that could sting you. The reef is lovely though, just make sure to pay attention. Also: no standing on the reef! Enjoy!

264980258.name: We had no idea
264980258.author: a TripAdvisor user
264980258.reviewBody:
We visited ixtapa island on a tour we were on, and fell in love right away.  The island appears to not have changed much, if ever, over the years.  The rustic, organic nature of the island is what makes the island a must on your list of things to do.  Our 10 and 11 year old boys feed the rabbits and dear that roam the island.  We snorkeled at coral beach which was amazing!!! Lots of fish to see, a little crowded with other snorkelers but lots of room to move around and look at the fish, urchins and sea cucumbers.  
We ate lunch with our tour at one of the restaurants, cant remember the name, the food was delicious and the guacamole was amazing!  
The beach area was beautiful and clean.  The water was clear and shallow great for younger kids.  
Only regret was that we discovered the island late in our stay in Ixtapa.  We would have liked to have gone back and spent the day there on our own.  Next time Ixtapa  island will be our first stop!

264958529.name: Beautiful View..worth $4
264958529.author: a TripAdvisor user
264958529.reviewBody: The island was very beautiful with amazing beaches, there are three different beaches to walk to but be prepared to be sitting in the water! The waves/water comes up very high so make sure you don\'t leave your bags and stuff on the beach. It only costs 40 pesos ($4 can) to take the boat over to the island and it takes about 10 minutes or so. The people helping you in and out of the boat will tell you to tip them (for grabbing your hand) which is slightly irritating. When you get onto the island likely someone will guide you over to the other side to go to the beach. The views and beaches are unreal, the water is so clear and blue and the sand is very clean and white. The snorkeling isn\'t THAT great, the water is too full of waves for snorkeling so definitely don\'t pay the $12 they advertise for. The island and beach is not that big so it can get very crowded beacause there is a lot going on in a small area.\n\nAnother thing that makes this an unpleasant experience is the amount of Mexican restaurant staff constantly harrrassing you while youre walking on the beach. The food and drinks are overpriced and you get very little amount of food for the cost (also there is a random "service fee" they don\'t tell you about).  Beers are cheap but just about everything else is very overpriced, we ordered a plate of "nachos" for $7 and it took about 20 minutes, and there was literally 10 chips on the plate. The server also tried to rip us off on our bill. It was disappointing because we had read and heard awesome things about the island, also you have to pay to use the bathrooms here. Overall, I\'d say go to the island to check out how beautiful it is, but bring your own food or eat before and prepare yourself to be harrassed non-stop.

264923869.name: Nice beach to go visit for the day
264923869.author: a TripAdvisor user
264923869.reviewBody: My Daughter and I took the boat over for the Day. If you are staying at the Azul hotels you can just take a short walk down the beach to the pier to catch the boat. It will cost $40 pesos a person for a return trip back. So keep your slip for your ride back. There are restaurants all the way down the beach. They all have table,chairs,loungers ( with pads) to use for the day.Just order your drinks and they serve you all day. There are washrooms, but no showers or change rooms. Water is calm and clear here. Down by the end of the beach is better for snorkeling. Also on other side is snorkeling area that is full of coral, would need water shoes/sandals to walk in this area. This area also has restaurants and a few gift shops. Water was waver on this side. Worth the trip for the day.

264438468.name: Take the boat ride over
264438468.author: a TripAdvisor user
264438468.reviewBody: Take a short ride over and hang at Coral Beach.  Grab some fins and get in the water, have a little bite and a sip while you\'re there.

264361538.name: Ixtapa Island is worth seeing
264361538.author: a TripAdvisor user
264361538.reviewBody: Ixtapa island is worth seeing to collect sea shells but the snorkeling is better in other parts of Mexico as there are lots of fish but not so colorful. I wouldn\'t go to the island again but would go back to Ixtapa for sure ;)

264350945.name: Beautiful water, beautiful views and the NICEST people I have ever met.
264350945.author: a TripAdvisor user
264350945.reviewBody:
Go early. Watch the owners and staff replenish their wares with boats coming in full of food and drinks and ice. There is no power so everything is done manually with fire for cooking. 
Take the water taxi 40 pesos return each.
Take your snorkel stuff.
Don't take food with you, buy it there.  Its money well spent as the experience is amazing and these people deserve it. 
On side of the island facing the hotels if you walk to the vey end restaurant, the owner there is so nice and the water is unreal.  He let us swim and watched our stuff for us.  It was like a clear blue bath.  So unreal, paradise.

264290658.name: Good Snorkeling
264290658.author: a TripAdvisor user
264290658.reviewBody: 3 different beaches, 2 are good for snorkeling. Good food at the restaurants and a safe place to relax. Water temp was perfect

264254732.name: Coral beach looked like white snow. BEAUTIFUL!!!!!
264254732.author: a TripAdvisor user
264254732.reviewBody: Ixtapa Mex. Is a wonderful place. Everyone is super laid back. nobody is in a hurry, the locals are so very kind,friendly and the ocean is super warm and crystal clear. The air port is the size of your thumb nail and is a very easy to go and out and the staff is also very kind. Now here\'s the big important thing to pay attention to.....Are you listening?? search and read the ratings!! I did not and had a totally sucky trip.I will tell you that the great ratings are just as that, GREAT. But the bad ratings are very accurate.  If you see a 4 star rating? stay away. A bunch of beautiful  resorts are in the coast lines of Ixtapa. pay the extra dollar and you will not be disappointed. Go for the cheap and you too will writing the advising review like I have.

264204575.name: Great day trip
264204575.author: a TripAdvisor user
264204575.reviewBody: Beautiful island :) was very quick to get there and has lots of great things to do. We wish we had of went a second day as well.

264096439.name: Snorkeling
264096439.author: a TripAdvisor user
264096439.reviewBody: Great place to spend the day. Need to go early for snorkeling before the tide goes out. Snorkeling on one side of the island and easy swimming on the other side. Restaurants that I have gone to had great food.

263755635.name: All Inclusive reprieve
263755635.author: a TripAdvisor user
263755635.reviewBody: Took the bus (10 peso) from outside our hotel to the pier beside Playa Linda, then boarded the water taxi (20 foot fishing skiffs) (40 peso roundtrip) to beach #2. Walked over to the other side (5 min) to the coral beach, great for snorkeling. Saw over 30 kinds of fish. We walked to the farthest tables and loungers on the right. Ask for Syd. Unbelievable food. He brought out a fresh Snapper, just caught that morning, plus lobster & shrimp. We agreed on a price including octopus and quesadias for the kids, he cooked it up for us, served it with chilled beers. The best food we had all week. Highly recommend everyone to experience this.

263606147.name: The Island
263606147.author: a TripAdvisor user
263606147.reviewBody: Beatiful sand and water, good food, and you can snorkel or visit a couple of other places while their. the boat ride cost 40 pesos return

262790434.name: Had a great time there.  Don\'t be upset by the persons trying to get you to sit at their facilities.
262790434.author: a TripAdvisor user
262790434.reviewBody: Loved walking in the green spaces on the island.  The food was great and the servers very friendly.  Would go again.\nBeaches are good.

262789971.name: Spectacular!
262789971.author: a TripAdvisor user
262789971.reviewBody:
Clear beautiful water,  lots of fish and amazing service!  Ishmael,  at coral beach, is the man! 
Bring some corn flakes, cheerios or bread,  the fish will each right out of your hand! 
If u do not have your own snorkeling equipment,  it will cost 120pesos for snorkeling,  google,  flippers and life jacket. Your money and personal stuff will be safe on your chair while you snorkel. We were not sure, so we did not bring a lot with us and regretted it once we were there! 
The taxi across is 40 pesos per person,  return. It is really worth your while!

262559210.name: Perfect!
262559210.author: a TripAdvisor user
262559210.reviewBody: My husband and I took a city bus from downtown zihuatanejo to playa Linda for 25 pesos. Then we took a water taxi to the island for 40 pesos each (round trip).  We got off the boat, walked straight to the coral reef beach and were seated by a waiter from Rebecca something or other (restaurant on the beach). Snorkeling gear rental was on the menu, our waiter delivered masks, snorkels, and flippers with our beer. Beer was 25 pesos, gear was 120 pesos each. We snorkeled for about an hour- loved it!  Beautiful fish, beautiful water, beautiful coral ! Then we shared lobster tacos for another 50 pesos before heading back to zihuatanejo.  Highly recommend hitting this oasis!

262291274.name: Ixtapa Island
262291274.author: a TripAdvisor user
262291274.reviewBody: If your looking for white sand beaches this island has them with great snorkelling spots . Great cold cervacas ! and also coconut and pineapple cocktails . Relaxing was our goal and it was accomplished .

262271288.name: Fun
262271288.author: a TripAdvisor user
262271288.reviewBody: Beach vendors lots, lots of fun. Food not good .easy to get to. Great way to spend the day. Took a tour 580 pesos

262181770.name: Beautiful Island
262181770.author: a TripAdvisor user
262181770.reviewBody: We spent the day here snorkeling and having a wonderful lunch.  Beach was clean and our kids saw many different fish.  Boat ride was also nice

262128795.name: Ixatapa Island
262128795.author: a TripAdvisor user
262128795.reviewBody: Don\'t take a tour to this island,lots more fun going by yoyrself,take the local bus for 10 pesos,then the water taxi for 40 pesos return,one side of the island is for snorkeling  nad the other side great for swimming.

261997533.name: Fresher would be to eat it in the sea.
261997533.author: a TripAdvisor user
261997533.reviewBody: Great variety of fish right by the shore to snorkel. Great food and ambiance. Close,affordable and magical moment.

261798015.name: Fun day!
261798015.author: a TripAdvisor user
261798015.reviewBody: Took a taxi from the resort in Ixtapa,  to Playa Linda. Walked down the pier to catch  a water taxi over to Isla Ixtapa (40 pesos per person) for a brief boat ride over.   Beautiful sandy beaches, and if you walk to the far side (a very short walk) you come to a more sheltered bay, which is perfect for snorkelling.   Great restaurants on the Isla, with palapas to sit beneath while enjoying a cold drink or very cold cerveza. There are several spots to get a massage.   There is a caretaker that lives on the island, but no one lives there otherwise. Everything comes to the Isla by boat. We saw a boat load of ice, Corona and food arrive. It was a relaxing way to spend the day.

261776974.name: Great snorkeling experience
261776974.author: a TripAdvisor user
261776974.reviewBody: Had David as a \'guide\', to show us where to go and he helped my granddaughter and kept her safe. If it weren\'t for him we wouldn\'t have done it.

261511924.name: Tour
261511924.author: a TripAdvisor user
261511924.reviewBody: Beautiful and Food was great. Service was wonderful. First time snorkelling and the instructor was very good. He showed us lots of ocean life and creatures. We also saw the crocodile sanctuary and was very impressed. The views from both sides of the island were amazing. Worth the money.

261489353.name: Great break from the resort!
261489353.author: a TripAdvisor user
261489353.reviewBody: Visited the island once during our stay in March. Took a cab from our hotel. 90 peso\'s there and 60 back. The cab dropped us off at the market where we were immediately greeted by the shop owners wanting us to take a look. Once we were through the market and on the peer we were swarmed by vendors wanting to escort us to the ticket booth to buy our tickets for the boat taxi. It was a bit overwhelming at first and I would imagine it to being attacked by sharks but now that I know what to expect it wouldn\'t be an issue for the next time. Turns out the guys on the peer are getting kickbacks from the restaurants on the island so that\'s the reason for the hustle on the peer. Didn\'t really matter to me where we went as long as they had cold beer. The island is very small so it\'s easily walkable if you want to try both beaches. The closer beach is easier to walk on however. We started off at the farther beach and had a couple of beers and did some snorkeling. As I mentioned there is a lot of washed up coral on the beach so I would recommend water shoes if you have. Good snorkeling and some live coral to see. At the time, this was the busier of the two beaches. After that we walked over to the closer beach ( about 4 minutes) and had more beer and nachos. Can\'t remember the name of the restaurant but it was to the far west side. Washrooms were the worst my wife has ever seen so ladies beware! Again, lots of fish and coral as well as a nice sandy beach. Last boat taxi back to the main land was 5:00pm and again all the attendants were quite aggressive when asking for tips.\n\nI would recommend this trip if you\'re looking for something to do. No need to book an official tour from your hotel though as you will be fine on your own. I believe the cost of this tour from our hotel was $40+ US pp and included lunch and one drink.

261126444.name: Great place to get away from the hotel.
261126444.author: a TripAdvisor user
261126444.reviewBody: Went over to the Island twice during our one week stay in Ixtapa80m peso taxi ride or 10 peso bus ride to playa Linda then buy a round trip ticket off the pier for 40 peso\'s round trip. Nice place to get away from the noisy hotel and do some snorkeling. The water is very calm and clear compared to the hotel zone.\nYou can buy drinks and food from the many beach bars20 pesos for beer or 10 for water. Nice to walk from one side to the other. highly recommend visiting there.

261011355.name: quiet beach
261011355.author: a TripAdvisor user
261011355.reviewBody: A much better and calm beach for swimming, but watch out for jelly fish. The are numerous in this area and they sting! If you go there, walk to the end of the beach and you will have total privacy.

260972468.name: Nice snorkeling spot
260972468.author: a TripAdvisor user
260972468.reviewBody: While I love watching the kids and their families playing at  Las Gatas, I have to admit that the snorkeling is better at Ixtapa Island.  We saw lots of fish and an ee. Also had a nice beach-side lunch.

260913993.name: A day well spent!!
260913993.author: a TripAdvisor user
260913993.reviewBody: A fine day spent snorkelling and relaxing in the sun with a excell service at our palapa. Cold beer good food and great family and friends!!

260650716.name: Went snorkling
260650716.author: a TripAdvisor user
260650716.reviewBody: Too bus to Playa Linda and got water taxi at the pier to Ixtapa Island. Went to Playa Coral & got table at Lili Cipriana where Lucas took care of us and got us set up for snorkelling. Nice area, saw some neat fish, but wished I would have taken my own snorkel gear, that said gear we rented was clean.\n

260631987.name: Two amazing beaches-one island
260631987.author: a TripAdvisor user
260631987.reviewBody: One side of beach--We enjoyed the beachfront diners while basking in the sun and enjoying a Corona.  Kids enjoyed the calm ocean blue water.\nOther side of the beach--coral, shells, waves and snorkeling.  The snorkeling adventure was fun and amazing.  Loved the beautiful fish and coral.

260527174.name: Great place to spend the afternoon
260527174.author: a TripAdvisor user
260527174.reviewBody: Ixtapa Island is a nice place to spend a day or half day. Snorkeling is great on the backside of the island. You can rent some snorkel equipment for about 70-80 pesos and either walk to that side yourself or pay for a guided snorkel tour. Crystal clear calm water for swimming on the front side of the island. Drinks are cheap if you just want to sit around and relax. Its just a quick bus ride or taxi ride to Playa Linda and a 5 minute taxi boat to get across to the island for 40 pesos return trip. Don\'t forget to stop at the croc reserve while you are in Playa Linda.

260505782.name: Great place with an authentic local feel!
260505782.author: a TripAdvisor user
260505782.reviewBody: Went there from club med. Great scuba with a guide for like $15 USD pp. lots of locals, great food! Highly recommend it. $8 RT water taxi from club med. Better than their excursions!!!!!

260308692.name: Great Little Get-a-way!
260308692.author: a TripAdvisor user
260308692.reviewBody: Want to get away from Ixtapa and Zihua for a day...take the water taxi over to Ixtapa Island.  Various little snack shacks to provide you beverages, snacks, food and snorkaling equipment. We had a quiet, relaxing day and enjoyed the sea life, including a Puffer Fish!

259788525.name: So many fish!!
259788525.author: a TripAdvisor user
259788525.reviewBody: Great spot to snorkel. Go in the morning as the fish diminish as the day goes on likely due to increase in activity. Great spot to get cheap beers and great seafood!! Don\'t bother with the expense of booking a tour. Just take the water taxi over and enjoy !! There is a path between the beaches that you can take to explore all the beaches

259681960.name: Excellent service, great place to spend a day
259681960.author: a TripAdvisor user
259681960.reviewBody: the livery boat staff begging for tips. The service on the island per se was great. This is a little oasis. Go with friends and you\'ll have a wonderful day.

259663130.name: A little imitimidating
259663130.author: a TripAdvisor user
259663130.reviewBody: Went out early one morning.  Maybe too early.  It was not what I expected.  Small restaurants everywhere with everyone wanting your attention.  Come in a drink beer.  Now I love a good beer but not at that time.  We walked over to the snorkling area.  There were some folks out there but again we were early.  Wound our way back with more people trying to get us to drink or eat.  We are in our 60\'s so do not base to much on our opinion.  Loved the boat ride over and back.

259637155.name: A few choices of sandy beaches with beautiful clear water.
259637155.author: a TripAdvisor user
259637155.reviewBody: A great day trip with several beaches to walk to. The swimming was gorgeous. You get to see crocodiles and many large igaunas on the walk to the boat. Its busy but worth the trip.

259608323.name: travel local
259608323.author: a TripAdvisor user
259608323.reviewBody: you can do this on your own  .  Just take a water taxi from the marina (round trip)  You then rent your snorkel gear and their are local who will guide you fro a  tip.  You can do the same at Los Gatos Beach, Zihua.

259593737.name: You need to do this!!
259593737.author: a TripAdvisor user
259593737.reviewBody: Three beaches on one island. very well done. Great swimming and snorkeling. \n\nA short boat ride to a day of fun.

259574907.name: Visit to Ixtapa Island
259574907.author: a TripAdvisor user
259574907.reviewBody: Just back from a trip to Ixtapa, part of trip went to the Island just off the Coast.  It was a wonderful visit to the island, ferried out by boat, p\\went snorkeling, laid on the beach, enjoyed varied and fantastic food.\n\nIsmael, the manager was the best, attentive, understood American language very well.  If you go to Ixtapa, you must plan a trip to the Island.  we stayed at Hotel Azul which is just across, but any area in and around Ixtapa will take you there.

259566946.name: Great day at the beach
259566946.author: a TripAdvisor user
259566946.reviewBody: Had the coconut shrimp. Beer is about  more expensive but the island is a reserve so no one lives there they bring in everything daily. Water shoes needed for snorkelling the beach the faces the coast is beautiful to swim in.  Remember to bring some money nit us only 40 pesos to get there and back.

259477472.name: great snorkelling
259477472.author: a TripAdvisor user
259477472.reviewBody: Great snorkelling, good food and drinks. Very nice relaxing day.\nTake a bus and boat to get there for $5

259182748.name: Fun to see but wouldn\'t spend too much time here
259182748.author: a TripAdvisor user
259182748.reviewBody: This was a fun experience and inexpensive. Our bus ride back to our hotel was the highlight, as our bus horn sounded like a ship\'s horn. It was a bit of a turnoff when we first arrived with restaurants harassing you to come to their place. We walked a couple hundred yards to the snorkel side and were seated under an umbrella while we enjoyed a couple drinks. It was quieter on this side of the island. A couple hours was enough but it was an experience and glad we did it!

259170685.name: Nothing there to see
259170685.author: a TripAdvisor user
259170685.reviewBody: I wrote about playa Linda and included the island. Speaking of the island only now, the small boat ride that cost 20 pesos for return trip over was quite nice, except for the climb into a rocking boat from a rough pier. It would be hard for an elderly or out of shape person. Take care in getting in and out , and watch your head. We only sat at an open Cafe for a beer, bought some silver braclets and watched the scuba divers in the waves. The water must have been rocky, because they all walked funny entering it! We walked up a path to higher ground , the view was very pretty. But not much to do there but drink, eat and shop for the same stuff that all the flea markets in Ixtapa had.

259147164.name: A dump, got e-coli
259147164.author: a TripAdvisor user
259147164.reviewBody: This place is a tourist trap. Its filthy & just like Las Gatas, a beach full of restaurants getting you to buy a place to sit for the day. My hub got e-coli from shrimp tacos there. Was sick on the plane while it was taking off & running to the bathroom. Stay away from the filthy, dirty, tourist trap.

259113121.name: Fun day
259113121.author: a TripAdvisor user
259113121.reviewBody: Easy to get too, great staff. Snorkelling good off the beach.  Have showers to rinse off put very poor water pressure. Bathrooms are truly Mexican but atleast hey have them

259035993.name: One time was enough, worth a first and only trip though
259035993.author: a TripAdvisor user
259035993.reviewBody:
After 3 years of going to Ixtapa, and not having the opportunity to go to the island due to rough waves, we finally made it this year!  We were glad we went, but I don't think we'd go again.

We went on a Monday, so I'd imagine it was not nearly as busy as a weekend.

We took the cheap water taxi over and were dropped off at the Varadero (spelling?) beach.  We walked straight through to the Playa Coral beach for snorkeling.  Those in our group didn't want to look past Princess Rebecca.  The guy was nice enough setting us up.

We snorkeled for a while.  It was very rocky getting in, but once out there, it was easy snorkeling.  We saw different types of fish, including an eel, and lots of sea urchins.  The water was a good temperature.  

We then exited the water and ordered lunch.  It took FOREVER to get the food.  And unfortunately, the quality was severely lacking. Pricing was probably as expected.  Cokes for about $30 pesos. The meals were running us dollar about 8-12.  They REALLY try to upsell you and your group to buy the full package where you get a ton of food for decent price, but it is still too much food for anyone. And, not worth it.  The nasty cheap cheese they use was horrible.

I purposefully avoided the bathrooms as we heard they were pretty bad.  The men advised that the "water" on the floor was NOT water.  That's just nasty.

What would I have done different?  Gone to one of the other beaches and checked for different restaurants before settling on a place to park for the day.

Try it once, but don't set your hopes to high on a perfect magical little island.

259021511.name: Worth a visit
259021511.author: a TripAdvisor user
259021511.reviewBody: Bring your camera. There are excellent views from the lookout on the top of the island.  A very good lunch with our package.\nBe sure to take the 10 min. hike to the "quiet beach".

259019772.name: A Must-Do
259019772.author: a TripAdvisor user
259019772.reviewBody: We didn\'t book a tour. Walked down to the pier and took the water taxi ourselves (40 pesos return pp). Got off at the 2nd pier (Playa Coral - the snorkelling beach), got a table on the beach at Lilli Cipriani, where we ordered beer for 25 pesos. Ordering food/drink reserves the table, and they keep an eye on your belongings. If you\'re early enough, you\'ll even get loungers! Then, we went around back to a place that rented snorkel gear for 125 pesos pp. The coral reef is out the back here. Great snorkelling, lots of fish to see! Afterwards, we headed back to our table, ordered food and more beer, did a little swimming at the beach in front, and simply relaxed before taking the water taxi back. I believe the water taxi runs from 9 AM to 6 PM. Check it out. It\'s worth it!

258946635.name: Relaxing day on the beach
258946635.author: a TripAdvisor user
258946635.reviewBody: We wanted to snorkle but the water wasn\'t great that day so we lounged on the beach & had some great food & drinks.  A gentleman named Ismail works at  one of the restaurants & took great care of us all day.

258874861.name: Awesome Beach
258874861.author: a TripAdvisor user
258874861.reviewBody: Friendly staff, they will take care of you when you arrive on the island. just enjoy and take in the sun

258861843.name: 2nd Rate Vacation
258861843.author: a TripAdvisor user
258861843.reviewBody: Club Med resort was run down and depressing.  Our room toilet, sink and shower kept backing up and smelled of sewer.  It was also damp and musty.    I got food poisoning and when I called the nurse she yelled at me on the phone for waking her up.  She told me not to bother her and hung up.  Also, the resort lists a climbing wall but there is not one there.

258855689.name: Heaven on Earth
258855689.author: a TripAdvisor user
258855689.reviewBody: A trip to the Island is a must.  There is nothing better than relaxing on the beach and feeding the fish on the coral side.  I will definitely be going back again next year.

258663318.name: Like to Snorkle
258663318.author: a TripAdvisor user
258663318.reviewBody: The trip to the Island is a great break for young or old. Great snorkeling. Have a great meal. Fun for all the water is very clear. It\'s just a great break in the day and a great 1/2 day excursion.

258659013.name: Great way to spend the day
258659013.author: a TripAdvisor user
258659013.reviewBody: Snorkeling was great.  Had a sensational seafood lunch on the beach. Friendly service.   Would definitely go back. Swimming was awesome.

258571355.name: Tip for getting reduced tour prices...
258571355.author: a TripAdvisor user
258571355.reviewBody: As you drive or walk on Ixtapa\'s main drag, you will be approached by many people selling tours. Never take the first price offered. The true price should be about half of the first quoted price. Have a little fun bargaining!

258485921.name: FIsh fry
258485921.author: a TripAdvisor user
258485921.reviewBody: We brought the fish we caught to a wonderful restaraunt on Ixtapa Island.  The chef prepared our mahi mahi and black tuna to perfection!!  It was served with vegetables, mashed potatoes and rice!  Wonderful!!

258478137.name: Love visiting here every year
258478137.author: a TripAdvisor user
258478137.reviewBody: The tiny ferries are easy to get to and inexpensive and a short trip to the island.  Great fresh seafood.  Awful bathrooms!!!  Good snorkeling on one beach and the other beach has calm, warm water for floating around.  Attentive service, but sometimes different places vying for your business can be uncomfortable.

258293280.name: Tropical blue water, soft white sand
258293280.author: a TripAdvisor user
258293280.reviewBody: Beautiful. Bucket of coronas on beach 6 for about 10.00, snorkelling, fish at your feet. Stunning.  40 peso water taxi to island from azul hotel, that about 3.50 canadian.  Aqua blue water, wildlife, crabs, wild deer, gorgeous flowers, fresh seafood. Great customer service from the little beach restaurants.  This is an absolute must.  Bring a water floaty, and float in the gentle blue water.

258207198.name: Don\'t take the excursion. Just go yourself. Way cheaper.
258207198.author: a TripAdvisor user
258207198.reviewBody: This place is quite nice. But I would go to the other side of the beach rather then where the boats drop you off. The beach is nice and its very empty.

258152677.name: Beautiful
258152677.author: a TripAdvisor user
258152677.reviewBody: Beautiful island, easy to get to. Plenty of places to eat and drink, make sure to deal along the way for beer prices.

258113199.name: Excellent island escape from nearby Ixtapa
258113199.author: a TripAdvisor user
258113199.reviewBody: We visited Isla Ixtapa (Isla Grande) for two days and nights via our sailboat in the anchorage.  After a long rest, we ventured ashore and headed to One of the many beachside restaurants.  The name of the one we visited is either Playa Escondido, or Tequila. it is essentially,when facing the shore,the first restaurant to the right of the little water alleyway they have set aside for shore landings.  There a group of us spent all afternoon drinking some margaritas, negotiating with the very reasonable and non aggressive vendors, and dining on some of the best seafood we have had.\nOrder the special grilled fish, served platter size, with lots of fresh condiments to make your own tacos.  More aggressive palates will thoroughly enjoy the octopus, grilled,, and served in little pieces with salad and vegies.  It was a wonderful way to spend the afternoon, with beautiful views, clear water and friendly restaurant and local staff.

258001292.name: Went for the snorkeling
258001292.author: a TripAdvisor user
258001292.reviewBody: Had read through reviews that ixtapa island was the place to go for snorkeling.  Island and beaches were very nice and there appeared to be lots of fish-we were the first ones on the island as we heard it gets too busy in the afternoon which it did.  We took the water taxi across with the head waiter at one of the restaurants so he took us to "their" chairs and set us up with a prime spot on the beach. Service was excellent and VERY reasonable. They rented us towels for $6 and drinks were very reasonable.  We stayed for about 4 hours and enjoyed some peaceful beach time but weren\'t able to snorkel as it was too rough still.  We had met another Canadian couple at our resort who went two days later and they said it was completely calm so I guess it depends on the day\nThink the snorkeling would have been great as saw lots of fish right up by shore(had taken a bag of cat food to feed them) and didn\'t see the deer or rabbits on our walk through the trails-maybe too early in the am

257977285.name: Snorkeling
257977285.author: a TripAdvisor user
257977285.reviewBody: I expected to go to the island and have a short ride out to a reef, but the reef was right at the waters edge. We had a guide with a boogy board to take us around the reef, but you really don\'t need one, that was nice. \nWe had lobster tacos at Lili Ciprione, which came with salsa and chips. There were 3 taco\'s, which was more than I could eat. Very tasty.

257962364.name: Not much to see here
257962364.author: a TripAdvisor user
257962364.reviewBody: Perhaps I missed something but I didn\'t see any attraction to this place.  To be fair, I did not go snorkeling.  Other than that, I saw nothing but restaurants with owners using high pressure tactics to get you to eat.  Not even worth the $4 water taxi ride, though the boat was the funnest part.

257892097.name: Great snorkelling.  Great food and drinks on the beach. Worth your while and lots of fun.
257892097.author: a TripAdvisor user
257892097.reviewBody: Dont be afraid to pay for a snorkel guide. He found us all types of critters and there are lots of fishies to see.

257844725.name: If in the area worth the trip
257844725.author: a TripAdvisor user
257844725.reviewBody: If you are in Ixtapa it is worth the bus /water taxi ride to see Pla Linda is also a neat sight You will be going right threw it to get the water taxi to Ixtapa Island

257826593.name: Beautiful one day trip
257826593.author: a TripAdvisor user
257826593.reviewBody: Enjoyed this as part of our Adventours excursion from Ixtapa.  About an hour kayaking out to the ocean and around a tip of the island into a bay watching boobie birds. Back on shore crossed island short distance to snorkel on coral bottom with great variety of fish. Nice fresh fish lunch included. If not on tour\nboat trip costs 40 pesos. Expect to tip at docks if not on tour.  Lovely quiet beach and great way to spend a day.

257824478.name: Great local experience
257824478.author: a TripAdvisor user
257824478.reviewBody: We spent the whole day there yesterday got the bus to drop us of at playa linda seen the crocodiles before we walked down to the beach cost only 40 pesos to take water taxi spent te whole day on the beach we are drinks, they even had fancy drinks farces out of pineapple or coconuts... It was a great day.

257820318.name: great beach!
257820318.author: a TripAdvisor user
257820318.reviewBody: Loved the beach and the calm water! You have to pick a place to set where they don\'t push you to buy lunch. Enjoyed the peace!

257732126.name: Trip to Ixtapa Island
257732126.author: a TripAdvisor user
257732126.reviewBody: Boat ride was 40 pesos. Good for snorkeling / swimming. Lots of bars to sit and enjoy a beverage.  Just relaxing !! Nice way to spend a day !!

257049292.name: Fun times
257049292.author: a TripAdvisor user
257049292.reviewBody: The beach, the people, the food, exploring the island, talking to the locals and the water taxi ride

256950655.name: xtapa island
256950655.author: a TripAdvisor user
256950655.reviewBody: snorkelling good but watch for coral . rocky beach  beach where you first land much nicer. Everyone wants tips. \n

256909380.name: Little Paradise
256909380.author: a TripAdvisor user
256909380.reviewBody: Fantastic day on the Isla. We snorkeled and ate grilled Mahi Mahi on the beach.  What more can I say!  Take the time to visit the Isla.

256833440.name: Toes in the sand
256833440.author: a TripAdvisor user
256833440.reviewBody: A great day at a beautiful beach, fantastic service, food and drinks!  We took the water taxi and lounged the whole day, soaking up the sun and enjoying the beautiful scenery.  You can negotiate your drink prices and enjoy authentic food right on the beach!

256795084.name: It\'s OK
256795084.author: a TripAdvisor user
256795084.reviewBody: I completely agree with migachan,gd454 and robinti and their comments.Strongly recommend you do it on your own and not with the hotel reps. Just take the bus for 10 pesos each and the short boat ride over to the island for 40 pesos. Lunch and drinks won\'t be cheap on the island. Snorkeling was just ok not anywhere as good as Caribbean.You are probably better off not buying a meal and just having a couple of drinks. The restaurant people can be pushy.Being at an all inclusive hotel a big breakfast can tide you over till you get back for a late lunch.

256631826.name: It\'s ok
256631826.author: a TripAdvisor user
256631826.reviewBody: Joined a day tour to come here but realize we could have just taken the local bus and then a ferry ride for much cheaper.  The waves are not as strong but it\'s not that special compared with the ixtapa beach in front of our hotel.  The restaurants there are few and pricy.  I also went snorkeling at the coral beach but the waters weren\'t very clear.  Overall, it was ok, wouldn\'t really suggest it.

256346132.name: Mediocre
256346132.author: a TripAdvisor user
256346132.reviewBody: Not much else to do in Ixtapa, so we went. Snorkelling was probably good for the area but not as good as Caribbean or Hawaii.  If you are shy book the tour, if you are savvy do it yourself, take the bus to the ferry, get your own ferry tickets, find a restaurant, snorkel early before the crowds. The fish are spooked easily because of so many snorkellers. You can leave early if on your own otherwise have to spend all day there with the tour group.

256257235.name: Ixtapa Island Feb 2015
256257235.author: a TripAdvisor user
256257235.reviewBody: This was a really great place to spend the day. Take the water taxi over and you can spend the whole day. Snorkeling, lunch, massages and just laying out at the beach. A must do when in Ixtapa.

256246544.name: Been there done that
256246544.author: a TripAdvisor user
256246544.reviewBody: We only went again because we had friends with us who had not been there. Take the bus, get the ferry and find a place to eat there. Do not book it through the hotel or tour group you came with.

255861584.name: Good news bad news
255861584.author: a TripAdvisor user
255861584.reviewBody: Went there for some snorkelling. My husband and I were herded into groups and then had to keep with our guide...we wanted to be independent.

255639475.name: Guacamole !! Fun day !
255639475.author: a TripAdvisor user
255639475.reviewBody:
We went with three families -14 people - on a tour booked through Louis? (Will edit when I find his card!) Our guide was Mario, who was very good, polite, informative, attentive but not overbearing. They were on time, with a big van & driver. He pointed out the sights along the way to the "marina" at Playa Linda. We went directly through the market to the little boats and over to the island, across to the snorkelling side and sat in the shade at one of the little businesses as  Mario directed. Someone immediately came and took our lunch order ans set a time to eat ( included with tour) and another to specify how many would be snorkelling. They brought the gear, got everyone set up and off they went! Those of us who did not snorkel were served a pop and the only other person who approached us was selling massage services. (His English was good, he knew all the right massage terms and came back just to politely be sure we understood that it would not be him giving the massage! But we still weren't buying! ) not pushy!
I don't swim with fish, but those who did had fun and saw lots. If you are a pro, this is probably not your place, but it was good for us! Boogie boards, life vests, guides (who will feed the fish so you can see them) and pretty stringent rules about not standing on the coral (which is good). It was not busy when we were there 11:00am.
