Maybe 1/3 capacity if that. Would have been a nightmare if all those seats/tables had been full! After snorkelling we switched back to the other side for lunch which was served promptly and was good. Fish or chicken, chips and Guacamole!! (This was the only guacamole I encountered on my vacation sadly. It was great and I had seconds!)
After eating the kids went for a swim at this side. Calm water and a nice little beach. Also great that it was not busy!
Overall a fun day! We were not rushed or left waiting and felt it was well worth the $. 1280 pesos for four snorklers. Total. But bring some tips for the guys in the boats and the snorkle boys. Just 10's and 20's pesos. You know. Tip your guide better! Good times!

255602685.name: Pretty, but on the expensive side
255602685.author: a TripAdvisor user
255602685.reviewBody: Our visit to Ixtapa Island was ruined before it began, since it was simply used as bait to attempt to lure us into what would have surely been a day-long sales pitch / process related to the Time Share sales at the nearby Azul Ixtapa resort.  After we quickly extricated ourselves from the \'Den of Thieves\' at that property, we pressed on to see Ixtapa Island anyway.  The main (front side) of the Island is chock full of small restaurants with tables & palapas, much like other beaches here.  Each one has a staff member who will greet and cajole you in an attempt to sway you into their patch of beach.  We chose the furthest one.  The meal was OK but it was more expensive than similar fare in places like Playa La Madera.  The protected shore at that end was clean and enjoyable to hang out on.  All in all -- not the best day and have enjoyed other areas such as Playa La Ropa or Playa Larga much more.  However, friends who recently arranged transportation to the far side of Ixtapa Island (no vendors on that side it seems?) and packed their own picnic lunch, appeared to have had a wonderful day.  So we will have to try again!

255454586.name: Ixtapa Island Snorkeling
255454586.author: a TripAdvisor user
255454586.reviewBody:
Recently spent 2 weeks at the Azul Grand which is very close to Ixtapa Island.  We were a fifteen minute walk to the pier where you catch the water taxis to the island so we went there several times during our stay.  Water taxi cost 40 pesos round trip. You buy tickets at a booth a the end of the pier.Please note that the persons helping you on and off the boats will ask for tips so you may want to have some change to give them.  Usually put 6 to 8 persons on a boat.  Water taxis start running between 9 and 10 am.  
  
Once you get to the island, their are many restaurants all along the beaches.  Competition from waiters to get you to sit at their tables from the various restaurants is fierce.  The staff will allow you to leave your bags and towels on tables with the hope that you will purchase food and drinks when finished snorkeling or swimming in the ocean.  We always just purchased drinks.  The most common snorkeling area is Coral Beach.  Recommend that you go early before larger numbers of persons start to arrive as the beaches can get a little crowded later in the day.   Snorkeling is ok at Coral Beach with descent number and variety of fish and a reef close to shore.   Nothing too spectacular.  

We also snorkeled on the other side of the island and found a greater variety of fish including some larger ones.  One other bonus was no crowds.  

Definitely worth the trip and would be a nice spot to spend the day at the beach.  Lots of locals there on the weekends.  Fun time for everyone and certainly a cheap excursion.

255340448.name: Ixtapa Island
255340448.author: a TripAdvisor user
255340448.reviewBody: Beautiful views and nice sand.  Lots of fish there.  Swimming is nice also.  Lots of people do snorkelling\nBoat is 4 peso per person to go over.  Limited lifejackets.

255250957.name: These fish are hungry
255250957.author: a TripAdvisor user
255250957.reviewBody: This is a great way to experience snorkeling while only knee deep in the ocean. My wife is a lousy swimmer and is able to safely view a great deal of fish in their natural habitat. For the more experienced swimmer you are also able to go deeper and expand your view. These fish are hungry. Take some bread or crackers and watch them swarm. We have our own snorkeling equipment but they rent them there as well. The water taxi costs 40 pesos round trip. Watch your head getting into the boat as I knocked mine very hard. My only complaint is the harassment of venders petitioning your presence at their particular restaurant. We politely denied their requests and continued on. I wouldn\'t spend all day there and wouldn\'t pay for this particular excursion . Hop on the bus that says Playa Linda for 10 pesos and go for a couple hours. Good times.

255132404.name: A must do!
255132404.author: a TripAdvisor user
255132404.reviewBody:
10 peso's to get to the water taxi - 40 pesos for a return ticket on the water taxi and another 10 pesos to go back home. The memories you will bring home - priceless!

The bus stops in front of a little market that you can either browse on the way in or out. The usual tourist stuff.

Water taxi's run are going back and fourth all the time so very little waiting. Even if there is a line up the wait is short.

A few different beaches to choose from. We wanted to snorkel so we chose Coral beach. A bit rocky but that is what brings the fish. Bring your own equipment or rent from there.

We tried two of the three restaurants at this beach. We preferred the Lili Cipriani restaurant in the middle. The waiters seemed more friendly and the foods wasn't bad. Plus their washroom was't too bad for being on an island. 

Princess Rebeca on the other hand was terrible. If you face the ocean, this is the restaurant on the far left. They did set us up nicely with loungers, chairs, umbrella's and tables but that's all that was good. Not only was the food was terrible, the waiter tried to charge us for beers we didn't drink. Very pushy in the beginning and when they realized we weren't drinkers the service got very slow. Don't even try the bathroom - scary. 

Coming back to the mainland is again quick and easy. While you are waiting for your bus there is a crocodile enclosure you can check out. Very interesting and great for taking pictures.

A great day of fun for very little money.

254934849.name: Isla Ixtapa
254934849.author: a TripAdvisor user
254934849.reviewBody: We Kayaked over from our hotel, but you can take the bus to Playa Linda and go to the end of the pier and take the water taxi over, when you get there you walk across the island ( not even 0.5 of a km to the snorkeling bay. Good snorkeling, nice little bars and restaurants for snacks as well.

254844325.name: Never on Sunday!
254844325.author: a TripAdvisor user
254844325.reviewBody: Ixtapa Island is a lovely spot to spend a vacation day..  There are now 14 different restaurants to enjoy and the food and prices are not outrageous and pretty good.  The water is clean and clear but folks extoll the snorkeling and there isn\'t much to see unless you are fond of dead coral.  There are numerous massage tables if you don\'t want to view dead coral.  \nIf you love big noisy crowds and screaming, crying children, by all means visit the island on a weekend, especially Sunday, or a holiday.  Pretty deserted during the week if visiting when school is on.  All in all, a nice way to spend a day soaking up sun and swimming in clean water.

254597803.name: Nice Day Trip
254597803.author: a TripAdvisor user
254597803.reviewBody: Very nice, not overly crowded, Take the bus to Playa Linda and then walk to the end of the pier and take the water taxi

254538447.name: Just to get away
254538447.author: a TripAdvisor user
254538447.reviewBody: If you are stir crazy,you might spend a morning here. The snorkeling is not much. Ther is a little hike

254515796.name: A fun day
254515796.author: a TripAdvisor user
254515796.reviewBody: Excellent snorkelling, decent food although a little expensive. A relaxing way to spend a day. Don\'t take tour, grab a bus for a buck and the water taxi for $4 return

254476318.name: A day in the sun.
254476318.author: a TripAdvisor user
254476318.reviewBody: I enjoyed Ixtapa Island - the quick boat ride to the island for a day in the sun, and a day of swimming in the ocean.  The locals were friendly - only downside was the public washrooms...could have been cleaner.  Other than that a great place to visit.

254141123.name: Everyone got sick
254141123.author: a TripAdvisor user
254141123.reviewBody: Everyone got sick after eating at Restaurant Luillis on the beach by the good snorkeling area. Don\'t eat anything that was washed with water or eat ice. They have a well on the island. We "upgraded" to the shrimp and red snapper. \n\nIt was nice snorkeling with the fish.

254130376.name: Great way to spend a day
254130376.author: a TripAdvisor user
254130376.reviewBody: We chose to do this without a tour company. A cab to playa Linda and and a water taxi ride cost about $25 us. The tours were about $60 us. We walked playa Linda and enjoyed the gator, iguana and turtles that were on display. There are some giant iguanas in that area! The ride out to the island was great. We met Oscar at the third restaurant and quickly found a friend. We snorkeled a bit and saw some great fish and then got lazy in the comfortable chairs by the water. We chatted with a very nice group from Canada and enjoyed the restaurant\'s hospitality. A very good day that ended with a bit of shopping in playa Linda. A few unique things if you are willing to look.

254107067.name: Great!
254107067.author: a TripAdvisor user
254107067.reviewBody: Must check out.  The best softest beach around.  Soo friendly.  Water taxis are great, fun and safe!  Beach vendors are very respectful here in this part of Mexico.

254045914.name: Ixtapa Island
254045914.author: a TripAdvisor user
254045914.reviewBody: The beach restaurants cover the beach, once in the water it\'s quite rocky but once you start swimming/snorkeling the fish are there.

254045139.name: Don\'t go to Ixtapa island
254045139.author: a TripAdvisor user
254045139.reviewBody: Not worth the money. Snorkeling you had to pay extra for and the snorkels were very dirty. Coral was grey and fish weren\'t colourful. Beach covered in plastic chairs and tables where they charge you just to sit there. Don\'t waste the day on this

254042448.name: Overrated :(
254042448.author: a TripAdvisor user
254042448.reviewBody: Ixtapa Island is a waste of money. It\'s an island filled with plastic chairs and tables - the snorkelling is not fantastic. The only time you see fish is when the guide throws food.

254019671.name: Awesome Time
254019671.author: a TripAdvisor user
254019671.reviewBody: We had so much fun. The food and service from Carlos at Lilli Cipriani\'s was amazing. Our tour guide Jose was wonderful and very knowledgable about the area. Such a great time. The snorkeling was fun and with our guide picking up cool things off the bottom of the ocean it was pretty amazing. We will definitely be back.

253883455.name: Lovely beaches and food
253883455.author: a TripAdvisor user
253883455.reviewBody: It\'s well worth the short boat ride (40 pesos round trip) to Ixtapa Island. The beaches are lovely and the restaurants serve wonderful fresh seafood.

253612412.name: Great day trip for snorkelling
253612412.author: a TripAdvisor user
253612412.reviewBody: Great day trip from the club med across to the island. We took a private boat as the club was charging us a lot of money to get across and an even more to snorkel. We had our own snorkels so hired one of the guys walking on the beach. He took us for a boat ride along to ixtapa city, told us about the area and then took us to ixtapa island. There one of the restaurant waiters seated us by the beach. There is also some snorkel rental places around. The snorkeling is actually quite good. I saw an octopus, squid, an eel along with some beautiful fish. Totally worth a day of fun.

253595127.name: Simple heaven on earth
253595127.author: a TripAdvisor user
253595127.reviewBody: 10 minutes away from Club Med but it feels like a world away.  Simply amazing.  Don\'t forget to go there for lunch and dinner.

253500401.name: Very relaxing
253500401.author: a TripAdvisor user
253500401.reviewBody: The trip over is done by water taxi from Playa Linda.  Once you go through the crocodile and iguana site (great) catch the taxi and then you have a choice of 3 beaches - all able to be walked too.  We go over to Playa Veradaro as there are many restaurants, very calm water and very convenient to walk over to the coral beach were there is great snorkling.  (bring tortilla\'s to feed the fish). Friendly, clean and tasty restaurants

253433580.name: Best Snorkelling!
253433580.author: a TripAdvisor user
253433580.reviewBody: The island features picture perfect beaches -  the snorkelling was fantastic on the opposite side of the island. Right into the water there is coral reef that you could explore for hours. Ask for Pablo for an amazing tour - he\'ll show you all sorts of incredible sea life!

253356333.name: A visit to Ixtapa Island
253356333.author: a TripAdvisor user
253356333.reviewBody:
Travel to the island is quite easy . Find your way to the pier at Playa Linda . If staying at any of the hotels , a public transit bus costing 7-10 pesos from Ixtapa or 12 pesos from Zihuatanejo will drop you right in front of the pier. It is a 10 minute walk if staying at hotels around the Azul Grand. Of course , cabs are abundant and can drop you at the pier , and are waiting their in the evening . We chose to go early, 9 am ,  as the snorkelling is better at that time, because the water is not all churned up . The cost is 40 pesos each to take the boat over , don't lose the ticket they give you for you return trip home. Snorkelling gear was available to rent on the island, just not sure what the cost was .

On the way over in the boat , we were befriended by one of the restaurant owners on the way over - Luili sp? , set us up on the snorkelling beach with chairs and umbrella , and then went to his place on the swimming beach for lunch. Quite the little business man and a wealth of knowledge about the area .
 Bring water shoes for the snorkelling beach as it is killer on bare feet . When snorkelling try to stay away form the far left , and the tow will drag you in to a very shallow area with lots of coral... might get a bit cut up if your not paying attention. It was quite deserted for a hour or so, and that was good , had the beach and water to ourselves . More people started to arrive around 1045-11 am with snorkelling tours . Another reason to go early. 

We headed over to the beach side to swim a bit more after we staked our spot to plant ourselves in the sand . We grabbed a bucket of beer , and chilled as we watched more folks come over and run the gauntlet down the beach to find a place to sit. I did not find any to be too aggressive as I had read earlier. Lunch options at this particular restaurant - Luili sp? which drew us there were freshly caught fish and shrimp . We enjoyed a seasoned red snapper , and have no idea what the seasoning was , other than it was red and tasted amazing , and the shrimp were done in a garlic butter and were oh so good .It also with salad and chips and salsa , far too much food, but we devoured all of it . He was a great host, and was not pushy at all . I would recommend his spot .

The last boat leaves at about 5 pm .

We enjoyed a hot sunny day on the island , hope you will too .

253234371.name: Snorkeling fun
253234371.author: a TripAdvisor user
253234371.reviewBody: This is easy to get to if you just hop on the bus & then get on the boat taxi!  Very attentive snorkel rental & great lobster dinner on the beach with a view of the coral reef-even some baby sea turtles!

253208348.name: Super tranquil day on the beach!
253208348.author: a TripAdvisor user
253208348.reviewBody: Loved this little island.  It\'s 40 pesos on the water taxi from Playa Linda.  We spent the day lounging, reading, swimming, snorkeling, eating lunch, having a drink, etc.  Super quiet and calm.  So relaxing and just beautiful.

253197122.name: Ixtapa island
253197122.author: a TripAdvisor user
253197122.reviewBody: go and see 3 wonderful beaches take the bus to playa linda and take the shuttle boat over and enjoy please plan for the whole day till  5pm anyways.

253051548.name: Relaxing side trip
253051548.author: a TripAdvisor user
253051548.reviewBody: Relaxing area with kayak rentals, snorkeling and great food.  Everyone working the ferry barked out that they wanted tips.

252752527.name: Spend at least 1 day here!
252752527.author: a TripAdvisor user
252752527.reviewBody: It is a nice change of pace from the resort, nice shade under umbrellas if you buy drink and food.  Might want to keep track of what you order, I think we were over charged, but didn\'t want to bother, so maybe that happens as tourists don\'t pay attention.  Water was great for swimming, kids loved playing on the beach.  Enjoy!

252734379.name: Fresh fish on the beach
252734379.author: a TripAdvisor user
252734379.reviewBody: Ixtapa Island can be reached by water taxi or in our case, a charter fishing boat. This is the 2nd year we have done this, leave the marina about 7, small game fish just offshore, then about 11 go the Island where our freshly caught (black tuna and spanish mackeral this year, skipjact tuna last year) fish are collected by Indio resturant and a  table set up for our group of 6. Fish is prepared 4 different ways and brought to the table, washed down with cold beer and/or margaritas. There are 2 sides to the resturant, one facing the small boat mooring area and the 2nd the snorkeling area, the side we were on. Prices very reasonable, food prep excellent, service ok. Downside, pesky flies and they don\'t take credit cards. Both years, friends who went with us commented that is was one of the hightlights of their vacation. I would also consider spending time over here taking the water taxi.

252646462.name: Highlight of our Ixtapa trip!
252646462.author: a TripAdvisor user
252646462.reviewBody: We only spent a day here and glad we did. We fished with a small charter boat "Juan" was our fisherman extrodinaire! We took our catch to Ixtapa island and they greeted us on the dock, took our fish, cooked it up, brought us beers, chairs, snorkelling equipment. We spent the day eating freshly cooked fish, the kids searched for seashells, met some great families. My daughter got her hair braided, we all bought jewellery. Everything was so cheap! I loved it. We stayed so long we thought Juan would have left but there he was waiting for us to return. Go check it out, we are sure glad we did!

252599379.name: Great Beaches, cheap beer
252599379.author: a TripAdvisor user
252599379.reviewBody: We went to the island twice on our last trip to Ixtapa.  It is only 40 pesos to go and come back per person.  Chair rental was free as long as you were buying something (20 pesos per beer at El Indio).  There are 3 main beaches on the island, all great.  The snorkeling at Playa Coral was awesome!

252497265.name: Lost it\'s appeal
252497265.author: a TripAdvisor user
252497265.reviewBody: I first visited this Island in 1986 and loved it. Since then we have returned 5 times. This time I was uncomfortable with the number of people and the lack of any upgrades in the facilities offered. The beachfront restaurants do not look like a safe place to eat and the boys waiting at both ends of the water taxi very demanding of their tips. I don\'t think we\'ll visit the Island again

252444587.name: Not impressed
252444587.author: a TripAdvisor user
252444587.reviewBody: Well this was not a good experience. Very high pressure the moment you step off the boat. The island is beautiful but we tried all 3 beaches and had to fend off vendors at everyone. Just makes it an unpleasant experience. They are VERY high pressure

252288651.name: A fun day
252288651.author: a TripAdvisor user
252288651.reviewBody:
If heading over to Ixtapa Island, make sure to visit Luillis Restaurant

Oscar will most likely meet you on the peer and walk you over to his restaurant
The best "enormous" garlic shrimp we have ever had!!

Ferry costs 40 pesos return
Opposite side of the shore is Coral Beach, beautiful fish you can see them off the shore without having to go snorkeling
There are also hiking trails to check out

252234264.name: Love the people
252234264.author: a TripAdvisor user
252234264.reviewBody: The group went snorkeling, I had a relaxing massage by the beach. You don\'t need to snorkel to see tropical fish. You can see them in the tidal pools just wading in the water.

252195477.name: Beautiful Spot - Well worth a visit
252195477.author: a TripAdvisor user
252195477.reviewBody: We were there over New Years Eve week, so it was extremely busy. \n\nIt was very easy to tell though how stunning the various beaches are on the Island, and it left us wishing we were there a week later once the crowds had dispersed. Worth a visit for sure.

252118681.name: Loved our time at Ixtapa Island!
252118681.author: a TripAdvisor user
252118681.reviewBody: From Playa Linda, catch a ferry boat for $1.50@ roundtrip to Ixtapa Island where we relaxed on the beach, under an umbrella all day drinking $1.50 bottled beer and eating fresh seafood. Ixtapa Island has soft sand and clear water. There are a few different stops off the ferry onto wooden docks where you can get off to explore the \u00bc mile island. The ferry boats come and go all day (last departure at 5pm). After a few visits to the island, we found that it is an easy and safe walk to the other sides of the island through the trees in the center of the island. There are clear paths that are walked by guests and vendors each day. Say Hello to Willy (selling tatoos)! Our favorite side of the island was the beach that faced Azul. The beach was flat and you could walk out into the water further with calm shallow water. Two other sides of the island, where vendors are also located, have a sloped beach. You can snorkel on Coral beach and rent equipment for about $9. The food was awesome!

252114921.name: The island
252114921.author: a TripAdvisor user
252114921.reviewBody: Great snorkelling,beach is made up of small coral bits so a little hard on the feet . Many little restaurants, easy access on and off via boat transfers. There is also a sandy swim bach and a couple of other smaller isolated beaches you can walk to.

251962290.name: Ixtapa Island - great snorkelling!
251962290.author: a TripAdvisor user
251962290.reviewBody: ToursInIxtapaZihuatanejo.com\nBooked my tour of Ixtapa Island online with this company.  They were great.  Jose was our tour guide and he was awesome.  Picked us up at 10 am.  Drove to Playa LInda, got on the boat and ten minute boat ride and snorkelled all day.  Had a great lunch and hung on the beach and got back to the hotel around 4:00.  It was a great day and would recommend them to anyone.  Jose was awesome!!

251939973.name: Anchored in the bay
251939973.author: a TripAdvisor user
251939973.reviewBody: We didn\'t actually go on to Ixtapa Island, we anchored in the bay on our way back from a fishing boat adventure.  The bay was calm, warm and awesome green sea water color!  We jumped off the boat and floated around for about an hour or so.  The waiters on the island will deliver beer pretty much however they can!  You call out how many and they hitch a ride on a small boat or paddle out on a kayak!  We had beer delivered twice and both times in pails of ice!  They just need the bottles back.  \n\nLovely :)

251868115.name: Great excursion
251868115.author: a TripAdvisor user
251868115.reviewBody: Don\'t pay for a tour from hotel, just grab a bus or cab to marina and get water taxi to island, this will save you lots of $$$

251726475.name: Great for relaxing and snorkelling
251726475.author: a TripAdvisor user
251726475.reviewBody: We spent a day on Ixtapa Island and it was beautiful. We spent the day at the last restaurant on the beach where the boats let you off and they looked after us very well. Even took us over to the other side of the island to snorkel on the coral beach. I had a massage and for $20 it was as good as any massage I\'ve had in Canada. Overall another wonderful day on the beach. Don\'t order the drinks that come in the pineapples though - attracted a lot of wasps.

251602237.name: Great snorkel spot.
251602237.author: a TripAdvisor user
251602237.reviewBody: Shuffle your feet. Lots of stingrays. So fun to see! Massage great food a bit over priced for the area

251497493.name: Nice beach,clear water
251497493.author: a TripAdvisor user
251497493.reviewBody: Having fish swim right up to you to be fed was exciting for our little girl. Decent variety of restaraunts to chose from

251364553.name: True Mexican beach experience
251364553.author: a TripAdvisor user
251364553.reviewBody: Most folks were snorkeling on the coral beach side of the island where you will see lots of fish (like in the Carribean), but I liked hanging out on the side where the water taxis drop you off on the lounge chairs outside the restaurant that cooked the fish I just caught - Mahi Mahi and black tuna.

251341853.name: Ixtapa island
251341853.author: a TripAdvisor user
251341853.reviewBody: The small boats were hard to get into and out of....the snorkeling on the island we really rough, the coral and rocks made it very difficult to snorkel!

251303662.name: Simplicity at its best
251303662.author: a TripAdvisor user
251303662.reviewBody: Some of the best lobster and coconut shrimp I\'ve ever had! Everything was sooo fresh! All the staff was very nice and welcoming to us from the moment you walk on the port to get on the boats til the moment you get off. If you think Ixtapa and Zihua are chilled out places, wait until you get to this island. You are in a whole new world. We went early in the morning, so we watched local boats come in with the day\'s supply of food, drinks and other goods. It\'s definitely a locals\' hangout.

251270810.name: 3 beachs in one
251270810.author: a TripAdvisor user
251270810.reviewBody: after taking the boat from Playa del LInda to the island you can enjoy a drink/food on the beach then walk thru the "woods" and enjoy the next beach which has snorkeling along with all amendities then climb the rocks to the next beach for more fun

251201661.name: Great food and snorkeling!!
251201661.author: a TripAdvisor user
251201661.reviewBody: Great place to snorkel. Make sure you get off on the second stop and walk to the other side of the island (about 100 meters). That\'s where the coral and fish are. The food and drinks were quite reasonable. They cook the seafood over a wood fire which was amazing. Remember to take cash (Paso\'s) . They do no accept credit card as there is no electricity. The washroom are VERY RUSTIC to put it lightly (you have to take a bucket of water and fill the back of the toilet tank to flush! Didn\'t bother the guys but not so great for the ladies.  Don\'t let this small set back deter you from coming to this great island.  \nIf you don\'t like crowded beaches, get there before 10am and leave at 1pm when the beach start to get full.

251109774.name: Lovely
251109774.author: a TripAdvisor user
251109774.reviewBody: This is a must do thing while in Ixtapa. You will not be disappointed. You can snorkel or just lay on the beach. Good food and great service on the island.

250703892.name: Snorkelling
250703892.author: a TripAdvisor user
250703892.reviewBody: So helpful took the water taxi for 40 pesos and rented equipment and hired a guide which was the best thing to do be sure and have a pineapple drink

250647920.name: great place for snorkeling and relaxing
250647920.author: a TripAdvisor user
250647920.reviewBody: Ixtapa island is a little gem where you can get away for the day enjoy snorkeling, relaxing read a book lay on the beach all of that great comfort

250628867.name: Awesome Adventure
250628867.author: a TripAdvisor user
250628867.reviewBody: Great snorkeling spot. Got to see lots of beautiful fish. Beautiful beach. Great swimming spot. Would absolutely go again!

250622479.name: Quiet and relaxing
250622479.author: a TripAdvisor user
250622479.reviewBody: We spend three months in Ixtapa and try to get to Ixtapa Island at least every 2 weeks.  It\'s a 15 minute bus ride to Playa Linda where you can stop and see the crocodile and iguana sanctuary.  A few pesos on a little ferry boat will get you to the island.  There are three sides to this island.  You can snorkel on one side, or sit on a beautiful quiet beach with soft waves.  You can pick a restaurant on the beaches that will provide you with a lounge chair and great food and drinks.  I highly recommend a visit to Ixtapa Island while you\'re in the area.

250386695.name: A must when in Ixtapa
250386695.author: a TripAdvisor user
250386695.reviewBody: 40 peso water taxi ride from Playa Linda, lots of places to eat, cheap drinks and nice beaches. good for a few hour getaway from the hotel.

250186153.name: Easy location to visit reef and see fish.
250186153.author: a TripAdvisor user
250186153.reviewBody: Reef is just off the beach and you can stand in the water and the fish will come.  Local bar/restaurant quite good and prices very reasonable.

250161482.name: Fish are everywhere... but a bit of a tourist trap
250161482.author: a TripAdvisor user
250161482.reviewBody: Liked showing my nieces the fish, that were all around you, even at knee depth.  The restaurant is ok, and its not expensive but you have to be very careful about your bill as they don\'t always charge you the price on the menu.  It closes @ 5pm, you can just jump a bus for 10 pesos to get there.  (Take the bus to Playa Linda, its the last stop you can\'t miss it.)  The market on the way to the pier is a cheaper market, so buying your souvenirs from there is good, don\'t forget to negotiate.  Just take the ferry for 40 pesos a person.  Don\'t need to book a boat.

250106673.name: Nice little getaway
250106673.author: a TripAdvisor user
250106673.reviewBody: Beautiful beach, nice clear water for snorkelling, didn\'t use any restaurants but nice little escape fro the resorts!

250097526.name: Beautiful, calm beaches
250097526.author: a TripAdvisor user
250097526.reviewBody: Ixtapa Island is beautiful little island with calm beaches.  Onside is a coral beach where fishes swim right up to you.  Sand is really coarse so, water shoes are recommended.  The other side is a calm normal beach that is waist high for a while.  Waves are both sides are 6" to a foot at most.  Food on island is generally cheap and delicious.  There are beach vendors and prices are generally higher that Zihuatenejo.  Boat trip is like 10 minutes from Ixtapa marina.

249841381.name: Coral Beach - Ixtapa Island
249841381.author: a TripAdvisor user
249841381.reviewBody: There are 3 beaches on Ixtapa island not including the nude beach and no one wants to see me naked including myself so we did not go there.  We got off at the second stop on the water taxi then walked across or behind that beach to the coral beach where we went to El Indio restaurant and met Sid.  He turned out to be a interesting man that we got to know and loved.  He also took the four of us out fishing for the day for $1800 pesos and we caught some tuna and mackerel  which he brought back to the restaurant and cooked for us in several different ways.  The fishing trip was more of a sight seeing tour so the day with tip cost us $50 Cdn each. Very worth it.

249621031.name: Unbelievable
249621031.author: a TripAdvisor user
249621031.reviewBody: Take an excusion with ixtpa eco excursions with Javier. It combines a bike trip through an ecological park filled with exotic flora and animals. Go kayaking off the island and snorkeling in the bay. The fish are incredibly abundant because it is protected from fishing. Javier is very gracious and knowledgeable.$86 dollars a person includes everything including lunch on the beach.

249566840.name: Ixtapa island
249566840.author: a TripAdvisor user
249566840.reviewBody: I enjoyed it but want to try manzanillo too. We took our own equipment this time to snorkel, took water taxi once and kayaks from azul grand once

249374082.name: Not much to write about
249374082.author: a TripAdvisor user
249374082.reviewBody: The descriptions of this place were good...nice swimming beach and snorkelling. Snorkelling was poor. The ocean was rough and low visibility. The other side of the island looked nice for swimming but they have made that into a marina...too many boats! Go figure...Don`t spend your excursion on this one.

249099175.name: No Biggy
249099175.author: a TripAdvisor user
249099175.reviewBody: The main attraction here is the short boat trip to Isla Ixtapa (Ixtapa Island).  Otherwise the beach on the island is small and rocky.  The few restaurants offer good food but are expensive compared to other restaurants. A fair warning.. the washroom facilities are horrible.  We enjoyed Playa La Ropa in Zihuatanejo or for more excitement and local flavour go to Playa Municipal (next to the famous basketball court) at about 6:30AM.  The local fisherman are bringing in their catch and the buyers are all there to make their purchases.  It is very exciting atmosphere and if you are in Mexico enjoy and experience the real Mexico.

248981013.name: a great afternoon on Ixtapa Island
248981013.author: a TripAdvisor user
248981013.reviewBody: A wonderful escape from the masses  of people and large waves of Playa Larga.    There was some interesting marine life to see snorkelling on Coral Beach.  The most interesting fish I saw were close to the shore, where it was quite rocky  You had to carefully maneuver to get around or over them to get further out and the day I was there, visibility further out wasn\'t great.  Given the rocks, coral--flippers really are essential.  The swimming beach isn\'t huge but the water is calm and warm and was perfect for just hanging out.  Lots of good restaurants--we parked ourselves at Pamelita on the end.  Prices aren\'t all that cheap, but the quality and taste of the food is great--the coconut shrimp and the garlic fish filet were delicious. You can have your table and lounge chair for as long as you\'re there, even if you\'re just having some beer.  Definitely worth the trip.  Many of the all-inclusives offer tours there for around $45 USD per person, but it is much better to do it on your own--cheaper and more flexible.  For 2 of us, transport from Ixtapa, ample food and drink, we spent $40 USD all together for a full afternoon.

248643555.name: Great Snorkelling!
248643555.author: a TripAdvisor user
248643555.reviewBody: Great snorkelling here!  Take a boat over for $4 return.  Lots of restaurants and bars.  Boats run continually so no long waits.

248520634.name: Ixtapa Island
248520634.author: a TripAdvisor user
248520634.reviewBody: I loved the beach restaurants but the beach was way too rocky to get in. If you can get by the rocks the snorkelling is beautiful.

248311669.name: Trip to do
248311669.author: a TripAdvisor user
248311669.reviewBody: Ixtapa island is the place to go, remember restaurants are there to earn a living so you must support them if you want to use beach furniture. Don\'t be a minge. Worth the trip from Zihuatanejo or Ixtapa.\nGreat beaches....

248291884.name: A Must Do!!!!
248291884.author: a TripAdvisor user
248291884.reviewBody: Very easy to grab a water taxi and head over to the island for a day, only cost 40 peso. There are lots of restaurants to choose from where you can get a lounge chair, umbrella, and table to use for the day. Walk around and get a lay of the land before you pick a spot.  We picked a place on Playa Varadero,  the food was very tasty, had fresh snapper for lunch. Snorkel gear is available for rent and it is safe to leave your gear at the table while you snorkel. Good place to take a beginner to snorkel, however the water gets cloudy if it is a busy day. Overall a must do when in town!

247854516.name: Great Snorkeling
247854516.author: a TripAdvisor user
247854516.reviewBody: Isla Ixtapa is a fantastic place to take your kids snorkeling.  The water is calm and shallow.  The abundance of fish of all shapes and colors is out of this world for the Pacific Ocean side of Mexico.\n\nI would strongly recommend taking the first water taxi to the island in the AM and hit the south side of the island (snorkel side as opposed to the boat side).  The restaurants on the island will offer the use of there lounge chairs and table and chairs for "free" as long as you buy drinks or food from them.  The prices are reasonable.  Spend 2-4 hours playing in the water or on the beach and then get off the island.  There are tours of people that get brought to the island to snorkel, except they are all wearing life jackets and holding onto a large kick board.  It is pretty obnoxious.  When the tours start to arrive the beach and water are overan with people.  At this point it is time to leave.

247690000.name: Great snorkelling - go early!
247690000.author: a TripAdvisor user
247690000.reviewBody: Take the Playa Linda bus for 10 pesos per person to the end of the line - Playa Linda.  Buy a round trip water taxi ticket (keep your stub) for 40 pesos person.  The water taxi ride is less than 10 min.  The guys helping you in and out of the boat on each end work for tips - totally voluntary...  The back side of the second stop is the Coral Beach.  I believe the restaurant we sat at was Princess Rebekkah - they do not charge for tables and umbrellas but, of course, the recommendation is that you order some cervesa or food throughout the day.  Your gear is safe at the table while you snorkel.  The food was very tasty.  Snorkel gear is available for rent.  The water was pleasant and lots of fish though the coral is past its prime.  The island gets very busy after lunch so go early before the water gets cloudy.  We went twice on our most recent trip :-)  Hop on the water taxi and bus to make your way back to your hotel.  Don\'t forget to check out the Crocodiles!!!  There is also a little market for shopping and an Oxxo for your convenience.

247685031.name: Great day - a mini retreat...
247685031.author: a TripAdvisor user
247685031.reviewBody: After almost two weeks in Ixtapa, our day on Ixtapa Island was like a \'mimi-retreat\'.  We took the local bus to the crocodile farm (which is worth seeing) and then boarded one of the many little boats (and there are many - some in good repair and some not) over to the island (second stop).  We walked through to the other side and snorkeled all afternoon.  TIP:  make sure  you don\'t have to purchase a very expensive lunch before sitting down in the \'free\' chairs.  We did move to another spot where we didn\'t have to spend a whole lot of money on food.  The tables belong to the many restaurants which are right on the beach and usually there is no problem at all.  This is our second time to the island and this time we had to move because we didn\'t want to spend $100.00 on lunch.  Snorkeling was good  - I even saw a sea snake this time!

247621639.name: Great Snorkeling
247621639.author: a TripAdvisor user
247621639.reviewBody: Traveled to Ixtapa Island and went to Coral Beach. Luis was a wonderful host and made sure we had everything we needed.

247490317.name: good snorkel , clean water ,
247490317.author: a TripAdvisor user
247490317.reviewBody:
very nice snorkel spot , clear water , good coral. I'm always thrilled to see little moray and saw black and white spotted eel in a coral hole.
Fresh fish lunch very good.

By afternoon got very crowded , best in AM , leave after lunch.

247426792.name: Nice Tourist Excursion
247426792.author: a TripAdvisor user
247426792.reviewBody: 40 pesos per person for round trip on a very small not particularly comfortable motor boat. Get off at second stop. Walk to the other side of the island, you will be given a free table and chairs on the beach in return for ordering reasonably priced food and drink. Bring water shoes. Bring snorkeling equipment. All in all a fun few hours.

247098694.name: It\'s like a mini vacation
247098694.author: a TripAdvisor user
247098694.reviewBody:
It only takes about 3 minutes to cross then you get bombarded by people trying to get to to sit at their restaurant. Once you decide where to sit it's great. Swimming on one side and snorkelling on the other. 
You can rent snorkel gear from the restaurant for about $12-15
Great swimming beach. There are jets kid, banana boats, all kinds of things to do
Tip the waiters well, they work on tips alone.

246884846.name: Tropical Paradise
246884846.author: a TripAdvisor user
246884846.reviewBody:
Isla Ixtapa was a fun day-trip from Ixtapa.  We took a taxi to the "Crocodile Farm" and then the water taxi out to the Island.  We got off at the 2nd stop and spent the day on the Playa Coral at El Indio restaurant.  I thought the snorkeling was fantastic!   I've snorkeled in Hawaii and Puerto Vallarta and this was the best!   The water was clear and there were a TON of fish.   Sadly, a lot of people walked on the coral and it was obviously in a poor state.

Sure, there were a ton of people out, but made for good people watching.   I also got quite sun-burned.   Don't forget to reapply sunscreen between snorkeling adventures!

The bathrooms were old-fashioned, in that you had to pour water into the bowl to get it to flush.   And although there were sinks with faucets, no water came out of them.  Made me wonder about the sanitation of the food preparers.

Overall, it was a fun experience and I would recommend it.

246716708.name: Beer & Swim
246716708.author: a TripAdvisor user
246716708.reviewBody: Six Coronas for $100 pesos, great food reasonably priced, fantastic swimming or snorkeling! Three beaches to choose from. They even have bunnies on the island. When I come back the island will be over run with rabbits!

246461927.name: Snorkelling
246461927.author: a TripAdvisor user
246461927.reviewBody: Ixtapa Island is a great way to spend the day to go snorkelling and relaxing.  We had lunch on the beach between spending time in the water checking out the fish. Only negative was the number of people in the same place.

246179660.name: Do your own tour
246179660.author: a TripAdvisor user
246179660.reviewBody: Ixtapa island is a great place to spend a day with nice beach, decent snorkeling and good restaurants. My only advice is to organize the tour yourself and save enormously. We booked a tour through the hotel for 52$ US and it can easily be done for 25-30$\nJust hop on any bus going to Playa Linda 10 pesos get off walk through the market walk past the beach to the pier hop on the boat to the Island 40 pesos return ( keep ticket) when you get there do the back side for best snorkeling. You can rent equipment for about 13$ or bring your own. Lunch will cost 10-15$. With the savings you won\'t mind tipping the boat guys or picking up something at the market or having an extra beer or delicious ceviche or guacamole. Enjoy.

246124294.name: Beautiful place
246124294.author: a TripAdvisor user
246124294.reviewBody: To get there just take a taxi to Playa Linda then walk till water taxi-40 pesos per person and you are there. You can sit there all day snorkeling was nice. Damian the instructor really nice. Vendors  come and try to sell you items no gracias is enough. Must see while in Ixtapa.

246059667.name: Worth the visit
246059667.author: a TripAdvisor user
246059667.reviewBody: We took the local bus from Ixtapa and the water taxi over. The bus is 11 peso\'s and water taxi is 40 peso\'s. we rented snorkelling equip for 100 peso\'s.  Don\'t bother paying $45 US for the guided tour.\nGet there early and you can get the front tables on the beach for buying a couple of beer. 20 peso\'s each. Worth it to sit there watching the surf sipping on a cold beer after snorkeling for a couple of hours.

245931988.name: Too busy
245931988.author: a TripAdvisor user
245931988.reviewBody: Did not realize we met a guy on taxi he was a waiter from a restaurant on island he encouraged us too stay there and sit got us a nice lounge chairs with cushions etc we had eaten a big breakfast before we went so we just wanted to relax we were hounded all morning to either order something to eat or too do an activity we ordered two coronas then the waiter brings us a bucket of coronas to buy it was ridiculous and lots of people walking by us and kids throwing sand etc so we got up to walk around the island the same thing everyone bugging us to book excursions or too eat at their  restaurant we finally took water taxi back to resort at about 1 pm

245413970.name: A great day on Isla de Ixtapa
245413970.author: a TripAdvisor user
245413970.reviewBody:
We spent a day on Isla de Ixtapa during our trip to Troncones. We were 2 families with young children and the beach swimming for the younger ones is not an option in Troncones (quite often not for the adults either.) We had a car so it was a quick 20 minute drive from Troncones to Playa Linda and then a short water taxi ride over to the island. The kids spent all day in the water and loved every minute of it. The adults relaxed and had some great drinks served in full pineapples.
The food was OK but the palapa restaurants on the island are somewhat expensive. They have you captive after all. It was very quiet when we were there on Dec. 16 and I can imagine that it can get very crowded. The only downside to the whole day was the number of locals trying to sell their goods. While I understand they need to make a living, it is very frustrating when you can't hold a conversation with your friends because the lady selling sea shell necklaces won't take no for an answer. I live in Mexico and am used to the artisans trying to sell me their goods, but I have never felt quite so harassed as this. Maybe it was worse for us because it was so quiet.
If you go, do try to remember to ask your waiter about the deer on the island. My daughter and I stumbled upon them by accident on our last trip up the hill to the restroom before heading back to the mainland. They had been fed a huge pile of vegetables and tortillas, which I am guessing is a daily ritual and one could get quite close and take pictures. Really fun for my daughter!

All in all a great day.

245295908.name: Great!
245295908.author: a TripAdvisor user
245295908.reviewBody: go to varadero island side, the last restaurant on the strip is quiet, good sea food, good prices and Friendly/Honest people!  great swim!!!

245034792.name: A peaceful haven
245034792.author: a TripAdvisor user
245034792.reviewBody: We went during the quiet season, so I can\'t attest to how this little island may seem during high season. When we went, it was quiet, few people, sun was shining. We snorkeled over the reefs (which as a Scuba diver, didn\'t impress me much). There are several reef fish. Water is a little murky near the shore. We pretty much "camped out" for the whole day, ate (service was great), and ran into the ocean every few minutes. A couple of peddlers came by every hour, but they weren\'t too persistent. This is a great place to spend the day with family. The playa is super protected and a great place for kids to snorkel. *We spent the day on the backside of the island, the "reef side."

245024302.name: Beautiful day out.
245024302.author: a TripAdvisor user
245024302.reviewBody: A wonderful day away from all-inclusive or regular hotel. Snorkeling, not a huge number of fish, a bite to eat, a massage if you want, and the big pineapple drinks. Nothing to dislike.

244976692.name: A Day on the Island
244976692.author: a TripAdvisor user
244976692.reviewBody:
Ixtapa Island is reached using water taxi from Playa Linda. The island itself has three different bays all with restaurants and beaches - we made our choice based solely on which beach we thought would have the sun the longest before falling into the shade. 

We ended up choosing Restaurant Rebecca, which happily provided us loungers and umbrellas for the day. We stayed the whole day and had a full seafood lunch from the restaurant which was quite good and fresh. We snorkeled twice, but found the variety of fish to be ok, and not as good as Las Gatas. 

The restaurant waiter was quite attentive and took us on an walk to see the resident island deer and rabbits, which roam freely. 

The only real downside was the condition of the bathroom, which were shared by all the restaurants on the beach - the nicest description is "rustic". The ladies had a ton of mice feces, which made you not want to accidentally touch anything. 

If you're an adventurous traveler and can handle some rustic elements it's an enjoyable day.

244828695.name: Lovely Island
244828695.author: a TripAdvisor user
244828695.reviewBody:
This is a quick boat ride from the pier down the beach from Ixtapa Azul.  We went twice. The food on the island was not very good at all (moldy chips, among other problems) and there were a ton of peddlers that were very, very aggressive.  LIke wouldn't after we said no numerous times, while trying to eat our marginal lunches on the west side beach.  That beach is VERY full of broken shells.  Bring water shoes.  There is good snorkeling there.  They feed the fish cat food to keep a bunch around.  They "kindly" rushed out to give us a bag as we were headed out (we brought our own gear) and then we were charged $6 for it later!  The water had terrible visibilty while were were there (rainy season) but I'm guessing other times of year it is very nice!

The east side beach was WAY better.  I found everyone less pushy over there, but it was a different day.  Drink prices were higher there (both sides) than other places, but they have to bring EVERYTHING out there, so I guess it's to be expected.  

One nice thing was they had massage tables (west side) and they were only $35!!  Mine lasted more than an hour as well.  I did enjoy that with real ocean sounds i the background, instead of some CD playing.  

I would go back for sure.

244804847.name: not much to do, snorkeled off the beach , so, so lunch, back to hotel.
244804847.author: a TripAdvisor user
244804847.reviewBody: it was hot, not much shade, lunch on the beach was nice . would not do this one again,  would have rather gone to zih to do some shopping, weather was great that is what we come for .

244581968.name: WildForestReview
244581968.author: a TripAdvisor user
244581968.reviewBody: Looking for a good day trip? Here\'s a good spot. Nice beach with lots of cantinas and food service. Don\'t bother booking a tour tho. You can get there on the cheap by taking the Play Linda bus for a dollar. Hop on the water taxi for a couple of bucks more. Save your pesos for beer.

244313663.name: Do not pass this up!
244313663.author: a TripAdvisor user
244313663.reviewBody: We were staying a a very nice all inclusive in Playa Linda and I could see Isla Ixtapa from my balcony. Never really wanted to head over there as I thought it would be another tourist trap.  take the 40 Peso water taxi over to the island. You do not need to book one of the private trips for much more. We got off at the second stop and wandered down to the end of the beach. Peacefull, warm beautiful calm waters and great service.  Purchase a beer or two and the chase lounge is free. Do not miss this beautiful opportunity to spend a few hours on the Island. Life is Good! ENJOY

243494654.name: A day trip
243494654.author: a TripAdvisor user
243494654.reviewBody: I first went to here 15 years ago. It was a very fun day trip, that was out of the way. My return was... a bit crowded. Still a fun day of sitting on the beach and enjoying not moving, but a lot of people are now enjoying the same. The prices of the food reflect such. The reef is also showing signs of deterioration due to the number of people, and the disrespect they show by walking across it at low tide, instead of swimming over it. If you are wanting to sit and relax, it is still a good trip with good food.

243366765.name: 4 beaches
243366765.author: a TripAdvisor user
243366765.reviewBody: 3 beaches with many sit down services, easy trip but have to leave before 5.00pm \nspend one day there..

243183353.name: good snorkeling
243183353.author: a TripAdvisor user
243183353.reviewBody: the snorkeling on coral beach was pretty good here. Easy to get in, even for kids. Not much beach though. Most of it is taken up with restaurants. Very nice scenery though.

243061725.name: Not impressed
243061725.author: a TripAdvisor user
243061725.reviewBody: Not too impressed but I have been there before. Water was rough to snorkel. Much better snorkeling beach at LeRopa.

242153919.name: Been there over 25 Times
242153919.author: a TripAdvisor user
242153919.reviewBody: Best place to relax and eat and drink last restaurant on beach at the very end from the boat launch drop-off (do not get off 1st drop off  as most people do ,,go to 2nd drop off  "Paridesco es con deso" ask for Tina and Pablo the best on the island ,,tell her Kenny/Kathy from NY friends she will take best care of you!!

241886616.name: Nothing special
241886616.author: a TripAdvisor user
241886616.reviewBody: Much better beaches over on the Zihuat side.  Snorkeling poor, unless you\'ve never been to the Caymans or Thailand.  Beach overcrowded, drinks overpriced.  My favorite beach was LeRopa.  No surf, no rocks, clean wide sand.  Try it.

241472768.name: relaxing
241472768.author: a TripAdvisor user
241472768.reviewBody: A nice place to visit, they have snorkeling and restaurants there, and swimming, and you can relax there. you take a water taxi over for around 3 dollars

241419258.name: A must see ...
241419258.author: a TripAdvisor user
241419258.reviewBody: A great day trip to the island ... after catching a few fish we were taken to the island and had the fish prepared for lunch. While our lunch was being prepared we spent some time snorkeling!

241170479.name: Heaven
241170479.author: a TripAdvisor user
241170479.reviewBody: The snorkelling, the view, the swimming!  Had the fish, they said it was Maui Maui, it wasn\'t and was mushy!  The beer could have been a lot colder!  Other wise beautiful, relaxing!  Our tour guide was really helpful,  RECOMMEND THE TOUR,  although you could take a bus, or ride a bike there and pay for the water taxi!  Oh if you don\'t give the water taxi guy a tip they get pissed! They expect a tip which is unfortunate!

240884703.name: Clear warm turquoise water
240884703.author: a TripAdvisor user
240884703.reviewBody: It\'s what a beach should be: warm  clear water and clean sand.  Restaurants on the beach serve fresh seafood. You\'ll find kayak and jet ski rental, banana boat rides and a nice place to swim. A paid boat ride on a small boat takes about ten minutes to reach the island.

240731674.name: Isle Ixtapa el Marlin Restaurant
240731674.author: a TripAdvisor user
240731674.reviewBody: Visited Isle Ixtapa yesterday to take in the beaches.  The "Coral Beach" was beautiful, walked from one end to the other then decided not to snorkel and to head to the swimming beaches across the way.  Ended up at el Marlin with the pink  tablecloths.....well we enjoyed the beach and the swim however the beer was warm, the food passable and the service inattentive.  Restrooms grimy.  Watch for the tip, it\'s included in the final bill.  \nMake sure you talk to other tourists before visiting Isle Ixtapa and choose a better restaurant than we did.

240386099.name: Ask before you buy
240386099.author: a TripAdvisor user
240386099.reviewBody: Cheap boat ride to get to the island.  We went to snorkel and were lead to the snorkel area.  Access was difficult because of the waves and the coral beach.  The fish will come right up to you looking for food.  Amazing colors and variety.  We had massages at 250 pesos each but made the mistake of ordering drinks before asking the price.  When the bill came at 320 pesos we were stunned.  That was for two drinks.  We bartered and got the price to 200 but that was still high.  Walked the beaches to the other side.  Nice view, small island.  Well worth the visit.

239576380.name: fun in the sun
239576380.author: a TripAdvisor user
239576380.reviewBody: cheap to get to the island, they wait on you well so they expect a good tip at the end of the day.  Cheap massages, snorkleing was fun and the food was good.  We had a seafood platter including lobster.

239399207.name: Beautiful beaches with good snorkeling
239399207.author: a TripAdvisor user
239399207.reviewBody: The cafe there is a great place to eat lunch then rent kayaks and snorkel gear.  Be aware the kids on the dock will expect you to tip them to help you off the boat BUT it is not required and frankly I feel this was just good manors and not something worth tipping for.

239304904.name: Good snorkeling, nice swim
239304904.author: a TripAdvisor user
239304904.reviewBody: Walked the nice trail from one side to the other. Disappointed with the litter throughout the vegetation. Wouldn\'t eat there. Water is clean and clear. It\'s best to have a life vest on to float,while snorkeling. Watch where to go in and out of the water. Large rocks. Scraped my thigh.

238743776.name: Worth the trip.
238743776.author: a TripAdvisor user
238743776.reviewBody:
I wouldnt say not to go all together but its a little over hyped. We took a taxi from Club Interwest to Playa Linda for 150 pesos each way. We took an early water taxi around 8am. It cost 60 pesos for two round trip from playa linda. We brought our snorkeling gear and walked the 2 min walk to coral beach. The island is very small. The coral reef is pretty much dead with tons and tons of dead coral washed ashore. The resturants chum the water throughout the  day so there are a ton of fish from the moment you enter the water. The fish follow very close and bump you begging for cat food which many people use to feed the fish. We did not feed them as we are against this. 

The reef is quite large but saw no more diversity then what we saw just 15 feet from our Hotel in Zihuatenago Club Interwest. We rented a two person Kayak for 2.5 hours for 250 pesos. The island is so small that we Kayaked around its entirety in just 40 minutes.

We loved the flora ie cactus and being on the island but there wasnt a lot to do except eat and drink. We went to the Princess restaurant and the food was just ok.

237037225.name: fun day trip
237037225.author: a TripAdvisor user
237037225.reviewBody: all great. Nice tour took us there and back. Snorkeled. Ate at beach. Staff made us comfortable with chairs and recliners. Wonderful weather. Very pleasant time. Would  recommend everyone take this side trip. Was a trip HIGHLITE !!!\n

236355588.name: Indio restuarant
236355588.author: a TripAdvisor user
236355588.reviewBody: Juanito, met us (four adults) at the pier and insured us that with his help we would get the best and cheapest tour of Ixtapa Island. This is so that he can make sure you sit in Restuarant indio\'s beach chairs. His service was excellent except that we did not get what we ordered. I asked for a plate of seviche and a plate of Nachos, with beef and cheese and guacamole. We also drank a dozen beers through out the day. The nachos came on a platter with beans, vegetables, rice, two chicken fillets and chips in cheese and chips in guacamole. The food wasn\'t that good and The bill for this food was over $150....Juanito the bandito...Stay clear of Indios.

234762988.name: IXTAPA ISLE WITH LOUIS
234762988.author: a TripAdvisor user
234762988.reviewBody: Any tour you want to go on choose Louis he is the best ever!!!! Speaks excellent english, answers all your questions is a joy to be around and has a knowledge of the area that is great!!! He took us to a private area for excellent snorkling, His vans are new and hold up to 18 people, his rates were excellent his phone number is 755-111-8028!!!!  GREAT DAY!!!!

232506998.name: Lucas at Lillli Cipriani
232506998.author: a TripAdvisor user
232506998.reviewBody: Lucas made our trip to the island fabulous.  Very attentive.  He took good care of us.\nI definitely recommend spending an afternoon on the island...and trying one of the "crazy drinks".

232251434.name: Snorkeling Escapade
232251434.author: a TripAdvisor user
232251434.reviewBody: Great island with three different type of beaches. Perfect place for snorkeling. Lunch is served at the beach.

230547970.name: A little paradaise...
230547970.author: a TripAdvisor user
230547970.reviewBody:
The island itself is nice... there is a little beach with a small coral reef and you can rent the equipment over there.

If you don't bring a shade, you are going to have to pay for snacks at one of the local shacks...  

They are good for sodas and snacks but nothing else.

I ordered an overpriced "pescado zarandeado" which is supposed to be a local specialty,,, it was burned.... dry and it came with "mexican style rice" which was also dry...   

Once again, zero environmental measures...

229333372.name: So So
229333372.author: a TripAdvisor user
229333372.reviewBody: Was not impressed, too many people trying to sell stuff and water to murky for snorkeling.  Didn\'t really like it much at all.  Tourist trap,,,,

228915007.name: Weather luxury
228915007.author: a TripAdvisor user
228915007.reviewBody: Temperatures to satisfy anyone.Warm breezes filled the air with a bottle of feel good.The people I met here all talked to each other and we felt everyone here was family.\nSo I think it\'s something in the air that makes you want to come back.Of course it goes without saying hats off to the staff with warm smiles.........

227692802.name: Beach to remember
227692802.author: a TripAdvisor user
227692802.reviewBody: Its a must see! Spend the day in the sun and surf. Excellent cafes! Three beaches to explore. Surfing at one and snorkeling the coral at another. A must see!

226692214.name: Crowded
226692214.author: a TripAdvisor user
226692214.reviewBody: Took a boat from the Marina for a very reasonable price but there were so many other folks out there that the water was cloudy and the fish were hard to see. Maybe going real early would be better. You can have a beer on the beach without the boat ride.

226529893.name: Boat out to the island
226529893.author: a TripAdvisor user
226529893.reviewBody: It\'s a beautiful island and USED to be very relaxing. One side is great for snorkeling, the other for swimming. Unfortunately a few years back, motorized waterspouts were introduced at the island and is\'s no longer so peaceful.

225996112.name: Quite
225996112.author: a TripAdvisor user
225996112.reviewBody: It is really nice to rest but also to do some activities as snorkel or swim, and to eat a good cheap food

223992408.name: Ixtapa Island
223992408.author: a TripAdvisor user
223992408.reviewBody: Great place to visit. They could improve the bathroom/restroom facilities and the people on the island should ease up on trying to sell you everything.

223047483.name: Beautiful beaches
223047483.author: a TripAdvisor user
223047483.reviewBody: My husband and I spent a morning on the island.  The boat over is quick and easy and they go frequently.  I especially liked the fact that most of the people on the island were local families, and it gave it a non-touristy feel.

222621898.name: Great day trip
222621898.author: a TripAdvisor user
222621898.reviewBody: We rented a boat to do some fishing and snorkeling and stopped at the island for lunch (freshly grilled mahi maui, which we had caught that morning. There is a central commercial area (read restaurants) that are flanked by a calm bay very suitable to swimming and another which is a bit rougher, but has excellent snorkeling. It\'s rustic, but beautify;

219834318.name: Trip to Ixtapa Island
219834318.author: a TripAdvisor user
219834318.reviewBody: It was a short boat ride to the island.  We went there for the snorkeling and lunch.  The water was not all that clear, but we did see plenty of fish.  The outside restaurant meal was good.

218587508.name: Beautiful
218587508.author: a TripAdvisor user
218587508.reviewBody: Full of fishes that swim around you, good food and clean beautiful sand, soft and the water is warm and calm only bad side is that you have to go in a boat and leave early because last one is at 5

217314515.name: Great little place to hang with the locals.
217314515.author: a TripAdvisor user
217314515.reviewBody: We went here from Club Med, we got to see the pretty fish and enjoy some local flavor, we love a little adventure, this was fun, they cut coconuts with machetes there are fresh oysters and there are also wild bunnies and chickens.  It is a unique little place to check out if you want to hang with the locals.

215370515.name: Good for famlies
215370515.author: a TripAdvisor user
215370515.reviewBody: This place is good for family groups. Its not suited for people wanting peace, quiet, and relaxation. The only way you\'ll get to relax is if you have some headphones to block out the loud kids laughing and playing. It can get crowded too.

215357603.name: Snorkeling the reefs.
215357603.author: a TripAdvisor user
215357603.reviewBody: We scheduled a tour for Ixtapa island, tour guide jose was awesome real nice guy I ended up short 500 pesos and he loaned me the money and I paid him back at the hotel. We took a van ride to the docks and took a water taxi to the island and walked to the other side which is where the reefs are at. It\'s a very short walk. The snorkeling instructor started giving us instructions and equipment, he took us out on the reefs and he would dive and bring up different types of reef wild life , the star spider was my favorite and the sea urchin was very cool. After snorkeling we ordered our food which was included in our tour package, food was real good and I ordered their sea food platter that\'s why I ended up owing jose 500 pesos. After we ate we cleaned up and changed walked back to the water taxi and as we got to the van he showed us a crocodile and iguana preserve. All I gotta say is WOW!!!! Icing on the cake , I would highly recommend this tour that is fun for the whole family.

215342609.name: Perfect for snorkeling
215342609.author: a TripAdvisor user
215342609.reviewBody: We went small game fishing for the morning and took our catch to Ixtapa island, where they prepared fresh ceviche, tacos, and steaks from our tuna. We then went snorkeling in the reef and saw tons of beautiful fish. Very small but beautiful island.

215006763.name: Love Ixtapa Island
215006763.author: a TripAdvisor user
215006763.reviewBody: We took one of the first water taxis over almost every morning and would have the place to ourselves for about an hour, and then leave before the hordes arrived.  Fantastic snorkeling, very sheltered, perfect for any age. Lots of restaurants, but we would just order a juice for the use of a chair, and the proprietor was happy with that. \nGo early!!

213363176.name: Much newer area with more tourism.
213363176.author: a TripAdvisor user
213363176.reviewBody: Lots of hotels, beautiful views and restaurants around. Ixtapa started in 1972 so much newer area. If you are looking for older, more authentic Mexico, Zihuatanejo is more your pace.

212959803.name: Good snokelling
212959803.author: a TripAdvisor user
212959803.reviewBody: The snokelling at Coral Beach is very good, lots of small fish. Road the local bus from Zihuatanejo which takes you to the beach and then you take a water taxi to the island. Bus ride from main street Zihu to Ixtapa island was about 45 mins long.  Waiters are aggresive (working for tips) but they will watch your things while you swim.  We still swam with our valuables just the same.  Bathrooms dirty take toilet paper with you.

212865252.name: Ixtapa Island was Paradise
212865252.author: a TripAdvisor user
212865252.reviewBody: We loved our excursion to Ixtapa Island.  The beach was beautiful, the snorkeling was amazing, the massage on the beach was very relaxing and the lack of commercialization was refreshing.  It was truly paradise.

212857500.name: Not worth the time honestly
212857500.author: a TripAdvisor user
212857500.reviewBody: The snorkeling on the other side of the island was ok, but not great.  the walk up and over the hill was tricky. Have to ask how to get through the restaurants.  Everyone bothers you to buy food and beer obsessively.  They were nice, but I didn\'t really care for it.  Would rather have stayed on the mainland.  Limited return boats too, meant we waited for a while to get a ride back to the pier.  \n\nDon\'t get me wrong, I loved Ixtapa.  I just wouldn\'t recommend the Island as an option to visit.

210043766.name: Beachy
210043766.author: a TripAdvisor user
210043766.reviewBody: Not really worth the 40 pesos each to get there. There is nothing really to see, snorkling, but nothing to brag about. One nice beach to sit at and drink and have lunch, other than that it\'s a toss for me.

207748187.name: On real beach area
207748187.author: a TripAdvisor user
207748187.reviewBody: Rocky and waves came all the way up to where you sit.  The food at the places were good.  The boat ride over be prepared to be asked to give a tip for them helping you out of the boat

207587066.name: Fun time!
207587066.author: a TripAdvisor user
207587066.reviewBody: My husband and I took a canoe from Azul Ixtapa to Ixtapa Island and it was so much fun! You can take a morning trip with guides or you can take a canoe out on your own (which is what we did). They have massage areas, food and they truly cater to you on the island. They do \'hound\' you somewhat but if you make it clear you are not interested  they do leave you alone which is like anywhere in the tourist areas.  It was a nice morning trip and so peaceful out on the water.  I highly suggest this trip to anyone staying at the Azul!

205141300.name: Nice day trip
205141300.author: a TripAdvisor user
205141300.reviewBody: This was a change of pace from the all-inclusive environment.  People say don\'t book the tour with the hotel, but I booked with Amstar ahead of time and found the price to be reasonable considering they pick you up and drop you off at your hotel and include lunch.  Since I don\'t swim or snorkel, I thought I might be a bit bored, but I did go walk around the island taking lots of pictures and I also got a massage, which was very relaxing.  I wouldn\'t say "you can\'t miss it," but if you have time and want to spend a day away from the hotel, it is very scenic and probably worth your time to check it out.  Our lunch was very good also, though drinks seemed to be a bit overpriced.

205116946.name: Beautiful spot
205116946.author: a TripAdvisor user
205116946.reviewBody: Small island you can only get to via motor launch. There are some simple restaurants on the island, but the grub is mighty good and reasonably priced. There is, I am told, a nude beach somewhere on the island. Never bothered to walk over there. The water is crystal clear, and there are coral reefs near the beach. Snorkling equipment for rent is available.

205067607.name: Creepy
205067607.author: a TripAdvisor user
205067607.reviewBody:
This was an impromptu decision to leave the comfort of our hotel in zihuatenejo, take a taxi to Ixtapa, and then a water taxi to Ixtapa island. 
I felt like from the time we stepped onto the water taxi from the time we got back to our taxi to go home we were preyed upon by vendors, restaurant staff, massage vendors, etc. 
we simply wanted to relax and snorkel, but were constantly harassed. We took turns snorkeling because we were afraid to leave our valuables. 
The water taxi drivers were RUDE in that they expected a tip (but only from the tourists....locals weren't harassed like we were)   The water taxis seemed very overcrowded to the point of being very unsafe, and unstable.  Fortunately I'm a good swimmer!  If you go to Ixtapa island, bring a few things:  MONEY, SUNCREEN, HEADPHONES, and DARK SUNGLASSES.  The headphones & sunglasses help to ignore the harassment.

204330744.name: Fun island to get away from the main land.
204330744.author: a TripAdvisor user
204330744.reviewBody: The day we went to Ixtapa Island the waves were really big. We went to other side of the island opposite of where the water taxi drops you off. We did agree to use one of the restaurants chairs in exchange for purchasing beers from them. Please check on where your tab is at with them regularly. We did have an issue at the end where they did try to charge us for a lot more beers then what we actually drank. We did figure it out but we did waste over 1/2 hour arguing the bill. Other then that the beach when you first get off  the water taxi is perfect for swimming and very clean.

203612020.name: Day trip
203612020.author: a TripAdvisor user
203612020.reviewBody: The water was not as nice as where our hotel was located.  There is not alot to see.  We enjoyed the french fries though and our husbands took a walk but there was not much.

203529708.name: Cheap, do it yourself vacation beach visit...
203529708.author: a TripAdvisor user
203529708.reviewBody: Do not pay the high hotel rates to visit Ixtapa Island..Ride the bus or taxi to Playa Linda and book your own ticket on the water taxi to Ixtapa Island (40 mxp).  Relax at your leisure on the island.  The restaurants on the island have beaches with Palapas and umbrellas with lounge chairs-(free if you order a meal with them.).  They provide you with your water, beverages or beer and have menus.  They can even arrange snorkle gear for you...again this is the restaurants on Ixtapa Island after you have ridden the water taxi.   \nThey also have kayak rental, banana boat rentals, paddle boat rentals, and greeat snorkeling.

203171703.name: Nice views and nice boat tip but the island inset that great
203171703.author: a TripAdvisor user
203171703.reviewBody: We went on the snorkeling excursion from the hotel. boat trip was nice. The staging area on a cliff  had a great view out to the ocean/island beach. The snorkeling was disorganized and the equipment was not that great. So advice is to get boat taxi from the clubmed beach, eat a meal at one of the many mexican restaurants and walk around the island or over the top to the beach on the other side. Don\'t waste your money on the snorkeling excursion from clubmed.

201730536.name: Fun snorkeling
201730536.author: a TripAdvisor user
201730536.reviewBody: You don\'t have to buy a tour to go. We took a taxi from our hotel to the water taxi stand for a fraction of the cost of a tour and we weren\'t restricted on our time that way.  We happen to be there when it wasn\'t busy so the snorkeling area wasn\'t too crowded and it was really fun. Given the restrooms were primitive and the wash area was a huge barrel of water that everyone shared we did NOT order food there.

201709188.name: dont bother
201709188.author: a TripAdvisor user
201709188.reviewBody: peddlers followed us all over this small island trying to sell us everything and get us to eat at their restaurant. Over crowded. \nAlso when we took the boat over they reminded us to tip our driver.

201210989.name: our little caribean!
201210989.author: a TripAdvisor user
201210989.reviewBody: this small island can be a great experience for those who are looking for turquoise water and snorkeling...besides that is beautifull to walk trough the four beaches the island has. there\'s plenty of restaurants offering sea food. but very few know the famous Marlin\'s restaurant wich owner Don Pedro serrano, is well known in the gastronomic world as the pioneer of the criolle cuissine. a mix of his asian rooths and local spicies with fresh sea food. his dishes had been tasted by international gourmets and priced many times. the very famoust dish and most try is: tiritas de pescado.\n(raw fish) dish he discover surviving one storm in the ocean while navigating near to the Balsas river. i think his hands were made to give love to the world trough his food creations! you have to try his food to understand what i\'m saying... ;)

200933494.name: Tourist Trap
200933494.author: a TripAdvisor user
200933494.reviewBody: We took the boat from Club Med to Ixtapa Island to snorkel. The island is basically a giant flea market full of vendors with bars and seating areas trying to get you to buy over priced food/drinks/souvenirs. The water clarity is bad, the currents/waves kind of strong. It was definitely underwhelming and disappointing.

200415166.name: a great day
200415166.author: a TripAdvisor user
200415166.reviewBody: Fun snorkeling. We also had massages, which were more relaxing than therapeutic. Enjoyed our beachside lunch.

200258591.name: IXTAPA ISLAND
200258591.author: a TripAdvisor user
200258591.reviewBody: Charlie on the Club Med beach(wearing the Eagles jersey) took care of us! Look for him.\nHe took us on boat ride, fishing, dolphin/sea turle viewing, snorkling and jetskiing.

200007191.name: Nice place to relax
200007191.author: a TripAdvisor user
200007191.reviewBody: Nice and clean beach, the food at the restaurants are not really good, but acceptable. Ideal place to go with childrens.

199812668.name: Perfect!
199812668.author: a TripAdvisor user
199812668.reviewBody: Have been to Mexico many, many times...yet this was first time to Ixtapa/Zihua...fabulous! Sunsets (and I\'ve seen so many good ones) were spectacular! We stayed at Sunscape Dorado Pacifica...great restaurants, great outdoor areas, great service. Huge waves, which I love. Went to Isla Ixtapa one day for snorkeling/massages ($20 for an hour!). Another day at Las Gatas for same thing. Had lobster there (not much meat, skip it). Any of the little places on either beach would be fine. Getting there by taxi ($7) then water taxi (4$ round trip) is simple and easy. I would definitely go again in a heartbeat and would recommend the hotel as well.

199579913.name: Nice day trip
199579913.author: a TripAdvisor user
199579913.reviewBody: Nice way to break up your stay...visit the island for snorkelling bring your own or rent from the vendors.  The fish will not be hard to find.

199434016.name: So fun!!  I would be back for the seafood.
199434016.author: a TripAdvisor user
199434016.reviewBody: We got there early to snorkel and then eat. We loooved the food. Grilled half pineapple stuff with seafood.  It was Incredible!!  My husband had a seafood Cordon Bleu, coco con limon, no alcohol. Service from the restaurant was great, the owner\'s son took us snorkeling, which was very nice too.\nThis place is more for nature or food oriented people. You will need to jump on a smaller boat to cross to the island. Once there, the bathrooms are basic, but clean.  It gets crowded by noon.

199424141.name: Great Time!
199424141.author: a TripAdvisor user
199424141.reviewBody: Unbelievable experience for kids and adults of all ages.  Swimming with the dolphins is amazing as is the show the dolphins put on right in front of you. Kind staff and service. Pictures are expensive but well worth it to capture the great experience.

198684324.name: Great place to break up the all inclusive experience
198684324.author: a TripAdvisor user
198684324.reviewBody: Take a boat from the pier for a few bucks or get a charter, either way it is worth the trip.  Get set up on the beach under an umbrella and go snorkeling and swimming.
