They will run drinks and food to you.  Set up a jet ski ride and rent snorkel gear.  Lots of fun and a different change of pace.

198591776.name: a day at the beach
198591776.author: a TripAdvisor user
198591776.reviewBody: we we the only bg group there and the place was near deserted.\nThe snorkeling was good.\nthe service was awful  they put the whole group on one bill and tried to rip us off, it took forever to get drinks and food like 15min for a beer and oan hour for lunch....we were like the only ones there.

198386961.name: A pleasant day trip
198386961.author: a TripAdvisor user
198386961.reviewBody: This is  great reason to take a boat trip. The beach is protected so children can play and swim fairly safely with their parents. The restaurants are casual but the food is good. If you are adventurous you can go trekking as well.

198006047.name: Loved Ixtapa Island
198006047.author: a TripAdvisor user
198006047.reviewBody: We loved the Island and felt like we were on a busy version of "Gilligans Island" The boat ride cost 40 pesos return and takes about 5 minutes to cross. There is no power or electricity on this Island, and you must return by 5. We went to Island 2x, and spent the day both times. Oh yes, make sure you bring enough money, lol, if you plan on having drinks and lunch! We rented chairs on beach which faces the Grand Azul. We were at the far end, area is roped off for swimming. Water was crystal clear, warm, and very calm. Beer was served ice cold, and the Bano was quite a hike up the hill, and quite a sight. We also spent a day on the snorkelling beach, had lunch at the Princess restaurant- very good, and sat there for the day. It is a very busy Island, and there are lots of beach vendors and resturanteurs, but once you get settled in, its fabulous!!!! We had a great time here and will return in the future.

197598643.name: Interesting Island
197598643.author: a TripAdvisor user
197598643.reviewBody: we kayaked from our resort and did some snorkelling. we didn\'t snorkel for long but it was fun. later we took the water taxi to the island to explore further. lots of options for food and drink. a fun experience!

197594008.name: Beautiful, Safe and Fun
197594008.author: a TripAdvisor user
197594008.reviewBody: Snorkeling with 1000s of colorful fish.  Drinks served in pineapples that are works of Art!  Massages for $25.  Safe and well managed.  5 minute boat ride from Club Med.

197540936.name: OK but enjoyable
197540936.author: a TripAdvisor user
197540936.reviewBody: The visit even with an average review is a must. The island has four beaches with one being a nude only beach.  You will arrive via a small boat from Ixtapa harbor.  Most likely on your ride over you will meet a representative of a restaurant. As long as you order food and or drinks  they will help you in many ways including watching your stuff and setting you up with activities,The snorkeling is decent with a large amount of fish located in sheltered water near the beach. I do not recommend spending an entire day on island as you can easily become bored.

197504729.name: Ixtapa Island Wonderland
197504729.author: a TripAdvisor user
197504729.reviewBody: Two beaches - coral reef side and beach side. We preferred the beach side. Pick a spot, order some cold beer - enjoy your day. I think eating here is a gamble for your stomach though.

197445036.name: Go yourself
197445036.author: a TripAdvisor user
197445036.reviewBody: There are many people who try to sell this as a package for $40 usd and up. It is also the main sales pitch for time share presentations. Don\'t buy. It is a wonderful place to visit, but take my advise. It costs 9 peso to ride the bus to playa Linda, which is another beautiful beach. Plan a day trip. Walking 100 yards from the bus stop you can catch the water taxi to ixtapa island for 40 peso, (not $40usd) there is a crocodile sanctuary and turtles and birds, plus the beach. Easy to get to and cheap. Recommend to any and all. Don\'t buy the $40 sales pitch

197338166.name: Good for swimming
197338166.author: a TripAdvisor user
197338166.reviewBody:
For a mere $3.00 boat ride this attraction is value priced.
Ounce you get to the island however, the bargain is over.
Pricey drinks, crowded beach and Don't eat the food. The island eateries have no refrigeration and temps run near 90.
The islands biggest offering is it's east side beach as the island breaks the incoming surf and offers one of the only places in the region that you can swim without the fear of rip tides.
Good for a couple of hours but I wouldn't plan on spending the day.

197319569.name: ok for a bit of snorkel
197319569.author: a TripAdvisor user
197319569.reviewBody: Very shallow in relationship to coral so be careful not to disturb the coral or get scratched. I don\'t see another reason to go. meh!

197308900.name: Relaxing
197308900.author: a TripAdvisor user
197308900.reviewBody: Going over to the island is a great place to relax and enjoy the peace and quiet.  You can walk over to the other side to do some snorkling if you want.  Waves are much smaller there.

197262434.name: Beautiful
197262434.author: a TripAdvisor user
197262434.reviewBody: We had gone fishing and they cooked our fish up for us on the Island while we were enjoying our pineapple carved out pina coladas. Went to the other side of the Island for snorkling, what a beautiful day! We\'ve been to Ixtapa twice and would do this again!

197225413.name: Great snorkeling
197225413.author: a TripAdvisor user
197225413.reviewBody: If you go here to snorkel be sure to hire a guide. They will find fish and plants that you will never find on your own as they are in crevices. The guides are inexpensive and well worth the money.

197168473.name: lilli\'s place fantastico!!
197168473.author: a TripAdvisor user
197168473.reviewBody: fresh oysters fish beautiful isla and great waiters ask for Nuco he is the best. Snorkeling is awesome and a great place for kids to play in the water calm.

197151932.name: Nice day trip
197151932.author: a TripAdvisor user
197151932.reviewBody:
Island was nice. We had to change to the one side as we do not snorkel. Restuarant service was poor on one side but had different waiter on other beach side.
Did not like that they put 75 pesos on for cooking food. 
Grilled chicken was good
Being older we had hard time getting on and off boats.
Would not do again because of this, It was nice to see

197040387.name: fun and cheap
197040387.author: a TripAdvisor user
197040387.reviewBody: Wasn\'t far from our resort, we were picked up by Rosita ( I believe her name was) with 2 other couples from another resort, where she happily drove us and gave us information.  You could snorkel or just relax.  We had a delicious lunch and was a great day overall.

196920783.name: Very Commercial, Not all that Pretty
196920783.author: a TripAdvisor user
196920783.reviewBody: It surprised me, but we did not find Ixtapa Island to be a nice side trip at all.  When i think of snorkeling beaches, i do not think of them lined by restaurants and chairs so that if you don\'t want to sit there, you are relegated to putting your stuff on a concrete jetty.  To me, it seems that they have taken what was a beautiful island and just ruined it.  I expected some areas to have the restaurants, but it seems as if every square inch of servicable beach is commercialized.  We spent about 2 hours going to the three different beaches and walking around, and that was more than enough.  I did not find the snorkeling good, and our hotel beach (Playa Hermoza) was much, much better than the beaches on Isla Grande.  This probably has appeal with the right mindset- if you went primarily for drinks and a fish lunch in the sand, looking out onto the water, I am sure it can be enjoyable - I just did not expect that was all the place was.  So for us, it was a big disappointment.  On the bright side, we enjoyed the crocodile lagune on Playa Linda close to where you get the water taxi.  The water taxi was fun and it was good to see Playa Linda and this part of the island.

196766736.name: Loved the crocodiles in the swamp before the boat ride.
196766736.author: a TripAdvisor user
196766736.reviewBody: It\'s nice little trip over there. If you can arrive before 11 am you may get to see the tiny white tailed deer that live there. The first beach is nicer if you just want to wade or swim. The snorkelling on the other side isn\'t great if you have been somewhere  else in the world that has great snorkelling. It\'s something to do!\nIt\'s easiest to get to the other side if you walk to the end of the first beach and then go over!

196436378.name: small island perfect for sun and snorkeling
196436378.author: a TripAdvisor user
196436378.reviewBody: Accross from our resort (club Med) this island was a 7 minute boat ride ($15pp).  We had our own snorkeling equipment and dove in! Bright and abundant aquatic lilfe on the snorkeling side of the island.  The other side is just crystal clear waters and sand.  Nice division the space and we loved the experience there.  Hightly suggest hitting it up if you are there.  If you bring your own snorkel gear make sure you have water shoes or finns bc theres a lot fo coral and rocks on the snorkeling side! The beach only side is remarkable and clean.  Safe too!

196382671.name: long hotel strip
196382671.author: a TripAdvisor user
196382671.reviewBody: Not much to say, no town to speak of just hotel strip with supporting businesses surrounding them. There is a nice bike path in the jungle.

196349447.name: snorkelling and lunch
196349447.author: a TripAdvisor user
196349447.reviewBody: really good value - great day! Snorkelling is wonderful and relaxing - no jumping off a boat in the middle of the ocean it is right off shore, calm and fun with plenty to see. Lunch was good too

196337788.name: Relax and swim
196337788.author: a TripAdvisor user
196337788.reviewBody: We spent the day on the island.  Nice little panga ride over and back.  Our daughter snorkeled for about 2 hours and then we moved over to the other side of island and spent the day swimming and eating.  The snorkel area is hard for viewers and the palapas get in the way of your view.  The water was just great.  Warm and very clean.  This is a great place to spent the day.  Beautiful place to cool off.

196215788.name: A must see
196215788.author: a TripAdvisor user
196215788.reviewBody: water very warm for swimming.  Scarry looking aligaters as you wait for the ferry to take you to the island.  There is two sides one for swimming the other for snorkeling

196177555.name: Great Local Experience
196177555.author: a TripAdvisor user
196177555.reviewBody: It was a great experience for travelers to see what the locals do for a getaway.  The island has 4 beaches one of which is excellent for snorkeling. Each beach has several outdoor retaurants where they catch the fish right there, show it to you on a platter and you pick the one you want them to prepare on an open fire.  Amazing and would dot it again the next time I go.

196069322.name: Beautiful snorkelling and lots of cheap beer!
196069322.author: a TripAdvisor user
196069322.reviewBody: What a beautiful day! Relaxing, eating great food, spending time with friends, snorkelling and having a wonderful day. Spend the whole day here! Take the bus from Ixtapa as it\'s very safe! Then don\'t forget to stop to see the crocodiles in their enclosure. great pictures and then on to the boat to the Island!

196048291.name: Beach time
196048291.author: a TripAdvisor user
196048291.reviewBody: We took the water taxi across, several went snorkeling, had lunch,  enjoyed the sunshine for several hours. Was a very enjoyable time.

196043480.name: Great place to hang out for a day
196043480.author: a TripAdvisor user
196043480.reviewBody: This is one of my favorite day trips from Ixtapa-Zihuatanejo.  A few years ago we took some books and hung out in the hammocks in the shade all day.  You usually get a nice breeze off the ocean.

195945539.name: great day trip
195945539.author: a TripAdvisor user
195945539.reviewBody: snorkelling ok, not great. lovely location. great for swimming. ferry ride to/from memorable. lots of vendors on beach.\n

195716757.name: Nice beak
195716757.author: a TripAdvisor user
195716757.reviewBody: We liked the change of scenery and the tour guide.\nThe beach is not very big but large enough for the small crowd that was there. Next time I would try the snorkelling. Tour guide(Jose) was very good.

195552530.name: A fun day
195552530.author: a TripAdvisor user
195552530.reviewBody: We kayaked over to Ixtapa Island which took about 30 minutes and which was a lot of fun. You can also take any one of many boats which will take you to the island from Playa Linda. The ocean-facing side of the island is where most people go. The beach is nice and you can buy your lunch and have a beer while relaxing on the lounge chairs. I disagree with some of the other "reviewers" who say the snorkelling is great. I found the visability rather limited and not a lot of fish or corals. For sure it is nothing compared to snorkelling in the Playa del Carmen region of Mexico. But I would recommend Ixtapa Island for a fun day trip.

195510351.name: Great snorkeling
195510351.author: a TripAdvisor user
195510351.reviewBody: This little island is worth a visit. The earlier in the day you get there the better, as it gets very busy around lunch time. The snorkeling is some of the best I have seen in Mexico. Bring some crackers with you to feed them, there are hundreds of fish that will come eat directly from your hand. The water is wonderfully warm and quite clear!

195431282.name: Paradise
195431282.author: a TripAdvisor user
195431282.reviewBody: make sure to visit island; good for snorkeling and swimming. Vendors are very friendly but not pushy.

195366014.name: Day Well Spent
195366014.author: a TripAdvisor user
195366014.reviewBody: We spent the entire day there!  Loved the area for swimming and snorkling and had massages on beach.  The food was good, the beer was cold and it was a great day on comfy lounge chairs.  We would go again!

195033103.name: Snorkeling reef in cove on other side
195033103.author: a TripAdvisor user
195033103.reviewBody: The ocean-facing side of Ixtapa Island has a beautiful snorkeling reef with clear water and plenty of fish and sea urchins.  You can bring your own snorkel gear or rent it on the beach.  During the day, there are plenty of bars and cafes to choose from, and plenty of locals enjoy the day here.   The last ferry leaves at 5 P.M.

195006389.name: Ixtapa Island
195006389.author: a TripAdvisor user
195006389.reviewBody: The snorkeling was great, even the grandsons could see the fish.  Great day with gentle waves.  Lunch was OK and drinks expensive, be sure and pay as you go as they tried to over charge us.

194984359.name: Good Snorkeling and hanging out!
194984359.author: a TripAdvisor user
194984359.reviewBody: Getting here requires a cab/bus ride to Playa Linda and then a water taxi. The round trip on the water taxi is reasonable. The island beaches have restaurants that provide sitting and watching your stuff included into the price of drinks/meals. It is almost a requirement that you park yourself at a restaurant and then at some point in your stay buy a drink/snack.\n\nThe snorkeling was great on the reef side. The other side has plenty of places to just swim. Worth a getaway if you are in Ixtapa or Zihua.

194953804.name: Do it on your own! don\'t book the tour
194953804.author: a TripAdvisor user
194953804.reviewBody: take the city bus for 10pecos and the water taxi for 40pecos rt and enjoy the island. We only stayed about 2 1/2 hours and had our fill of snorkelling/swimming.  The tour is 6 hours.

194858362.name: Nice beach and good snorkelling, disappointing meal
194858362.author: a TripAdvisor user
194858362.reviewBody: Snorkelling was really good here.  The meal (at El Indio) wasn\'t.  I would expect that the fish would be boned before being served...I hate picking bones out of a filet.

194850522.name: Good day trip
194850522.author: a TripAdvisor user
194850522.reviewBody: Good spot for snorkeling and a pleasant day at the beach.  Since we had our own snorkel gear we simply took the local bus from our hotel and paid for the water taxi.  Very cheap.  Many little cafes with reasonable prices.

194775949.name: Worth the money
194775949.author: a TripAdvisor user
194775949.reviewBody: Snorkelling was great. Massages were fantastic but more expensive than in town. Restaurants were good. Swimming was very nice. Easy ferry ride across.

194531741.name: Snorkle - Better than I ever imagined
194531741.author: a TripAdvisor user
194531741.reviewBody: The snorkeling at Ixtapa Island was phenomenal.  I have been to Costa Rica, Hawaii, Puerto Rico, Cabo, etc.   It was a very impressive little reef.

194341061.name: A great way to spend a relaxing day. Better snorkeling than Las Gatas.
194341061.author: a TripAdvisor user
194341061.reviewBody: We came to Ixtapa Island around noon, taking the water taxi from the Playa Linda pier. We crossed over to the snorkeling side of the island and spent the remainder of the afternoon snorkeling and relaxing. The waiters at Lili Cipriani Restaurant set up the beach chairs and umbrellas to our liking and brought us delicious quesadillas and guacamole. The fish are so abundant that you don\'t need to step farther than a few feet or even use a mask to see them. But the water is safe and the farther you swim out the more clear it gets and more varied the fish are. There are no boats to contend with, and the crowd much smaller. Like every beach we have been to in Mexico there are peddlers who will try to sell necklaces, crafts, or other items. But a polite "no, gracias" is all we need to say. If you go here, there is no need for a guide, and you can rent snorkeling gear and towels at most restaurants. It\'s by far a better snorkeling experience than Los Gatas.

194329121.name: Better than expected snorkelling
194329121.author: a TripAdvisor user
194329121.reviewBody: Rather than pay for an expensive excursion from Club Med, we walked along the road for 10-15 mins to Playa Linda, enjoyed seeing the crocodiles, then hopped on the ferry to the isla at the pier for 40pesos. We brought our daughters\' snorkeling gear (we find that rentals for kids often do not fit) and rented gear for ourselves, after meeting someone on the ferry who rented gear. The snorkeling was pretty good, no turtles/sharks/rays but decent coral and great schools of fish, right off the beach at Coral Beach. Definitely worth a visit if you\'re staying in the area. We walked back along the beach, beautiful and fun to check out the other resorts along the way. Cheap outing, adventure and fun!

194076316.name: Fun place to visit.
194076316.author: a TripAdvisor user
194076316.reviewBody: The access is real easy from any hotel in the Ixtapa area. We enjoyed the snorkelling and didn\'t have a hard time find some chairs and shade. 3 different beaches to choose from. Animals on the isla, deer, rabbits and chickens. prices for food reasonable drinks too.

194060082.name: Beautiful water
194060082.author: a TripAdvisor user
194060082.reviewBody:
The beach on Ixtapa Island was much more beautiful we thought that the beaches on the mainland.
It was much more intimate and the food and drink excellent.  We had whole grilled red snapper in a beautiful
presentation with pina coladas in whole pineapples. The water was incredibly warm and clear. The boat ride
over was quick and reasonable. Really didn't want to leave!!

193807456.name: Not What It\'s Made Out To Be
193807456.author: a TripAdvisor user
193807456.reviewBody:
My husband and I visited this island off Playa Linda by taking the motorboat transport.  The round trip was $8 for both of us and the bus to/from our resort was $4 total.  Once on the island, there are several outdoor restaurants which supply the only seating on both the snorkeling and swimming sides of the island.  The island is very narrow so the same restaurants have seating on both sides.  
We ate at the first restaurant off the dock.  We shared a $40 fresh caught red snapper platter which was very good.  The service was good and the staff will watch your belongings if you plan to swim or snorkel.  You can rent snorkeling gear and life vests for a reasonable price.   
The beach was very hot and buggy.  The snorkeling was rocky and the water not very clear.  The swimming side was not as rocky, but the swimming was definitely limited due to lots of boats in the area.  There are restrooms at each restaurant, I assume.  The one where we ate was disgusting.  
Lots of people kept trying to sell us 'tours' of the island.  I'm not sure exactly what they were selling as there is no ';admission' and and the cost to get there and back is only about $15 for a couple plus cost of food/drinks while you are there.  It did not seem near as good as it was made out to be.  
We're not sure we would visit the island again.

193783171.name: great snorkling
193783171.author: a TripAdvisor user
193783171.reviewBody: we made it over to island 3 times this year. We took some folks from Penticton BC and their first time. They loved it and as always we did also. You have to meet Hector Senior who sells Ironwood carvings. His work is fantastic. The food and drinks are also great over their..

193612860.name: Peaceful and laid-back
193612860.author: a TripAdvisor user
193612860.reviewBody: We came across to the island from Club Med, and went snorkelling.  We were able to sit atop the hill when we were finished, and enjoyed the beautiful view while eating some delicious food.  We were left quite alone, and it was a really nice break from the activity at the resort.

193607302.name: Murky waters
193607302.author: a TripAdvisor user
193607302.reviewBody: The water at Ixtapa island was very murky and hard to see through and since we were there to snorkel it was a waste of time and money.  I wouldn\'t snorkel there again.

193582320.name: Snorkeling Great!
193582320.author: a TripAdvisor user
193582320.reviewBody: This is our 4th time traveling to Ixtapa and we had never been to Ixtapa Island!  What a shame, because this island has far superior snorkeling to Los Gatos.  We should have visited here on our earlier trips!  We hopped the bus from our condo in Ixtapa by 9, to take advantage of the clearest undisturbed snorkeling.  There aren\'t a lot of busses headed to Playa Linda, so the first one that comes, see if you can get on it.  We made the mistake of thinking the bus was too full and ended up waiting 10 min for the next one.  \n\nThe first-time friends we took were in awe with all the colorful fish we saw.  What a blast when the hundreds of fish came to eat the crackers we opened!  Huge fish would swim right up to our masks!  So fun!  We brought along a cooler with beverages/snacks, and had no trouble from the restaurants for bringing that because we bought lunch from them.  We had no trouble catching a water taxi back to Playa Linda around 3.  There is a shaded awning on the dock while you wait.  Can\'t wait to revisit on our return trip soon!

193582136.name: Okay local island spot to visit
193582136.author: a TripAdvisor user
193582136.reviewBody: A couple of nice beaches here and typical beach hut food.  No power or water here so order everything cooked. Reasonable prices.

193484435.name: Snorkelled in January
193484435.author: a TripAdvisor user
193484435.reviewBody: We liked that we went on our own, not with an organized tour. We hopped on the bus in Ixtapa for 9 pesos each, took the water taxi over to Ixtapa Island for 40 pesos round trip. We paid one of the locals 60 pesos to take us out snorkelling and to navigate through the coral, my travel partner from Calgary enjoyed it as well, it was her first time ever snorkelling. We saw a good variety of fish, saw a little eel. When we came back and walked to the bus stop, we saw the crocodiles in the enclosure there, pretty neat they were all out sunning themselves.

193441655.name: A must do when you visit
193441655.author: a TripAdvisor user
193441655.reviewBody: Wonderful spot to swim and snorkel.  The little restaurants serve great food.  Either arrange to visit thru your travel person (a lunch and beverage was included in our deal) or you can bus/cab to Playa Linda and then take the water taxi to the island.  The water is warm and clear and lots of fish along the reef.

193298731.name: Great adventure
193298731.author: a TripAdvisor user
193298731.reviewBody: Just wrote a review on Las Gatas Beach and I would rate Ixtapa Island as excellent.  Have been here numerous times and am never disappointed.  Great swimming and snorkelling.  Just getting there is an adventure........bus ride from Ixtapa...8 Pesos......Alligator farm and wild bird life..good...\nTrip by boat to the island...40 pesos return...good food...and of course, a flea market.  Great day of fun

193282819.name: Snorkeling incredible
193282819.author: a TripAdvisor user
193282819.reviewBody: Take your own drinks and food, can get very expensive.  Snorkeling equipment can be rented for $10 per day, well worth it.

193164963.name: Beautiful
193164963.author: a TripAdvisor user
193164963.reviewBody: The water and the scenery was lovely.  We didn\'t do any snorkeling preferring to walk the beach and look for shells. The one gentleman on the boat that took us out there was not shy on asking for tips but he was not rude about it.

193097819.name: food and beach
193097819.author: a TripAdvisor user
193097819.reviewBody: The beach was great food not so much and prices not so much also. Expensive for what you get.The beach is two sides one for snorkeling which is fine and one calm side for swimmers. Not the greatest on both sides but a very relaxing day. Take the bus to Playa Linda and then take the sea taxi to the island. Forty pesos  for two both ways. No need to take tours from hotels.

192865468.name: Worth the trip
192865468.author: a TripAdvisor user
192865468.reviewBody:
Take the short water taxi ride from Playa Linda (40 peso's return) which takes you to the second beach.  Walk south-east behind the row of restaurants away from the beach - not far (2 minutes) tops and you will see the third beach.  

Nice beach, protected bay.  You can rent snorkelling equipment, chair, table, umbrella, etc.  Snorkelling is ok, further from shore the coral is nice too.  We "rented" a table, 2 chairs, umbrella and 2 chaises for the price of 2 beers and a tip.  

Mainly locals.  Very safe as there are lifeguards, military personnel and a nurse in attendance. Can walk around most of the developed part of the island in less than 1/2 hour.  No need to go with a tour company.  Buses from town go to Playa Linda, then walk past the crocodile preserve and little market towards the ocean and up the pier.

192495962.name: Great visit
192495962.author: a TripAdvisor user
192495962.reviewBody: Very rustic island with a wonderful snorkeling area. The place is quiet quaint and no pushy vendors. Beaches we visited were acceptable and the snorkeling beach was very nice. Free to go over from our hotel via kayak or water taxi for $40 pesos per person. Taxis seemed pretty safe. The pier on both ends was falling apart but still served its purpose. Hold onto small children and those with mobility problems may have difficulty getting down the pier and on the boat.

192414175.name: Isla Ixtapa through My Lens
192414175.author: a TripAdvisor user
192414175.reviewBody: From  our balcony, on 19th floor (Suite #1915), at Azul Ixtapa Grand Resort, I watched the Isla Ixtapa every day of our one week stay, through my lens, changing views of this Island, from prior to sunrise to long after sunset, in fog and sunny clear day and in the brilliant red hues of sunset. It was the greatest pleasure to take pictures, only to avoid taking a boat trip from Playa Linda because we both don\'t like small boat trips, nor do we do fishing. However, I do recommend it those who love fishing. It looks majestic and beautiful, sleeping giant in the sea, visible from end to end, wherever  you are on the sea shore, beaches or board walk.

192359035.name: Good if First Time Snorkeling
192359035.author: a TripAdvisor user
192359035.reviewBody: It is crowded and everyone looks for a tip. The beach has quite a slope to it so you have to dig your chair in to compensate. Food was good, beer was cold and came in buckets, snorkeling good for kids or timid persons as you can sit in the water with a mask and see fish at the shore. They are like trained dogs when they see a cracker package.The reef is colorless, and visibility murky. The bathroom was disgusting. One visit is enough to say been there done that. \nCheap enough for the day, Transport from hotel and back, including lunch and one drink, we got it for $20 p.p. Some hotels charged double that price.

192356483.name: Ixtapa Island
192356483.author: a TripAdvisor user
192356483.reviewBody: Gorgeous and a definite DO NOT MISS for your trip.  Snorkeling and swimming is like living in a aquarium.

192167955.name: Great day trip
192167955.author: a TripAdvisor user
192167955.reviewBody: Hired a fisherman for the day, took us fishing, caught three fish and then to the island where the restaurant prepared the fish for us while we sat on the beach drinking beer.. What a great experience, I could not think of a better way to spend the day..

192148219.name: Ixtapa Island SCOOP!
192148219.author: a TripAdvisor user
192148219.reviewBody:
First of all SAVE your money and do this one on your own - it's FUN! Take the local bus and forget the $35/$40 they want to charge you for shuttle, lunch and bla bla.....We visited Ixtapa Island on January 22, 2014 and here is THE SCOOP!

The boat taxi from the main land to the island is $4/RT per person. Taking the bus is $1 from your hotel to get to the boat taxi. Tell them you want to go to "Playa Linda" and it's basically at the end of the road and the only place to get off. Stop and see the alligators in a protective habitat there - they're HUGE! 

Just so you know, the boat taxi's are basically just regular size boats - not some commercial ferry you may think of in the States.

$8 to rent snorkel gear - mask and fins only. You can also rent a life jacket, but we didn't.

It's FREE to sit in a chair w/an umbrella - in fact the restaurant people try to get you to sit at their restaurant (business!).

I didn't feel bombarded w/peddlers, sure they came around, but it wasn't annoying. Of course they are trying to make a living too, but when I shook my head no, they left me alone. 

There are two sides to this man-made island. One is a sandy beach, the other side has more coral for the snorkelers. We stayed the entire time on the coral side - my husband snorkels and I soak up the sun. I sat on a chair right on shore  and in the sand enjoying the waves as they rolled up. 

My husband had a few beers, I had two sodas and some ceviche for a total of $15 incl the tip - cheap, I thought! 

The island wasn't crowded (we were there on a Wednesday).  People came and went.  Some stayed all day, like us while others only for a few hours. The crowd seemed to change frequently. 

They offer massages for $20/hour!! I've included some photos with this review in hopes it helps you enjoy this little piece of heaven :)

191953200.name: Loved it!
191953200.author: a TripAdvisor user
191953200.reviewBody:
While enjoying Playa la ropa, we met Moses, a boat charter owner.  
Moses encouraged us to join him on a day excursion to Ixtapa Island.  I am so glad we did!
The island is beautiful, the staff wonderful, and the snorkeling great!
The boat ride was just over an hour and we were able to see Zhijuat and Ixtapa from another view.
Will definitely do this again!

191941104.name: Best beach day ever!
191941104.author: a TripAdvisor user
191941104.reviewBody: Liked everything water was clear and you can see all the fish swimming too.  Drank buckets of beer on the beach....service was good!

191889252.name: very beautiful
191889252.author: a TripAdvisor user
191889252.reviewBody: nice place but don\'t spend the entire day there , you will get bored ! One hour was enough for me rather than an entire day.

191861125.name: nice spot!!! great snorkelling
191861125.author: a TripAdvisor user
191861125.reviewBody: Beautiful spot, don\'t waste the money on a tour though, catch a bus out to playa Linda for 90 pesos and get the water taxi over.

191820158.name: Good beach
191820158.author: a TripAdvisor user
191820158.reviewBody: The beaches were good and the snorkeling average due to the water being murky.  If you fed the fish you had lots of them if not they were harder to find.

191721512.name: Good day trip
191721512.author: a TripAdvisor user
191721512.reviewBody: This is a great day visit place, and \'fun\' to take the little boat for 40 pesos across the water. (I believe it was free to come back, but the kids will ask for a tip.\' If you go, we were advised to head to the other side of the island for better snorkeling... Easy to get to - there is a sandy path that takes you there, and you can see the other side easily.  We sat on chairs with umbrellas, ordered the standard 2 Pacificos and Guacamole Por Favor - and spent some nice time checking out the fish and hanging out. It was crowded when we went - but it was because it was during Mexico\'s 3 Kings holiday week.

191339943.name: Nice view
191339943.author: a TripAdvisor user
191339943.reviewBody: Loved the view. Didnt like being hounded by the people. hey wanted you to come into there restaurants. Which are all over the beach. The 1 bathroom was disgusting, no door , no toilet paper & no flusher on the toilet. FILTHY

191254735.name: thumbs up
191254735.author: a TripAdvisor user
191254735.reviewBody: Relatively good snorkelling & easy to get to & from.  Warm water & friendly staff.  Also a nudey beach for those that are interested.

190863604.name: Honeymooners
190863604.author: a TripAdvisor user
190863604.reviewBody: We spent a day at this island, which was just a short distance from the market area in Ixtapa. The beach was beautiful, the food was good and the island had many different activities to offer.

190664676.name: Too busy, too many peddlers, didn\'t trust water taxi
190664676.author: a TripAdvisor user
190664676.reviewBody: We took the water taxi (40 pesos per person, round trip) to Isla Grande and were dismayed at how many people they tightly packed into the little water taxi.  In addition, we drove away from the pier and turned around twice to pick up more people even though there were two more taxis corralled right behind us to pick them up.  It was a nerve-racking ride and one of the staff asked for a tip about 10 times during the 3 minute ride.  The 1st beach (swimming beach) was very beautiful but the beach that is a 2-minute walk was packed full of people...literally elbow to elbow.  This was 11am on a weekday.  We couldn\'t get further than 7 feet walking before some muchacho was harassing...and I mean rudely harassing...us to get a chair at his restaurant or buy something or get snorkel gear.  We turned around immediately and went to the other beach which was much quieter but we already had sour tastes in our mouths and only stayed about an hour.  We swam a little and it was lovely, that I did like.  On the water taxi ride back, we almost hit another boat and the staff were so obnoxious, I questioned their sobriety.  If we ever went back, we would kayak and go earlier in the day.

190425480.author: a TripAdvisor user
190425480.reviewBody: it was quite for about 1 hour then there were so many people in the water it was hard to get in and see the fish.  And the prices on the menu is only a suggestion, 50 pesos extra for garlic on the food.

190331109.name: Nicest beaches in Ixtapa/Zihuatanejo & great snorkeling!
190331109.author: a TripAdvisor user
190331109.reviewBody: Absolutely beautiful beach and clear water for snorkeling. The beachfront is different from that of Ixtapa & Zihu as the sand is golden blonde from the coral, the water is crystal clear and great for snorkeling! We kayaked over to Ixtapa island with a small tour which was included in our stay at the Azul Ixtapa resort. It was about a 20 min paddle to the Island. We were some of the first to arrive at the Island around 10 AM, none of the eateries or massage tables were open for business. This was great the island was quiet and serene. There were many beautiful swarms of colourful fish! Bring your snorkel!

190321944.name: Great relaxing day!
190321944.author: a TripAdvisor user
190321944.reviewBody: WE read reviews and took advice to do it on our own, not through a tour even though the price of $20 sounded good on the street, we did it all for about $14 and that included our food and drinks.  We took the bus from Ixtapa for 9 pesos and then the boat trip over is 40 pesos return included.  The boat operators are independant too and try to get you over to their beach chairs and restaurant.  On the north end (Varedaro) there are two sides, one with the coral reef and one with a sandy bay.  We stuck to the sandy bay side for the day as the sand was so soft there and not full of shells.  I did snorkel also on the coral side and saw a lot of fish.  We also saw a rabbit, rooster and a deer ran by on the beach.  the coral side is busy, so if you enjoy pieace and quiet and maybe more shade you will like the sandy bay side instead.

190066394.name: Great Excursion
190066394.author: a TripAdvisor user
190066394.reviewBody: Kids snorkeled the coral reef and we had great food and awesome massages!  $20 for an hour.  It was best to get there in the morning because by 11am the beach was packed and restaurants full.  Lots of yachts and boats park close so it was fun to sit see them come and go.  Got a taxi back to the mainland at 3pm and the line was pretty short.  I hear if you leave much later the line is down the beach for a taxi, and it\'s hot!  No fun to stand there and bake.

190040110.name: Ixtapa Island
190040110.author: a TripAdvisor user
190040110.reviewBody: Snorkeling was awesome!  Food the same...ask for Ericc, he will look after you!  For 40 Pesos a person to get across, this Island is a must see...

190008471.name: Make an Informed Decision
190008471.author: a TripAdvisor user
190008471.reviewBody: If you\'ve done some really great snorkling before this is not your place.  Otherwise the snorkling is OK but not spectacular. The island is not far from shore, maybe 1/2 mile or so, and there was a mass of humanity when we went. The location is very focused on tourism and it feels that way when you arrive.  However, even though we were apprehensive when we first arrived the beach service was good, the food was much better than we expected and overall we had an OK trip.  Would not put it on our "gotta go back" list, one time is enough.  It does seem to be a very popular location with the locals.

189944654.name: Hi light of our vacation
189944654.author: a TripAdvisor user
189944654.reviewBody: Take the local bus for 9pesos to Playa Linda. Boat for 40pesos \nRent snorkel equipment, eat, drink and soak up the sun!

189908367.name: Family Vacation
189908367.author: a TripAdvisor user
189908367.reviewBody: We loved that we could snorkel on one side of the island and play in the water on the other side.  You can take a bus or taxi to Playa Linda and get on the water taxi, it was very easy to get to the island.

189755306.name: A culinary experience with ethnical favor.
189755306.author: a TripAdvisor user
189755306.reviewBody: Best way to arrive is to be part of a yacht touristic excursion and be ready for a seafood great lunch. Snorkeling is fantastic, easy and safe.

189556056.name: Nice Getaway.
189556056.author: a TripAdvisor user
189556056.reviewBody: Very pretty but overrun by people trying to sell you food and drinks. Not quite a serene eco hike. But everyone was quite nice and it was crowded.

189370477.name: Pristine beach, great snorkeling
189370477.author: a TripAdvisor user
189370477.reviewBody: Ixtapa Island offers several beautiful beaches, clean water and great snorkeling for those who like swimming around fish and coral reef.

188892019.name: Save some cash and do this trip on your own
188892019.author: a TripAdvisor user
188892019.reviewBody: Wonderful island but rent a cab to bring you  to pier to ferry to island instead of paying a tour guide   You can rent snorkel set on island and the bar staff is very friendly. We go to the island every year we are in ixtapa.

188121093.name: Most beautiful place in the world
188121093.author: a TripAdvisor user
188121093.reviewBody: When I dream, I\'m on Ixtapa Island.  The beach has beautiful golden sand and absolutely perfect for swimming!  It\'s kinda like  the lagoon on Gilligan\'s Island, very small waves and nice and sandy on the ocean floor.  You can snorkel, rent jet skis or just relax and have a drink or two.  It is primitive on the island (no plumbing or electricity) but the restaurants have generators.  It is the most relaxing place to go in Ixtapa.

187502310.name: Great snorkelling
187502310.author: a TripAdvisor user
187502310.reviewBody: Took the bus and water taxi. Very easy. Snorkelling was at the second stop and vey short walk to third beach. Good fish variety but watch not to get too close to coral due to small shifting currents and gentle rolling waves that can take you off your planned course.

187393643.name: Nice place to visit
187393643.author: a TripAdvisor user
187393643.reviewBody: We took a bus from our hotel in Ixtapa ( 9 pesos ), caught the water taxis at Playa Linda ( 20 pesos ) on a Saturday with the expectation that it would be crowded but it wasn\'t. This time of year is low season so we were pleasantly surprised . Since we didn\'t want to go snorkeling we stayed at the first beach the water taxi stopped at. We sat down at Lili Cipriani restaurant 15\' from the water and enjoyed some cervecas and appetizers. The beach behind us was only about 2 minutes away (great for snorkeling) but we just wanted to swim and this was the best place. Beer was 25 pesos but their margarita prices were steep (120 pesos). They had some margaritas that were poured into pineapples or coconuts that looked wonderful for 150 pesos so maybe the prices weren\'t all that bad because they looked huge. Our waiter was named Erick and he was very friendly and helpful. For a long time we were the only gringos on the beach but everyone there was so friendly they made us feel right at home.

187374820.name: Great for snorkelling
187374820.author: a TripAdvisor user
187374820.reviewBody: Watch the people that sell you beer.  They also charge you for their service and then expect a tip.  The snorkelling on the island is very good.

187075331.name: Dont bother
187075331.author: a TripAdvisor user
187075331.reviewBody: We paid $38 each to be driven and then via boat from Zihuatenejo to the island.  A rather small lunch and one drink was included at Ciprianis.  They were so disorganized we had to fetch our own drinks and got crowded out of our spot we paid for.  It was hot, crowded and uncomfortable.  The reef is pretty much overused and trashed, although there were a few nice fish. A waste of a nce day.

186427774.name: Go Early
186427774.author: a TripAdvisor user
186427774.reviewBody: You must be there before 10 before the tours arrive. I have heard people say that the water gets churned up by all the people in the water but I think it is really just from the waves.  We were there on a very quiet day and we found it much easier to see when we went in at 9:30 then when we went in a few hours later.  You don\'t need a tour.  Take the bus and then the water ferry from the wharf at Playa Linda.  Bring snorkel gear from home.  I don\'t bother with the flippers any more.

186389503.name: great afternoon
186389503.author: a TripAdvisor user
186389503.reviewBody: This island is a special little place.....easy to get to on a fun little ferry boats........cool beach restaurants with great food.....and fantastic snorkelling over on the coral beach.....just do me a favour and don\'t touch the coral.

185508096.name: Great diversion.
185508096.author: a TripAdvisor user
185508096.reviewBody: While the beaches at Ixtapa and Zihuatanejo were great, the island allowed for snorkeling and sand beaches with several beach restaurants.  We loved our day there. Even the ride over on the water taxi.

185353388.name: Used to be less crowded
185353388.author: a TripAdvisor user
185353388.reviewBody: Visited in Feb 2013, there were at least some corals left.  Visited again in Oct 2013, all corals destroyed by tourists, beach looks like coral graveyard.  Water became too murky, not worth taking a snorkel anymore.  Without negotation, $8 USD roundtrip per person, kids typically free.

184536042.name: Best day trip ever.
184536042.author: a TripAdvisor user
184536042.reviewBody: This was a very relaxing and comfortable place to go. The snorkelling wasn\'t great when we were there because the water hadn\'t settled out from the rainy season yet. The restaurant we used was great the owner Mark Anthony treated us like royalty.

184432245.name: fabulous fresh food, cooked over wood fired ovens--great!
184432245.author: a TripAdvisor user
184432245.reviewBody: We loved the food, it was wonderfully fresh and grilled to perfection.  There were 9 of us and when presented with our food--we clapped, it was just that gorgeous and delish!!

184280799.name: Take the bus....
184280799.author: a TripAdvisor user
184280799.reviewBody: Ixtapa island is wonderful place to spend the day. The Island offers two beach one side is great for snorkelling and the other offers wonderful swimming. Lots of restaurants to choose from and you can even have a massage . Make sure you know the prices before ordering food and drink. Massage prices can also be negotiated. If a group of you are going to have a massage you will get a better deal. Don\'t forget to tip, these people rely on your generosity. Enjoy!!!

180997954.name: Ixtapa Island
180997954.author: a TripAdvisor user
180997954.reviewBody: Princess Rebecca is located on the snorkeling beach. The food is great, and the prices are reasonable. Depending on the weather and tides, getting in and out of the water may be a challenge. Overall, I consider this a must do when in Zihuatanejo. You can take the bus that says Playa Linda, and ride it all the way to the end. When you get off the bus, walk to the beach and look for the pier where the water taxis are located. With the breezes off the ocean, it does not matter how hot it is, and its\' a great way to spend the hot afternoon. In addition, there are numerous places to get a nice relaxing massage, while listening to the ocean and feeling the breeze!!

180942159.name: Ixtapa Island, a great day-trip
180942159.author: a TripAdvisor user
180942159.reviewBody: To get there, take a water taxi from the Playa Linda dock.  There are three beaches between which you can walk.  The one on the south side is open to the ocean and is mostly coral (rough on the feet) but has the best snorkeling.  This is at the island\'s narrowest point so the restaurants there also service the beach just across to the north side of the island.  This beach is quite calm and quiet.  Food is good at these restaurants.  Beer is always cold.  A couple of guys usually arrive about mid-afternoon in a boat filled with shells for sale.  Beautiful stuff.

177187089.name: Cool place, great snorkeling
177187089.author: a TripAdvisor user
177187089.reviewBody: Let someone help you at the dock. They will take you to their restaurant and sell you gear. So many to choose from, this is easy and it was a good value for us.

177162205.name: A claudy but hot day on Ixtapa\'s Island..
177162205.author: a TripAdvisor user
177162205.reviewBody: Before taking the boat to the Island, I explained the guy that we, a group of five, wanted to go to the other side of the Island called "baredero beach", of course, the guy gave us his point of view, of why was "much better to go to the other side, the south side, latter on we realized that it is where he works. We order drinks and a big huachinango, a super and delicious   fish that can be prepared to your own desire and taste. After we ordered the food, the fish was good, but not well cleaned.  Two years ago at this island, I paid, for the same amount, 1/2 of the price that I paid this time. I found that the restaurants on the Island has raise food prices at an exorbitant levels.

175593556.name: Nice tour
175593556.author: a TripAdvisor user
175593556.reviewBody: Ixtapa Island is worth the short trip to visit.  The waters were excellent for snorkeling and the hospitality at the island restaurants was very good.  It was a nice place to chill and a nice change of scenery

174999005.name: Ruined our day
174999005.author: a TripAdvisor user
174999005.reviewBody: We heard the snorkeling was very good and it was.  You have to get a table and it\'s yours for the day.  We asked for a menu but the waiter did not bring one.  We just wanted some snacks which we ordered.  Not much food at all.  4 beers total and it was about $75!!  What a rip off.\nIf you go, be sure to know what the price is before ordering.

174239291.name: Great place for snorkeling!
174239291.author: a TripAdvisor user
174239291.reviewBody: We loved this island...5 minute boat ride from Club Med...cheaper to rent jet skis, you can snorkel...and just hang out! Massages are $25 for one hour!

172966342.name: Nice place
172966342.author: a TripAdvisor user
172966342.reviewBody: Ixtapa island is right across Ixtapa, you need to take a ferry to get there. It has three small beaches but the one worth visiting is "coral beach" (playa coral) . Snorkeling with a guide is worth the trip , as well as having lunch at "princess rebeca" the farmost restaurant on that beach . Server Ismael is very friendly . Don\'t expect a fancy place, it\'s a shack ,but fish is very fresh, order the pescadillas or camaronillas ( fish or shrimp "quesadillas").

172587296.name: Clean, safe, fun
172587296.author: a TripAdvisor user
172587296.reviewBody: Fresh delicious food (lobster, fish, mexican snacks, we loved the rice). In the same island you can snorkel and in the other side you can swimm and run in a water moto!

172298195.name: Must do while in Ixtapa
172298195.author: a TripAdvisor user
172298195.reviewBody: Water is cooler and has snorkeling.  Make sure you check prices on things you buy.  There are people on the beach who will try to lead you to their restaurants.  SO, get an opinion on which restaurant is best before going.  Boats go in and out of the shore so watch your kids.

170951959.name: Not worth it
170951959.author: a TripAdvisor user
170951959.reviewBody: To get to the island, you need to go to the harbour in Playa Quieta. The wait to get a boat is long under full sun with no shadow at all, the dock is in bad conditions, besides the ticket you will be pressured 4 times to tip to the guys helping you to get in and off the boat. Before taking the boat, there will be people recruiting you to go to their restaurant in the island, avoid this. When you get to the island, you will notice the places closer to the dock are very crowded and they get better if you walk. We were recruited and even tough the seafood was fresh and very tasty, there were no wc services and the umbrellas were all broken. Instead of Isla Ixtapa, I would recommend to visit Las Gatas. Just go to Zihuatanejo Downtown, walk the beautiful handcrafts market, the dock has been renewed, plenty of shadows and get a ride to the beach, take the time to select a nice place. You can even negotiate the price of the beers and sodas before you sit down.

170318681.name: snorkling fun
170318681.author: a TripAdvisor user
170318681.reviewBody: Lots to see in the sea!  Good time was had by all!  Plenty of chairs with umbrellas to keep the sun off.  Sea was a bit rough due to weather conditions, but we still could see the fish.

170069791.name: Fun way to spend a day -- go with Luis
170069791.author: a TripAdvisor user
170069791.reviewBody:
the first time we heard the pitch for this tour was when we were walking into the airport after landing in Zihua.  

everyone pitches this tour from your taxi driver to the waiter at breakfast.  that being said, we eventually relented and signed up for a tour with Luis. 
well worth it.  

Luis turned out to be a great guy and even though we would have liked a little more air conditioning on the ride, he was a stellar guide who kept our party of 14 organized and informed. 

the tour includes transportation to and from your hotel to the island, a 2 course lunch, a beer and an opportunity to snorkel with or without a guide. you can bring your own gear or rent some for $15usd. the guide points out the different species, you get to hold a star fish, check out a sea urchin up close and and feed tortilla to the fish while you snorkel. i mean what more could you ask for fifteen bucks and the setting is incredible. 

for me, even more than the snorkeling and the fun new people and the beer-- i loved the outdoor kitchen on the island. tortillas are hand made and griddled over an open fire. incredible huge, fried whole fish came out of the primitive kitchen where they haul in the food every morning. as a foodie, i was totally fascinated. 

after the day on the island we had some time to see the iguana and alligator reserve park near the pier, there's also an outdoor shopping market right there, but we opted to skip it. 

Luis is a great guide host, we had a super time and met some of our favorite people of the trip. so brush off the guy that corners you in the airport -- let luis organize your trip to ixtapa island.  it's a great way to spend a day.

169734219.name: Nice snorkel and nice food
169734219.author: a TripAdvisor user
169734219.reviewBody: Get to the island by water taxis or organized tours from professional tour guides or dive/snorkel shops. Theres many restaurants to choose from and different beaches to visit. Choose the beach according to what you want to do. Theres great snorkel and swimming beaches to hangout. Theres also a path to visit up the hill thats very enjoyable!

169434912.name: Be Careful
169434912.author: a TripAdvisor user
169434912.reviewBody: While a nice little boat ride to the Isla, it can be very expensive if you do not check and see how much you are spending. The food is way more expensive than anything in town.

168925589.name: So glad we went!
168925589.author: a TripAdvisor user
168925589.reviewBody: We stayed in playa ropa and took a cab to Ixtapa.  We took the ferry over.  The beach was so great.  The sand was white and the water was crystal clear, something i was not expecting.  take water shoes. We went to the beach on the opposite side of the snorkel beach.  Go down to the end, there are less people.  Go early, the beach closes around 4 or 5.

168091061.name: Good Snorkeling Good Beer Good Food
168091061.author: a TripAdvisor user
168091061.reviewBody:
We booked a trip through one of the timeshares in the area and were not let down. The trip from the mainland to the island was a short one, via local water taxi. The island itself has no power, but there are a few restaurants and bars located there. The food was all cooked over an open fire and the beers were chilled with good ol' fashioned ice. 

My wife and daughter went snorkeling and said it was great. Warm water, and tons of fish to see along the reef.

Because we were part of an organized group we were on the island for around four hours. To me, it was a bit too long to just sit there and sweat (and drink five or seven beers), but all in all it was a nice experience.

167709444.name: So fun!
167709444.author: a TripAdvisor user
167709444.reviewBody: Well, we found our way to this island via a little salesman in town who promised us the moon and didn\'t deliver. Thankfully my little family can roll with the punches and we made the best of it and as it turned out it was one of the best times we\'ve had! I recommend skipping the tour fees/false promises and making your own way. Take the bus from Ixtapa to the Alligator Park. That\'s what you\'re going to ask for when you\'re trying to catch the bus. Or you can take a taxi. Either way, it\'s easy to get to. Then for a few pesos take the ferry across to the island. Walk across the island to the "back" side and rent your snorkeling equipment and get a guide. Our guide was a knowledgeable, ultra-friendly, English-speaking young man who MADE our snorkeling experience! He dove down and brought up all kinds of sea life for us to examine and pointed out many things we would have missed. He also did a very good job of pulling us along so that we could really concentrate on breathing and observing rather than swimming and guiding our own selves. Love him. Such a wonderful person. Like I said we had the best time! Then I recommend going back to Ixtapa for food if you\'re so inclined. Or get a massage! oh yes, that was also awesome! I just can\'t recommend the food service or the restaurant that was part of the tour package deal. It was the only bad meal we had for the whole seven days and the only REALLY bad service we had. Oh well, you live and you learn and fortunately even with that it was a spectacular day.  We will do this every time we visit Ixtapa and probably do it multiple days. I love snorkeling!!!

166989832.name: BEWARE
166989832.author: a TripAdvisor user
166989832.reviewBody: I love the massage !but beware! there a lot of men .make sure you wear a suit you dont have to take off.

166897409.name: Ixtapa Island Fishing Trip
166897409.author: a TripAdvisor user
166897409.reviewBody: We enjoyed our day trip to Ixtapa Island.  We fished along the way and the chefs on the island prepared our catch.  (Mackerel ceviche was the best!).  The island is a little run-down--don\'t expect pristine conditions.  But you can get really cheap massages, and relax for the afternoon!

166835487.name: My favorite day of the entire trip!
166835487.author: a TripAdvisor user
166835487.reviewBody: I loved the nice cool breezes on this island, kayaking was awesome, and the food was delicious! We payed about $40 each and that included a van shuttle to/from the dock, the boat ride across, lunch, and the alligator park.

166176310.name: It was fun, cheap water taxi...might as well try it
166176310.author: a TripAdvisor user
166176310.reviewBody: Snorkeling on the backside is good.  Fun and relaxing.  Take out the Banana ride...it was fun for our whole group

165932412.name: Nice little island
165932412.author: a TripAdvisor user
165932412.reviewBody: more sea life here than off shore. short ride up to island and the water is calm and warmer. this was a nice 1/2 day trip. take some water or drinks with you.\n

164022307.name: Fun
164022307.author: a TripAdvisor user
164022307.reviewBody: We had a guide who found a puffer fish, octopus, and sea spider for us to hold.  I recommend having a guide.

163122036.name: Great Food!!
163122036.author: a TripAdvisor user
163122036.reviewBody: We had lunch at Lilly\'s on the lee side of the island, and loved it.  500 pesos bought the best seafood lunch I have had in a long time.  Three lobsters, two crabs, half a dorado, and a smattering of shrimp for the two of us.  We happily took some back to the hotel to enjoy for dinner.  Our waiter, Carlos, was great - knowledgeable about the seafood and the area itself, and patiently put up with my terrible Spanish.  \n\nWe didn\'t have time to enjoy any of the other attractions, like snorkeling, but certainly would if / when we go back.

162784673.name: Great time.
162784673.author: a TripAdvisor user
162784673.reviewBody: This was part of my honeymoon trip back in 2004.  It was a fun time.  The snorkeling was a bit rough compared to calm Caribbean waters.  But I would go again.

162755819.name: Great!!
162755819.author: a TripAdvisor user
162755819.reviewBody: Loved the island beaches, great to snorkel, have a drink, a nice meal and swimming. You could see the fish even without snorkel equipment!

162238150.name: Adventure
162238150.author: a TripAdvisor user
162238150.reviewBody: Great easy excursion for the family. Hop on a boat right on the beach and head to the island for snorkeling. There is restaurants there but we haven\'t eaten there. You can spend hours in the tide pools checking out sea life and snorkeling or just an hour. It is up To you

162203215.name: Delicious Food, good service...
162203215.author: a TripAdvisor user
162203215.reviewBody: We ate at the Cipriani restaurant there. IT was delicious. We had tiritas de PEscado, Ceviche and Pescado a la Talla. All fresh. All good. Good and friendly waiter Erick was very entertaining

161946534.name: Very touristy.
161946534.author: a TripAdvisor user
161946534.reviewBody: It was a very touristy area. You could buy the same things in Zihautanejo for half the price. The people were pushy. Not my idea of a fun vacation.

159153173.name: Ixtapa island
159153173.author: a TripAdvisor user
159153173.reviewBody: Probably the best place to be bothered. As soon as You get off the water taxi you are hassled to sit at their establishment or buy their goods. The beach facing the main land was the only one calm enough to swim in and was way too rough to snorkle on the coral side.

158865297.name: Enjoy the quiet
158865297.author: a TripAdvisor user
158865297.reviewBody: Quiet time, relaxing on Coral beach, visiting with the vendors & sipping a cool one.\n\nIt ia an annual "must" visit.

157076713.name: Ask for Ishmael at Princess
157076713.author: a TripAdvisor user
157076713.reviewBody: We have visited Ishmael for the past few years and enjoy his enthusiasm, kindness, and amazing food. Get the full Seafood Platter (pick your own fish, shrimp, and lobster all caught that morning) with Pico de Gallo (you will want to copy his recipe) and walk away with a truly memorable experience. Get there early for the cliffside palapa if possible.

156919560.name: Snorkle
156919560.author: a TripAdvisor user
156919560.reviewBody: Ixtapa Island is great. Wonderful place to snorkel and enjoy the peaceful atmosphere on the island. People are friendly and service is good.

156904240.name: Nothing special
156904240.author: a TripAdvisor user
156904240.reviewBody: People are boated over to 2 beaches with several fish restaurants. Typically, you catch fish on the way and they prepare it for you while you attempt to snorkel off a rocky shore (ineteresting but challenging)

156773852.name: Isla Ixtapa
156773852.author: a TripAdvisor user
156773852.reviewBody: If you go, make sure you snorkel first thing in the morning as it gets congested and stirred up as the day goes on.

156559647.name: Not that impressed
156559647.author: a TripAdvisor user
156559647.reviewBody: we could see lots of large fish from the shore, so the snorkeling might not be bad, but as a place just to visit, Isla Ixtapa was not that  interesting.  The water taxi ride was fun, but very large swells made exiting the boat kind of scary.  I enjoyed the crocodiles at the other end of the dock much more

156543475.name: Ixtapa Island
156543475.author: a TripAdvisor user
156543475.reviewBody:
Nice beaches for swimming.  Reasonable price for motorized water sports.  A taste of the "locals" which is fun.

Not much space for sun-tanning.  Great for relaxation and hanging out, and trying local restaurants.  Otherwise, it's a small island with not much to do

There's snorkeling on other side of island but too wavy to be good

155994999.name: Great for swimming
155994999.author: a TripAdvisor user
155994999.reviewBody: This beach was fantastic, great for swimming, snorkelling and the food was fantastic. The water was calm, no waves, clean and sandy bottom, excellent for kids.  It is a short water taxi ride from Ixtapa.  Watch your head getting into the boats.

155857364.name: Princess Rebecca is wonderful!
155857364.author: a TripAdvisor user
155857364.reviewBody: Our favorite place! A great day, and if you go to Coral Island, Ishmael is a great server at Princess Rebecca. We traditionally get a big platter of shrimp, lobster, fish and have the meal of the trip.

155854856.name: A nice side trip
155854856.author: a TripAdvisor user
155854856.reviewBody: This was nice day trip organized by the Air Canada rep Enrique with lunch and boat ride included.  We rented snorkel equipment and were taken out into the viewing area by our guide.  We clung on to ropes around a small  flotation platform. There were very big waves so the water was murky.  Our guide brought food for the fish.  We had fish all around us.  We could feel them as they rubbed by our arms in their swarming around the food.  It was fun to snorkel and great for my daughters who had not done snorkelling before.  However the view of fish, coral and underwater plants pales in comparison with snorkelling on the Great Barrier Reef or places in the Caribbean.  Perhaps there are times when there waves are less and the water is crystal clear and there is more to see.  After we swam around on one side of the island we walked a short distance across the sand to a calm bay.  Here there was a sandy bottom for the most part.  Our guide took us to one end of the beach where he picked up and showed us some sea urchins.  We returned here to snorkel and swim on our own after the guided tour ended.  I had an excellent grilled fish for lunch.  We watched schools of big fish swim right up the the waters edge on the swirling water side of the island.  We sat in the water and they swam around us.  We took the boat ride back to Linda Beach.  There is a crocodile preserve there.  We saw lots of crocodiles and iguanas.  This was a pleasant trip to a very relaxing getaway island.

155508790.name: Nice for snorkeling.
155508790.author: a TripAdvisor user
155508790.reviewBody: Good snorkeling on one side of the beach. other side nice sand good for laying out. we did a snorkeling tour so food was included. it was great food. but it was spendy if u wanted a drink.

155445464.name: Away from it all!
155445464.author: a TripAdvisor user
155445464.reviewBody: A great place to spend a carefree day on the beach. Just sit and snooze with a bucketful of ice (beers as well), by your side.  You\'ll need them as it gets nice and hot,(usually 30-33 degs all year round.  I was lucky that my friend had a motor boat and we left from Ixtapa marina and took us just over half an hour.  This is preferable as you just might get a school of dolphins escort on the way to the island. Magical!  When moored up, close to the small beach, just dive in, swim ashore and chill out.  Oh, just be aware they only serve cold beers and great food, shrimp, octopus and good Mexican grub ;-)

155367906.name: nice side trip
155367906.author: a TripAdvisor user
155367906.reviewBody: Nice island just off Ixtapa  at the northern end of the resort. Easily accessed by bus to PLaya Linda then 40 peso panga ride to the island.  3 beaches  2 sandy and one  has lots of coral. Go snorkelling at the coral beach. Equipment for rent available.   Food is good and fresh at the many cafes on the beaches. Last boat back to the mainland about 5pm. Gets  busy at weekends so try to go midweek.  we went a couple of times during our 2 month stay at Zihua. Best trip there was by boat from Zihua to Ixtapa Island - great chance to see sealife on the way there and back

155354249.name: Worth a look!
155354249.author: a TripAdvisor user
155354249.reviewBody: We took the local bus from Zihuatenejo to Playa Linda, then the water taxi to the Island.  Pretty basic experience, but nice snorkelling.

155009319.name: Worth the ride
155009319.author: a TripAdvisor user
155009319.reviewBody: We stayed at Ixtapa Azul, kayaking out one day and taking the water taxi the next.  Snorkel equipment is available at the instruction center and I would advise renting there.  Great guide also available there.  There are lots of lunch options though prices high.  A walk around the island is interesting, rustic and refreshing.

154968915.name: Diverse spot
154968915.author: a TripAdvisor user
154968915.reviewBody: Two sided island, one swimming beach with restaurants, one rocky for snorkelers.  We kayaked there, a bit rough, but fun.

154687318.name: snorkeling
154687318.author: a TripAdvisor user
154687318.reviewBody: beautiful clear water great snorkeling and chilling out on the beach.  food was great.  It was cheaper for us to go there with an excursion than going on our own.  We were able to be picked up from our hotel in a van brought to the island on a boat and snorkel and eat all for $25 pp   This was an excellent value well worth it

154587572.name: Totally a must see!
154587572.author: a TripAdvisor user
154587572.reviewBody: The beach was so clear and calm for swimming.  We went snorkeling and saw many fish and the beautiful coral.  Our guide was very helpful.  He went to the bottom and brought up star spiders and an urchin.  They looked scary but we were able to touch them.  The water was just the right temperature for snorkeling.  Later we rested on the hammocks in the shade.  Beautiful view and very relaxing!!

154456870.name: great snorkling
154456870.author: a TripAdvisor user
154456870.reviewBody: we had a fun time snorkling and haning our at the beach.  Food at the little resturants on the island are very good

154451718.name: Amazing snorkeling adventure!
154451718.author: a TripAdvisor user
154451718.reviewBody: Great place to go for calm waters and beautiful scenery. We ate a great lunch made right on the beach. Well worth the money.

154220765.name: Great place to relax
154220765.author: a TripAdvisor user
154220765.reviewBody: Had an hour long massage, don\'t miss it.  Food was good, drinks are great, service is very friendly.  Snorkeling was interesting, I rented a guide and life jacket because I cannot swim well.  It was well worth it, the guide dove down and brought up interesting creatures from the rocks for us to see and hold. It was a beautiful place.

154056886.name: Snorkeling Excursion...
154056886.author: a TripAdvisor user
154056886.reviewBody: Brought my family there because again we heard it was a great outing.  This is our first time snorkeling and we had kids with.  The snorkeling guide never asked us if we ever did this before we basically had to figure things out ourselves and the waves there when you first enter the water with slippery sharp coral and rocks around was very difficult. The fish that you see was nice but not all that great.  So if the guy tells you to go snorkeling and it is only $35.00 US, that does not include the equipment.. you do get a lunch that is suppose to be FRESH catch of the day (I am a chef- not even close!). So we did try it but I don\'t recommend it!

153952553.name: Excursion
153952553.author: a TripAdvisor user
153952553.reviewBody: We only had access to two beaches..the beach was cramped...too much beach furniture and tables and chairs in front of each restaurant made for walking along the beach pretty hard because you were walking sideways.  There wasn\'t much beach front on the beach we were on...the excursion was OK for the value of it.

153881424.name: A la Talla Fish (Pescado a la talla)
153881424.author: a TripAdvisor user
153881424.reviewBody: If you want to have amazing fish tacos. Order Pescado a la Talla at this place. It\'s their speciality. You have to be there early, because they run out!

153876170.name: Pescado a la talla. For Fish Tacos
153876170.author: a TripAdvisor user
153876170.reviewBody: Eat Pescado a la talla! You\'ll love it! Marinate fish cooked on the grill. Delicious! I liked everything here, no complaints!

153789309.name: Snorkling
153789309.author: a TripAdvisor user
153789309.reviewBody: I was assigned to David, a snorkling guide. He showed me so many things, i was like a five year old looking everywhere to see what David was showing me.

153742483.name: Coral Beach
153742483.author: a TripAdvisor user
153742483.reviewBody: This is a fun day trip. The panga is $40 pesos each for a return trip. We had a tip from someone to take the boat to the second stop which takes you around the corner from the main beach. We wanted to snorkel but the water was too rough that day so stayed on the calm side and swam, drank and ate at the end at Pamelitos (I think). They were totally laid back. We had a great lunch of coconut shrimp and garlic shrimp with rice and salad. I think our bill for the day (with cervezas and other drinks) came to $200 pesos. They had padded lounge chairs and umbrellas. They also rent seadoos, kayaks, and other water toys there. They do not go out and solicit like some of the other places.\n\nMy partner had an hour long massage nearby for $200 pesos and said he hadn\'t felt that good in a long time.

153337029.name: not impressed
153337029.author: a TripAdvisor user
153337029.reviewBody: Okay, I understand the snorkeling is what it is all about, but the beach where the snorkeling was had such a bad decline, you struggled to stay on the beach lounger without sliding down.  Very rocky.  we ate at the Indio Restaurant, had the Red Snapper, shocked how it was served, but decent. I would only go there if I had kids because of all of the fish and shallow, calm waters.

153045352.name: Relaxing
153045352.author: a TripAdvisor user
153045352.reviewBody: Beautiful beach with snorkling on one side and swimming on the other. Tranquil, with great food and unique drinks. Fun boat ride there and back. We go every time we are in Ixtapa.

153000142.name: Ok
153000142.author: a TripAdvisor user
153000142.reviewBody: Not much there, but a nice day out. It was not expensive to go over by water taxi, and there are many restaurants to choose  from.

152825637.name: Beautiful
152825637.author: a TripAdvisor user
152825637.reviewBody: We have been to Ixtapa Island before and it was just as beautiful the second time.  The snorkeling is fun, the scenery is gorgeous, and the food is awesome. It\'s always a very relaxing trip,

152633212.name: Best of Two Beaches
152633212.author: a TripAdvisor user
152633212.reviewBody: This was one of my favorite beaches.  One side has soft sand and tranquillo atmosphere with good restaurants and cold beers.  A short walk thru the path to the other side of island there deer in the bushes.  The islanders are sure to have fresh water for the animals, There are more people and better for snorkelling cause the reef is there. This side of the beach is rougher due to coral and shells smashed on the shore from the reefs.  Great Isla!

152553939.name: Very nice!
152553939.author: a TripAdvisor user
152553939.reviewBody: Great for swimming, no waves.  Water was warm.  Lot\'s of little restaurants.  No water there, bring your own or drink beer.

152500195.name: Excellent side trip
152500195.author: a TripAdvisor user
152500195.reviewBody: If you  like to snorkel, you will like Ixtapa Island. No need to sign up for the hotel package tours to this location. Simply take a cab from hotel to Playa Linda - get out and walk through the market to the pier. Buy a ticket for $4 US on the pier and take a panga (small fishing boat) across to Ixtapa Island. Pick any establishment to hang out at for the day. Those on the far side (away from the boat pier) of the Island offer the best snorkeling.

152350131.name: Great Snorkelling
152350131.author: a TripAdvisor user
152350131.reviewBody: Best snorkelling I\'ve had on the Pacific Coast, clear water and lots of fish. Don\'t miss the crocodiles and huge iguanas also.

151971571.name: get the shrimp
151971571.author: a TripAdvisor user
151971571.reviewBody: we loved the island and had the breaded shrimp and to die for. Luis was our guy there that got us the hut on the beach and waited on us. He really goes out of his way

151666513.name: Good snorkeling, expensive beer and food.
151666513.author: a TripAdvisor user
151666513.reviewBody: The island is beautiful but very commercial...expect to spend some money on drinks and food, and it\'s not cheap!  We had about 8 beers, guac and horrible nachos (cold beans) and it was $50, nachos and guac were $5 each, beers were about $4 each, too.  Bring your own cooler, stop and get drinks and ice and snacks at the little store in the market before the pier.  They cook fresh seafood on grills, this was a little pricey, but smelled incredible.  The island has deer trails that go up the cliffs...not for the faint of heart or anyone scared of heights, no guardrails here!

151392166.name: Snorkel Heaven
151392166.author: a TripAdvisor user
151392166.reviewBody: If you go, get Ismail to be your guide.  He is on the pier walking to the beach.  He is amazing.  He helped us get a tabel, recommended where to go, what to eat, made sure we had everything we needed for snorkeling.  He also served as our security and put us in a secluded spot.

151102616.name: Snorkeling!
151102616.author: a TripAdvisor user
151102616.reviewBody: This is the best place we found to snorkel.  One side of the island is set aside for people to do just that.  They have tables and lounges set up for you to youse but the restaurants are on the other side of the island so it gives you a more tranquil experience.  But if you want something to eat or drind a waiter will be only too happy to bring your what you want.

150700206.name: IF you like snorkeling, go here.
150700206.author: a TripAdvisor user
150700206.reviewBody: Had a wonderful time parked at Lily Ciprianni Restaurant on the backside of Ixtapa Island.  The beach on the back is more slanted, but worth it for the reef.  For those looking for adventure this is a great day excursion.  The crocodile reserve is worth seeing as well before you board the ferry from Playa Linda.  The taxi will drop you right off and the pier is easy to see.  Hop on the ferry for 40 pesos round trip, bring or rent snorkel gear, and enjoy the reef that has fish swimming in 1 ft. deep of water.  We walk down a ways to a restaurant we like.  Erik our server at Ciprianni was wonderful and we followed him from his days on Las Gatas.  He speaks perfect English and for such a young man truly understands the importance of return business. Enjoy some seafood, chips, guac, and check out the amazing fish all around you in the clear waters.

150673391.name: Day Trip to Ixtapa Island
150673391.author: a TripAdvisor user
150673391.reviewBody: Instead of going with a group, my husband and I ventured out on our own via taxi to Playa Linda, then took a water taxi to the island and walked across to the coral reef side of the island near Rebecca\'s. It\'s all a bit third world, but as we got there early, we had our pick of spots on the beach. We found a table and chairs jutting out into the rocks and beach a bit and proceeded to have a very relaxing few hours. Starting with salsa and chips and Coronas, Benicio took very good care of us. He brought us a platter of fresh fish and lobster, and we decided on grilled lobster for lunch. Served with french fries and rice, and a garlic oil/butter, it was soooo good. The crabs on the nearby rocks were so cool to watch. We didn\'t go for the big drinks in the coconut husks, but they sure looked good! You can snorkel right off the beach and rent equipment from Rebecca\'s if you need to. Beautiful place!

150292157.name: Good day trip
150292157.author: a TripAdvisor user
