150292157.reviewBody: We had really good snorkeling at Playa Coral (one of the three beaches).  Don\'t buy a tour, just take a bus to Playa Linda, get a water taxi for $4 and spend the day there and enjoy.

150268076.name: Really great day with interesting, unexpected highlights
150268076.author: a TripAdvisor user
150268076.reviewBody: We took our own trip to the island, rather than going with an arranged tour.  Took the local bus from Ixtapa to Playa Linda, only to discover a creek with crocodiles and amazing birds... fascinating.  The boat to the island was fast and fun, and the island -- the coral beach side, had some of the best snorkeling just off a beach that we\'ve experienced.  It was all good.

150217187.name: Great Snorkelling
150217187.author: a TripAdvisor user
150217187.reviewBody: Just had a great day snorkelling on Ixtapa Island.   Jump off at the water taxi at the second stop and head across to bay across from the dock.   Rent a mask, snorkel and fins and walk right in off the beach.   Lots of fish 50 metres in from shore.  Well worth the trip.

150212113.name: not much going on but cute
150212113.author: a TripAdvisor user
150212113.reviewBody: My family sailed over and spent some time on the beach not much to do but a nice get away. FIshing was fabulous caught a HUGE Mahi Mahi.

149907635.name: swindlers! they are out to victimize the tousrists they should be protecting in astrange place
149907635.author: a TripAdvisor user
149907635.reviewBody: Royal Holiday Club and this hotel, and all others associated with RHC, are defrauding tourists for many years, now. They should have been stopped many years ago by the governments were they operate, by the credit card companies, byt he travel companies, but they are still at it.

149887168.name: Paradise found!
149887168.author: a TripAdvisor user
149887168.reviewBody: Sun, fun, great service, food, drinks, ocean, snorkeling, swimming, waves, beaches what\'s not to love!

149684697.name: Snorkel
149684697.author: a TripAdvisor user
149684697.reviewBody: One of the best snorkeling places we have found. Much better than Cozumel. The reef is alive with coral and more fish than once could hope for. Easy to get to and you just walk right in.

149678321.name: beach food/beverage service, snorkeling, swimming
149678321.author: a TripAdvisor user
149678321.reviewBody: The ferry costs 40 pesos and takes you to Ixtapa Island beach which is lined with restaurants offering food, beverage, chairs, umbrellas, tables.  You share the water with boats moored close by, with snorkeling a short walk over to the other side of the island.  No waves, but good for sunbathing and hanging out with your family for a day.  Snorkeling was fun.  We had our own gear but others seemed able to rent gear and even a guide to tow you around.  Oscar was our cheerful and excellent host at the restaurant right in the middle of the beach.  Ceviche, tiritas, fish tacos, buckets of cold beers were served up fast and as often as we wanted.

149354656.name: Interesting fish, but very crowded
149354656.author: a TripAdvisor user
149354656.reviewBody: My 7 year old son HATED this excursion from the Club Med where we were staying.  The snorkeling was interesting, but it was very crowded and dirty compared to the Club Med property.  Wasn\'t worth the cost of the transfer.

149301588.name: Pure tropical bliss.
149301588.author: a TripAdvisor user
149301588.reviewBody: This island had the best beaches we went to in Zih. Fine white sand, crystalline water, excellent snorkling right at the shoreline.\nBeachfront restaurants line three of the four beaches: use of chaise lounges is included if you buy something to eat or drink, and prices aren\'t steep. The fourth beach is commerce-free, and slightly more remote, but it is not the "nudist" beach described by over-imaginative locals. Note that Ixtapa Island is best reached by a five minute launch from Playa Linda near Ixtapa and the Club Med; Playa Linda is 25 minutes from Zihuatanejo by taxi (about $15US one way).

149174530.name: Snorkelling day trip
149174530.author: a TripAdvisor user
149174530.reviewBody: Great value for the cost - a long time snorkelling and a really good lunch. They didn\'t just drop us off - they spent the entire time with us, fitting equipment, guided snorkelling, and relating local history.

149117852.name: Wonderful Snorkelling
149117852.author: a TripAdvisor user
149117852.reviewBody: We had a great guide for snorkelling.  He showed us really good spot and fed the fish in front of us.  We also order and ate fresh fish right on the spot.

148664711.name: went snorkeling...well worth the cost! saw tons of fish
148664711.author: a TripAdvisor user
148664711.reviewBody: was a full day, included pick up and return transportation, lunch and was a terrific experience. You can either take your own gear or it is available to rent. The lunch included a beverage, we had the fish that was offered as part of the package, you could also add lobster or shrimp, glad we didn\'t, had a hard time eating everything we had on our plates (plenty of food for sure!)

148624924.name: Great place for lunch!
148624924.author: a TripAdvisor user
148624924.reviewBody: Good snorkeling on southside reef or just have lunch on the beach. Boat ride out to the islands is cheap.

148600338.name: Crowded and horrible food
148600338.author: a TripAdvisor user
148600338.reviewBody: The restaurant we were taken to by our "guide" was positively awful, awful! The food was served cold and it was tasteless and, uh, did I say awful? Worse than that. The island is not worth the trip.

148535352.name: Snorkeling
148535352.author: a TripAdvisor user
148535352.reviewBody: Better than average snorkeling.\nDrinks and food available, can get a little pricy.\nEasy to get on and off the island in the water taxis which are always coming and going.

148528374.name: Very interesting snorkel experience
148528374.author: a TripAdvisor user
148528374.reviewBody: After a short boat ride to the island we enjoyed the snorkeling and the wonderful service from our waiter/guide.  Food was good and the area we snorkeled in was interesting and safe.

148455202.name: Nice and relaxing
148455202.author: a TripAdvisor user
148455202.reviewBody: Very nice place, relaxing.  Equipments are not expensive at all to rent and you don\'t have to go far away for snorkeling.  To get the the island is also quite inexpensive....which is a real treat.  No one bothers you also with buying stuff.  Great place for relaxing.

148318647.name: A fun retreat
148318647.author: a TripAdvisor user
148318647.reviewBody: If you are going to be in Ixtapa for awhile consider this side trip. My wife and I have bikes here and we ride the bike path from Ixtapa to Playa Linda. After we lock up the bikes we take a water ferry to Ixtapa Island for some snorkeling. It\'s not Maui when it comes to marine life, but it\'s not bad for around here. \n\nWe usually stake out a spot by one of the many restaurants right on the beach. In fact, you can\'t avoid them as waiters from the various beach cantinas solicit your attention with hopes you will buy a dinner or at least a beer or two (which we normally do). We hear that the fish is excellent, but we usually don\'t eat there or if we do, just a snack.

148181809.name: Great snorkelling
148181809.author: a TripAdvisor user
148181809.reviewBody: Take the local bus to Playa Linda and then the water taxi over to Ixtapa Island . The snorkelling  beach is straight thru from the beach you land at. Rent at the beach restaurant, water is clear and warm wih lots of fish. lots of lose coral when you first get in.

147956164.name: Fun change of scenery
147956164.author: a TripAdvisor user
147956164.reviewBody: It\'s a narrow beach, but beautiful water and views.  Snorkeling was good, and the food excellent!  Fish cooked over an open fire, perfectly done.

147905452.name: Great Place to Cool Off
147905452.author: a TripAdvisor user
147905452.reviewBody:
We took the bus from Zihua to Playa Linda past Ixtapa for a whopping 10 pesos each.  BUT the bus driver passed a watering truck on the right and squeezed by him by just a few inches and then our bus driver was pulled over by the police, which is NOT a good thing, especially when it adds at least 20 minutes to your bus ride.
After all that commotion and getting the bus restarted, we headed out again in the broiling heat.
We got off the bus at Playa Linda and saw the crocodiles, lizards and iguanas all behind fences.  Then we walked down to the Pier and walked out to catch the little boats that go out to the island called Isla Ixtapa.  It cost 40 pesos for the round trip and of course, when you got to the island's beach and were helped out of the boat, you were asked for a few pesos as a tip.  I did succumb the first time, but on the way back, I just ignored the request.  I had already paid for the ride and didn't need that much help getting out of the boat.  REALLY ??
We were told to go to the restaurant called Indio, which we did, after discovering the owner was sitting across from us in the little boat.  She showed us to her restaurant and we were there for the day.  I would suggest trying another place as all of the 7 or 8 places were very busy.  I was overcharged for my tiny glass of juice at 60 pesos.  It should have been 20 at the most. But the chicken fajitas were excellent.  So if you go to Indio's don't order a juice.  They were very nice people there and so any restaurant is fine.
The swimming was fun and the water very refreshing. Wear water shoes though as there were large rocks and sharp shells to avoid.  Next to the Indio restaurant, they had all kinds of water toys for rent.  We saw jet skis, kayaks, etc.  and I would imagine they were all at reasonable rates.  
If you wanted to snorkel, you could just walk up over and behind the restaurant to the other side of the island where there was another beach with huge coral reefs.  It was so shallow though that we did not venture out so as to not get cut up by the coral, which can be a nasty problem.
You can rent snorkeling gear and go for it if you are so inclined.
I highly recommend this for a day trip, but try to go during the week, as weekends, when we went are extremely busy.  And if you have a cooler, take your own beer and snacks.

147896153.name: DAY WELL SPENT
147896153.author: a TripAdvisor user
147896153.reviewBody: Take boat over from Playa Linda for 40 pesos.  I prefer the back side of island as the ocean side has too much coral.  Favorite restaurant is ESCONDIDO which is next to last on beach.  Tina, one of waitresses has been there for 24 years and the service and food are more than acceptable.  No electricity so everything is cooked/grilled over open flame, super.  Beer is cold and food is very good.  Lemonade is also very refreshing.   This side of island is better for nice calm water and swimming.  Can walk over behind the restaurant about 100 yards and on the front/ocean side of island which has great snorkeling and lots of fish but navigating the rocks and coral can be a bit tricky.  Last boat departs back to Playa Linda around 5 PM.

147883720.name: Nice Beach - Lots of Locals
147883720.author: a TripAdvisor user
147883720.reviewBody: Very nice and quiet in the morning.  Get off beach by Noon, or you will be swarmed by vendors every five minutes wanting to sell you something and tons of small kids whose parents must not have a job.

147822284.name: Nice little island
147822284.author: a TripAdvisor user
147822284.reviewBody: We were able to get a free ride from Zihua to the docks in Playa Linda; which we had to pay $40 pesos 2 way per person to get to the island. They have like 4 different points in the island where you can stay. We decided to spend the stay snorkeling so we pay about $50 pesos for fins and we head to the water. The variety of fishes was nice, but nothing I ever seen before. However, it was nice to have the experience while in Ixtapa. We ordered few drinks and we got charge a service fee of $40 pesos, but we got the chairs and the umbrellas. Overall, it was a nice day in the water..

147821591.name: Great
147821591.author: a TripAdvisor user
147821591.reviewBody: Great to swim and snorkel, it was calm clear water and you can snorkel either side of the island. You can take your own food and pay for a chair or buy food there and beer or whatever you want to drink. Everyone was very helpful telling us we can take a boat back from either side. Its worth spending a day there

147697244.name: Snorkeling
147697244.author: a TripAdvisor user
147697244.reviewBody: Came to the island to Snorkel. Friendly people and a great experience. Water was warm and clear and saw plenty of fish.

147636050.name: Great for a day trip
147636050.author: a TripAdvisor user
147636050.reviewBody: If you are staying somewhere in Ixtapa, charter a small boat (cheap with a local) and spend several hours on the island. There is great, incredibly fresh sea food & good snorkeling.

147160069.name: Well worth seeing as I went there four times
147160069.author: a TripAdvisor user
147160069.reviewBody: Snorkelling was great and beach was great. Water was really warm. Beer was priced at about $3 as you had to have ones because the restaurants have all the chairs.

146503787.name: Ixtapa island
146503787.author: a TripAdvisor user
146503787.reviewBody: We took a tour from hotel, really nice snorkelling and great food.  Was worthwhile to pay the little bit to have the snorkel guide.  We snorkeled later on our own and then we knew where to go in the bay.

145251627.name: Snorkeling
145251627.author: a TripAdvisor user
145251627.reviewBody: Fabulous spot to go snorkeling and swimming and to just relax.\nFood and drinks are excellent and everyone there was so very friendly.

145202043.name: relaxing
145202043.author: a TripAdvisor user
145202043.reviewBody: Kayaking banana boat, lunch. lunch is not good, maybe try ordring off the menu, we should have. shopping is a little expensive.

144838736.name: Excursion
144838736.author: a TripAdvisor user
144838736.reviewBody: Boat taxi was easy.  Police presence made it safe and carefree.    Snorkeling at Coral beah was really neat.  Get a guide that knows where to go and what to look for.  The food and drinks are plentiful and delicious.  We had a blast.

144785576.name: Take a boat there on your own!
144785576.author: a TripAdvisor user
144785576.reviewBody: We took a tour here that we booked through our hotel for 475 pesos per person. I would recommend going to the dock where you can get a boat over to the island yourself! It\'s way cheaper and you can figure out everything to do there without a guide. Our package included snorkeling (but you can rent the gear yourself, which we still had to pay for separately), lunch (which was ok-- i would have rather picked a restaurant there myself) and seeing the crocodiles by the dock where you leave from (which you can totally check out on your own). The snorkeling is really good! Bring crackers so you can feed the fish and they will swarm around you! They are beautiful! The water is calm and warm.

144601383.name: Nice coral reef snorkelling
144601383.author: a TripAdvisor user
144601383.reviewBody: Go to the coral side to snorkel. Booze prices vary at each place so shop around. Lots of pelicans at the boat launch, bring camera.

144114409.name: Top 10 most romantic places
144114409.author: a TripAdvisor user
144114409.reviewBody: A real treat with nice restaurants,clean water...treat yourself with a great meal and a drink.Don\'t just stay there eating peanuts and drinking lemonada to save $.Enjoy life....

141192106.name: It is checked off of our list......
141192106.author: a TripAdvisor user
141192106.reviewBody: The Island was small and crowed.   Visibility while snorkeling was poor.  The boat taxi over was warm and crowded.  I would go to the Island for a few hours just to experience it.  However, a few hours were more than enough for us.

137020896.name: Quaint but beautiful
137020896.author: a TripAdvisor user
137020896.reviewBody: Great snorkling and very quaint. There isn\'t much on the island but they do make a great fresh grilled fish that is caught only moments before!

136857650.name: Fun, quite day of snorkeling
136857650.author: a TripAdvisor user
136857650.reviewBody: We went with a small tour booked through the agency that picked us up at the airport. The tour included travel to the island and lunch. We rented the snorkeling gear on the island for (I think) 75 pesos a set. A lot of fish, relatively calm waters, easy swimming. It was a very fun day trip.

136436786.name: Don\'t miss Ixtapa Island on your trip to Ixtapa
136436786.author: a TripAdvisor user
136436786.reviewBody: Really fun and so gorgeous. We took a whale boat trip over to the island and spent several hours snorkeling, swimming, shelling and eating on the island and had a great time on trip back because we were able to see whales.

134433133.name: Worth the trip
134433133.author: a TripAdvisor user
134433133.reviewBody: A nice break from resort life and so worth it!  Coral reefs, fresh grilled seafood, banana boats, jet skis, incredible day for the whole family.

134313633.name: Very calm waters
134313633.author: a TripAdvisor user
134313633.reviewBody: Great beach to enjoy the calm waters.  The restaurants are good\nand friendly staff.  We went snorkling. Great!

133272219.name: Great Snorkeling
133272219.author: a TripAdvisor user
133272219.reviewBody: Went snorkeling on the island and had a great lunch on the beach.

132780149.name: Awesome
132780149.author: a TripAdvisor user
132780149.reviewBody: Ixtpa Island was the best part of our vacation to Ixtapa.

130038636.name: WAS DISAPPOINTED
130038636.author: a TripAdvisor user
130038636.reviewBody: We were on a 15 day cruise and this excursion took place on day 6 ~ where we truly needed to get out and see something !!  We were taken on a boat (very nice) to a place to deep sea snorkel and were given wet suits (not full ones) to protect our bodies from all the jellyfish that were in the water.  Most of us got stung, not a pleasant way to snorkel.  After spending only a few minutes, literally MINUTES, snorkeling we were taken to a beach which was less than pristine, the sand was very coarse and rocky.  The water was murky so you could not really enjoy the beach water there.  They served us lunch.  Once again, just OK.  And then the day was over.  My husband and I wanted to pay additional money to parasail, but we ran out of time.  Not very impressed with this excursion.

130013463.name: Anniversary Trip
130013463.author: a TripAdvisor user
130013463.reviewBody: Great beach , lots of coral , coarse sand on the snorkel side , great clean swim side on the island. Watch for bottle caps and glass in the sand on the snorkelling side . Lots of fish to see !!

129760182.name: Average and costly
129760182.author: a TripAdvisor user
129760182.reviewBody: Beautiful island if you go to the other side.  Great snorkeling.  Food on the beach is way overpriced.  Just average.  Go to Cozumel if you want to snorkel and not get sick on the food.

129333681.name: Good snorkeling.
129333681.author: a TripAdvisor user
129333681.reviewBody: Snorkeling from the beach was very good. The food at the restaurant was good but the beach and restaurants were nearly deserted.

129141607.name: Too good to be true
129141607.author: a TripAdvisor user
129141607.reviewBody: Bought a boat trip from a beach vendor, who said it was $10 less than the hotel. Didn\'t tell us his boat was really just a water taxi that my friend ,literally, just missed getting his arm crushed between the open window and the rocky dock. Didn\'t tell us the snorkeling that he raved about would be $12 additional. Didn\'t tell us that the chairs situated down on the beach would get us a "maybe you give me a little bit for setting the chairs up for you." Others had fun, we did not. ASK what is included.

128680151.name: Excellent Shrimp & Mackerel on the beach
128680151.author: a TripAdvisor user
128680151.reviewBody: We rode a local bus from Sunscape Pacific Dorado to Playa Linda and then took a Water Taxi over to Isla Ixtapa.  While waiting for the panga to pick us up we met a waiter from a restaurant from the snorkelling side of the island.  He set us up with a palapa and chairs and looked after our needs all day.  For lunch he brought out a selection of shrimp,lobster, red snapper, and mackerel to choose from.  We went with the garlic shrimp and charcoal grilled Mackerel.  It was awesome.  12 beers, 6 cokes, 4 sets of snorkel gear, a great spot on the beach for a day and seafood lunch for 4 -$80 with tip.  Memory of a lifetime....priceless.

128450119.name: It was OK
128450119.author: a TripAdvisor user
128450119.reviewBody: Unless you are going to snorkel or take a 30 minute hike around the island, there is really nothing else to see or do but wander past the many restaurants and massage businesses.

128351732.name: Not so great snorkeling
128351732.author: a TripAdvisor user
128351732.reviewBody: Glad we went to see it. Took the bus from Ixtapa to Playa Linda, very easy 10 pesos. Walked down to the pier and paid 40 pesos each for a return ticket to the island. Took about 10 minutes to get there. Getting off the boat, was met by a man who took us to the snorkeling side and set us up at his restaurant table on the beach. Paid 20 pesos for Coronas, and 120 pesos for snorkel gear. It was a little old, but worked well. The deaf mute man I had heard about took us out through the coral. He had a boogie board with ropes attached, and went down and got a puffer fish that he brought up and let us handle. When we got back to shore, he wrote $5 in the sand, so we gave him 50 pesos. Not the easiest or best snorkeling spot, very murky and wavy water. Glad we did it though. Paid our bill and headed over to the swimming side, about a 2 minute walk between the 2 sides. The beach and water are amazing. Just laid there on a lounger getting Coronas brought to us, watched the fishermen bring in fresh fish to the restaurants. Headed back to the mainland, got off the pier and followed the fence up the canal where you can see the crocodiles and iguanas. Back to town again easily on the bus.

128092334.name: Beatiful, relaxing and magics things to see!
128092334.author: a TripAdvisor user
128092334.reviewBody: This is a excellent place to pass almost one day there.\nYou can take you many pictures on the sea or on the stones!! The water is very transparent and clean... The color fishes are the maximum, !!! There are many things to eat!! \nVisit this place! Only 4usd aprox. On boat!! And you arrive to one wonderful island!! In ixtapa

127676606.name: Worth the Trip
127676606.author: a TripAdvisor user
127676606.reviewBody: First off, it was beautiful. Secondly, had the most amazing seafood Ive had in a long time! Head to the snorkeling side, talk to Burro (aka Benny) and he will feed and water you so well!!!

127613121.name: Totally fun, and doable without a tour
127613121.author: a TripAdvisor user
127613121.reviewBody: We went twice, once through our hotel and once on our own. The hotel deal was nice as no one fought for our business, but it was a lot cheaper to do it on our own. Spanish is not essential, but there are VERY few non-Mexican tourists out there, so be ready for a really cool experience of the real M\u00e9xico!

127413478.name: Good snorkeling
127413478.author: a TripAdvisor user
127413478.reviewBody: Snorkelling was very reasonable having the guide was great. Got to hold a puffer fish. Loved it

127381746.name: Beautiful Beach
127381746.author: a TripAdvisor user
127381746.reviewBody: def recommend taking a boat - it\'s very nice.  easy and cheap to get a boat from playa linda, then head over there

127188087.name: Not worth $50 each
127188087.author: a TripAdvisor user
127188087.reviewBody: Save your money.  Take the local bus and the water taxi. Buy your own lunch,  The snorkling wasn\' t that great but the beach on the one side was very nice

127147545.name: Great experience!
127147545.author: a TripAdvisor user
127147545.reviewBody: Snorkeling and a lobster lunch as well as a great beach fully staffed.

127037896.name: Great day at the beach
127037896.author: a TripAdvisor user
127037896.reviewBody: We took a bus from the hotel strip in Ixtapa to Playa Linda (9 pesos) and the ferry to the island was 40 pesos (return - keep your ticket for your ride back). If you are the last one off the boat, they will ask you to tip the boys who helped you off the boat. Rental of snorkel gear is easier than packing it to Mexico yourself (or you may want to just pack your mouth gear). The island is pretty small, so walking around is easy. We enjoyed the coral beach side. Meals and beer were inexpensive and the hour massage on the beach (almost the best one I have ever had) was only 180 pesos (~$17 CDN!!!)

126708210.name: It was ok
126708210.author: a TripAdvisor user
126708210.reviewBody: nice snorkeling, if you could fight your way over big gravel big and big waves smashing you constantly. more expensive than las gastas

126654026.name: Great snorkeling with the guide! skip the food:)
126654026.author: a TripAdvisor user
126654026.reviewBody: There is a fellow that will be your guide for snorkeling for 30 minutes.. he is mute and is an amazing communicator and guide. The fellows saw many fish and touched a "puffer fish".  Beer was good but my advise is do not eat here... definitely some hygiene issues with the beach cafes.

126609424.name: Great day!
126609424.author: a TripAdvisor user
126609424.reviewBody: Went to far side on pacific, murky water from the big waves but still a great day. Snorkeling was a little rough but was ok.

126514486.name: Great snorkeling!
126514486.author: a TripAdvisor user
126514486.reviewBody: Day of in and out of the ocean, the sooner u get there, the less people, the more fish and things you see.

126507265.name: Snorkling
126507265.author: a TripAdvisor user
126507265.reviewBody: The waves were huge so the water was not clear for snorkling, first time that has every been like that for us out there. Food they cook is amazing .

126297654.name: Fun Day On the Beach
126297654.author: a TripAdvisor user
126297654.reviewBody:
Spent a lovely afternoon at Isla Ixtapa! Took the ferry over from Playa Linda, a $4.00 per person ride. There was a young man on the boat who represented one of the establishments on the island. He gave us a good price for renting snorkle gear ( $8.00 per person) and walked us directly to his restaurant on Coral Beach. We were set for the day. They served good cold drinks at a very reasonable price ( $1.00 per beer!), we snorkled and played in the shallow warm water where it swirled around the coral reef at the shore line. It is so important to understand that you must not stand on the coral or try to walk on it. If you do, you will be shooed off by a loud whistle and sharp yells from establishment owners!
On the other side of the island ( which is a very short walk), wave runners are for rent for around $40.00 per half hour.
The water is clear and warm, the fish are plentiful and beautiful, there is shade for those who need it, and lots of good food and drink available. 
Barter with the beach vendors! We foolishly paid double for a silver bracelet that we could have bought in Zihuatanejo! Oh well...........it's all part of the experience! If you are not interested in what they have to sell, a firm "No, gracias" is all it takes.
A lovely way to spend the day!

126238671.name: Snorkel and relax
126238671.author: a TripAdvisor user
126238671.reviewBody: Great food, cheap beer and good snorkel guides.  Walk around on the trails and enjoy the views.

126233014.name: Little Island
126233014.author: a TripAdvisor user
126233014.reviewBody: Loved everything about it!!!!!  You can feed the fish and snorkel over at the island.  The kids really enjoyed the beach - much nicer than the beach at the hotel.

126023228.name: Mondays are boring.
126023228.author: a TripAdvisor user
126023228.reviewBody: We went to the island on a monday and we had the entire beach to ourselves. We ordered food, and that brought out the flys by the hundreds, possably because we ordered fish and we were the only ones at the beach. We did enjoy the sandy beach and the clear water .The swimming was great ,got bored to qickly so we left after about two hrs .I sugest if you go, pick a day when it,s a little busier and it will probably be really enjoyable.

125969397.name: Good Snorkeling
125969397.author: a TripAdvisor user
125969397.reviewBody: Very interesting island. Good snorkeling.. fish everywhere. restaurants on the island are great! Wonderful food. We went with a guide. LuisDe la Maza- He was outstanding( at www.istapatoursluis.com). One problem is getting to and from the island. The pier is very high. When the tide is in you can get in and out of bbots fairly easily... however on the way back.. leave EARLY... the tide drops and creates a problem getting in and out of the boat. When we left the tide had dropped a lot... and getting out of the boat was a 3 foot jump up... thank goodness there were some men in our boat to help us get out. Don\'t forget to tip these guys that hang around helping  you get in and out of the boat. Worth the buck.

125894883.name: Amazing
125894883.author: a TripAdvisor user
125894883.reviewBody: The place is prefect, little beach cove, good mexican food, decent snorkeling.  Having to take a short boat ride out to the island adds the the experience.

125766272.name: So so
125766272.author: a TripAdvisor user
125766272.reviewBody: Like taking the water taxi over to the island.  The island was hot and not much to do.

125457858.name: nice day side trip from local resorts
125457858.author: a TripAdvisor user
125457858.reviewBody: You can visit this pleasant island at very low cost by walking from local resorts (safe) and taking the public ferry boat from nearby Playa Linda.  Walk over to the beach with a reef and go snorkeling right from shore.  Be sure to wear water shoes for rocks and coral, stay for drinks/snacks at any of the numerous beach side restaurants.  Also in Playa Linda, see the interesting crocodile pond (free) and small local tourist market, or do a long walk the local beach.  All the locals are pleasant and friendly.  Take a taxi back to your resort if you are tired, but get a quote before you board.

125456533.name: Worth the trip
125456533.author: a TripAdvisor user
125456533.reviewBody: Liked both sides of the island.\nQuick trip to get there, nice day away from resort.

125363913.name: Snorkelling Isla Ixtapa
125363913.author: a TripAdvisor user
125363913.reviewBody: We got picked up from the resort and taken to Play Linda to catch a ferry. Enjoyed a fantastic snorkelling excursion on the coral reef with the most fantastic snorkel guide. I believe his name was Sylvano, he is a deaf mute. If you have the opportunity to snorkel on Isla Ixtapa search out for Sylvano as he will give you the best tour for your money.

125354022.name: We went snorkeling and it was fun!
125354022.author: a TripAdvisor user
125354022.reviewBody: The number of fish were limited, but the snorkeling guide was very good.

125349131.name: fun
125349131.author: a TripAdvisor user
125349131.reviewBody: This is a fun little place to go and have a few drinks and snorkel.  Best done if you have a group.  Look for Tona - he\'s very friendly and will tell you all kinds of stories!

125202799.name: No different then the main beach.
125202799.author: a TripAdvisor user
125202799.reviewBody: I wasn\'t quite sure what the excitement was about this Island.  Basically it offers what Ixtapa can offer although one can see tropical fish right at the beach.

125082319.name: Favorite day in Ixtapa
125082319.author: a TripAdvisor user
125082319.reviewBody: We have gone several times.  We catch a boat in Zihuatanejo then fish on the way to the island.  They cook our fish while we snorkel.  Makes for a great day.

124979615.name: Nice food and good for snorkeling
124979615.author: a TripAdvisor user
124979615.reviewBody: Nice food and good for snorkeling, people is very kind with tourists too.

124873590.name: Breath taking.
124873590.author: a TripAdvisor user
124873590.reviewBody: The Island is so beautiful, it is a must see for anyone going to Ixtapa.

124810212.name: Best snorkeling ever!
124810212.author: a TripAdvisor user
124810212.reviewBody: They have an amazing area for snorkeling, right off the beach.  Tons of amazing fish.  Restaurants are good.  There are other beaches too (including a nude beach, we hear tell), but we only went to the coral beach for snorkeling.

124619156.name: Quiet Adventure
124619156.author: a TripAdvisor user
124619156.reviewBody: Was a pleasant adventure to an island off the main coast.  Quiet surroundings and good food. Calm surf to swim and snorkle.

124343854.name: Nice
124343854.author: a TripAdvisor user
124343854.reviewBody: It\'s cheap and easy to get to.  Small boat takes you there, it\'s mainly beach and restaurants.  Nice for a change.

124209872.name: snorkle
124209872.author: a TripAdvisor user
124209872.reviewBody: If you snorkle recommend it... the other beach is nice also not much to do on the Island

124165970.name: Fun to be had.
124165970.author: a TripAdvisor user
124165970.reviewBody: The Island is a fun place to snorkle. lots of fishes on the reef. We watched snorklers feed the fish-absolutely enchanting. My wife got nipped by a coral eating fish--small one--no problem. Lots of coral washed up on beach.\n   Only  problem would be disembarking from the fish boats that bring you there. Docks are high and boats dip so watch out. One tourist gashed his leg on the sharp cement dock.\n   Meals are good at the restaurants and beers are cold. Would do it again.

124138904.name: A Peaceful Easy Feeling...
124138904.author: a TripAdvisor user
124138904.reviewBody: When we went over from Club Med one day, we found an almost deserted island that reminded me a little of Belize.  We snorkled and just kind of vegged while I wandered off to take picture all over the place which was very colorful.  I could see it being a zoo on a local Mexican Holiday but such was not the case on our visit in November 2011.

123973592.name: my first time snorkeling
123973592.author: a TripAdvisor user
123973592.reviewBody: food was great beer cheap and had fun snorkeling in ocean

123917511.name: impressive
123917511.author: a TripAdvisor user
123917511.reviewBody: Loved the beautiful beaches. the water clarity, the warmth from all the beach restaurants.

123906255.name: have too see it at least once
123906255.author: a TripAdvisor user
123906255.reviewBody: the island is something you should experience at least once we go back about every other trip just for fun and lunch. we enjoy it

123885099.name: Best Beach in Ixtapa or Zihua
123885099.author: a TripAdvisor user
123885099.reviewBody: My wife and I have been to Ixtapa many times and our visit to Ixtapa Island is always the highlight of our vacation.  The beach is on a small crescent-shaped bay with fine yellow-white sand, clean clear cool Pacific Ocean water, and 4 or 5 beach-vendor "haciendas". The best beach is on the north side of the island, so for most of the day the sun is to your back and left and the view over the water with the mainland in the backgroud is beautiful.  Consider this a day-trip, pack your beach bag, and travel north from Ixtapa about 5 miles to Playa Linda.  Take the Playa Linda bus, only 9 pesos.  From Playa Linda, buy a round-trip ticket on the "water taxi" and go to the "second" the beach.  I usually like either of the 2 vendors about half way down.  Full meal service, snacks, and cold beer at reasonable prices are available, along with all the special mixed drinks.  Covered tables, large beach umbrellas, and padded lounge chairs are yours for asking set up right close to the water\'s edge.  Sleep, read a book, dangle your feet in the water, bargain with the few easy-going beach vendors.  The perfect Mexican beach experience!

123853539.name: Ixtapa Island
123853539.author: a TripAdvisor user
123853539.reviewBody: if my children were older I think it would have been great - would try again next year.\n

123653506.name: Fabulous!
123653506.author: a TripAdvisor user
123653506.reviewBody: This was a beautiful place, peaceful and the snorkelling was amazing!!

123468498.name: Snorkling/Lunch
123468498.author: a TripAdvisor user
123468498.reviewBody: Took a 28ft boat to the island. Waiter came out to the boat, took our food order and brought our lunch back to the boat. The waiter took us into the beach where we snorkled in the bay.\n excellent!!!

123452217.name: fun feeding the fish
123452217.author: a TripAdvisor user
123452217.reviewBody:
Very quiet beach, good beach combing.  We picked alot of small pieces of coral,some shells and sea glass.  We bought along several packages of Saltine crackers to feed the fish.  We waded in up to our knee, broke the cracker into smaller pieces and fed  the fish. There were alot of fish swiming around our feet. There was snorkeling also available, although we did not go.
They served lunch on the island which was good. Overall we enjoyed the trip
l
The lunch they served was good

123324204.name: Ixtapa island - make it a day
123324204.author: a TripAdvisor user
123324204.reviewBody: So so snorkeling, go early to get clear water, don\'t miss the crocodiles at the entrance

123237949.name: Fun Day Trip
123237949.author: a TripAdvisor user
123237949.reviewBody: We had a great time in Ixtapa Island...  Great snorkeling and just a short ferry ride to get there!

123232172.name: Great snorkeling
123232172.author: a TripAdvisor user
123232172.reviewBody: Ask for Benny at the Pacifica.  We had a fabulous seafood dish at a great location on the beach.

123160315.name: Great place to relax
123160315.author: a TripAdvisor user
123160315.reviewBody: Good food and drinks.people are alwyas friendy and willing to do what they can to make your visit fun

122944255.name: I Had The Time Of My Life
122944255.author: a TripAdvisor user
122944255.reviewBody: I visited Ixtapa for the first time and on the airplane ride  from L.A., read a magazine article describing a snorkeling trip the writer took and it sounded surreal, so I decided to do the same thing.  My party & I took a taxi from hotel row in Ixtapa to Zihuatanejo pier.  It cost about $8. Then we hired a panga, or motorized row boat, to take us directly to this tiny beach called Isla Ixtapa.  There were hundreds of tourists in the front but a waiter directed us behind all the outdoor restaurants where it was quieter and breathtakingly beautiful.  We were led to a shaded table, on a white sandy beach, overlooking the most crystal clear calm turquoise water lagoon I had ever seen.  After drinking a Margarita, I walked to the water and dropped fish pellets in.  Suddenly my ankles were surrounded by huge groups of large fish fighting for food. What a hoot!  After lunch I hired a private snorkel guide & swam out in 75 feet of water, with clear visibility, to see assorted colors and sizes of fish that made me giggle loudly and believe I was Jacque Cousteau filming a segment of National Geopgraphic.  Juan, my instructor, would dive down to the bottom of the sea and bring up puffer fish, sea urchins, and starfish for me to pet and touch.  I will never forget this experience especially since I can\'t swim.  Bring an underwater camera if you go; bug spray for bees; walking shoes due to shells; and sunblock.  Lunch can be bought but avoid Lili Cipriani\'s and manager Christian.  They will rob you without using a gun.  The cost of renting Snorkel equipment & a guide is $15 pp.  You can even get an outdoor massage there or just swing in a hammock.  Take the kids and have a spectacular underwater adventure.

122840976.name: bring pesos
122840976.author: a TripAdvisor user
122840976.reviewBody: bring pesos to buy a beer (approx 2$)  bring yur own snorkle gear

122733228.name: wonderfull island
122733228.author: a TripAdvisor user
122733228.reviewBody: very calm water at coral beach\nThe fish at the beach restraunt was wonderfull

122688674.name: A great day!
122688674.author: a TripAdvisor user
122688674.reviewBody: The people were friendly. The snorkelling beautiful and lunch awesome!

122685471.name: OK for kids
122685471.author: a TripAdvisor user
122685471.reviewBody: overpriced average snorkeling trip, drinks and food very expensive, and poor quality

122683352.name: Relaaaaax
122683352.author: a TripAdvisor user
122683352.reviewBody: Spent the day with friend, snorkeled, had a really great lunch with buckets of beer.  What else is needed.

122157369.name: I wish I hadn\'t gone  :(
122157369.author: a TripAdvisor user
122157369.reviewBody: Too commercial with depressing atmosphere and young children mopping the bathroom.  Snorkeling was ok but water is not very clear and tourists were diving down and breaking off pieces of coral from the reef to take home!\nNot a part of Mexico I wanted to see.

122000607.name: Enjoyed it very much, no need for a tour to this destination
122000607.author: a TripAdvisor user
122000607.reviewBody: We read up on how to get there. Once at the pier it is inexpensive to get to the island, we were met by a waiter who wanted us to go to his restuarant. We indicated we wanted to snorkel, so he took us the short distance to the other side. We got a table and were able to leave our stuff there and explore the island without worry, there were very few customers at this time. (Nov 11th?) We ordered food and made sure of the prices, we had the most amazing fish (baracuda?) and we tipped well. Just knowing that things were being watched while we snorkeled. By the way, snorkeling around the pier where the water is calmer was fantastic. We watched guides take people out where we were sitting, and it was tough water to enjoy.

121932047.name: Loved the Island
121932047.author: a TripAdvisor user
121932047.reviewBody: The island trip was one of  our Mexican high-lites. Our guide to the island was great. The restaurant had really good fresh fish. Jackie and I went snorkeling on the island and Julius was a perfect guide. He took was thru the coral safely and found all kinds of fish and sea animals. The island has three different beaches to choose from.

121667289.name: Fun time for a few hours.  Walk the trails and see the whole island not just the beaches.
121667289.author: a TripAdvisor user
121667289.reviewBody: The restaurants will try to get you to sit down and have a beer and some food as you walk past them.

121641394.name: not worth it
121641394.author: a TripAdvisor user
121641394.reviewBody: beach hard to walk on, very crowded too, tour unorganized

121327835.name: A great place to swim
121327835.author: a TripAdvisor user
121327835.reviewBody: If you are at all afraid of the waves in the ocean take a trip to the island .  We spent a few great days at Restaurante Buzo with Marcus the best waiter on the beach.. had the very best garlic shrimp I have ever had..with the shells on so full of flavor..The water is so calm and warm you just walk in and enjoy..it is only 40 pesos for the two way trip from Palaya Linda .

120842625.name: Quiet & serene
120842625.author: a TripAdvisor user
120842625.reviewBody: Great little island, a few minute boat ride from shore - 3 beaches, 1 is full of coral but great for snorkeling. Lots of neat little beach bars & palapas to sit under to enjoy the cervesas.

120837853.name: perfect getaway
120837853.author: a TripAdvisor user
120837853.reviewBody: very relaxing quiet , swimable beach.  it had that tropical island feel. we all had massages for 20 us dollars for one hour. they do an excellent job getting the kinks out.

120825322.name: A must day trip while in Ixtapa!!!
120825322.author: a TripAdvisor user
120825322.reviewBody: You will have a very nice and quite beaches, a mexican little fisher villa, and if you like to walk around, perfect private spots where you will get a total relax!!!\nHIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

120752682.name: Amazing snorkeling, well worth a visit and let me put some of the negative reviews in context
120752682.author: a TripAdvisor user
120752682.reviewBody:
This was my third trip to Zihuatanejo and I have done a lot of snorkelling at Playa La Ropa and Playa Los Gatos. I took a trip before to Playa Manzanillo a few years ago in May but there were too many jelly fish to snorkel. I had been avoiding Isla Ixtapa in part because of negative reviews. So I cannot compare Playa Manzanillo and Los Gatos, but found the snorkelling to be amazing on Playa Coral, the exposed outer beach.

I took a tour from Playa La Ropa with Ferdinand and was accompanied by Christian. We trolled for fish on the way but did not catch anything despite there being Bonitas jumping everywhere on the way there. Their boat was quite basic: just a panga with a canopy, but very seaworthy and Christian definitely knows the local waters. The view on the way with pounding surf on rocky outcrops and islands, studded with cactus and birds circling -- pelicans, vultures, frigate birds, gulls, terns -- was spectacular. The day with a guide was $90 USD for two. 

The water at Playa Coral was crystal clear. Christian accompanied us snorkelling and would carefully point out smaller marine life that we might have missed. I saw more species than I had ever seen before because it was a coral reef with species that are more common or exclusively in that habitat. A few locals threw some tortillas in the water and a feeding frenzy of 12" long fish ensued in a foot of water two feet from the beach. I saw lots of rainbow wrasses, sergeant majors, puffer fish, angel fish and other colourful fish I had know idea of the species.

The highlight was an Eagle Ray, 5' across hovering in crystal clear water 5 feet below me. I hovered above him while he slowly glided beneath me for two minutes. Unfortunately the battery on my waterproof camera had died (just $100 from Coppels in Zihuatanejo for a Kodak waterproof (to 3 meters: 10 feet) ).

The food at Indio's was great: BBQ snapper and coconut shrimp for three with drinks for about 600 pesos: about $50.  You can find better prices at other places in the area, but sitting on a coral beach with incredibly fresh fish and shrimp, a margarita or two, what would you pay for that in North America! Muy gracias, signor! 

We also stopped to snorkel at Las Elephante, a rocky island with a coral reef which was fun, but again not nearly as good snorkelling as Playa Coral. 

So my advice is ignore the negative reviews, find a good captain, put on the snorkel and fins and be prepared for a great day. I remember one reviewer saying "this is not the Caribbean". That is true: this is pacific Mexico, a whole different ecosystem, and the Caribbean is amazing, but this is still great.  Bring an underwater camera or get a disposable Kodak underwater camera and prepare to be amazed.

120080649.name: Waste of time
120080649.author: a TripAdvisor user
120080649.reviewBody: this is an overpriced place for what you get, we took the tour package and it was soooo not worth it. Very little food for what you have paid for, you are told the beverages are included, however, you are charged in the end for water and pop anyway, glad I did not order beer!!!!!

120079676.name: Did a kayak/snorkel tour
120079676.author: a TripAdvisor user
120079676.reviewBody: Tour was from hotel and Free.  Didn\'t try restaurants or other activities on island.

118370320.name: Be careful of the vendors...
118370320.author: a TripAdvisor user
118370320.reviewBody: Ixtapa Island is great palce to spend the day or afternoon. Snorkeling is OK for the area, but not always the best. The ocean gets stirred up a bit and it is not always very clear. You can rent a chair/lounge for the day, but be careful of the vendors. Many of the waiters will "up charge" you when ordering drinks or food. The restaurants actually allow them to do it so they don\'t have to pay them. Always check a printed menu or varify the price before ordering and you will be OK. It is a terrible practice and I know many people that have been ripped off by the waiters doing this. Definately not good for future business!!

115931116.name: Isla Ixtapa is a joke.
115931116.author: a TripAdvisor user
115931116.reviewBody: This place is a joke when it comes to snorkling, the beach is uncomfortable to walk on in barefeet as it\'s semi crushed coral and rocks. The visibility is poor at best and the variety of fish isn\'t all that good. I suppose if you have never been snorkling in the Caribbean and seen how great it can be, then you may halfway enjoy this place.\n\nAnd the "restaurants" are a ripoff, very expensive and of course they don\'t want to tell you pirces until after you order. Want the use of a towel? That will cost you $3, whereas at Las Gatas beach in Zihua nobody charges you to sit on a freakin towel.

106834550.name: Amazing fun, sun,food & good people at Antonios
106834550.author: a TripAdvisor user
106834550.reviewBody:
We have been going to this island for the last 8 yrs and its always a blast. We go at least 3xs during our week stay in Ixtapa. We do some snorkeling then hike over the the calm beach side park our buts at Antonios Resturant. Always FANTASTIC food , ICE COLD cerveza, the staff are very helpfull Miguel , Angel & Mr Antonio love you guys. 

Plz stop in say hi, order some prawns yummmmm cyu next year :) 

Greg&Karen

68743760.name: Nice Island but be careful of overpriced restaurants
68743760.author: a TripAdvisor user
68743760.reviewBody: The island is beautiful with lots of colorful fishes close to the shore.   It\'s definitely worth spending a day there.  We brought lunch.  When we arrived at the pier, a guy approached us and said he was a helper for tourists so we assumed he worked in the ministry of tourism (he wore a shirt with ISLA de IXTAPA on it).  He led us to a place and sat us down on a table which appears to be part of a restaurant.  Then he asked us to order meals.  We told him we brought lunch.  Then he told us the table would cost 80 pesos if we don\'t order any food.  So we ordered a juice.  He brought us a pina colada (non alcoholic) and asked for 100 pesos!.   And that\'s not all.  He proceeded to tell us that ordering one drink is not enough.  By sitting on that table, we would have to order at least 300 pesos worth of food.  I guess we were a little naive to believe him when he told us he was just a helper showing tourists around.  I don\'t mind paying if I know ahead of time what to expect.  I hate to be misled by people who try to rip off tourists.  By doing that the locals create a bad reputation for their country.

54996444.name: Interesting, but -
54996444.author: a TripAdvisor user
54996444.reviewBody: We have just returned from two weeks in Zihuatanejo and spent an afternoon on Ixtapa Island.  We had heard so much about it and we were very excited to go.  We took a bus to Playa Linda and then a water taxi over to the island.  The day we were there, it was very busy and crowded and we found ourselves steered to a table on the beach of Playa Coral where we were crammed in with hardly enough room to pull out a chair.  The waiter was very friendly and attentive, and after settling in my husband went snorkeling as we were told it was excellent.  Unfortunately, that day the water was very murky and we were told that is common as the water gets churned up very quickly by so many people paddling about.  All in all, we felt rather overwhelmed by the number of people and after a few hours decided to return to the mainland, so we can\'t really comment on the restaurants as we did not eat there.  However, the whole trip was very worthwhile as we then discovered Playa Linda, an absolutely beautiful, unspoiled and quiet beach which unfortunately is often overlooked as it is viewed mainly as just a stop off point from where you catch the water taxis to the island.  We fell in love with this beautiful area and spend the next three days there.  \n\nTo sum it up, we found the trip to the island quite disappointing, but many people absolutely loved it so I guess it depends on what you are looking for.  For us we were looking for beautiful peaceful surroundings and we found it - at Playa Linda.

38248189.name: nice for kids, be careful what you\'re charged
38248189.author: a TripAdvisor user
38248189.reviewBody: The island has nice, but somewhat crowded beaches, packed with restaurants. The nice thing is that the water in one of the beaches, Varadero, is very calm and great for kids to swim in. The corals are very close to the beach, so also nice for kids to get there.\nWe went there with a water taxi, no need to take an excursion, since the beach is close and the island is small (plus everybody speaks english).\nIn addition of being crowded, another problem is that all the restaurants try to overchartge you on all items. Be careful to ASK FOR THE MENU AND ASK FOR THE PRICE for anything BEFORE ORDERING, otherwise you\'ll be unpleasantly surprised.

34481237.name: Isla Ixtapa - Not what we expected.
34481237.author: a TripAdvisor user
34481237.reviewBody: Each person\'s experience is unique and ours was a disappointment. We had read the reviews regarding the island and we were looking forward to an adventure. We took a taxi from our hotel to where the water taxi takes you to the island. When we arrived, there was a small market section and right away we were harassed to come to the restaurants. One employee would not leave us alone and actually walked with us throughout the market and along the pier to the water taxi. (We were agitated that he would not leave us alone.) We paid for our ride $4 USA per person and climbed aboard a small water taxi. (The employee climbed aboard too.) When we arrived at the island, the employee stayed with us again. We asked for his card and said if we wanted something to eat or drink we would come see him at his restaurant. The beach was crowded with restaurants, and that was it. We walked to the otherside of the beach and there were more restaurants. We were hasseled the entire time we walked around. We were so discouraged and irritated, that we caught the water taxi back to the mainland. If you are looking to snorkel, you might be interested, but we were so harassed, we didn\'t even explore that option.

27166793.name: A little secret about Ixtapa Island
27166793.author: a TripAdvisor user
27166793.reviewBody: In general the beaches on this little island are like every other, umbrellas, lounge chairs, inexpensive beer. The little secret is to go to restaurant Ixtapa and ask for Ray. He can set you up for their private dining area on the back side of the island. They have the most amazing red snapper dish (smoked, not grilled) with fresh lobster and shrimp. The view is amazing as well.

24954326.name: pack accordingly
24954326.author: a TripAdvisor user
24954326.reviewBody: Do not book the tour to Ixtapa Island; go there on your own.  Take the bus and get off at the end of the line.  Walk across the street and head to your right.  On the way towards the market, you\'ll see a viewpoint.  Stop and check out the alligators, turles and iguanas.  It\'s free.  Walk through the market and onto the pier and pay for a return water taxi ride to the Island ($3.00) Do not lose your stub for the return portion of this trip.  Ask your taxi to drop you at the pier on your right and then walk through the pathway to the far end of the Island.  Bring some bread along to feed the fish.  If you are on a limited budget, you can pack your own lunch/snorkel gear/sunscreen/towel/booze and the entire day should cost you less than five bucks.  Having said that, I should mention that five bucks to us is nothing and means the world to the people working on this Island.  They literally RUN to serve you well.  It\'s a cheap excursion for the day, I urge you to be generous and tip these people well.  If you end up setting up a table on the peninsula, be very careful.   A wave can virtually wipe you out.  Yes, the bathrooms are definitely the sore spot of the Island; I pack my own wipes everywhere and they always seem to come in very handy!

13212215.name: Go early in the morning!
13212215.author: a TripAdvisor user
13212215.reviewBody: We\'ve been to Isla Ixtapa 3 times now - the most recent just a couple weeks ago (Jan 2008).  We go primarily for the snorkeling at Playa Coral.  The fish are large and plentiful but you have to be there early (before 10 AM) while the water is still crystal clear.  By afternoon so many people have churned up the water that visibility is nearly zero.  There is also some good beachcombing - interesting driftwood and rocks - if you walk past the beach (to the right as you face the water on Playa Coral) around to the point.  We\'ve always had good food there but it is a bit more expensive than one would pay at a beach restaurant on the mainland.  More annoying, we did have the experience that someone else mentioned in an earlier review - a 15% "service fee" was already added onto the bill but then the waiter claimed an additional 10 pesos above that.  It\'s not the extra $1, but rather the negative feeling it left us with.  This may be a new \'trick" because it had never occurred on our previous visits and on this trip we encountered the same thing at 2 other beach restaurants in the Zihuatanejo area. \n\nIf you are a snorkeler, I\'d recommend Isla Ixtapa as an early morning trip. Get in a couple of hours of snorkeling, then head back to the mainland for lunch.

10841377.name: Good place to relax
10841377.author: a TripAdvisor user
10841377.reviewBody:
My husband and I spent an afternoon at Isla Ixtapa in Nov 2007. There are two swim beaches and a snorkeling beach. The waves were starting to pick up at the snorkeling beach, which faces the Pacific so we did not snorkel.

The swim beaches are very small, good for children and perfect for a dip to cool off.

We sat at the restaurant 7 Mares, because I had seen it in the Ixtapa/Zihau forums. The service there was great! The owner came out to greet us personally and brought us each a drink on the house.

Every restaurant will try to get you to sit at their tables. Take a look at the menu...a lunch entree for around 70 to 90 pesos and beer for 20 pesos is reasonable. Some will have 2 for 1 drinks from noon to 5:00pm.

The beach vendors selling necklaces and such will usually go away after a polite "Gracias, no." Others will start spreading their wares out on your table and require a firmer "nada" before they leave you alone.

There are two piers to the main beach on the left and a smaller beach on the right. The snorkeling beach is on the back side of the island on the right. There is a foot path over the hill connecting the two swim beaches.

6232886.name: Ixtapa Island
6232886.author: a TripAdvisor user
6232886.reviewBody:
Nov. 2006, Just returned from a week in Ixtapa / Zihua and had a ball. There is so much to do that you could stay busy every day, or just laze around and do nothing.  

Went one day over to Ixtapa Island, and I highly recommend it. Take a taxi from your hotel and then catch the water taxis to the island. Water taxis was 30peso ($3.US) so not going to break the bank. We heard several people state how expensive the food and activities were over on the island, but found that not to be true.  In the middle of the one swimming beach / snorkling beach there is a restaurant that serves both sides of the island. It must be shaped like a dumbell as the island narrowed at this site and a particular restaurant served both sides.  We started out early in the day on the snorkle side, and fed the fish, and then later moved over to the softer surf for the children to play in the water. (3 and 5 year old, surf on swim side was okay for them). The waiters assited us with moving all of our equipment, and even went so far as to move our chairs from under the palapas on the surf side over to the swim side.  Jessica speaks English and has no trouble assisting you with whatever you need for the day. But what could you need except snorkle gear, a palapa, drink and sun?  
Go there, you won't be dissapointed. Oh, and check out the Crocodiles in the nature walk on the way from the parking lot to the water taxis.

5362976.name: Crystal Clear Fun
5362976.author: a TripAdvisor user
5362976.reviewBody:
we were in Zih/Ixtapa for 10 days - 2 of which we spent on isla ixtapa (mid june, 2006). it's the low season so there weren't many tourists. the water for all three beaches were crystal clear and stunning. playa coral has some reef, but it's obvious that it's not cozumel or cayman islands, nor do they claim to be. we saw a lot of fish, but didn't go in very deep where you can see starfish and seahorses. 

we didn't order food (except for quesadillas) because we were full from breakfast. keep in mind, this island is not very developed - it doesn't have electricity. the restaurants get fish the night before and keep them on ice. we met another couple who have been going there for years and haven't had any bad experiences, but we were being super cautious and just ordered a bucket of beers :)

as the water taxi heads to the island, playa linda shines it's brightest: palm tree lined beach with the mountains behind them. wow.

the vendors WILL ask you to look at their stuff, but just shake your head no if you're not interested. browsing at their stuff will only make them more agressive to make a sale (i would too if i had to feed a family doing this).

i'm guessing that the description of the beaches in the previous postings were the result of a lot of people making the water murky. fortunately for us, the water was like the caribbean's! i'll try to post photos soon so that you can see for yourself.

it was a great experience

4385267.name: Be careful of what you eat by waiters at the beach in Ixtapa Island
4385267.author: a TripAdvisor user
4385267.reviewBody: In Jan.2004 we ordered lobster & prawms from afriendly waiter who insisted that I order as the rest in our group had.  After insisting that I order, he said he would give a little surprise with my order.  The surprise was "marinaded strips of  uncook fish" which I only sample.  Two days later I was deadly sick with septic shock. Ater going to the naval hospital in Ixtapa the young doctor on duty gave me valium so that I could calm dowm. That nite at 3:00a.m. I was taken to a clinic in Zihuatanejo where the doctor  did a blood test & found out that I had tyhoid fever. On our way back to Seattle, the medics in L.A. took me off the plane & took me to the hospital where I spent 5 days before returning to Seattle.  Please remember that those open stands do not have running water.....\n

3435568.name: great day for calmer water
3435568.author: a TripAdvisor user
3435568.reviewBody: As many people know El palmer beach hotel zone has very rought water, Ixtapa island has the opposite, one side is for snorkleing and the other is for calm water and relaxation.  We went over to ixtapa island and mainly stayed on the side opposite of the snorkling.  The water was very calm and clear and plent of pool loungers.  Beaware of the snackbar and restraunts they may seem 3rd worldish and the restrooms have no running water but the service was great.  They appricate your business.  Do not take the tour they usually will ask 35usd per-person and the meal they give you is not worth it.  Take a bus from the hotel zone for 6 pesos (.60) per person to playa linda then take the farry to the island 3 usd per person round trip and enjoy!  A average lunch with a beer is around 5usd.\n

3284609.name: wonderful hike around island
3284609.author: a TripAdvisor user
3284609.reviewBody:
My husband and I went on a day trip to Ixtapa Island and the highlight was a wonderful hike around the island with another couple.  When you arrive at the dock, hang a left from the beach instead of going to the right where everyone else goes.  There is a path (a  bit steep and rocky but we managed fine in sandals) which takes you to the peak of the island.  The views are spectacular (careful - don't go to close to the edge!) and are well worth the trip.  The trail eventually descends to the snorkelling area and then you are back in the tourist trap (about 1/2 hour at slow pace with picture stops).  We didn't go snorkelling as it was very wavy.  There were people walking on the coral reefs which is very bad for them - there are signs asking people not to do this but it wasn't enforced.  As a nature person, please don't step on the reefs!

All in all, the places where the typical tours go on the island aren't really worth it but if you step off the beaten path, you will be rewarded.   Then go to the beach and enjoy some beers!  

PS - take a town bus (6 pesos/person) to Playa Linda and then the boat (30 pesos/person) instead of a tour.  Much more freedom!

2972888.name: What a disappointment
2972888.author: a TripAdvisor user
2972888.reviewBody: Just got back from a cruise to Mexico which we loved, but our excursion to Isla Ixtapa was a real disappointment.  The small fishing boat that took us to the island almost capsized (everyone sat on one side) - well we did get a laugh out of that!  There are about 5 or 6 different restaurants on the island and the one we went to wasn\'t ready for us, the beach was dirty, the chairs weren\'t out etc.  The water was very calm and warm, but several of us were bitten by invisible tiny jellyfish (at least that\'s what we were told). While swimming we were constantly moving out of the way of small boats that would come close to shore to deliver food to the restaurants, consequently our swimming area kept getting smaller and smaller.  The lunch served at the restaurant was good, but the bathroom facilities left a lot to be desired. Next time we\'ll just go to a hotel for the day!\n

2581677.name: Don\'t waste you time....
2581677.author: a TripAdvisor user
2581677.reviewBody: If you want to be trapped on an island all day with nothing to do then go the ixtapa isle! my friends and I  went to snorkel which was about a joke you can\'t see a thing! The so called restaurants are pretty bad! I would never go back again!!   Don\'t waste your money! \nInstead rent a moped and go to playa la linda beach! you can come and go as  you please!\n

1909311.name: Try a different excursion, like the Sunset Sail!
1909311.author: a TripAdvisor user
1909311.reviewBody: Please don\'t waste your time and $$$ on this excursion. It\'s not like it was terrible, but the beaches and pools at all the hotel\'s in the area were far better. The comp. fish lunch was great though. They served a tunafish fillet with garlic/butter. It was outstanding. Go on the Sunset Cruise on the 85ft. sailboat instead. That was fantastic.

1703240.name: needs to be built up a little better
1703240.author: a TripAdvisor user
1703240.reviewBody: the family visited Ixtapa Island in 2000 it was okbut the water was a little dirty and the minute yousat down to enjoy the sun they would try to sell youjewelry or drinks. The people were nice butdid not care for the restaurant food. environmentwas dirty. Maybe in a few years this island willbuild up but for now till then try another place

1663574.name: Skip the Ixtapa Island trip
1663574.author: a TripAdvisor user
1663574.reviewBody: We tied in the Ixtapa Island trip at the end of a fishing trip. The captain was supposed to catch a fish and cook it on the beach for us. \nWhat actually happens is that there is a restaurant of sorts on the beach where they will cook your fish. We didn\'t catch any, but they did have fish to cook for you. The fish was good but a bit pricey. At the end of our stay at the restaurant/beach, the waiter had the nerve enough to ask for a bigger tip than he got.The beach itself was crowded and kind of a tourist trap. The snorkeling beach was the same. The water was cloudy because of all the people, but if you were a good swimmer, and swam out a hundred yards or so, there were plenty of fish and a good variety.Fortunately our ride was there after a couple of hours so the disappointment was kept to a minimum. If we had been stuck there all day, it would have been a bummer. Skip the Ixtapa Island trip and go to a nice beach restaurant on the mainland.

1644429.name: A must do activity, two versions of the same day...
1644429.author: a TripAdvisor user
1644429.reviewBody: We heard that Ixtapa Island was the place to go for snorkeling, so we brought our gear down with us and looked into the options once we arrived. We ended up taking two trips to the Island, one cost us 480 peso, the other 160 peso, and we knew of people that spent 750+ peso.The first time we went to the Island we booked through a vendor on the Beach for 240 peso each and had to pay 100 peso down. We knew the Hotel was selling tours for 350 peso each, so we figured if he didn\'t show we were only out $10. The tour guide showed up in the morning with his Suburban full of people from other Hotels and he drove us to Playa Linda. From there he got us onto a ferry to Ixtapa Island. Once on the Island he got us to order lunch which we would get a 2pm, and helped people get their equipment if they needed it (rentals were not included in the tour price, and lunch was a filet of fish with one drink of choice). The tour guide then showed us to Playa Coral and let us loose. On this day Playa Coral was busy and somewhat cloudy, but mostly calm. There were tons of fish, but they kept their distance. The coral reef near the shore is obviously near the end of it\'s life and fairly dull. As you get deeper it gets a bit better, but don\'t expect the reef to be the attraction.It was obviously a cool enough experience for us to want to return 2 days later. This time we went on our own and tried to get out there before the 10am tours. At 9am we took a Taxi from the hotel (50 peso), and bought our own ferry ticket (30 peso return). Once on the Island we had one of the ?restaurantures? help us find a great seat (we tipped him in the end as all of our gear remained in our possession while we were snorkeling, the tour guide watched our stuff previously). On this day the water was 10 times clearer, there were very few people, and we had brought a few crackers to feed the fish. Even before we open the crackers the fish were more approachable, and there seemed more of them (we even think we saw a barracuda along the surface, but were still confirming if that\'s even possible). We snorkeled for 2 hours straight until the tours showed up around 11:30 and then we just hopped a ferry back to Playa Linda, and another 50 peso Taxi ride to the Hotel.Some people at the Hotel paid for the 350 peso tour and the only difference I think was the air conditioned bus that took them to Playa Linda.

1540174.name: must see
1540174.author: a TripAdvisor user
1540174.reviewBody: Paradise!! is all I can think of when Ixtapa Island comes to mind. We have been in Ixtapa twice and are returning again this month. We would not miss the chance to visit the island as often as we can on our vacation.We love to stay at the Qualton Club and either take a boat trip over or simply paddle. The island is a great place to snorkle and then sit back and relaxe as the locals pamper you with a pale of ice cold refrehments and fresh sea food if you would like. Ixtapa Island is very tranquil and pictureesque. Try to sail around the island and you will see another quit spot to visit. We love this little island, can not wait to visit once again.

696773.name: WORST DAY of Vacation!
696773.author: a TripAdvisor user
696773.reviewBody: The hotel was charging $35 to take you to the island; the street price was $25...but for 5 pesos (50 cents) for a bus to Playa Linda, and 30 pesos ($3) round trip you can get there easily.  The front beach is crowded and water is yucky...no snorkeling here.  Made the mistake of overpaying for snorkeling rental ($7 from the first guy I came to on the beach) BEFORE I checked out the coral beach.  As it turned out, I schlepped snorkeling gear a short walk through the jungle (pleasant trail) only to find out that the water was too rough to snorkel in.  If I went into the water past my knee someone came running from the huts to tell me not to get in the water.  Twice we were swamped by unexpected huge waves that engulfed us and left us with backpacks thoroughly soaked.  The public toilets are nasty and smell horrible.  The whole area is very rustic (but I didn\'t mind that) but the guy who rented me snorkel equipment when he knew I couldn\'t use it should be ashamed.  The crossing back over got hairy in 4-5 foot waves...I got a little nervous when they started passing float vests to everyone.  Got dumped into the water again when we landed.  Food and drink prices are horribly expensive.  To do it right again... I\'d bring a cooler w/food & drinks, my own snorkel gear (plus float vest).  Very pretty area...\n
